Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Oplacesyoullgo
Reviews.Content: Lost a star only due to being able to hear our neighbours who really weren't being very noisy. Service was amazing - tv stopped working and they sent someone immediately - at 1 am! Bathroom was dated but we were on a lower floor - guessing the upper (and pricier) floors have been updated. Great bed, amazing service as well as being steps from great restaurants, bars and events. HIghly recommend the sushi place, Ki. Room service was quick as was the valet. I will always check here for a room first from now on. We stayed on a wedding rate and the room was less than 150 - that's less than most anything in toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: snowkoan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Aeroplan miles and were quite happy with our stay. We took the train and so we were in our hotel room 15 minutes after getting into Toronto. Room was quite nice, though climate control wasn't perfect. The concierge was extremely helpful with our questions. Minor quibbles: the pool was great but closed early one of the two nights of our stay. Also, there was a mistake on our bill that didn't need to be there. The front desk was very apologetic and we left with a good feeling. Would stay again, though not at full rates.

Reviews.Title: “An Old Standby”
Reviews.Author: Rob_S_987
Reviews.Content: I work long hours at a nearby financial institution and have found myself staying at the Royal York frequently (15-20 stays a year). The service is usually very consistent and I have rarely had a bad experience. On my last visit about two weeks ago, I noted with regret that they appear to have changed suppliers of their shampoo, conditioner, body wash for their bathrooms. I had actually noted this over the last three or four months, but wasn't until I read a few of the recent comments below that I found out it was a permanent change. (I innocently assumed they were having supplier issues and the Miller Harris products would re-appear at some point.) I have to say, it's definately not an improvement. The labeling on the bottles looks dollar store cheap (a pseudo stensel, black on tan, plain label), the shampoo is average at best and the conditioner is greasy to say the least. Also, I find myself using as little as possible to avoid the pungent smell. It's really a shame to hear that the Miller Harris products are gone unless I have time and initiative to chase them down by pre-arranging then, should they even have any left. (I shouldn't be told I can "buy" them at the Fairmont Store - they should already be in my room) I don't normally make it a habit of paying attention to shampoo and conditioner in hotels (hey, it's just something you use in the shower), but it's really hard not to notice this downgrade. I'm not sure if this is a money saving initiative gone wrong, or just a case of facilities procurement dropping the ball. It actually smells bad enough (not to mention it seriously drys out your skin...and for a guy to notice this, you know it has to be bad) that I would consider another hotel (any hotel) that didn't use these products. I'm floored management hasn't had more complaints (yes, it's that bad). Long story short, if you choose to stay at the RY, bring your own shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap. (one wonders if this is the real reason behind the change!!)

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: nursemack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the second weekend of March, it was our first time here. Rooms were pricey as we knew they would be. Lots of construction around hotel made it hard to find parking (no fault of the hotel). We stopped to ask a staff member of the hotel whether underground parking was cheaper than valet, he instructed us to park underground telling us it was much cheaper. Turns out, valet is $32, underground parking cost us about $5 more for the night, it would have been more convenient for us to do valet as we had several bags and coolers to carry. The hotel is nice, outdated but nice. Things could have been cleaner. We noticed that the carpets were quite stained throughout, and most things could have used a quick polish. Rooms were small but nice none-the-less. A maid barged into our room at 730-8am the next day. We weren't impressed. Staff weren't overly friendly but the check-in process was quick and we used the express check out to avoid lines. Overall, glad we went but would probably not go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal York Should Be On Every Traveler's Bucket List”
Reviews.Author: Craig1963
Reviews.Content: Once the largest building in the British Empire, the Fairmont Royal York remains the hotel chain's Canadian flagship destination, and it's one every traveler needs to experience at some point in their life. Located right downtown Toronto across the street from Union Station and within easy walking distance of just about everything, this elegant hotel is THE place to stay in Toronto. You get a sense of what you're in for when you walk into the main lobby, and look down at the tens of thousands of tiny mosaic floor tiles, creating intricate patterns for as far as you can see. Someone clearly meant for this place to make a statement, and it definitely does - in every way. Take a walk along the mezzanine and check out the large historic photos of the hotel and you really understand just how special it is to stay here. Check-in was super easy. Our room was on the Gold floor (12th floor), so although our suite was not the largest in the hotel, we were nonetheless thrilled at its upscale appointments, including an HD television big enough to double as a tanning bed, and a massive, crazy-comfortable king bed. The bath linens were super-soft, and as always, the room was spotlessly clean. The turn-down service, complete with water bottles waiting on the nightstand, was a really nice touch. I often stay at Fairmonts in the course of my business travel, but this was over the top. Dinner, at the hotel's Epic restaurant, was not inexpensive, but reflected by the incredible service and quality of food. The wine list was fantastic too. The Royal York is, as mentioned, an easy walk to just about everything downtown .... and you can access the Toronto subway directly through the lower lobby. In spite of some serious construction work along Front Street, our room was quiet and we didn't hear a sound. I slept like a rock, despite the work going on outside. Any traveler visiting Toronto needs to put the Royal York on their agenda, and stay here at least once. It really is that special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: misskelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip we got back from yesterday, we were here for 3 nights and boy were we glad we chose to stay here! We arrived about 1.30am and we had a little cheese and fruit platter waiting for us, the room was divine, the staff were amazingly helpful, and the hotel is a short walk to attractions, shopping and restaurants, not to mention being opposite Union Station. Our room was gorgeous, and the bed very comfortable. The Library Bar is divine and has a great atmosphere. We ate both breakfast and dinner at Epic restaurant, which was simply amazing, the food, the ambiance and the staff, amazing! Try breakfast/dinner/drinks here and you won't be disappointed! The only complaint we have about this hotel, and other Fairmont's (unless you are a president's club member - which we are not, nor do we intend on becoming) is that the hotel does not have free wifi, so keep that in mind unless you want to pay for some expensive internet!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars for the guest room + 5 for the hotel = 4”
Reviews.Author: Trvlng4fun
Reviews.Content: Although I am a big fan of Fairmont hotels I must say that these rooms are the smallest we have ever stayed in. Still loved the hotel â€“ its history (take a walk around and look at the photos) and its distance to everything! We walked to so many of the places on our to-do list!

Reviews.Title: “downgrade on toiletries”
Reviews.Author: Human44
Reviews.Content: I stay with Fairmont regularly for business and pleasure, and was disappointed that they have downgraded from Miller Harris toiletries to a French brand called 'Le Labo.' The scent is much stronger, and less appealing to me, When I asked about the change, I was told that Miller Harris toiletries are still available for purchase in the Fairmont hotel shop. That tells me there is a priority on cost-cutting and upselling rather than delivering quality products for the premium room rates being charged. From having my favourite hotel soap and shampoo, Fairmont has now fallen to the bottom of my list. I'd rate Crowne Plaza toiletries over Fairmont, which is sad.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Skibummer
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York is a sprawling old hotel in downtown Toronto. It is conveniently located and has the ambiance of a bygone era. It would require a huge amount of capital expenditure to modernise this hotel and it has not been spent - miles of corridors with dated guest-rooms opening off them. You cannot fault the hotel for delivering a high standard of Fairmont service and it is certainly nothing to complain about, but it is really nothing special and I would only stay here again if I needed to for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and food”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Two separate business trips in early 2012. Had a pretty parlour suite. I love the ambience and history of this hotel. Yes the rooms are small and dated but it's an older hotel. No different than Europe or New York City. It's about the history, the grandeur of the ballrooms, excellent food and Fairmont service. Bed very comfortable. Excellent linens and toiletries. Dinner at the Epic restaurant, had the three course fixed menu for only $48. Great choices and good quality. Great location too. I brought the car but it's so convenient on the subway, train and shuttle to Island airport. We had meetings on the executive floor for one day. Bar none best facilities and service on this level. They're used to dignataries. Was very pampered for the day. My daughters stayed with me one night and they loved walking around. Small fitness room, good quality equipment. Beautiful pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning property!”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is a very impressive and historic building. The rooms are a bit smaller than some other downtown hotels, but very comfortable and well appointed. Staff are friendly and helpful. Valet parking, while a bit pricey, is well worth it. The location is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: shellkireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights last week for work, great location and staff very pleasant. I misplaced my wallet and the Porter (Brian?) was very helpful and immediately suggested options to help me find the wallet and made a few calls for me. It turned out one of the hotel residents found the wallet and she went to great trouble to return the it to me personally and I did not get to thank her enough for the trouble she went to and her honesty so thank you if you reading this review! The Porter when I told him my wallet was missing kindly said not to worry too much sometimes these situations have a good ending and he was so right! Gym open 24 hours which is great for people like me trying to get over jetlag, also had breakfast in the hotel and it was great. WI-FI is available at a charge per day but there is a Starbucks across the road with complimentary WI-FI.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sadie280
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the Royal York both for business and pleasure. I was very disappointed during our last stay (Feb25th). I had a booked a suite for our family of four as we were going to the hockey game. Upon arrival the valet parking was disorganized and over crowded. It took us 15 minutes just to get off the road into the parking area. The suite was very nice and clean. There was a VERY LOUD party on our same floor that raged until 3:00AM. Management did nothing to address the noise level - loud laughter and people running in the halls. I dont mind a party; but, it is out of hand when people are allowed to bellow and laugh until 3:00 in the morning. I paid over $300 for the room and none of us were able to sleep. Not worth the stay. I will be cutting up my Presidents card and steying somewhere else on my next visit to Toronto!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel but showing it a little as well”
Reviews.Author: pensfan58
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying here, having been very pleased with several other Fairmont properties in the past. Its not that I wouldn't stay here again but the hotel was feeling a little tired. The water pressure sucked and I couldn't control the room temp all that well. The Library Bar in the lobby had unattentive service and was grossly overpriced. Was it horrible, no. Was if 5 star, no. It was Ok and it worked for my trip, but compared to Fairmont's I've stayed at elsewhere (Quebec City, Pittsburgh, Charlevoix) it was a dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming room”
Reviews.Author: GriffindorOtt
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel, like the Chateau Laurier, Montebello, Frontenac very beautiful, but you don't sleep in the lobby. Had a "deluxe" room with a king bed and a sitting area which consisted of a threadbare sofa bed and a brass and glass coffee table. It did not look like the room in the photos on the website. It was a worn down version of those. There really was no view. From the second floor looked down on a lower roof and the side of the building. It took a very long time to adjust the water to a comfortable temperature in the small bathroom. Service at the bell desk and reception was very good and prompt. Housekeeping was great. There just isn't anything that would make me want to go back to this hotel for the price. Pros: right across the street from the train station, on the underground walking PATH, and on the subway line. How about a couple complimentary bottles of spring water in the room instead of $6 bottles of Evian Fairmont? Do not pay for internet at this hotel. Go to the Fairmont website and join the "President's Club" - no charge. Keep your number with you and use it to log on to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “My "Bad Hair Day" Stay at the Royal York...”
Reviews.Author: Holly M
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited about staying at the Royal York, as I had not been there since I was a child (30 years ago) and I remembered it being pretty fancy. Here's the one thing that stands out from my Feb 26 - 28, 2012 visit: Our shower had NO water pressure and the water was luke warm at best. So I had 2 days of really bad hair... Other than that, I would say this hotel is average at best. Our toilet leaked, but we knew the hotel was boked for a conference so we didn't even bother asking for another room. I threw a towel on the floor to soak it up. And the toilet would run constantly; which again my husband fiddled with and managed to fix each time it happened, It is in need of some updates; things are looking a bit shabby. Great location, great service, and great beds. It was clean, and like I said the location is great. But the hotel is tired and in need of some freshening up...

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: philbert09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife in August '11 and i have to say that i really could not fault this hotel. Gorgeous through and through and if you get a chance to stay on the executive floor with the lounge is such an added bonus. Great service, great food, great amenities, fantastic location - what more could you ask for from a hotel? Nice work :)

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located in an impressive hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlandherdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and it was wonderful! The rooms were clean and the room service was outstanding! Nothing compares to this hotel especially when comparable hotels were charging higher rates.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded room - good service and location”
Reviews.Author: MtlHabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in Toronto as I had a lunch meeting and Toronto was forecast to have a major snow storm. Storm never happened but wife and I stayed anyway. Check in was smooth and room upgrade was great with plenty of space, sitting area and two washrooms. Room was situated on the 5th floor, quiet and not to far from the elevators for easy access in the pathway for travel underground. Great deal of choices for entertainment and dining in the area and as I am very familiar with TO, we had no problem finding our way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: abnewf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Royal York during a very busy weekend in Toronto, and although we expected this to impact our visit it didn't. The hotel was incredibly busy but service was great, check in was a breeze and we did not have to wait. The decor is what you would expect from a Fairmont, old style but classy and comfy. The room was clean, we had a great view, and the amenities were wonderful. We got back to the hotel late that night after having a very early supper, and ordered room service. After waiting for about an hour (but being told 30 minutes) we called, just wondering how long our wait would be and within 10 minutes it arrived. The next morning upon check out the lady told us room service had comped our meal because of our long wait, saving us over $100!! This is why you stay at the Fairmont, service is always amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LadyLestat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and it was wonderful. Check in: Fast and efficient and the lady at front desk (sorry forgot her name) was helpful and polite. Took all of 2 mins to get the keys. Room: Fairmont King Room. Perfect size. The bed was comfortable and I had no problems falling asleep. The bathroom is a bit small though, but it's not like you're sleeping in there. Cleaning staff was polite and friendly. Always smiling. The walls are a bit thin though, but not a big deal. Nothing was going to bother my stay here. Location: Perfect and centrally located to all the attractions, ie: CN Tower, Rogers Centre, ACC, Union Station etc. Shuttle services are also available and right outside the hotel. The only downside is the crazy expensive prices for the restaurants in the hotels. But there are many other options available in the area, so explore for yourself. There are some hidden gems. I will stay here again if the occassion calls for it. Thank you for the great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Girl that needs Room Makeovers”
Reviews.Author: ARKonVacation
Reviews.Content: This is a beautifully grand hotel in the downtown Toronto area close enough to everything that is Toronto. I am from the area and I can attest that when you sit in its stately lobby, you can just feel the historical significance of the hotel. The staff are superbly helpful The guest rooms are another matter though; the beds are comfortable but the rooms are in need of upgrading especially the bathrooms. It took us about 5 minutes to get hot water for bathing. I will come again but sincerely hope that the Fairmont will upgrade the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Grand stay at a Grand old Dame”
Reviews.Author: CityBoy1760
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze with presidents club. The room was clean beds comfortable view of city great. Lobby of hotel is great for people watching. Conceirge was Spot on with all dinner and site seeing recommendations. The Library bar is a great place to relax after dinner or long Day of site seeing. The hotel is conveniently located to all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine Weekend in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: thewoodstead
Reviews.Content: What a lovely and romantic place to spend Valentine's weekend! The Royal York is a stately and gracious hotel. The service is wonderful (including the perfectly polished shoes delivered to the room), the food in the Epic resteraunt delicious and the rooms tastefully decorated and comfortable (love the cushy bathrobes). Since the hotel is right downtown, we were able to take the subway from Union Station to visit friends and walk to the shops. We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Justin130664
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Royal York when I'm in Toronto cause the location is so great and it's convenient, specialy during the rainy day or during the winter to go to my meetings by the inside corridors. Service is also perfect and the restaurant, Epic is a great place for business breakfast, lunch or dinner. Justin

Reviews.Title: “A nice business staple”
Reviews.Author: g8trgrl
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for two nights last week (one of them Valentine's day) and must say, the service was great. The desk staff had been beyond helpful a prior week when I had forgotten to reschedule my reservation; and they didn't disappoint in person either. I arrived on Monday night and chatted with a great, speedy concierge who got me to my favorite shoe boutiques before closing; the bell service and doormen were similarly great getting me a cab whenever I needed one (and on my return to the airport arranged a car which was the same price as a cab). The bed was old school (what, no platform?) but the wireless was easy-peasy and included as a President's club member (free) and the minibar was stocked up. Plus, I had an unplanned dinner in the hotel at Epic, which lived up to its name of being healthy and good food. Honestly, I live in the UK so North American service levels are a bit of a luxury for me - but the folks at the Fairmont delivered. Yes, the hotels' a bit old and showing its age - but you know what? For the first business trip in recent memory, I had no temperature control issues; no noise issues; and the amenities were exactly what I needed. How can you complain about that? You can't.

Reviews.Title: “working...”
Reviews.Author: habh8erswife
Reviews.Content: While working at a conference at the Royal York, the food was delicious, the staff were attentive and very professional and the hotel was absolutely beautiful. The room was on the small side, but the bed was very comfortable, the room was clean, and the wi-fi worked flawlessly. The hotel is also conveniently located near Union Station, the Air Canada Centre, the Toronto Path, etc. Because of the wi-fi (with the President's Club), the location, and the luxury accommodations, I'm going to stay their with my husband on a trip to Toronto coming up in March.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service in an Iconic Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCH_in_Canada
Reviews.Content: I'm a Platinum member in the Fairmont President's Club, so I stay in a fair number of Fairmont properties each year. As I live near Toronto, I've attended numerous conferences and events at this property over the years, but had actually never stayed here before. With the auto-show going on just down the street and with tickets to the Rock game across the street, we thought why not spend the Family Day weekend at the Royal York as a vacation away from home, yet close to home. We booked a room as part of a winter promo and was able to upgrade into a large corner suite with (ornamental) fireplace, dining area, 2 bathrooms and seperate bedrooms. The decor was looking a little worn, but still charming. However, things are being updated as we had a 44" LCD TV in the bedroom and what looked to be a 60" unit in the parlour. The biggest annoyance with this property is the cost of parking at $42/day. We managed to get a spot in the underground municipal lot next door at 40 York Street and paid $27 for the whole weekend! Keep this in mind if you're ever driving in to stay at the Royal York. We had a mixup on the final day of our stay, which could not have been resolved in a better way by the hotel. We were using up some Fairmont Spa/Dining certificates before they expired at the end of Feb, which were provided as part of the annual benefits of the FPC loyalty program. As it turned out, the certificates can only be used at the "Willow Stream" branded spas, which the Royal York's spa was not. After the spa accepted the certificates and provided the massage treatments, they said they made a mistake and could not accept the certificates because they were not a Willow Stream spa--something that should have been mentioned before accepting the certificates and providing the treatments! After explaining the mixup to the front desk, they simply removed the spa treatments from the bill and said to use the certificates for lunch in the restaurant before leaving. What a great way to handle a situation like this, to show loyal Fairmont customers that their business is valued. It's one of the reasons I love to stay at Fairmont properties. If you like iconic properties with some history and charm, and don't mind things looking a little worn in places, the Royal York is a lovely place to stay. Also be sure to join the Fairmont Presidents Club--if you stay with them a lot, they really take good care of you!

Reviews.Title: “Construction in Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: Deb C
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in the downtown area, it's old and is showing its wear. Front Street is under construction, so, it was hard to get to. Our room could've been cleaner, found alot of dust under the bed and along the wall edge, I believe they only vaccum the main traffic areas. We used the valet parking with no issues, it is pricey thou at $42 a nite. Breakfast in the lobby was $150 for 4 people using the buffet. There is fast food down on the PATH, Harvey's, Swiss Chalet, Tim Horton's etc, but there not open in the evening. Jack Astors, and Cassey's across the street. salmon at Cassey's was great.....

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I travel to Toronto every 6 months and always stay in different hotels, and this time we decided it was finally time to stay at the Fairmont Royal York. This Fairmont location lives up to the Fairmont expectations. Yes, the hotel is old but it is beautiful and has some of the best staff we have ever experienced. Our plane landed at 8 am on a Friday February 10th, so we got to the hotel well before the 3 pm check in time, which was no problem. The lady working at the check in desk (Nadya, I believe her name was) was friendly, fast and found us a room right away, also giving us an upgrade to the 14th floor where our room had an amazing view facing the lake, air canada centre, union station, Billy Bishop airport (got to watch lots of planes land and take off) as well as the CN tower. Our room was a decent size with a king bed. The bathroom was a little small but most hotel bathrooms are. The room was a little dated in it`s decor, but it was charming. Best of all the room was quiet. We were very close to the elevators and didn't hear them at all, we also did not hear any construction noise from the street below or traffic. This was probably because our room was on the 14th floor. The cleaning staff who were in the hallway by our room would always greet us ith smiles and make sure we didn`t need anything. The hotel is in the perfect location, a 2 minute walk to Union Station and the Air Canada Centre, and about 10 minutes to the CN tower (the Skywalk is closed at one point and we were required to take a detour because of the aquarium construction) and you can get almost anywhere from the underground PATH. The doormen were very friendly and helpful as well, always insisting we let them carry our bags up the stairs when we first arrived, or carry them down as we were leaving. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and we will definitely be staying here next time we come to Toronto, as well we will both be recommending this hotel to everyone we know looking for a place to stay in Toronto. This is by far the best hotel experience we have had in the city. My only complaint is that the pool was FREEZING and the hot tub was out of service for the entire 4 days we were there. Also, we called down 2 days before check out to request a 1:30 checkout time as our flight didn't leave until 3:30, and the girl said she would put in the request, and on the day of checkout we called them to confirm and the man said there was no record of us requesting a later check out but allowed us to do so anway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MD00016
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a great, old, beautiful hotel. My husband, daughter and I came for a night stay in Toronto in January. The door man was very nice and helped us with our bags. (Just a note that the underground garage is not very obvious itâ€™s behind the building in the alley and you get in through another building.) The check in desk was great! The lady was very nice and happy. Nice to see! They gave my daughter a little stuffed lion called Rory. Apparently they give these to the little ones. They also sent up cookies and milk to our room!! We got an upgrade for a small charge and it was worth the extra money. The room is a bit tired she needs a little lift, however the beds are comfortable and clean! The room was clean and the two bathroom great. Other then a bit tired as well. I love the old details with the chandeliers hope they will keep those if they ever renovate. There are many restaurants near by lots to choose from. There is a Tim Hortons at the corner from the hotel if you need something quick in the morning. Overall our experience was great service fantastic. We had a small issue with neighbours that were a bit loud however we did not let that dampen our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historical building that is worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: mitti33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for two nights. The building is beautiful and if you have never been inside before, you will be impressed Take the time to view the historical photographs and information boards posted on the mezzanine level. I have been to the Royal York on previvous occassions for various events and conferences. The staff do an excellent job of making sure your needs are taken care of in a polite and attentive manner. The lobby bar is a great place to sit and people watch altough the drinks are not cheap! I love the convenience of having the underground pathway below the building and the easy access to all of the downtown venues. The rooms are small (consider the time period in which the building was constructed) but they are comfortable and clean. My room was somewhat larger than my friend's and it had more storage space which I appreciated.The water pressure was a bit of an issue while I was there. It is worth staying at this historical hotel at least once but there are more reasonably priced hotels in the downtown area with more space and more modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashion railway chic is alive and well”
Reviews.Author: EriksPinkAngel
Reviews.Content: This grand old lady is well worth a stay or even visit if your in Toronto. I have now stayed twice and the service and quality has been of a high standard each time. Rooms and bed linens clean and tidy. The hotel is directly opposite Union Station - handy if you arrive by train, and the airport shuttle bus picks up and drops off right outside its door frequently. It is linked by the underground walk ways of Toronto and is within easy walking distance of a lot of major attractions. Concierge desk knowledgeable and polite. Day tours easily booked from here with pick ups and drop offs. Yo may pay a little more to stay here but not as much as some places who are not as good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Heather L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful architecture and right down town Toronto! Very helpful and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stately old building, very good overall”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: I love old hotels with lots of history, and this one did not disappoint in that regard. Rugs in the common areas were plush, lots of brass and/or gilded materials, big heavy wooden doors, etc. The guest rooms did not have quite the same feel - they seemed more dated than stately. Service at the front desk was impeccably polite but nothing really stood out as memorable. I was disappointed that the gym was closed the week we were there. The hotel offered entrance to a nearby health club that opened at.... 8:00am! Unfortunately, I did not have time to lounge about waiting for the health club to open, so I missed out. Good location with easy navigation through the underground walkways, and taxis always at the ready outside.

Reviews.Title: “It's everything we thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: kanadai
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York is a grand hotel. Given the cost, it's not the kind of hotel we usually choose. But sometime you just have to pamper yourself. And we did, but only for one night. Three of us arrived by train at Union Station and walked across the street to the Royal York. Quick and easy. We were impressed the minute we walked through the door. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff and we were in our deluxe room in no time at all. Our room on the seventh floor had two double beds and a roll-out bed. It also had two full bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable with down pillows. As you would expect for a hotel like this, the service was above and beyond the norm. We went out for dinner and when we returned the beds were refreshed and the garbage from the earlier part of the day was removed. One of the beds had a small note with the weather forecast for the following day. In the morning there as a copy of the Globe and Mail outside our door. We had a lovely breakfast in the Epic restaurant but it was pricey. But we knew it would be so it wasn't a surprise. If you want to splurge or impress, this is the place to do it in. Would we go back again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Very central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jimboza
Reviews.Content: This hotel does seem to be the centre of Toronto, with all the shuttles, walkways and main business areas of Toronto right there. I'm not sure how I feel about the slightly dated look and feel of the place, I guess it has some historical value, but it seems a bit tired from some angles. I was dissapointed how many normally standard things like internet access is charged for, but in general its OK. Next time I may stay somewhere a bit more fun & edgy, but it is very convenient as a base in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Mona B
Reviews.Content: We loved our room, it was clean and spacious. The dinning I felt could have been better, not that much variety, mostly pub style, and very expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Royal treatment!”
Reviews.Author: Moira L
Reviews.Content: An upgrade to an enormous suite, fresh fruit and workout clothes waiting for me, 5pm check out, free shuttle to city airport. Very Royal indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Royal York, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Laurabay17
Reviews.Content: We flew into Billy Bishop downtown airport, which had a free shuttle directly to the Royal York. Very convenient. The hotel is historic, grand and lots of options for food,drink, etc. Pricey hotel for small rooms if you don't have a deal of some kind, though. (We did).

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havee17
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Royal York Hotel in downtown Toronto. The hotel is huge and centrally located. It is a short walk to the Hockey Hall of Fame and acrss the street from Union Station. I stayed in a king room suite with a "view". As it turns out my windows were covered with a permanent shade so not sure what view there was. The room was clean and the decor OK. The Wi-Fi did not work on my IPad or Android phone. I called the front desk and they offered to send up a Tech but it was late so I passed on having the Tech come to the room. The hotel is a little dated and needs a make over..

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: baileypenney
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York is a beautiful historic hotel that is central to all attractions in downtown Toronto. It is connected to the underground PATH so it is easy to get around when there is bad weather outside. The hotel has all the amenities of a full service establishment. Excellent restaurants though expensive. However, there are plenty of choices of restaurants in the vicinity if you so desire. The staff is friendly, room decor plush & clean but lighting is low. Room sizes vary but some can be small. Beds are very comfortable. My room was small (this time I was solo and didn't mind), but definitely too small for 2 persons. So make sure you know what size room you desire. Being a member of Fairmont's Presidents Club is a plus with complimentary internet access in room. Overall, another pleasant 3-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: trkndg44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on Jan.27. We took the train to Union Station which was across the street. It was an easy transition.The hotel was nice with that old established feeling to it. You could access the underground malls where you could walk shop and eat for miles without going outside. The rooms are well acquainted, however the washrooms are small. You could not have two people there unless one was in the shower. The beds were quite comfortable and the rooms were quiet.We found the restaurants in the hotel lacking. If we stay there again we will eat elsewhere.We had a nice stay and the service was excellent but will probably stay elsewhere next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: taveler2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip for one night in Janary 2012. While the building itself is beautiful, including a very nice hotel lobby, my room felt a little "tired." At first glance, the room looked great. But the carpets were old, the fabric on some of the chairs was stained. The bathtub was old and the toilet seat cover really needed to be replaced. The toilet seat cover, especially, was unacceptable. I expected much more from the Fairmont Royal York. For the amount of money they charge, I would expect them to update/renovate the hotel. I did not have breakfst so I cannot comment on the food. The location of this hotel was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “A beautifull Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alila60
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York Toronto is a beautiful hotel. Staff very friendly and helpful. I couldnt get over the beauty of this hotel and so central. Best part was being able to go shopping underneath. Wonderful and a wonderful little cafe where we had breakfast on our last morning. Breakfast and dinner in the hotel was lovely. I felt like a queen. We stayed in this hotel last August and would recommend it. Hopefully we will get back someday. We spent 4 wonderful days here. There was also a lovely swimming pool which we swam in everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Getting tired”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeMunich
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a suite in the Royal York and found that the decor was looking a bit worn out in the living area, although the bedroom area was fine. It feels like the hotel is due for a renovation, although it has its pluses, like the President's Club program and the location. Meals, especially breakfast, are overpriced. Staff is especially well trained and professionally friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service, typical of Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Bluegrassdog
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the staff and service at this hotel has steadily improved in the last 3 years. We have taken to staying at this hotel on a fairly regular basis (3 or 4 times/year) because in other cities we stay at Fairmont hotels almost exclusively (they are dog-friendly). I hold that the Fairmont standard in customer service is typically excellent, from their central reservations office to their staff at all their properties. This last trip, we noticed that the excellent customer service was indeed up to par with their other hotels. The woman at the front desk was so incredibly friendly that it made me happy to be there. Others were also friendly and helpful, and it was a nice perk to have our deluxe room upgraded to a junior sweet. In fact, it is precisely these types of pleasant perks that has made us pretty steady Fairmont customers. While the Library Bar continues to be insanely expensive, I guess the reality is that a hotel of this incredible size has to pay its bills somehow. Nevertheless, this bar is very warm and pleasant, and the wait staff is excellent and friendly. Now, as always, there is an exception: if you want Bellhop service-- someone to help you drag your suitcases down the ridiculous staircase to your waiting car-- forget it. They will, however, stand around and watch. And if you make a comment about it, you might get a shrug. It's almost like the bellhops are working for a different hotel. Very unpleasant group.

Reviews.Title: “A regal experience”
Reviews.Author: Caelorum
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is a beautiful hotel with lots of old world charm. The lobby is magnificent and the Library Bar is a wonderful place to unwind after a long day, The room was spacious and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at a landmark hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Magicats
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on a Jaunt discount in December. Despite the construction it was easy to pull into the hotel and have our car taken by the valet. The basic Fairmont room was more than big enough for the two of us as well as the amenities of the room were great. One thing that people have to remember this hotel was built in 1929. The rooms may not be as big or luxurious as some newer hotels, they are still very well up kept as well as the property itself. There was no noise from the traffic or construction happening outside. With our car safely stowed away we walked to the distillery district for a winter festival they were hosting down there. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance to theatres, clubs, restaurants and other sites like the Hockey Hall of Fame. Union station is right across the street so if arriving by rail this is the best place to stay. Out of all the hotels available in TO there are only 2 we would stay at and this is on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, expected bigger rooms for price & brand”
Reviews.Author: Ninjaman0714
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Fairmont for 4 nights in mid July 2011. When I was choosing a hotel to stay at, it narrowed down between this and the Intercontinental (both similarly priced) which was close by. I had stayed at an Intercontinental before in Greece, and was quite pleased with it, but I had a colleague who was living at the Fairmont in Dubai, and based on his feedback on the Fairmont brand, I decided this might be a nicer option for my wife and I. The hotel looks the part from the moment you enter, very regal & reminiscent of Old European architecture. From the check-in experience, service was very good. All staff were very helpful and accommodating - we also managed to get a late check out on our final day without any issue. Location was pretty nice, walking distance to the CN Tower and of course all other sites near to the CN Tower. Hotel has underground that connects up with a few other towers, and also the Union Train Station. Plenty food places scattered around the nearby streets, including within the hotel itself. The underground also has a few food courts. The room was not tiny, but just a little too small to be very comfortable - if my wife and I had normal luggage, we would have been very cramped. Rooms were kept clean though. Overall, I had no real problems with the hotel, and what would have been an average hotel stay was put over the top with the fantastic service we got, from the front desk to the concierge to the bellhops. When next going back to Toronto though, I would try the Intercontinental just for a comparison, as they both are certainly not the cheapest options out there, and for the price I paid, I ideally would have wanted a little more room - especially if walking with a couple normal sized suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction”
Reviews.Author: dhalliday3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights at this hotel. You can tell that once upon a time it was very elegant but now it is very tired. The pool, sauna, etc. were under construction so we were give access to these amenities at another hotel. We didn't use them as we wanted to stay in our hotel. Our room key had to be re-set twice as it kept failing. The sound of construction work started early (just after 8:00 am) so no rest or quiet time. The windows were covered so we couldn't see outside. There was no water pressure for the shower although the water did stay hot. On a positive note, the staff were really friendly. I'm not used to writing negative reviews for anything but for what you pay to stay here....be advised!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive from the second you enter the hotel matched by fantastic service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Cruseliner
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, location fantastic, fantastic for both business and pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Familiar but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: juliebooBuffalo_Ny
Reviews.Content: I am in the Presidents Club and this is one of my favorite hotels. PART OF THE FACADE IS UNDERGOING RENOVATION-the west side-so we requested a room away from the noise and street. Though we were four floors up you couldn't hear anything outside. The staff are always professional and our deluxe suite proved more than large enough for the the of us. My only complaint is that the pool was VERY cold and I could only manage one lap before jumping out.

Reviews.Title: “Why wouldn't you stay here? Its fun.”
Reviews.Author: cfilmcat
Reviews.Content: Downtown Toronto, right across from the train station and walking distance to all the downtown meetings you could have booked. Also connected to underground tunnels all the way to Bloor St. for those blustery Toronto days Perfect for business and vacation. Plus the biggest chandelier studded lobby I think in the city. An old railway hotel that takes up the entire width of a city block.

Reviews.Title: “Stay and Fly”
Reviews.Author: SpensMiniCoop
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Royal York as it offers parking for short flight out of Toronto as well as a shuttle to Billy Bishop Airport.

Reviews.Title: “peace of mind”
Reviews.Author: Kathy D
Reviews.Content: In December my youngest brother was taken to St. Michaels Hospital to undergo a very exstensive bowel surgery. He was in ICU for quite a while. The Royal York offered our family a free stay for a week durning the month of December. The staff at the Royal York were very accomodating and made our stay there special. Thank you so much for giving us a much needed break from the travelling we were doing at this trying time. My family apprecieated your generosity.

Reviews.Title: “Great high tea experience at Library Bar!”
Reviews.Author: mcmau2002
Reviews.Content: It was a great high tea experience at the Library Bar (Royal York Hotel). We purchased two vouchers for high tea and we didnâ€™t expect that the food quality was this high and the service was excellent. Sometime when you use vouchers instead of cash, you will get a different service, but definitely not at Library Bar! The staff were all friendly and great! We went to other places for high tea before such as Four Seasons and Windsor Arms but we really enjoy this one. We will come back for high tea again!

Reviews.Title: “getaway in the city”
Reviews.Author: FroginTO
Reviews.Content: I booked one night stay at the famous Royal York hotel, operated by Fairmont. It is a fabulous hotel, full of history and right downtown Toronto. My room was in the "new" wing built in the 1950"s. The original part of the hotel was buitl in 1929 to be branded "the tallest hotel of the Empire"! The lobby still retains its original slendour. It is quite nice. My room was clean, fully appointed. The room service was impeccable, the food hot and on time. I would recommend the hotel to anyone looking to get away. Now one must remember that despite the refurbishing and upgrades done in the the past years, the bones of the Hotel are 60 to 80 years old therefore the room sizes are smaller, the sound proofing might not be optimal sometimes. To prevent such problems, request a room far from elevators and ice machines. I found if you ask at the front desk they will do everything possible to accomodate you.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal downtown base”
Reviews.Author: Sue-and-Steve-Ascot
Reviews.Content: Used the Fairmont for a stop-over on a business trip and it is a good base for that purpose. The reception staff and concierge are very friendly and helpful with good suggestions for the surrounding area. The style of the hotel is a little old-fashioned but there are good facilities and a good business centre. Wi Fi is good but not cheap - or free as it should be these days in business hotels. You have easy access to Toronto's underground avenues and the hotel is directly opposite the Union Station. The hotel is one of Toronto's "grand dames" hotels and is very well located and that makes it a useful base.

Reviews.Title: “disapointed”
Reviews.Author: joythemama
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royak York this summer with y granddaughter. It was a disapointment. The pool and hot tub were both cold. There was no one in them we asked that they be turned up only to be told they were at code. In all my days of travelling I have not been treated like this.

Reviews.Title: “Central Kid Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agiustino
Reviews.Content: We were visiting family in Toronto and spent 3 nights here for a local getaway. Our kids, ages 4 and 6, loved the hotel's decor. We ate all our meals at the restaurant, Epic, in the lobby. Kid menu was great and we enjoyed piano player each evening. Recommend the burger. Room was great, two room suite with two bathrooms. We all slept well. Cleaning person met our daughter and brought her a kids size bathrobe later in day without asking. Indoor pool was great for the kids. Easy access to subway to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leegns
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while travelling for buisness however since we spent a few days in the city we were able to sneak in some personal time too. The hotel is in a great location for hitting the stadium, CN Tower, and the Eaton Centre. We were able to walk to everything we had time to do. The rooms were sufficient but nothing overly special. Overall exactly what I would expect for the price. The service for the conference was VERY good. They served plenty of coffee and snacks through the day. The tables were cleaned off and provided with fresh water when it was appropriate to do so. They did a wonderful job!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing heritage hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Durodeb
Reviews.Content: This is one of the original CP Rail hotels. As such, it is an older property and suffers from some of the ailments that older properties do. However, it is a lovely old building with a lot of heritage and if you are prepared to put up with a few inconveniences, it is a great place to stay. It is directly across from Union Station (the main train station in Toronto) with great access to both the subway system (which in Toronto is quite good) and an urban train network called Go Transit. You can also take the train to places like Ottawa and Montreal and end up right downtown (in Montreal's case) avoiding the hassle of the airport. The rooms are pretty average in terms of the amenities. The beds are comfortable. The staff are generally pretty good although I would not categorize this as one of the friendlier Fairmont Hotels (and I stay at Fairmont a LOT).

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel; Superb Service; First Class!”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: I am amazed (dismayed) by some of the reviews of this absolutely excellent hotel. I am a frequent guest at the Royal York (both for business and leisure) and I cannot recommend this place more highly. From the moment you arrive at the front desk to the time that you check out you are aware of the grandeur of this grand old house. Some comment negatively on the worn nature of some of the furniture. That is part of the attraction for me. This place is brimming over with character and history. Do yourself a favour and take some time exploring the second floor of the lobby and see pictures of the history of this hotel. Check out the sign in book on display in the lobby. In the warmer months ask the staff about the possibility of visiting the bee hives and roof top garden. Have a bite to eat in one of the many restaurants or bars in the hotel. The Epic has a great restaurant and a fine side lounge. My favourite bar is the Library Bar. The serving staff are exceptional particularly Rene who deserves special mention as he goes out of his way to ensure that you feel at home. On the lower of arcade level is a fine pub called Pipers and a little deli open for the morning and afternoon (my recommendation for a quick breakfast in the morning). At night you are close to everything or anything you'd like to do. If you are lucky enough to get an upgrade to a suite you may want to opt to stay in. If so, try going to Longo's (a full service grocery store near the Air Canada Centre that is accessible through the PATH south bound through the nearby Union Station). Longo's has a great and affordable cold and hot salad/buffet bar. There is a well stocked LCBO in the PATH right near the Royal York as well. Occasionally you will find that your room is not ready on check in. Invariably the staff will try to get you an alternate room. If they can't they will offer to check your bags while you wait. We once had a rather long wait for the room and the apologetic staff gave us a voucher to use at the library bar where my wife and I enjoyed a fine riesling 'on the house'. The work out facility on site is adequate especially if all you want is a cardio work out. There is a full set of dumbells but not much space. The Airporter serving Pearson International Airport stops just outside the Royal York (on the west side) and tickets for it can be purchased at the concierge desk in the lobby. The free shuttle to the Toronto Island Airport stops at the same location. The staff are unfailingly friendly. The architecture is spectacular. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & leisure club”
Reviews.Author: thisisdeh
Reviews.Content: Nice stay here - had a great suite (very big, bit old fashioned in style but very sizeable). Enjoyed the leisure club and pool. Service recovered big time after a hit and miss start where the booking/reservation wasnt quite right and the reception manager didnt know how to resolve it but hats off to Pauline the Rooms Manager who dealt with it personally, very effectively and well. She went above and beyond and rectified the situation with great professionalism and called me to discuss. Nice touch and made a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Excellence.”
Reviews.Author: BoyLP
Reviews.Content: The Royal York Hotel remains steadfast and true to its dedication to elegance and stately tradition. The reputation of this hotel certainly precedes it and we were not disappointed; in fact, we were exceedingly impressed. We had read some of the dissenting reviews on Tripadvisor and after our stay at this formidable hotel, we can only conclude that those people are insufferably ignorant or else just plain unintelligent. We spent two days in Toronto before Christmas as our gift to one another. We attended a show, had dinner on top of the world at the CN Tower, and took in an exhibition along with the other signts of the city at Christmas time. The Fairmont Royal York was impressive in its timeless architecture, its evident maintenance, its warm and dedicated staff, its unequivocal elegance and its flawless attention to detail. The Lobby cannot be properly captured in a photograph, it was truly captivating in all of its luxury. We arrived by train at 8:30 in the morning with the intention of leaving our bags with the Bell Desk at the Fairmont, only to find at the check-in desk that there was a room waiting for us. We were greeted by a lovely young lady-- whose name I will not mention for privacy's sake but whose initials are H.R.-- who provided exceptionally efficient, effective and personable service while checking us in. The attention to detail was immediately evident as the lady at the front desk knew we were there as our gift to one another, and that we sought a room away from the ice machines and elevators if possible. This was information I had mentioned upon booking the room weeks earlier, but it had all been duly recorded with our profile. We were delighted to be able to take our bags to our room so early in the day. We were almost out of the foyer on our way to the East Wing when this same helpful lady from the front desk swiftly walked after us and informed us that she had given us a room that was rather closer to the elevators, and she asked us would we return with her to find another room. Within minutes we were on our way to the Eighth Floor in the main building to our new room and deposited our luggage. The room was beautiful. We overlooked Front Street, Union Station, the various waterfront towers and Lake Ontario itself. We could even see the Toronto Island airport! We had a lovely sitting area by the large window, a king bed, marble bathroom, a desk with chair, a bureau for the television, and a table for the coffee machine with tea, coffee and all the necessities. The historic tradition of the hotel was evident with the beautiful moulding around the walls at the ceiling and the floor and the glass doorknob on the bathroom door. The decor was sumptuous and elegant; rich drapes with beautiful patterns over white sheers on the window, coordinating linens and upholstery on the bed and the solid-wood furniture, all finished in a rich medium-dark wood. There was plenty of space for luggage beside the bed; the coat closet with ironing facilities was perfect for our overcoats. We were so pleased to find that bathrobes were waiting in the bathroom, which was outfitted with many soaps, shampoo, creams, conditioner and other accessories. The room in its entirety was perfectly appointed in furniture, decor, and amenities. We felt right at home when we returned later in the day as we prepared for supper and the show. That night, we strolled the Mezzanine level overlooking the grand lobby with its nostalgic photos of the Royal York in earlier days. We spent a wonderful time at the Library Bar-- the bar mix is fantastic-- which is another highlight of this great old hotel. Another triumph in decor, the Library Bar was the perfect place to unwind after the show and have a few drinks, just to soak up the cool and relaxed atmosphere. We took a look inside the Imperial Room adjacent, and it is nothing short of magnificent. This room wouldn't be out of place in a palace. It is splendid and nothing short of pure glamour. Returning to the room, the bed was exceptionally comfortable; it gave a soft feel and firm support all at once. The white linens were impeccably fresh, crisp, clean and comforting. Excellent sleep quality. The next morning we decided to try the pool. Donning our bathrobes, we were very pleased to find that the pool and fitness facilities are located on their own floor. In so many hotels one must walk through the lobby or past the front desk or the restaurant to get to the pool, and it is awkward to meet fully-dressed strangers in one's bathing suit. We were greeted by a very friendly lady at the pool who signed us in and gave us the same type of thick, soft towels we had in our room. The pool and whirlpool were an extension of the hotel: impeccably clean and well-appointed. Every detail considered. The plants and deck-chairs, the tiling, the glass roof overhead... it was perfect. We were very impressed by the large water dispenser near the door: it was full of ice-cold water whose surface was covered with thin-sliced rounds of oranges, lemons and grapefruits! It was absolutely the most thoughful and effective amenity to place near the pool and whirlpool. At check-out we were met with the same friendly service, and we spent the last little while before our train arrived waiting in the grand lobby, enjoying the beautiful Christmas decorations and watching the passerby. In case you couldn't tell, we were immensely pleased and absolutely delighted with our stay. So many hotels miss the mark, but the Fairmont Royal York has clearly stood the test of time owing to its elegance, unsurpassed service, and dedication to the ultimate experience for its guests. We sincerely hope it will always be thus. We also wish to heartily thank the staff at the Royal York for an unforgettable experience we hope we can soon repeat.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: ajs2467
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for New Years with some friends after attending an event at another hotel. The hotel itself is really nice, especially the lobby. The rooms themselves aren't so special. Our room was very small with two small double beds and old looking wallpaper. The room was clean and the beds were fairly comfortable however. Our room was on the 7th floor and it did have a great view of the CN Tower and the location is great, right across the street from Union Station. All of us were glad we didn't drive, parking was expensive and the line for the valet the next morning was long! But overall I'm not sure I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “The Failmont Royal York”
Reviews.Author: rykmac44
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend the night in Toronto and chose the Royal York. We were very disappointed with the entire stay. Upon check in, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade for a small fee to a higher floor with a south facing view, so we did to floor 15. Not realizing that meant waiting 2.5 hours for the room to be ready. Once we finally got into the room, the duvet cover was dirty with black marks all over it, the night stand had something sticky all over it and the T.V didn't work. I called down about it and after waiting 45 minutes for someone to come I went down to the lobby where I waited again. Finally a maintenance guy came in to try and fix the T.V, and then another one came and couldn't get it to work. They said we would be taken care of so to just wait for a call. The call came and we were offered floor 6! I said no thank you, I am not being downgraded. We had to get to an engagement so they said they would fix the problems while we were gone. Upon our return, they did fix things. I was very disappointed at the service I was given based on the reputation of The Fairmont Royal York. On a more positive note, the location is great. Walking to the ACC, shops, Union Station, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place except for the hotel rooms???”
Reviews.Author: djm36
Reviews.Content: I love the building, the pool, the fitness centre and the food. But, I find the rooms small and some parts in need of a good cleaning (e.g., light fixtures). On all three visits to the hotel, we were kept awake by people in neighbouring rooms. There seems to be very 'thin walls'. I much prefer the rooms at the Cambridge Suites and can usually get a suite there for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: wqh
Reviews.Content: The room was top notch and the service second to none. Every employee was so friendly - it was amazing. It's close to everything and easy to catch the subway. If you are coming to toronto, this is the place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Showin' her age!”
Reviews.Author: UKBen75
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York feels like its stuck in a bit of a time warp. Which is fun and a bit kitsch in the lobby but unacceptable in the rooms. With some of the spectacular new hotels opening up in Toronto, this old dame is going to become a relic soon unless there is some urgent updating of the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool temperature is just too cold!”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: it's -7 outside and yet the Fairmont's indoor pool's temperature is so cold I can't put my foot in it! few men manage to swim while ladies and kids keep telling each other "it's too cold"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Pricey Extras”
Reviews.Author: beajolley
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose to stay for one evening at the Royal York because of the good location. I was arriving by train to Union Station and it was easiest to head there. We found that things like the WiFi, In-Room food, and room service were all incredibly expensive. I felt that because of the premium price being paid for the room itself it was a bit much to be charging so much for everything else. Obviously you expect to pay extra for room service, but having to pay extra for simple WiFi seems a bit much to me. Overall, I'd recommend only staying here if you have lots of extra money and nothing better to spend it on.

Reviews.Title: “Shes an oldie, but a beauty!”
Reviews.Author: atvbragg
Reviews.Content: This is like the cougar of hotels. Its old yet good looking and still lots of life left in her. Check in was a breeze. Very friendly. Rooms were clean, no issues. Obviously an old hotel and has a nastalgia about it. Its meant to be this way. I would stay here again. Right in the heart of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: bw73
Reviews.Content: Ok, some of the rooms can be a little bit small with tired furnishings but overall I love this hotel. Grand lobby with beautiful decorations, this hotel has some real 'character'. For me, what makes my visit every time I return is the staff. Courteous and efficient, willing to go the extra mile. Maybe I've been lucky but I've never had to wait for very long checking in or checking out and the staff always take the time to have a chat (the Maltese lady is very friendly). I had some dealings with a gentleman called Sasha and he is a credit to the hotel: helpful, efficient and willing to go 'the extra mile'. As for the breakfast: a la carte is expensive but the buffet is good value for money. If you want a snack and you can be bothered you can go to the basement level where interconnecting walkways lead to a Starbucks and there is a small food court in the train station opposite. I always look forward to visiting The Royal York Fairmount; excellent location, amazing staff and an overall wonderful experience the minute you walk through the doors!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Close to Everything in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: russkychick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older hotel, but still a luxury hotel. It has a wonderful location, right across from the train and subway station (Union Station). It also has valet parking at the hotel. And if you fly into Toronto on Porter Airlines like we did, the free Porter Airlines shuttle bus stops right at the side door of the hotel. It couldn't have been more convenient for us to get from the airport to the hotel. The staff are all very friendly and helpful, and great at giving directions for walking around Toronto to sightsee or go to eat. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and would stay there again if I had a chance to travel to Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Old dame still fine...”
Reviews.Author: myounder
Reviews.Content: Great location and a storied history. But it shows a little. The carpets could use replacing and the furniture has the odd nick and scrape. This is not a modern hotel in the slightest - lots of dark wood, brass and green velvet. But in a stoic way, it's not pretending to be either. The pool affords great views and the concourse below has nice shops including a great toy store and pipe shop/tobacconist. Like the pipe shop, most of the staff have been there forever, meaning they are very good at their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Historic and Current”
Reviews.Author: Henryk07
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice this year at the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto and enjoyed our stay in every way from the historic structure to the excellent service provided. Our suite and room were more than what we expected. The location is central and much to see and do within walking distance. You're close to shopping, many 5 star restaurents and sporting or entertainment events...etc... The servicewe received from the valet to the front desk staff and employees was warm, helpful and in turn made your stay that much more memorable I ca say this is the finest hotel in Toronto and we've stayed in most of the hotels in the dowtown area over the past thirty years. So spoil yourself and try out the Fairmont Royal York and you'll agree that it's a place you will return too.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and charm, good service, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Semi-retiredOntario
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York Hotel is located in downtown Toronto across the street from Union Station. This historic landmark was built in the 1920s by the Canadian Pacific Railway as part of its chain of hotels across the country. The dÃ©cor in the lobby is worth a visit. The hotel is located close to both the financial district and the many entertainment venues in Toronto. For most of my many stays at this hotel, the service and accommodations have been very good. The rooms are spacious, clean and furnished in a style that fits the chateau architecture. The staff at the front desk were courteous and efficient. However, on one occasion in August the hotel appeared to be severely overbooked, and I waited in line for an hour to check in, and then was told that my non-smoking reservation could not be honoured. A smoking room was found for me, and I was assured that I would be moved in the morning. Several others waited until after midnight before a room could be found for them, and others in line gave up and left to go elsewhere. The next day I was given a new room while I was out, but my luggage disappeared and it took a few hours and some persistence to locate it. The supervisor on the front desk told me he had delegated the task to the bell captain. After a few hours, I still did not have my luggage, and when I checked with bell captain, he said he was too busy to look for it. This was an unusual occurrence (at least for me), but it left me hesitant to return. I would recommend calling to confirm that your reservation will still be honoured when you arrive. My ratings are based on my experience over several other stays.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting.”
Reviews.Author: mubber
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Dec. 10th for one night. Being the Royal York I was expecting glitz and glamour. Instead we were gouged and disappointed. Room was dated but okay. No vanity in the bathroom to put your toiletries on and the love seat and clock radio were 30 yeatrs old. The carpet was old and had stains on it. Valet parking $42, beer at their bar $9 and get this...buffet breakfast for 2 people....$87.00 TIP AND TAX IN. I forgot to mention the strange item I found in the bed we we retired. Would I go back, not unless it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel in great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: grahamdpatterson
Reviews.Content: Can't beat location in down town - opposite Union station, on the PATH underground walk way, a "rocket" subway right outside and walking distance to most torrist hot spots. Make sure you join the Fairmount Present's club - to get the best rooms, Dinning & upgrade vouchers and free internet access. Slightly old fashioned style rooms & decor but the size more than makes up for this (particullarly the suites with own living rooms). Lots of choice on places to eat & drink within hotel with reasonable prices for this garde of hotel. Slight noise from trains in morning (but not enough to keep you awake) and you are opposite Unions station so what you woudl expect. All in all great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and staff”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebax
Reviews.Content: Fairmont service is very consistent. I find the staff are very accommodating. The location is fairly central (close to the financial area and shopping district). There are quite a number of great restaurants close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired of reading the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Frequent T
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Toronto for the last 10 years on a regular basis and while I initially favored another hotel chain, I have for the last 3-5 years decided that the Royal York will be the home away from home. Yes it is an old hotel and yes the rooms are small - but its location is great, the atmosphere is wonderful and some of the staff genuinely recognize some of us frequent visitors. The staff are great with kids (my 2 year old got one of the Royal York lions). Its can be pricey, but there are often sales, including the "advanced purchase" option, so that you can always get a room at a reasonable rate. If you can, stay on the Gold floor - the experience is worth every penny. All this to say, I for the life of me cannot understand the level of criticism being levelled at this hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location but improvements could be made on soundproofing the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley_B1985
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, close to all attractions including the Air Canada Center, shopping, CN Tower, etc. Our room was clean and comfortable. However, the rooms are not soundproof at all. We could hear the conversations that were taking place in the room beside us as well as individuals snoriong when we went to bed. Not impressed by this when the cost of the room is so high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cuseconnection
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and usually stay here when we make our way up to Toronto. The rooms and hotel itself are very elegant and classy. The Library Bar is one of our favorite spots in the city to unwind, plus their known for their martini's. Epic is supposed to be great (can't really comment since we've never eaten there). Its also very convenient to have the subway directly below the hotel. Parking is a bit costly, but that comes with being a big city. All in all, this is our favorite hotel in Toronto and one of our favorite cities to visit in North America. Its always a treat to visit this world class city! T

Reviews.Title: “still excellent”
Reviews.Author: ursula312
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the weekend at the RY, and had a splendid time. We stay there a few times a year when we go to the city for the opera or a concert, and it's many years since we had a bad experience there. The room was nice and spacious, dinner in EPIC was great, and the room service breakfast was also a wonderful experience. The staff were all attentive and efficient. We often stay on the Gold floor, which is a terrific experience. This time we didn't, and it was still wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful celebration weekend”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyBeaver
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Gold level as part of a celebration. The Gold level is a truly wonderful experience. It starts with a private check-in and includes a lounge area and rooms with nice upgraded perks. Kudos to Hanna for accommodating an early check-in. The room itself is finished very nicely and the housekeeping staff come in twice per day and keep it perfect. The breakfast is really excellent with lots of treats. They also have deserts through the day and evening plus appetizers early evening. Every staff member is very friendly and they go out of their way to please you. Definitely a place we want to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty smelly room”
Reviews.Author: *Mark*J*L*
Reviews.Content: I asked our company agent to book this place because I was attending a conference there. She specifically requested a non-smoking room with walk-in shower (not a cramped tub with a shower curtain). I checked in late Sunday night after a trans-Atlantic flight and after 15 minutes of the check-in desk looking for a "nice room" for me I went up to get some much needed sleep. The no-smoking room was dark, cramped and absolutely stank of stale smoke, plus the bathroom had the ubiquitous tiny tub and shower over with tacky shower curtain. I went back to reception to say that this was not acceptable, apparently the hotel has only a handful of rooms with walk in showers and none at the rate booked for me, when I questioned why they took the booking I was told that they always try to meet requests (even if it is impossible maybe?). Anyway I checked out and went to Le Germain where I got a lovely bright, clean, non-stinking room and woke refreshed to take a lovely shower. The Royal York is in serious need of modernisation - it is trading on a prominence it lost about 20 years ago!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Experts”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Powell
Reviews.Content: When a business has been doing it as long as the Fairmont Royal York, one tends to either excel, or fade away. After visiting the hotel in August 2011 I now see why they are so popular. From check in to check out interactions with staff are pleasant and speedy. The rooms were well maintained, a bit small (but it's an older building so understandable) with very very comfortable beds. The spa was very nice, ntohing much to say eitehr way on it. It is important to note that every service or good this hotel provides is very good, but pricy. It's certainly not a place for a cheap bite or massage or valet parking, so know what you want and what you are willing to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: FÃ©lix C
Reviews.Content: The service was impecabble! But the room.... The rooms are very small and DIRTY. You can see dust everywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Miladh
Reviews.Content: Very old, defenitly needs to be renovated. I stayed there for a week for business. After the second day the toilette from above started to leak on my floor although there was no one in it. It ruined most of my toileteries and the hotel only gave me 50$ to use at their restaurant. Their restaurant, the Epic, was so expensive i ended up spending 70$ for one meal that was very average. Not worth the price. I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, classy hotel in a very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Aceone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RY for 4 nights last week, 3 by myself and one with a couple of girlfriends in a one-bedroom suite (13-145/147). There is a lot of construction going on outside the hotel, like most of the downtown area so my friends, who arrived by train, did not have the normal inside access from the Union Station. This suite has a view of Lake Ontario, but partially obstructed by highrises. The bedroom had the usual extremely comfortable, king bed and a smallish bathroom but the living room was huge and had a beautiful large bathroom with vanity and a fireplace (not functioning, sadly!). The marble in both bathrooms gave them a lot of character.
