Service at this hotel is really great, from check in to small touches like the nightly turn down service and complimentary bottled water (which may have been because I am a Platinum level FPC member). There is a shopping concourse in the lower level of the hotel, which includes an LCBO outlet with a good wine selection, ATM's, etc. I had 2 dinners at the Epic restaurant which were both excellent. The last night we ate in the Epic lounge. The food was excellent but our female server seemed to be in a rush to get us out of the way when we first sat down to order. Once we were into dinner, that improved dramatically as additional servers came into play. Just a note, there are dozens of restaurants within easy walking distance of this hotel and the concierge had some excellent recommendations. The wallpaper is lifting a bit in the bathrooms, and the furniture is not brand spanking new, but I would not expect that in this hotel .. while the lifting wallpaper should be fixed, I can't imagine walking into a room in the RY and seeing furniture without some "patina". If I had one complaint it would be the "mini bar" in the room. Most Fairmonts have a decent mini bar with good liquers, a decent wine and at least a couple of beers and some juices. Not sure if ours was just not stocked but it was kind of a joke -- it looked like they were waiting till everything was gone till they restocked.. Chateau des Charmes wine .. seriously? And you do not want to know what the cost for this was! I would definitely stay here again -- lots of character and great location. The complimentary shuttle from the Toronto City Airport drops you off and picks you up right at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Long past its glory”
Reviews.Author: bettybookends
Reviews.Content: For a Fairmont hotel, the Royal York is surprisingly faded and outdated. The fixtures, fabrics and rooms are old, stuffy and blah. The airconditioning gave me a bad case of a cold with wheezy flu-like asthma. This hotel used to be grand. It now needs a major decorative overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas shopping getaway...”
Reviews.Author: celticmoon
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've visited this hotel many times for different occasions, but I've never stayed over night. Chose the Gold Floor with no regrets. The no wait check-in is on the 12th floor, but I chose to check-in via email in the morning, after receiving an email requesting that I do just that. As a President Club member, the wifi is free. The room includes a well stocked mini fridge, bathrobe, bright bathroom lighting (which for the ladies, is a big plus) and complimentary water at turn-down. As another reviewer mentioned, the room is tastefully classic in it's decor, the bed comfortable with good linens and toiletries. The hotel is very busy this time of year, but she can handle it!. The lobby has a gorgeous Christmas tree, and the hotel is festive with it's classic decor and old Canadian Pacific charm. Very close proximity to shopping, concerts and transportation. Breakfast is served in the 12th floor lounge as well as canapes at 5 pm. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful on this floor and the lobby level. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again while visiting Toronto on a shopping trip or weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “A landmark hotel that needs some love”
Reviews.Author: FreqBizTraveller68
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is definitely a Toronto landmark in my hometown which I left years ago. I always admired the stately hotel and it's lobby maintains it's traditional magnificence. This being said, although staff are very friendly, it is definitely on the lower end of Fairmont hotels. I was very irritated by a very long line up at check in when I arrived. It is never easy for a hotel to predict guest flow, but there were enough other staff floating around that they could have deployed a few to ease the backlog. My experience at other Fairmonts is that this would never happen. Most of all the rooms and the interior design on the whole is desperately in need of a facelift. The faucets, tiles, trim, etc. in the rooms is easily 30 years old. While everything functioned reasonably well, it's way below Fairmont standard (and that of the newer hotels in Toronto that have sprung up in recent years). I found the sheets smelled strongly of chlorine bleach as well... thank god I had linen spray from another hotel. I would always recommend a stay at the Royal York for visitors, particularly leisure, because it is such a stately landmark, but if you are looking for the quality one can expect from other Fairmont hotels, there are other hotels in Toronto that offer this.

Reviews.Title: “Old but nice hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Concierge34
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel in April. Location is perfect. It is one of the historical hotels in Toronto. The old elevators are amazing. Reception is fine but since our rooms are prepaid they blocked my credit card in order to guarantee my extras. I reported this issue to thjeir spv but I only got an apology. Concierge is located at the centre of the lobby and the blonde lady was very halpfull. Their breakfast quality is excellent. I observed that old waiters are more helpfull than the young ones.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame”
Reviews.Author: stuckinTO
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to experience this iconic and historic hotel and I was glad that I had the chance arising from a cancelled trip. This hotel is truly grand and opulent, though it's really showing a lot of aging. For me that's character though some might argue otherwise. The room I had was on the 14th floor, with view of the city. The room has tasteful classic furnishing and was clean, the bed comfortable and ample, the washroom bright and well stocked, with complimentary bath robes. I also had a large sized flat screen TV with local cable which was great. (never watched the Grey Cup in such comfort). The room was comfortable and cozy. My mini bar was well stocked and of course for fee. They had nice selection of drinks and grubs. They also had an overnight kit which was handy but at a premium. Just make sure you don't forget your oral care kit or you'll end buying theirs which I did. The internet was also charged at $16 which was quite a letdown. But I suppose that's a part of their revenue stream and that's totally understandable with hotels these days. I didn't try their meal service but their menu shows a lot of variety and some even locally sourced. I will try them next time. Their fitness centre is decent, with a lap pool, wet and dry sauna, abundant exercise machines, whirlpool, with an attendant on watch. It's also clean and well stocked. Staff I've met all around the property were attentive and helpful. Overall, it was a pleasurable stay. Definitely not a five star facility as I've originally thought but it's definitely grand and still holds the distinction of a historical icon. It's a great place to stay when you have that on mind.

Reviews.Title: “Always lovely”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse50
Reviews.Content: I am addicted to the Gold Floor of the Fairmont hotels! Great service, comfortable rooms, generous breakfasts and appetizers in the evenings. The rooms at the Fairmont are on the small side and the bathrooms are tiny - a reflection of the age of the hotel. I love their pillows so much that I bought some at the Fairmont Store - and they shipped them to my home. The lady working in the store could not have been more helpful. This is a very busy hotel and the weekend we were there there was a hockey game so the lobby was hopping - but all was calm on the Gold Floor! The Library Bar is a gem - and the acoustic guitar player made the lobby outside just melt away. The location as mentioned by others is also a plus - I like it because it is a quick walk to The Bay, bars and restaurants in the downtown. The airport bus also stops outside. I'm already looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourite hotels”
Reviews.Author: bertandernie101
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Royal York. We have stayed severl timkes and have never once had any issues and will keep returning. The hotel itself is a very iconic building settled into the financial districe skyline, right opposite the Raill station. It has PATH access so in the winter months you can walk right up to the Eaton Centre without going above ground. Its location is perfect for all the attractions of Toronto. The hotel lobby is beautiful, and rooms are quite spacious and very comfortable. The hotel is very clean and seems to be well taken care of. Staff are fantastic and nothing has ever been an issue for us when staying here. The pool is a decent size and never gets crowded, as is the whirlpooll and sauna/steam rooms. We also seem to get revy reasonable rates here too and always tend to ring the hotel direct as apposed to going online.

Reviews.Title: “Tradition and Location”
Reviews.Author: FamilleQuiVoyage3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Fairmont Royal York during a quick family business trip to Toronto. We are regular Fairmont clients and were happy with our stay at the Royal York. As others have said, the location is excellent -- right across the street from Union Station so very convenient for us since we arrived by train. We booked a regular room and it was well-appointed and very clean. Their new line of bath products was also very nice. Our one disappointment was the food we ordered through room service. The rolls with the dinner were dry and the food was only average. We have come to expect much better from Fairmont room service.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to this hotel for our anniversary. First visit for both of us This is supposed to be a very good old Hotel with a very good name. We used a Jaunt to book our room. We probably got the only room that had not been decorated in many years. Considering the cost of staying in this hotel, I really expected the best. I have stayed in much nicer hotels for far less money. Probably will not go back. Too bad. Cost for parking and eating at this establishment was just outragious. I dread to think what you have to pay in order to get a nice room. When calling for your car to be brought up, please allow at least an hour or you will be dissappointed with that service also.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location”
Reviews.Author: mseifried
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th time staying at the Royal York. Whenever we come to Toronto for theatre, Leaf games or Wine show....we always stay here....... WHY ?? because once you park, you can walk, subway anywhere you need to go. The ACC and Rogers Centre are 5 min walks, the Metro Toronto Convention Centre is minutes down the street. I usually book a standard KING bed room. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. They have been upgraded with LG LCD TV's which is nice. The hotel is old and maybe could use some updating.... from a decorating perspective. Front street in front of the hotel is all under contruction so a bit of a pain for driving. The valet area always seems so busy and congested with cars coming and going. Its crazy checking in and out. The staff are always friendly and helpful. If you can source a good deal on-line... it is a great hotel in the party district...

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment to a point”
Reviews.Author: tntlock
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the Valet and Bellhop service is immediate and friendly. In fact, the entire staff are very outgoing and helpful. When you enter the hotel you believe you have stepped into a magical fairyland palace.....until you see your room. Although the hotel is one of the oldest downtown Toronto, the rooms appear even older. Obviously no effort or money has been spent in keeping up the rooms appearance with mismatching wallpaper and curtains and a thin sheet draped over the bed. Even the bathroom is so small in some rooms the towel rack is at the end of the shower...you must remove all towels before running the water. On a special note, be sure to rise early to get hot water as after 7 am you are out of luck. Luckily there are enough attractions and events to keep you busy during your stay so you don't spend much time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to get to but worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheryl J
Reviews.Content: I'm from Toronto but because I live in the suburbs and didn't want to drive hone after a night in the city, stayed at the royal York for a night. Because of construction , it's not easy to get to the hotel but once you do it's worth it. Great service , quiet, nicely appointed and very comfortable bedding. I'll stay downtown more often if I can stay at the royal York ! A hint: although valet is a whopping $40/ night, use hotel.com or Expedia.com to get a better deal and to get to the valet entrance approach front st from Jarvis and drive west on front st, valet is on the right.

Reviews.Title: “They tried to make up for the problems”
Reviews.Author: RWilliams05
Reviews.Content: We took the train from Ottawa to Toronto in July. The train station is across the street from the Fairmont Royal York Hotel. Convenient - but the underground passage to the hotel was blocked and we had to haul our luggage up to the ground floor and then across the street -which had construction going on in front of the hotel. We had advised the hotel of our arrival time - around 4 pm. When we arrived, we were told our rooms (2 rooms) were not ready. They suggested we wait in the bar. No problem. We waited - and waited and waited. Finally, upon checking, we discovered that some other people had been given rooms, although they had arrived after we arrived. We had a short conversation with the front desk staff and were given assurances that our rooms would be ready soon. We were also given gift certificates - which just about covered the bar bill for one drink each, given the prices in the bar. A couple more checks at the front desk and we finally got into our rooms at 7:30 pm! Not happy campers by that time. To top it off, one room had not been properly cleaned and the other had a very noisy air conditioner. We returned to the front desk and finally got into upgraded rooms at about 8:15 pm. We were also given larger gift certificates for the hotel to use during our stay. Things went very smoothly after that and we enjoyed our stay in the upgraded rooms on the Gold floor with all the club amenities. The hotel did eventually sort things out. They could have given us a better indication of why the rooms were not ready or just upgraded us from the start to get us into rooms. Anyway, we were eventually satisfied with the hotel, the service and the rooms. I would stay there again. The location is terrific in terms of downtown access, access to the underground walkways in the downtown area and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Public areas are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Helen S
Reviews.Content: Take a stroll through the beautifully decorated historic public areas - on your way to a more efficiently run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel just a few problems when we arrived!”
Reviews.Author: raebroughton
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to say that I did enjoy my stay at the Fairmont Royal York but there were a few things that could have been better. When we arrived at 8.30pm we were told that our rooms were not ready yet due to the previous guests late check out. We were told that we should be able to check in within an hour. Due to the fact we couldn't check in straight away one of our rooms was upgraded and we were also given vouchers worth $80. This was a nice gesture but after an 8 hour flight from the UK the last thing you want is to wait a further hour to get into your room. In the end it took more than an hour and we finally got to our room just before 10pm. Even though we had problems checking in the lady on the check in desk was very polite. After this things did improve, our room and bedding were very clean and comfortable especially the pillows. The bathroom was also clean, we were given plenty of toiletries and the towels were of very good quality. Then on the second day of our stay another minor problem occurred, our key card would not work so we had to go back down to reception. The lady on reception asked us if we had kept our key cards near our mobile phone or credit cards. We hadn't so we knew that we had not caused the room key to fail. It did only take a minute or two for reception to sort it out so it wasn't the end of the world. However we had just had a long day out and we just wanted to relax in our room. The room was facing an area outside that had some construction but the noise was minimal and wasn't too much of a nuisance. The tea & coffee making facilities were also good apart from one day when we were just left coffee but no teabags. The gym and indoor swimming pool area was kept very clean and was a nice place to relax with a good choice of amenities in the changing rooms. Overall my stay at the Fairmont Royal York was very pleasant and apart from the few issues we encountered I would stay there again. The rooms were lovely with a very comfortable bed and location was perfect for getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water”
Reviews.Author: brenrobe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal York for business November 17th, first time. Beautiful lobby, great location. Room was on the 9th floor. It was small and worn, as others have indicated, however the bed was very comfortable. In the morning, at 6 a.m., there was no hot water. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk, I was advised that a number of guests had expressed the same issue, and there was no hot water at all that morning in our wing. Apparently the idea that others had also suffered was supposed to compensate for the cold shower. Bottom line - too much money for a small tired room and a cold shower.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property, treat you like you are a VIP”
Reviews.Author: rgrs7
Reviews.Content: I'd have to say the Royal York exceeded every expectation I had after I read a few negative reviews on Tripadvisor. We stayed in a Fairmont Gold Jr. Suite - room 16-153 which was right beside the Queen's Royal Suite, which was kind of neat. The Gold level is definitley worth every penny. I won't lie, we paid quite a bit to stay, but with a young family with 3 boys aged 5 months, 2yrs and 5yrs the perks of staying at a downtown property close to all ammenedies was necessary. The best thing about the Gold level is the lounge. You have access to snacks and drinks nearly around the clock, all included in your room rate. This also included breakfast, which was also amazing. The staff provide VIP treatment all the way, with preferred check-in on the 12th floor. They were very informative and caring. They took lots of time to talk to our kids and involve them. One of the nicest perks was even though our check out time was 12pm, we stayed in Toronto until around 5pm to visit the CN Tower etc. They held on to all of our belongings and invited us back to the lounge before we left. Most hotels moreless kick you out at check-out. Regarding our room - I have read some reviews where people indicated they were falling appart. Whether it was because we were on the Gold Floor, our room was in fantastic shape. It was approx. 500 sq ft, had its own enterance lobby, followed by the living room that must have been 25 x 25 with a nice fireplace, couch and TV, it then opened up (open concept) to our bedroom area (20 x 20 perhaps), with the bathroom off of our bedroom. The furniture was in good shape, everything about the room was high-end. Sure the wallpaper in the bathroom was a bit old, but its the Royal York. It's supposed to feel a bit rustic. The pool area was fantastic, especially for younger kids. The main pool is great, around 4ft deep, but they have a small splash pad style area for the little ones which was a hit with our crew. All in all it was an amazing experience and a top notch hotel. If you are sensitive to price than it may not be for you I'll admit that, but to us it was worth every penny and look forward to returning! Please give me a shout if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Marion T
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Royal York for the last 8 years annually for a business conference. The past few years I have noticed that the service has declined. I joined the President's Club hoping the service would improve, it didn't. This past week Nov.8-11th I was a guest. When my friend and I arrived we were told there was no rooms available on the President's Club floors and we had to settle for the 9th floor.(with older tired looking rooms.) We were told it wasn't as nice but that was all they had. I have an adversion to heights and was not happy. The following day after lunch we were locked out of our room, checked out by accident. The day after we were going to our room when we ran into a woman with 3 dogs going into the next room. I am allergic to dogs. We went to the front desk and the gentleman (I use this word loosely) was not helpful. He reminded us that this was a Pet friendly hotel. There were no other rooms available. Later that evening we were contacted by a hotel representative offering us another room on the same floor, we told her we were leaving the next day and I had started taking antihistamine medication. She did consent to give us a $50 dollar food voucher after WE had to ask for compensation. It was not offered by the hotel. I used to look forward to my annual trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Room just OK, Very pricey”
Reviews.Author: gramasherry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Fairmont the Royal york as part of a gardening group trip. The Hotel is lovely, the staff was attentive. The room was clean ,but I expected more as far as ambience. Location is awesome walk to the market and restaurants and the train station is across the street.The underground shopping tunnel system was interesting but I had differnt expectations and was dissapointed. It felt liika a BIg empty shopping mall. Everything in the Hotel is PRICY. Lobby bar $20.00 US for a Manhattan. The breakfast buffet was top notch, but I had my only bad experience there. The on duty Manager ws quite rude when telling me I had to move when I sat at a table that was supposedly reserved for VIPS. There was no reserved sign on it. Aparently because I was with a Gardening group I wasn't a VIP :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classic hotel with service that left a sour taste”
Reviews.Author: SandyVancouver
Reviews.Content: We were flying through Toronto and decided to spend the night at the Royal York with my inlaws who live in a small town about 2 hours outside of TO. As we don't get to Toronto often, we wanted to book a room at the Royal York as we love its classic style. Also, we have stayed at a few Fairmont Hotels and the service has always been impeccable. On this occasion we booked a room through a travel website in my name but indicated that there were four guests. On the day of arrival we telephoned the Royal York from home to confirm the reservation and to let the Fairmont representative know that my spouse's inlaws would be checking in before us as our flight was getting in to Toronto in the early evening. The representative (Rachel) told my spouse that it was not possible for his parents to check in earlier as their name was not on the reservation. I then got on the phone and confirmed that the room had been booked under my name and I was confirming that it was okay for the hotel staff to let my inlaws check in earlier (we had already paid for the room in full). I was told that this was not possible for security reasons. I asked the representative what were the security issues for the hotel but she couldn't come up with a clear answer and gave me some outlandish example of some man who was stalking me gaining entrance to my room. I advised her that I was waiving the hotel of any liability and I was giving her permission to let my inlaws in the room. I told her I could fax her this information in writing. She would not accommodate our request and instead made us call the service provider who then had to put us on hold while he called the Royal York to give her the names of our inlaws so they could check in earlier than us! This felt like such an unnecessary inconvenience. When we arrived at the Royal York the hotel was beautiful and the front desk staff at that time (not Rachel) were very professional and pleasant. The room was well appointed, clean but small (we knew it was going to be small). We had free WiFi and the beds were really comfortable. I wanted to go for a run in the morning and the staff helped me out with a route. Our stay was really very pleasant so I was disappointed that it had initially been soured by a lack of service on a simple request.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is tired, staff tired, and rooms are tired. Kick the elevator to close it from the Valet.”
Reviews.Author: MD M
Reviews.Content: I first have to say I have never wrote a review on any of the hotels we have stayed at. This time I felt I was obligated to since it was disappointing to say the least. We stayed at this hotel the last weekend of October, 2011. Prior to booking this trip my spouse and I were excited to stay here with our 9 month old son. The Royal York was one hotels we had not been to yet in the city. The thought was to stay at this hotel every 2 weeks during the winter weekends (we live outside the city). We thought the location was perfect for being able to walk with our stroller in the winter time using the Path underground. After this experience we will NEVER stay here or recommend it to our friends ( with strollers or to those with limited mobility and need to use elevator.The entrance by the valet parking)! Valet Parking- 4 staff members watched us ( continued their conversation) pull up park our car empty out our SUV with our stroller and try to navigate the stairs with stroller. They were to busy talking to help. I do not expect to be waited on hand and foot but a simple hello or come and park our car would be nice. My spouse had to go up to them to tell them we wanted valet parking and where the elevator was. Elevator from outside- not clearly marked. On way out had to kick it to close (staff member told us "yes well it was built in 1929", he knew about it). Another time did not work at all and had to carry stroller down stairs. Not bad for a pregnant women. Room- on our way to our room the table outside of elevator had a layer of dust and grimy fingerprints all over it. We watched a cleaning staff member walk by garbage in the hall and on the table. The room over all was typical but wall paper in bathroom peeling in various spots. The furniture was clearly very worn, not shabby chic either. Food- we ordered room service. Limited menu. Cruise boat quality. The apple pie for $14 go to the supermarket below you will get something more for your money. I don't expect gourmet but quality since it is the Royal York. Very disappointed. I don't mind spending money on great food not the issue. Food poor. Go to the Keg for your steak.The staff member who brought in our food was the friendliest of the weekend. Our exit from the hotel was the same as we entered the elevator needed a kick to close the door.Valet staff watched us load our belongings into our SUV. We travel extensively throughout the USA. We stay at 4 and 5 star hotels so we know the level of service that should be provided. In this economy one would think customer loyalty goes along way to fill all those rooms. Like I said I have never wrote a review on any of the hotels we have stayed in all our business and holiday travels. I felt I had to because of this BAD BAD experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SurftheRock
Reviews.Content: Great brand, location, staff. The room felt like a flea bag motel. There has to be better options in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jeff C
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a lot more from this place. The room I got looked like it was very desperate for a decore upgrade. As I was adjusting the curtains a metal rod fell on my head, the ended up giving me a 15% off coupon or something for my next stay.. thats not really what I wanted. I would expect them to at least comp me for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Old,dated and needing some attention”
Reviews.Author: AGG1
Reviews.Content: Landmark hotel in the centre of Toronto. Paid an excessive room rate for a hotel that was very average. hotel needs some serious attention to it, very dated. You pay for the name fairmont rather than anything else. Fortunately i have been to other fairmonts and have a different view of the hotel chain because of that. positives are: great central location in Toronto and close to attractions such as the ferries & shops. room was cleaned well and friendly front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Like these old railroad hotels, but too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: EAZELIFF
Reviews.Content: Yes, i know it is a landmark building in a major city. But I paid over $300 per night for a room that was fairly nice, but frankly, not worth that price. If I paid more like half of that for the same room I would consider it a reasonable value. Actually, I kind of liked the elevator sounds The health club and pool get high marks, as do the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a classic traditional property”
Reviews.Author: InternationalBiz
Reviews.Content: Was there for a biz trip and had a room only on the first floor...nevertheless the room was nice and more than ok! The hotel is very old and has a lot of history! So are the public areas and the floors, but the roms are quite up to date and the bed was very comfortable... Matching the age of the hotel, most of the guests were also rather in the senior segment. In general a nice stay in a great location in the center of toronto!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Lady!”
Reviews.Author: surfsideMichigan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Royal York Hotel because I was taking the train to Toronto from London and was able to roll my suitcase across the street to the hotel. I have stayed there before but many many years ago. I was relieved of my luggage ( more than I normally carry) at the front door and it was in my rooms before I was! On checking in I was informed that I had been up-graded to a double suite and it was magnificent. I was sorry that I did not have friends or family with me to share it with but that did not prevent me from enjoying it. There was construction happening outside the window which could have been annoying if I had wanted to sleep during the afternoon. I went downstairs for a late lunch in a pub that had pretty poor service and was not terribly good value for money. I guess it's hard to expect a club sandwich these days to be JUST a club sandwich. What I got ( once someone finally came to take my order ) was difficult to eat with any grace as it was all slippery with something that tasted a bit like jam. So - lunch was not great but the room service Eggs Benedict in the morning made up for it! My breakfast arrived promptly via a smiling waiter and it was delicious. I would recommend this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Still Grand....mostly”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler93
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel I admit I was a little leery of staying here. However I was very pleasantly suprised by the room and service. While a little dated and slightly shabby (but not terribly so) the room was spacious and comfortable. The bed is especially nice--had some of the best sleep ever in a hotel!!! Room was quiet, housekeeping was efficient, water pressure was good, all in all a nice experience. Keep in mind that this is a very large hotel (over 1,000 rooms) so a little bit I suspect is the luck of the draw. I was not paying for a premium room and mine was better than fine, so maybe the problems noted in earlier reviews are behind them. I had breakfast twice in the restaurant EPIC and that was excellent--food tasty and fresh ingredients, service attentive (I can particularly recommend Mike as your waiter) and price reasonable for what you get. I also had a quick lunch in the sandwich shop downstairs--also fine. The hotel lobby is magnificent if a bit crowded at times. One small glitch. When i checked into the room there was a note and a package of cookies for someone else. I notified the front desk and someone came in a few minutes to remove the cookies. I wanted the other guest to get what the hotel intended for him. It would have been a bit nicer tho if they had left them and given another package for the other guest--after all it was only a few cookies. Basically they were saying that I was not worth a cookie lol. Not really a complaint-but since Fairmont tries to be a full service luxury chain, this struck me as just petty. But cookies aside, i can recommend the fairmont Royal York for its great location, service and history.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrASToronto
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Royal York many times for conferences, weddings etc. and have always thought the food was excellent and the principal rooms, event rooms etc. were beautiful. However, b/c I am live in Toronto, I had never stayed here before until a couple of weeks ago when I had a conference and decided to try it out. I agree with the other reviewers that the rooms are small and need updating, but the rest of the hotel made up for it for me. I had a room right next to the elevators and I thought it would be very loud - it was louder than I would have liked but much better than other hotels when I've stayed near the elevator. I guess these old buildings are more sound proof than some newer ones. The athletic facilities were great - great to have an indoor pool and whirlpool in downtown Toronto - a lot of hotels don't - and the gym was 24hours and the service was friendly and unpretentious everywhere. Check in on a Friday evening at 6pm was very slow and they should have had more people helping out, but when I finally did get to the front, the reception staff were relaxed and professional. I'd stay here again for a conference - loved the pool, the service, the food, the grandeur - but not with my young kids as the rooms are too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: lorna29
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I have stayed t this hotel and will not be the last...it may not have the modern edge that other hotels do in Toronto but the beds are awesome and the rooms are clean and that's what I want when I'm away from home...Now when we checked in this time we had an upgrade coupon but their system was down and they weren't able to upgrade us on the spot so we were given a dinner voucher for the hotel's fantastic restaurants ( we have always eaten well here) and then were told to check with the front desk to perhaps get our upgrade when the system was up, but to be quite frank we were pleased with our regular room and even got the CN tower view...Great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Bit disapointing”
Reviews.Author: dipti29
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference for three days and stayed in the hotel its self. The conference facilities were great. Beautiful artful historic rooms. The lobby is lovely, and both main restaurant and the Library Bar were nice. Elevators have very cool metal and woodwork. Very easy to take metro to and from hotel. The first night we arrived the hallway filled with smoke as our neighbors were having a party next door. We could hear them through the thin walls and I got quite sick (have pretty bad allergies to cigarettes). Had allergies in the room all three nights tho the noisy tv/music/party noises ended after first night. Surprised that the level of smoke did not set off any smoke alarms. That experience ruined the charm of the room and made me unforgiving of other small details: window did not close all the way, cool draft as a result, and quite a bit of street noise on the weekends, no easy spots to plug in phone, paid for wifi and did not work all that well, closet awkward to get hangers in and out of, small for two beds and two people.

Reviews.Title: “Showing It's Age”
Reviews.Author: MagellansStomach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend getaway. Booked based on the online pricing offer, it's common to get a $149/night rate for the hotel. When checking-in upgrade the room which did result in a fairly large room, upgrade was $70/night but allowed for smoking. While hotel is a reasonable value beware the $42/night parking rates which add up quickly compared to the room rate. The rooms could definitely use an update. The sofa bed/couch was starting to fray very noticably and in general the room was aging but fully functional. it was ironic that such a large room with so much open space had a tiny bathroom. Very good location and the staff has always been friendly. Check-in parking and check-out parking were quite long, partly due to local construction. Upon check-out we were advised the car would take 20-30 minutes, did come in around 15 minutes though.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location...attention to detail, attention to details”
Reviews.Author: Mojo_6674
Reviews.Content: A great landmark from a by-gone era. I have stayed there for a total of 20 nights within 4 stays this year. You know what you are going to get, this being always a clean room and comfortable bed. A really cool spot within the hotel is a little watering hole called York Station. I will let you try to solve where it is. It has strange hours but it's a place where Hemmingway would hang if he ever came to this hotel. I really have nothing bad to say about th hotel except for some needed improvements. First, when you arrive with bags you may need help up those internal stairs to the reception area. I take my own but it sure feels awkward pulling you luggage like a heavy bag of potatoes. Next is the newspapers that Fairmont proudly lays by your door in the morning to all it club members. What a waste in today's age where many folks have on-line access to news. I for one have clicked off the option to receive the paper, but still get it regardless. I have mentioned this to the hotel and they assure that they update my profile but still wait. Other details missed was a phone call made prior to arriving that I wanted to upgrade my room, but had no record of this when I showed up. They care of me regardless but this is the details that I expect this type of hotel to be best in class at. On this same trip, my wife who was not traveling with me, called the hotel the night before to arrange for a piece of birthday cake to be sent to my room. Well much to her disappointment, when she called me the next day and asked if I got something delivered, it fell flat once again. Now I do want to mention that my wife called back inquiring what happened? The hotel did apologize and sent me a piece of cake and wine bottle free of charge. It was appreciated, but if I was running this place, those missed details is what makes my customer experiences memorable. I could go on on countless of little omissions throughout my 20 nights at the Royal York, but this is more for the hotel to read and get better at. Otherwise this place is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “A Historical Building”
Reviews.Author: Mel-J-B-08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for September long weekend. Although this is a very beautiful historical building, I found the rooms to be smaller than your average modern hotel. Also, the appliances and hardware in the rooms could be updated. I found even with an upgrade to a bigger suite, the electronics and decor of the rooms resembled a more historic look and feel. This hotel is also very pricey, not only to stay in, but to eat in as well. This is a great hotel for location, it is right across the street from the train and subway. As well, it is a great place to stay if you are attending a hockey game, basketball game, baseball game or even a concert. Overall, it was a good place to stay and close to many restaurants and site seeing places, like the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel..”
Reviews.Author: LL123500
Reviews.Content: This was an average hotel considering it is part of the fairmont group. It's a large busy hotel and in peak hour the reception desk and bell service are chaotic. Like all fairmont hotels the service was fantastic, although they did get our reservation mixed up. The rooms were clean as would be expected however there was no in room safe available. The location was great, close to CN tower, and right across the road from Union station.

Reviews.Title: “Trading on "Fairmont" name”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late I know, however we have beeen constantly travelling since our stay in early Sept. I note all the other reviews regarding dated property and poor hotel standards and I also note the constant apologies from Hotel Management, however with so many poor reviews why don't they fix the problems, then they wouldn't have to keep apologing. I won't repeat all the comments from so many poor reviews other than so say, that was our experience as well. For the price, poor hotel, poor value for money, there are better options in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Rip-Off”
Reviews.Author: Gundelsploom
Reviews.Content: $343/night for a small room with a queen size bed, a bathroom so small you have to get out to change your mind, non-existant water pressure and a room beside the loudest elevator I have ever heard. Other than that, the hotel was just fine. You can pay a lot less and get a lot better in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGL46
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently for the Toronto Scotiabank marathon.There was a minor issue with our room when we were checking in - they had us in a room with a Queen instead of a King, but with some insistence on our part, that problem was quickly corrected. Staff were very friendly, the food was good (Epic restaurant) although expensive. The room was clean and well maintained given the age of the hotel. The walls are thin so parties in the rooms around you will be heard. The location doesn't get any better in Toronto. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overworked Staff, Tired and Dated Product”
Reviews.Author: Bryce R
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York was a huge dissapointment, the building is dated, the rooms look like they have not been updated in 20 years and the staff look like they are being work to the bone. With a name like Fairmont Hotels and Resorts attached to the Royal York you expect a certain level of service, the Royal York did not live up to any of my expectations. The staff are doing the best they can with a dated and tired product, the owners of the hotel should be embarassed that they expect people over $200 per night for stay. If they do not make some serious changes to the hotel very soon they will continue to lose business from me and many other loyal guests.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Khalie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Royal York for the Waterfront Marathon. Service was okay, room okay too. Pretty pricey for what you get. Location is awesome, but parking is tricky (and expensive too).

Reviews.Title: “Great service and OK room”
Reviews.Author: Jay G
Reviews.Content: While all the service is impeccable and the lobby and access is great. The room and the fitness centre are getting dated and run down for such a land mark hotel!

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY STAY”
Reviews.Author: CALABASHBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend for 3 nights. Not sure what all the complaining is about. We had a lovely deluxe room on the 9th floor --- no issues with the room -- no issues with elevators --- no issues with restaurants -- no issues with anyone or anything. Upon check-in there was an "issue" with their computers (ok - this does happen) and they gave us each a $25.00 food and beverage voucher. We used it the following morning for room service for breakfast. It was wonderful ! We actually went over the $50.00 however we were not charged for any of it. The hotel is old but grande. If you do not like this style of hotel -- then stay elsewhere but you will be missing out of one of the nicest hotels in the area. The location was perfect -- we did all the sightseeing/tourist stuff. The PATH is awesome -- wish we had something like that in Boston as well as the St Laurence Market --- My husband and I have stayed all over the world and I would give the Royal York 2 thumbs up ! P.S. -- the Queen stays here when she is in town !

Reviews.Title: “Very good but need some renovation”
Reviews.Author: L-P L
Reviews.Content: Hotel very well located, close to the CN Tower, train station, Air Canada Center & Hockey hall of Fame. The service provided is very good, but the rooms need some renovation. When we were there, they started the renovation, maybe in a early future the hotel will come back as a reference in Toronto. A good value for less then $160

Reviews.Title: “Wait until renovation is finished”
Reviews.Author: ptbrk
Reviews.Content: Yes, no doubt this is a nice hotel, but with renovations undergoing, it leaves a lot to be desired. If you happen to end up at the Fairmont Gold level, the lounge area makes it an enjoyable stay. The food offering, albeit limited and repeated daily are fairly good. I found that charging for alcohol (honor system) was a bit tacky but the selection was good. The service is remarkable and everyone is extremely friendly. The WiFi was dismal. Free or not, it needs help. I had to log in several times during my sessions to stay online. Normal rooms are extremely small. If you are going to work, the chairs are not ergonomically fitted to the desk, so you'll end up with sore shoulders.

Reviews.Title: “Living off their laurels?”
Reviews.Author: chazsat
Reviews.Content: Arrived at thr Royal York for a 3 night stay during a recent convention. Rooms were prepaid 2 months in advance. When we first arrived the reception staff advised that the nonsmoking, king rooms were not available. They offered to put us in a parlor room(translation= sofa bed). When we stated that was unacceptable, the only other option was a smoking room for the first night and then they would move us to the nonsmoking room.The rooms did smell like smoke(who allows smoking in hotels anymore?). They did move us the next day for the remaining two nights. The hallways were like a hazmat site, with blowers and dehumidifiers everywhere. The outside of the building was undergoing some sort of resoration o the room I was moved to had heavy palstic over the windows. Al in all, not a pleasant stay and for $264 Cn per night plus tax, very overpriced. Great location though.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Dame with some updates needed.”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: Pleasant stay in a great old hotel with strong sense of place and excellent walkability to major buisiness locations. Airport Express Shuttle is direct, fast, & cheap with wifi & power outlets on board. Room was small with underdized desk covered with hotel electronics and a wild maze of cords underneath - messy & limiting in terms of work space. NEEDS A CURVED SHOWER ROD!!!! No excuse that guests have to battle a grotty shower curtain. This is a low cost update long overdue. At $239 this room was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Fairmont standards, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Bluegrassdog
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel a couple times a year-- reluctantly, but do so because we are Fairmont President members. On the positive side, they may be aware of their limitations as a "luxury" hotel because their rates are extremely low and reasonable. It's also in a good location. The rooms are clean and comfortable, but very small. We've had two previous experiences within the last two years where we've had to request room changes (they had on-going renovations, and I think some rooms were renos and some were not). The rooms are VERY small (but many older hotels are comparable). One severe criticism I have is that one of the perks is the beautiful Library Bar....However, it is sooooo extremely expensive it's absolutely infuriating. They charged $15 (without tip) for an ounce of gin!!!! I was outraged. On Sunday morning, in the restaurant, oatmeal was $10/bowl and coffee (plain brewed) was $5. I understand that hotel restaurants are expensive, but I couldn't help but feel that they need to charge extra because they know their rooms are not up to par anymore. I sort of feel sorry for the hotel, but they are really taking advantage. They are also enduring some terrible on-street renovations that make access to the hotel a bit compromised. While it's not their fault, good luck getting someone to direct you, or take your bags, if you pull up at the York Street door. I recommended to several people that they post signage or have bell hops at the various doors, but I didn't get the impression that my suggestion was taken seriously. For the most part, everyone is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are a real bargain. However avoid the bar and the restaurant unless you are on a very luxurious expense account....

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay in 15 Years”
Reviews.Author: Darryl B
Reviews.Content: Should have listened to the reviews before booking. Requested a king, non-smoking unit about 2 months ago. Arrived and found that they had no NS rooms available and the hotel was full. They put me in a smoking room on the first floor. I assume the entire 1st floor is smoking as it wrecked of smoke when I walks off the elevator. The room and hotel hasn't been remodeled in years. I'm guessing since the '70's. The room was narrow, carpet old wallpaper pealing, exhaust and A/C vents filthy, drapes didn't separate...everything was dated and in poor shape. Bathroom is tiny and all the equipment waste way too much water. There was some type of plastic liner used in the tub/shower that had air pockets underneath it. Mold visible in the tile grout of the shower. No one should be asked to sleep in a smoking room. It was 3 nights of the worst sleep I've had in years. Really....you don't update the hotel in 40 years? OK, maybe you have this "old, nostalgic" theme going. But what ever happened to ding maintenance? Vacuum a return air cover when (if?) you replace the filter. Wipe down the exhaust grill and scrub the grout when you clean the bathroom (which should happen every day). And listen...It's 2011. Low flow toilets, aerators on faucets and low flow shower heads are inexpensive upgrades with very short paybacks. If your a hotel that is partnered with the Greenbuild conference, shouldn't you at least do a few of the low hanging fruit retrofits? It's just smart business. I'll never support this hotel chain again. I'll put my money on those who take pride in their facility and respect the environment.

Reviews.Title: “Poor show, Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: Ange999
Reviews.Content: Expected a really top quality stay to end our holiday in Canada. However ... it all started to go slightly wrong at check-in when they advised that our room was on the 6th floor and that there was building work going on outside all these lower floors. This meant that there was scaffolding all around and the windows in the rooms had been blocked off so no view. We had been allocated a corner room which in normal circumstances would have been nice but now just meant we had TWO windows we couldn't see out of. This made the room quite dark and claustrophobic and also meant that in the morning, we couldn't see what the weather was like and dress accordingly - had to do a quick reccie outside then go and adjust for sun/rain/whatever. We had booked the room last December so would have expected the courtesy of an email to advise the situation with the building work so we could make an informed choice. The room itself was spacious enough but had a very badly stained carpet, scratched bedside cabinet and altogether a slightly sad, dingy feel to the furnishings. Also, a plastic faux marble tissue holder - oh dear. The plastic bath felt very flimsy and the bottom of it actually bent when I stood in it to take a shower (and I'm only little!). We didn't realise that the wifi wasn't free and got hit with a bill for over $15 a day - shame on you, Fairmont - even the smallest hotels these days offer free wifi. All in all, the impression was of a once-grand old lady on on her uppers - not good. One redeeming feature was that the staff (reception/concierge/rooms) were all very polite and very helpful. However, wouldn't recommend the Royal York to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MartaMToronto
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Toronto most of my life and have been to many hotels, and can genuinely say this was a huge disappointment since ive heard good things over the years. The hotel is old and known for it's vintage antique look. The main areas like the hallways and enternces are wallpapered and the carpeting is old and dirty. The hallway carpets smell like mold :( The room it's self was very small which is common in the downtown core, but clean. Once again old dirty carpets and cheap wallpaper line the space the bed was not as comfortable as some of the higher end hotels. The tv was flat screen but the cable was basic and fuzzy, whats the point of having an expensive tv with fuzzy picture? All in all I'd say it's over prices and in need of serious renovations to catch up with it's rivals.

Reviews.Title: “OLD,Smelly, Poor Service ,Haughty”
Reviews.Author: 22minky
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel of yester-year. It is in need of a major uplift. The hotel buliding is historic and beautiful HOWEVER it smells, the carpeting is ancient,the walls are old...it needs help. They charge for use of the business centre-5.50 per half hour to use a computer! The lounge's service in the am is not great ..the staff is snobby for no reason..my room was not cleaned up to par-re not all towels replaced..tea not replaced-vacuum job not great...truly not impressed...however hotel location is A1 price at 188 is also A1 but I will walk to Marriott Residence next time for 170 get services for free

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: This would be a 5 star except for ongoing problems with the Internet. The staff really tried to help but the problem continued. The concierge was great for dinning suggestions. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kim31ca
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is centrally located, directly across from Union Station. Many attractions are only a couple of minutes away on foot. The staff is very friendly and efficient. The rooms are very clean but dated.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mont_Family
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night . A great price package we purchased wth Juant including breakfast and parking. The hotel was what I expected, Old!!! but thats what it is. If you want modern go to an upscale newer hotel. Location was perfect as we had tickets to a show that evening. Room was ok nothing fancy but as I said It was what I expected. Clean and comfortable. The negative was the fan blowing but didn't blow any air in the room just a noise sounding like it was. I am glad it wasn't a hot day or this could have been a problem. Bathroom was small, bed was comfortable. We had a little view of the lake from the 10th floor. Quiet nice. The breakfast was amazing. Everything you could want and more I was very impressed. Just glad it was included in the package as It was very expensive. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic stay of choice in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ChevyCamaro
Reviews.Content: We'd been to the Royal York before and loved it, but...it's been several years, so...we wondered if we'd still love it. Absolutely. We asked for a very quite room..and that's what we got. That and a nice view of the CN Tower as well. We love the classic elegance that only an older property can offer, but without sacrificing modern amenities. We also liked their online check-in and check out...it makes arrival and departure very smooth. Since we come to Toronto by train, it's so nice to stay across the street from Union Station...don't even have to go outside to get from one to the other. And the Royal York is so close to the Distillery District, St. Lawrence Market, and sooo many great restaurants. We need to go back...soon! (Tip!!! Join the Fairmont President's Club - for free - and your WiFi access is free...otherwise, there's a charge!)

Reviews.Title: “Old, Elegant with Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is old and elegant with friendly staff, however the rooms need attention. The carpet in our room was old and felt greasy under feet and you needed to wear shoes and there was no privatesy when using the bathroom as the door wouldn't shut.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but could be updated”
Reviews.Author: Nikita42
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night at this hotel. I have been wanting to do this for years. My husband, who has stayed here once before on business, booked it as a treat for me. I was going to a concert at the Air Canada Centre and this hotel was only a block away, so that worked out great. Really beautiful hotel, but overpriced and needs updating. My husband got a government corporate rate of $189 plus $40 to park the car. What I found really upsetting was when we got to our room and I wanted to hook up to the internet, I found that it was going to cost me an extra $15.76. Really?? After charging this much for the room, you couldn't include the price of internet usage! That said, room and washroom were clean, good water pressure in shower.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetwistcone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a work related/long weekend break. We were greeted and taken up to our room efficiently and promptly. The room was pristine if somewhat small, but certainly enough space for 2 people to move around comfortably. Was very disappointed in breakfast options - stayed here previously and found the buffet at the york landing restaurant in the hotel to be not so great (lots of choice, but lacking flavour) and overpriced at 25$. We tried the breakfast at EPIC after seeing decent reviews on it - buffet was 30$ (!) and individual cooked breakfast options ranged from 18-25$ ----not including coffee or juice which were a whopping 5$ EACH. (and this was not mentioned when the server came by with a carafe of each and poured them for us - immediately making our bill at least 20$ on the spot. a better option would be to go to the Marche 2 blocks down Front street for a choose-your-own-bfast/meal option in a lovely clean, fun environment. otherwise, the service at the hotel was efficient and prompt - a lovely place to stay b/c of the history of the hotel ( i like the vintage-y hotels) and because of proximity to the metro stations (downstairs) so the entire downtown was very very easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Broken, out dated, dirty....”
Reviews.Author: Kristin092011
Reviews.Content: Being a Fairmont Hotel we booked in for a 2 night stay expecting problem free accomodation. How wrong I was! First room on the 11th floor had a door adjoining the room next door, when the guests checked in to their room beside ours we could hear EVERY word they said and that was mid afternoon! Front desk was FANTASTIC, offered us a new room on the 8th floor. Thank fully that was quiet. The decor throughout the hotel was tatty, dirty, broken, old, outdated and frankly was a complete let down. The rooms were not cleaned very well, the furniture worn, scratched up and in need of TLC. The wallpaper was coming off the wall,the corridors were coming apart, the bed skirting was dirty, old and frayed. The bathroom was small, dated, the wall paper was awful, there was no fan and the door stuck when trying to open and close. The phone in the room didn't work. On the upside the pool was lovely and clean. Location was central. I would NEVER recommend this hotel. Next time I will definately stick with a Sheraton or try one of the many other raved about hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in the British Empire”
Reviews.Author: William W
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York makes a big play of its history and heritage - when it was built, it was the largest hotel in the British Empire. Problem is, it hasn't really moved on since then. The decor, service, and amenities are all decades behind where such a benchmark hotel at this price should be. Rooms near the lifts (which are impossibly slow) are impossibly noisy. Standard rooms are small, with miserable bathrooms. Our loo flushed hot water and the cold tap ran hot water too, except when the hot tap ran cold water. Carpets, wallpaper and paintwork are all flaking at the edges. No ramps at the entrance for luggage. A musty / stale cigarette smell on our floor. Queues at check-in, check-out, concierge desk, bellboy, breakfast. Oh, and they charge extra for wifi, that didn't work very well. Staff are perfectly nice and friendly, but they are pushing water uphill. If you are booked in here by your company (as I was), ask to move. If you have a choice, please stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Frasjms
Reviews.Content: The Royal York may be a member of the Fairmont group, but it does not live up to the standard of service expected. Arriving in the evening after working all day, there was no room available upon check in. The hotel was completely over-booked and had no idea when my room would be ready. This was the second time I had this experience at the Royal York in the past two months. I also understand that this was the standard greeting that most hotel guests received when they arrived for the conference I was attending. Many people waited until midnight for their room with little apology. This hotel's policy of overbooking to the maximum created problems throughout the week. I would not recommend the Royal York to anyone. There are many smaller hotels in the area that are just as conveniently located with my better service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: conselier
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this was my first stay at this hotel and all I have to say about it are just compliments, For sure I'll be coming back every time I visit Toronto in the near future. I stayed at this Majestic hotel during summer for a weekend and customer service was very impressive since Toronto is a city were almost everyone seems to be in a rush. The check in was fast, the room I did stayed at was very comfortable and they made sure before I arrived that all my request were taken in consideration. The Royal York is located withing walking distance from Toronto port, which is awesome to hung out at night, also just a few steeps from there is the CN tower, also Yonge street is just there, since I enjoy to walk it was easy to get to the heart of down town , DUNDAS SQUARE, A couple of blocks more from there I had dinner at a Korean Grill House which is really awesome, I would recommend it to anyone who like asian food or just want to try something new. Hope this feed back helps everyone who is looking to stay at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieEC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont for a second time while my daughter and friends attended the huge Fan Expo at the downtown Convention Center late August. This gorgeous historic hotel is a great location for exploring the downtown - very walkable all directions. We stayed on the Fairmont Gold level this time, with breakfast included, and found the experience very peaceful and civilized, with highly responsive service (though we are FAR from demanding wherever we stay). Lots of restaurant choices all around the hotel. When we were there, there was extensive street construction right at the hotel's front door though this didn't cause us a problem. Parking under the hotel is very convenient -- choose Self Park as the Valet Parking is quite pricey. I'd choose the Royal York any time I get to enjoy that great city!

Reviews.Title: “great staff / bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: phoebe_skywalker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night and booked the 'fairmont view king n/s. I had to wait 1 hour for the room, this was no problem and the nice young man at reception gave me food/drink vouchers for the wait. I was surprised at the quality of the room as I had heard the Royal York was a posh hotel. The furniture/curtain/carpet was very old/well used and everything the neighbours said could be heard though the paper thin walls.The room was also extremely damp. The air conditioning was making a hissing sound, even when it was turned off. I called maintenence and the man was very nice and said there was a problem with it. So they moved me to another room- as it was late now they said there were only 2 rooms available. The windows were boarded up in the new room and there was also used wine glasses in the bathroom and the bathtub was full of hair and soap scum. They said they would reduce the price for this room. I complained. So they moved me to a 'gold' room.The quality of the sheets/pillows/furnishing was much higher, the wallpaper was not peeling like it was in the previous rooms and yet...both mugs for the tea service were dirty and in the morning a very noisy venting system switched on. Summary: all the staff I dealt with (check-in, restaurant, maintenence, bell boys) were attentive and kind but this hotel has huge issues with organisation and cleanliness. I cannot recommend it if you are looking for a clean, quiet, peaceful hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Past it's prime”
Reviews.Author: GMan61
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a weeklong conference to Toronto and me and my colleagues had the misfortune of our company booking our stay at the Fairmont. The common areas were beautiful and classic but the rooms were completely outdated. Having my flight to Toronto delayed, I arrived at the hotel at 1:00 am. Since I was staying for 6 nights, I had a large suitcase with me. There was no one at the front to help with the luggage and to make it worse, there are no ramps! I had to carry the suitcase up the steps. When I checked in, I was told it was a room with 2 double beds. I requested a change to a queen or king bed and was told there were none available. Hard to believe but I accepted it and thought I'd ask the next day. When I got to my room, I immediately smelled stale cigarette odor. There was a large stain on the carpet in the middle of the room and found that the closet was no more than a foot in depth. Trying to hang 3 suits and 7 business shirts was a challenge to say the least. Next morning, I approached the front desk and while the attendant was extremely helpful, she offered another room that turned out to be identical to the first. Later in the day, she found a room with a queen bed and "normal" sized closet but was told it would be $20 extra as it had a view. I argued that this was unacceptable, that they should provide the same price as a courtesy. She would not budge and I was told there was no manager around and this was the only room available. When I went to the new room, it also stank of cigarettes although not as bad, the wallpaper was peeling in a couple of areas and the "view" was of the construction going on in front of the hotel. Leaving me with not much choice and considering I would be out for most of the days I was in town, I accepted this room. The front desk told me a bell clerk would be up in 15 minutes to help me move my belongings. After one hour and no one showing up, I called the bell desk and was told they were extremely busy but would put my order at the top so someone would be up in the next 10 minutes. After waiting almost another hour, I went downstairs to get the new room key and moved myself. When I checked out I disputed the additional charge and after 20 minutes of back and forth, they finally agreed to waive the extra $20 a night. In speaking with my colleagues, they all shared similar experiences and all requested a change in rooms. The only exception was one individual who requested a smoking room and was given a suite. The one positive of this hotel is the location. It was ideal to the convention centre, stadium and financial district. This however, is not enough for me to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NADIADON
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights for our honeymoon a few years back and we just enjoyed this place so much. It's really well located, the service was great. We were even upgraded to a much nicer room with a great view. Great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: babyboomer58sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Royal York for 2 nights, room was quite large and very comfortable. Hotel was close and handy to Restaurants, Tower, sightseeing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travellover3868
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Royal York for three days for a company meeting. This was my first stay at a Fairmont. At my company's suggestion, I enrolled in their "President's Club". The lobby, the meeting rooms and the common areas are just beautiful. You can feel the history as you walk through the hotel. Their catering service is quite good. Upon arrival, I had lunch in the restaurant near the lobby and it was good, but expensive. My room was a very good size and there was a nice flat screen television in the room. The location is great - you can walk to the CN Tower and the sports stadium. There are many restaurants within walking distance. However ... this is a hotel that advertises itself to be a luxury five-star establishment. This hotel did not offer an in-room safe, there was not a bathrobe in my room, there was no turn-down service, and there was no make-up mirror in the bathroom. Most 5-star hotels offer all the above and many of the 4-star places I've stayed at offered those amenities and more. Now it gets ugly. When I arrived, there was dark hair in the bathtub and sink (I am blonde, so I am certain it was not my hair) and it was never cleaned the entire three days I stayed at the Royal York. When I arrived there were water splashes on the bathroom mirror and the closet mirror that were never cleaned. The room was not vacuumed while I was there. The bedskirt was frayed along the entire bottom edge. There was some kind of brown stain on the carpet near the night side table. The hallway on the second floor leading to my room always had trash - it did not look like it was vacuumed regularly at all.The toilet tissue holder in my bathroom was broken and many times the toilet tissue fell on the floor. My "view" out the window overlooked a rooftop that was littered with lots of trash. Water pressure was fine, however at 8:30 on Saturday morning, there was little hot water and I ended up taking a lukewarm shower. At checkout, there were several errors on my bill, which were quickly corrected once I talked to the front desk, but that was annoying. If The Royal York is any indication of what Fairmont hotels are like, I doubt I would ever stay at another Fairmont. It just is not a luxury hotel. I don't think I'd stay here again - there are just too many other options available in the downtown Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: westie034
Reviews.Content: The hotel decoration is a little tired, particularly on the very long corriders leading to the bedrooms. Our room had a funny smell , not strong or obnoxious, I think it may have been a smoking room and whilst the curtains and carpet may have been cleaned the smell is still in the furniture. Whilst bed linen and towels are very clean when my husband dropped something and couldn't find it we found the rooms aren't cleaned properly, lots of other customers debris (hair clips, razors etc) under the beds. Good location for sightseeing, CN Tower and ferry to Toronto Island short walk as is St Lawrence Market

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: Rogandrose C
Reviews.Content: Arrived 17th August for a 3 night stay at 4:30 PM, part of our month long tour of Eastern Canada which was to include our celebtration of our 25th Annivesary. Problem started immiediately with a statement from reception that there was overbooking ( flight crews) & that our room would not be available until 7:30pm, this was bad enough after a transatlantic journey , but after several more delays where front of house management were totally ineffective, we finally had our ( not the one we were advised of), at 9:30 PM, discracefull for a so called top class hotel- spoilt the start of our vacation & we vow never to advise anyone to stay there again- pathetic managment who demonstrated zero concerns for us as customers

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail - Their Key to Success”
Reviews.Author: Rob_S_987
Reviews.Content: I've been a Fairmont President's Club Platinum member since 2006 and I continue to be impressed with the service and attention to detail of the Royal York staff. I am always greeted with a smile and usually by name (I still can't figure out how they can do this with so many guests in house each day). My latest stay was in August 2011. I told the Gold Floor concierge that I was expecting friends to arrive shortly as we were all in town to see a concert. I was barely in the room before a knock came upon the door and completmentary bottle of red wine with 4 glasses arrived. This was in addition to receiving a complementary room upgrade to a junior suite. I travel a great deal for business, but I always look forward to staying at the Royal York. The Gold Floor staff are clearly a cut above. My thanks to them once again for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in central Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ncg1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a company function for three nights. The hotel is just fine for conventions and business meetings, with plentiful meeting spaces and a handful of restaurants and other onsite amenities. The hotel itself is a little worn, as the decor appears dated and the hotel could use some renovations. The room was just fine, comfortable bed, large flat screen tv, and complimentary internet. Not the best hotel around, but a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Past its Prime”
Reviews.Author: BiancaC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Fairmonts around the world and this was sadly the least enjoyable. We stayed 5 days. It feels like a train station. Our corridor was worn and strewn with food trolleys. The suite was large and had everything one might expect, but was tired. Security was a concern; several times the door to the adjoining room was left unlocked. On the last day we found our luggage stored in an unsecured room! We were assured it was not the norm...... The restaurant breakfast was overpriced and bland; the tables heaving with business personnel. The staff were all pleasant, room service prompt, but overall I felt unvalued. We were just another churn of this huge hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel that once was is no longer...”
Reviews.Author: Leslie-Anne B
Reviews.Content: Of all the Fairmont hotels in the chain this one, has the lowest quality service and rooms. The rooms are old and outdated in design and the bathroom is barely big enough for one adult. After having stayed in the Hotel Vancouver and the Fairmont in Whistler this is truly a disappointment from the Fairmont chain. From the moment of check-in there was a issue with getting the pre-booked room (2 queen beds), we were asked to take a room with a King bed when we had clearly stated we required two beds back in February 2011 when the reservation was made. We were made to wait longer past the official check in time, by an hour and once we did check in we found dirty towels, no bathroom toiletries available and no clock radio! We were there on business and required a clock radio to make sure we were on time for all meetings. Being a President's club member we were supposed to receive complementary morning paper and free standard internet. We had to request the paper of which we were told the were out of and told to purchase one from a box outside the hotel . The we tried logging on to the internet to find that their wireless and cable internet was down- this continued for 2 days. This will be the last time we stay at the Royal York, the Diamond in the crown jewel no longer shines.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with quality”
Reviews.Author: seema60
Reviews.Content: We came here for two days. Check in was a breeze. Our room was in the second floor east wing. When we came in it smelled musty. I had to search For the thermostat and start the fan i noticed the breakfast order had been filled by the precious guest and not changed. There was no flioor lamp so my husband had to prepare for his meeting with light from the bed lamps. The bathroom was quite small, old looking, wall paper from 19 th cent. The shower was pathetic and lukewarm. I left the room next morning at 10 am, came back at 1 pm to find the room had not been made up yet. I had to ask the housekeeping lady to clean up while I waited in the lobby! Overall I was quite disappointed with this well known Toronto landmark. Pros: in the heart of Toronto in front of Union station.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StarfallDarling
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days here during a convention in August, and I had an absolutely wonderful time. Every member of the staff I ran into was extremely nice and helpful, and housekeeping staff was just wonderful. They had a room ready for me when I arrived a few hours prior to check-in, and the beds were extremely comfortable. I was happy to find the room completely clean, and the location of the hotel is perfect. Just steps away from all sorts of restaurants, and a stone's throw from the CN Tower!

Reviews.Title: “By no means the Fairmont standards I remember”
Reviews.Author: Chyla1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks while I was on business and years ago used to work for the Fairmont chain. Service was not up to par with what was expected from us when I worked there. Front desk check-in was mediocre. First week was much better service than second week. Bell desk service was very friendly and quick. I called down twice for water that was not brought up until I called down an hour later to question where it was. Internet was very spotty and couldnt connect some days. Rooms (or at least the two I had) were dated and not too impressive for a Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant lobby, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Reg-Jas
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Fairmont Royal York. I was traveling on business, and the hotel is in a nice location, with a lovely lobby and restaurant area. My understanding is that this hotel often hosts famous guests, however I'd bet their rooms are MUCH bigger than mine was. I had a queen bed, which took up a good portion of my room. The bathroom was so tiny, there was absolutely no where to put my makeup bag, and my elbow kept hitting the wall while I was drying my hair. The room could also use some updating - the lighting and fixtures in the bathroom were in disrepair.
