However, the hotel still assumes an air of graciousness, and breakfast in the restaurant was very good. I would likely stay again, if traveling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Average in all respects”
Reviews.Author: laterallife
Reviews.Content: A historic landmark building with a superb location indeed and extremely convenient if you travel to downtown by subway and pop up via Union Station. Check-in was comical - Labour Day weekend, mid afternoon, 1,365 rooms and supposedly fully booked yet just TWO staff on reception. You'll find more staff in a backpackers to help out! That said staff were courteous and helpful. Room was tired, dated and desperately in need of a refurb plus it enjoyed the musical sound effects of the staff elevator which was annoying. The gym was tiny for the size of the property. Service in the Epic restaurant was decent but food average - my salmon/cheese bagel was delivered in a 'make it yourself' fashion which was strange. Needs some big investment to truly qualify as a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “old but still good”
Reviews.Author: trik1234
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly old hotel nd a bit tired - the service levels are good but the general attitude of the personell needs a shake up - one gets the feeling that they are doing you a favour. the restaurants are good - nothing to rave about. the rooms are tired - need a major overhaul

Reviews.Title: “stayed once but probably won't again”
Reviews.Author: has2bperfect
Reviews.Content: A beautiful exterior but our room was small, somewhat tired and very dark, and the service was fine, but not nearly as good as the Fairmont in Vancouver airport. Most probably will choose somewhere else next time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights stay”
Reviews.Author: Gordon W
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed overnight on the 9th floor. We had a great view. We left the hotel and took the subway, then a trolley to Chinatown, pick up our supper and travel the same way back. It took us only a half our to ride the round trip and get our food We got back to our room and set up the table and chair to look out the window. We had a great view of the activity going on at the Air Canada Centre. The first night there was an NHL hockey game and the second night there was a concert. We were also close to the CN tower and the Olympic Stadium. We enjoyed our room, all the amenities the hotel offered and the customer service was excellent. When I have the chance I would like to spend more time there,

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: punkparents
Reviews.Content: The lobby / public areas are beautiful. The grandure of this historic hotel are still evident, but the rooms leave alot to be desired. Rather dated and underwhelming. Good customer service and they handle the rushed environment with ease. Hope our next stay is more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “OK because of the location.”
Reviews.Author: travelchick05
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel quite regularly on business. It's OK but not really special. I stay because of the proximity to my meetings. And there are no special features for the disabled (i.e. showers) when I've asked for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night here (Friday Sept 9th) while in town for business. Staff were great (housekeeping greeted me every time I walked by), check in was quick & easy & friendly, as was the checkout. Slight problem with my bill but he fixed it immediately with no questions asked. Rooms slightly 'dated' and a little smaller, but hey, it's 82 years old, with all that history. Didn't bother me, just commenting on it. Rooms were very clean & comfortable. Did a quick run in the fitness centre. Decent size & good machines. Wish I had more time for the steam room or pool, but didn't have a chance. Looked very nice though. Obviously close to everything, so top marks for location, as well. The Toronto International Film Festival was going on, and it seemed like this hotel was the 'main area' for it, so that says something, too (they had lights and cameras and were doing interviews here). Overall, would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment! Perfect loction”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fairmont Royal York for 4 nights in first week of September. Got a room at East wing, 5th floor. Bed was ok - nothing too impressing, room overall ok, again nothing impressed me. In the room there was only one single sofa by the bed stand, no coffee table. Bathroom seemed really old. Our room was a standard room category, so old stuff didn't feel luxurious! The Elevators in east wing looked much older than the main ones near the reception. The hotel was packed with tourist for the long weekend. We saw two hollywood faces, don't know their names - not the big shots. The hotel's location is perfect. right across union station. Gym, swimming pool and whirlpool were good. I would rather stay at another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ist time in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Briandublin22
Reviews.Content: After 5 hectic nights in New York, hurricane and Wedding on the same day we looked forward to 4 nights in Toronto. Short hop from NY to Toronto, bus transfer outside arrivals brought us straight to our hotel, The Royal Fairmont, one of the grand hotels from another age. At one time it was the largest hotel in the British Empire, the Queen has stayed here while visiting Toronto. Easy check in, room on 7th floor, up we went, straight in and straight out, this room was more than ready for a make over. Flowery wallpaper and a very musty smell, in fairness we were given another room straight away but no body should have been offered this room in the first place. The second room was fine but too close to the lift shaft but I didn't work this out untill we had our bags unpacked. The hotel is grand and old and could do with some work inside, there is work going on outside. We had no food, but others in our party had and were very pleased with food and service. Plenty of restaurants/bars nearby, not far from CN Tower and lakeshore all within walking distance. So great location, good service but a little tired.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the usual great Fairmont standards”
Reviews.Author: acamacho1970
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Fairmont Hotels and Resorts I was unpleasantly surprised by the shabbiness of the furniture (desk scratched and torn uphostery on the chair). Also the clealiness of the room left much to be desired. I missplaced my reading glasses for two days only to find them on the floor indicating that no vacuum had touched the wall to wall carpeting in as many a days. Also while looking for my glasses I looked under the beds and prefer not to describe what I found. Having said the above, the front desk staff and rooms service staff and service was outstanding, with prompt and courteous details all the time. Also the location could not be any better with the subway and train station just across the road and the convention center less than 5 minutes away Price/quality all depends on how clean you expect a room to be whatever the price you pay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: thefrequenttraveller
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time I've stayed here in the last 18 months and each time my room seems to have got worse. Collegaues taht are at the top tier of the presidents club stay here all the time and rave about the place, but I seem to get small, old fashioned, out of date and not clean room. This latest stay, in the middle of the toronto film festival gave me no real options to move. I will not be staying here again even if it is a good location (the intercontenintal or the hlton will be preferred for location). What was wrong - a time old fashioned room with poor lighting a view of a building site, an uncomfortable chair, no plugs that don't require a yoga lesson (mind you that's pretty common) and a sink that made the most amazing scream every time you turned the tap on and noisy air conditioning that requires external tools to change the settings (they are pneumatic). Saving graces and the only reason this didn't get a single star rating is that the staff are actually quite good. I had several examples of very good service this week and as many other people say, the bar environment is actually very nice. I suppose I should just stay there as long as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Elegance”
Reviews.Author: lgoldman
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a weekend at the Royal York to attend a close friend's wedding. Really nice, classy property. The room was nicely decorated but a little dated.Bathroom a little on the small side but very functional. We checked in and had no trouble getting the rooms that had been confirmed 2 months before but I saw a few people in the line ahead of us struggling with the front desk staff. The place was very busy and loaded with tour groups and conventioners. Toronto is a big tourist attraction.Reminded me very much of the Chicago Hilton & Towers on Michigan Avenue. The Royal York is located in the downtown Toronto area close to UNion Station. It is a short walk to the Hockey Hall of Fame which is a must for any hockey fan. Also close to the St Lawrence Market, Theatre District and a short cab ride to the Distillery District. CN Tower & Air Canada Centre.The major street construction project at the front door was a little annoying but we were distracted enough with the wedding festivities that we weren't really bothered by it and that was certainly not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Gold Floor”
Reviews.Author: Bermudafan65
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on the Gold Floor because we wanted to treat ourselves to something special. We've supported this hotel for many years because we like the location - close to theatres, restaurants, shopping, etc. Our most recent visit was rather disappointing because the first Gold Floor room we were assigned was not clean. I had to do some wiping up in the bathroom before using it. There was a fair-sized lump of some sort of dark dirt on the carpet right inside the entry door. From the lint and dust all around the baseboards, I have to assume that the hotel vacuum cleaners have no crevice tool or edge-clean capabilities. When we called the front desk to request another, cleaner room, we received an apology and were given keys to another Gold Floor room. This room was somewhat cleaner but a similar line of dust and lint ran all around the baseboards. It was so obvious - you couldn't miss it. The mat in front of the sink was a very dingy light grey colour. I expected a white one. Perhaps it's a new colour scheme for the hotel. Both Gold Floor rooms had views to the concrete walls and windows of other nearby high rise buildings. That was disappointing also. The highlight of our stay was a delicious dinner in the hotel restaurant Epic. We did enjoy the Gold Floor Lounge for afternoon tea and breakfast the next morning.The service there, and at the front desk, was warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “as always, it's like coming home”
Reviews.Author: YVRGUYS
Reviews.Content: friendly, comfortable, old-world. We always stay at the Fairmont Royal York when in Toronto, and it was a pleasant stay as always. Room was spotlessly clean as usual. Valet parking (required) was fast and friendly. (don't even think about what it costs!) We arrived late afternoon after not having lunch on the plane, so settled into the library bar. The server was very pleasant and accomodating. Lunch was excellent. If you want modern, yet old-world charm, good service, the Royal York always delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisey”
Reviews.Author: torero5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely noisey. Housekeeping staff continually slam doors , yell down the very long corridors to each other from early morning till evening. No consideration for guests trying to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Rob S
Reviews.Content: Royal York is an extravagent hotel. Location excellent. Lobby and restaurant stunning. Service was great. However the stay was terrible. We booked and prepaid! king bedroom. We made some special requests because of a very special anniversary. None of them were met and we were downgraded to a Queen Bedroom and given a breakfast voucher. The carpet had stains. the sheets had stains and the bedsheet was so old it was shredding in spots. The bathroom door didnt close etc etc etc and etc... Advice - upgrade your guests never downgrade.... I was hoping it would had been a great stay but it wasnt. I never write these things but was extremely disappointed in one aspect of a great anniversary weekend that was planned. The time in Toronto however was fun. In my line of work I recommend accomdations to a number of people. After my first stay.. not good at all..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: wiljor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 nights here and all in all it was a good stay. The room was nice, on the 14th floor looking towards the lake. The hotel itself is old and is an icon in the city of Toronto with great facilities and service. Everything in the hotel is pricy but what can you expect in a major city. The gym was complete and had many cardio machines with the pool on the same floor. If you are looking for a good hotel in a perfect location the Fairmont Royal York is the place. I recommend becoming a Presidents Club member before you arrive (it's free) because you will get free wifi as part of your membership, and at 25 bucks a day, it's worth it. We love Toronto and will go back to this hotel again. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Throwback to classic elegance long forgotten”
Reviews.Author: Lucky1178
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Royal York with my family and found it to be a great throwback to the days of elegance and incredible customer service. The type that is seldom seen in todays world. The design of the lobby and each room make you feel like youve stepped back into the early 20th century (in a good way) just by the opulence of the design that would be deemed too costly in a hotel built now. I would definitely stay here again as it is close to just about everything in downtown Toronto and has everything you could want.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typically over-priced”
Reviews.Author: npcommunications
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal York while in Toronto for a business conference in January/11. Decent room, but it was a bit small. Everything was clean, but well used. I think they need a renovation or update to make this hotel shine like it used to. Good service, easy check in and out. parking costs were unbelievably high!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Liney1966
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was excellent. Very efficient staff at check in. Asked if any chance of a room with a view and our double looked out at the CN Tower. Our sons' twin room was also super despite run of the mill city hotel view. Not quite sure why a huge organisation like Fairmont can't provide free internet service when much smaller hotels and bed and breakfast locations can. Having the shopping mall in the basement was useful for grabbing a coffee and snack in the morning instead of using hotel restaurant. A slight issue with a mis-charge from the mini bar was sorted out at check-out although this meant that fast check out couldn't be used but was sorted by staff without issue. There is a lovely, opulant feel to the hotel and a "3 nights for the price of 2" deal with Trailfinders made it even better value.

Reviews.Title: “Legacy hotel right downtown”
Reviews.Author: androidmilf
Reviews.Content: Legacy hotel is ideal for business visits as it is located right in the financial district. The hotel's staff are courteous and attentive. There was road construction in the area (August 2011), however that is a fact of downtown life in a big City. Piper's Pub (one of the hotel owned restaurants) is great. A tip is to go online to the Fairmont Website and register as a President's Cub Member. Membership is free but Members get free internet in the rooms and discounts on food in certain of the the hotel restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Past times”
Reviews.Author: DeepeeSurrey
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Canada and our tour company could not picked a better hotel to have started our trip. I was most impressed with the luxurious main foyer which indeed reflected the wonderful past glories that must have thrilled patrons in the 1920's and 1930's when the hotel was built. Our room however, although, of adequate size, containing two large double beds, did not have the same wow factor. Not that it was in any way dowdy or unclean it was just dated and required a bit of a make over. Our favourite part of our experience during our stay at this hotel was the room service that provided us with one of our most memorable meals on our holiday. I propose to attach an image of our meal and you can see by the pleasure on our wives faces how good it was. The buffet breakfast was brilliant and catered for, pretty well, every taste that one could imagine. The reception staff were first class and help me with my queries without a condescending attitude that often you get from others. In fact the only real complaints that I have over my short stay are a) the rather surly attitude of the waiters at the breakfast buffet and b) the room cleaning staff needed to have more supervision and possibly more tutoring than they have already. The position of the hotel within the city of Toronto is absolutely fine and served all our needs, being closish to the harbour and all the attractions that we needed to see. I will also refer to a fab place near to the hotel for an evening meal, it was called MARCHE which was situated in a cathedral style surroundings and served wonderful food of all types (well worth a visit). I would like to conclude by thanking Toronto for it's hospitality and well mannered driving but would like to see the architects of some of the tenement blocks that surround the city beheaded and their work demolished ( what will they look like in 20 years).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel would love to return.....”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandIan174
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 9th Aug for three nights..It is superbly located in the tourist area of Toronto. We were made to feel special from the moment we arrived in the hotel.We stayed on the gold floor with breakfast included this was outstanding we would highly recommend this hotel for a truly fantastic first class hotel in Torronto.

Reviews.Title: “The great hotel of the British Empire”
Reviews.Author: everthecritic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights and had read the Trip Advisor reviews beforehand, these had set some doubts in my mind but, I am glad to say, I was delighted with the hotel and its staff. This hotel is old fashioned having been built in 1929 apparently. It is huge and it is grand. If you can't cope with green baize lined lifts, floral curtains and wall paper, pink carpets, furniture with Queen Anne legs then there are lots of very modern hotels for you nearby. I should also mention the quaint fox-hunting prints hung on the bedroom wall. I decided to enjoy it all. My room was a fair size and the bathroom and toiletries very good. I heard no sound from adjacent rooms and, equally, I don't play my TV very loud when I stay in hotels, I think is simple consideration. for others. Everything was clean and the bedding luxurious. The pool is good as are the saunas and steam rooms. My stay happened to co-incide with India Day and there was a good sprinkling of Indian guests in their national clothes. It was like being back in the days of the British Raj. All very nice. One feels obliged to make mention of any impefections and for me the only one is that the friendly and conscientious chamber maids are too few and you can get back from a hard day of sightseeing etc to find your room has not yet been made up. A request to the Reception had no effect. I bet the Queen and Prince Philip don't have this problem when they stay there - other guests shouldn't either!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Gold floors are a cut above”
Reviews.Author: Milton1667
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Royal York gold floor on the weekend of Aug 12th. We stay on the gold floors 2-3 times per year. I do agree with another reviewer that the level of service has decreased but the quiet efficient service is still there. The check-in has always been a breeze; I do feel sorry the folks queuing in at the main floor; the lines can be amazingly long. Gold floor service offers a nice quiet complementary buffet breakfast that formerly had eggs benedict but now just scrambled eggs (and kippers, cheese,fruit, yogurt, breads, deli stuff, your bacon and bangers, excellent coffee and tea etc.). There is also complementary hors d'oeuvres at 5 pm. The Gold folks will book a reservation for you. There is a separate elevator that goes up the Gold floors. The location and status of the hotel cannot be beat IMO but I still have only once paid full price for this service. There is a sale price (usually seasonaly) emailed to me by Fairmont as I'm a member of their (free) club. Sadly it's only 15-25% usually. I highly recommend this hotel still, especially for folks coming in by train as it's just across the street. Of course Fairmont has it's own entrance from Union Station but the stairs involved doesn't help those with luggage

Reviews.Title: “Elegant with a lot of history”
Reviews.Author: jereece
Reviews.Content: The Royal York was built around 1929. It is an elegant hotel with a lot of history. On the mezzanine floor you can walk around and see a lot of photos of famous visitors and celerity that have performed there. It really lives up to it's "royal" name. The Queen of England has visited there. There are signed photos of her and the Prince. The Imperial room is where most performances have take place and was the room for our conference. However up stairs there is a ball room with wood floors that's larger than a basketball court. It's huge. There's lots of stained wood throughout the motel. The food at the motel was very good but it is expensive. My room was a little smaller than I expected and the bathroom was a little dated. My only problem was the A/C was not working well but I guess in Toronto you don't need A/C very long. The Royal York is about 2 blocks from the CN Tower so getting there is a short walk. I am glad I had the opportunity to stay there and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected”
Reviews.Author: Nicole R
Reviews.Content: When i opened my curtains to look at the beautiful view i found a pair of dirty socks (not mine). Showered in the morning and there was no hot water!!! Whats up with that?

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good place to business trips”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeML
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location.... Really well connected to the underground and good amenities and restaurants. If you come during winter, this hotel is a must. If you come in during summer and wish to stay in a newer and treandier hotel this is not your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant service, loud elevators”
Reviews.Author: RJALSA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. It is not my regular choice for downtown Toronto but I have stayed for conferences, when other hotels are booked, and for this stay, because I was attending a breakfast meeting in the hotel restaurant (the Epic). Beautiful ornate decor and rooms. Excellent service. Generally quite clean. On the downside, the bathrooms are old and small. The elevators are also very loud even a few rooms away from the elevator bank. And, checking in late is a problem in securing a non-smoking room. This visit, I was checking in late. I phoned at 5:00pm and asked for a room assignment. While they generally do not do this until you are physically there, they did do so and I appreciated that since I had to stay in a smoking room on my last visit and it was problematic for allergies. On the plus side, the Epic restaurant is wonderful. I have eaten there several times. The food is excellent and the ambiance is wonderful. I have no hesitation in booking important meetings there. The restaurant staff always do a superb job.

Reviews.Title: “One of Canada's Grand Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: MJCDN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it very acceptable. Considering it is one of the older hotels in Toronto it is still of acceptable standards.The large lobby is still quite attractive with the open mezzanine looking down to reception. Hotels are not built like this any more and you can tell that in its hayday this would have been the place to be. I get the impression that it is now a convention hotel as it has some very large ballrooms. That being said the "oldness" does have a bit of charm to it. Room was spotless and the food at the two main restaurants was very acceptable. In my opinion it could do with a slight facelift but that might take away from what this hotel represents which is a time when CP built these hotels during the railroad boom in Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with modern service”
Reviews.Author: klytia
Reviews.Content: I was at the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto for a large company function. I was fortunate enough to spend the weekend there and experience a lot of what the hotel has to offer. It's very well located and one of the largest hotels in Toronto (also the most meeting space in all of Canada). Some people might call it "tired" but I found the delicate details throughout the lobby to be quite beautiful. Marble floors, elaborate chandeliers, even the intricate woodwork on the ceiling were a site to behold. The lobby preserves the regal nature of the Royal York. The rooms are quite the opposite of the heavy lobby. I suspect they have been renovated in the not-so-distant past because they had a bit of a more modern feel than the public hotel spaces. Spacious and comfortable, the the bed was to die for. The bathroom could have been a touch bigger (single sink, toilet, tub and shower) but was also well appointed with fabulous amenities. I was able to participate in a wine tasting which was very educational and fun. I also received a tour of the kitchen which I took to be an excellent sign. Any restaurant operation that so willingly will let guests into their kitchen is doing everything right! And boy are they, the food was fantastic. Even the banquet food (complete with salads, veggies, prime rib, and a risotto station) for a large group of over 100 was perfectly prepared. Everyone loved the food! they also have a roof garden of their own where they grow organic herbs and veggies. They even have a set of beehives where they make their own honey! Our function was held in the Imperial Room, off the lobby by the Library Bar. What a room! Spacious with a sunken dance floor and small stage, this room has plenty of possible layout options. It also has all of the detailing in the same style as the lobby, beautiful, elaborate, and old world. Far from your standard "vanilla" ballroom, if I were a bride I would definitely book here! Impeccable service fit for royalty in a historic setting. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Back again - worse than two years ago!!”
Reviews.Author: GGGSarnia
Reviews.Content: I have already provided a review follwoing my stay at this hotel two years ago. I was, once again, forcedto stay at the hotel due to a conference I was attending being held at the Fairmont Royal York. If anything the hotel has got worse. Check in was a joke with rude staff, queues and mislaid bookings. Once again dirty dishes strewn all over corridors leading to rooms. Once again a minute roon with the most ridiculous warddrobe / closet ever invented and built. In order to hang clothes the wardrobe/ closet doors had to be left open. The depth of the closet, built into the wall, was only about 30 cm ( I measured) whcih meant shirts and suits had to be hung so that they projected into the room with half in the closet and half in the room. What a joke!! I would call this hotel Fawlty Towers but that would be an insult to John Cleese and his team. The gym and swimming pool are fantastic although thye could do with a good clean. The restaurant I had breakfast in each day was filthy dirty with smeared surfaces cleaned with smelly cloths. Food was OK but if the restaurant cleanliness is anything to go by I would be frightened to look in the kitchens. Surprisingly stayed in the Fairmont in Quebec City recently and that was spotlessly clean, had very attentitive staff and excellent food so this chain can get it right but not in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, spot with fading glory but handy location”
Reviews.Author: JuliaUstinov
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip little realizing that the Bollywood film awards would be in full swing which gave the hotel an exotic, fun, sometimes maddening papparazzi and crazed fan nuttiness in the lobby. The check-in was superb and the clerk managed to rustle up a nice room . Hint: be sure to sign up for the free Fairmont presdients club card to get complimentary internet and maybe some extra consideration. The rooms are nice but on the fading glory side. The bathroom is small and almost institutional. I felt like I was staying in high-priced chicken coop. The army of housekeepers are efficient - one man rushed in - like the White Rabbit from Alice in Wonderland - to restock the mini-bar, ignoring my dishabille. It'sa convenient location - since I used to live in Toronto, I know the system and I was delighted to go down to the concourse and get whisked away by Toronto's amazing subway and streetcare system and be in a cool neighbourhood like Queen St West in moments. The hotel gym is very nice.Overall, it's a good locationbut I would stay at something more boutique-scaled if I wasn't there on a business account. The Toronto convention centre is a short walk away. Try to fineigle a lake-view room - the ferries and newly busy Toronto island airport make it a pretty, interesting view.

Reviews.Title: “All we needed!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyBQueensland
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a very comfortable hotel. No complaints at all. It was grand and spacious on entry and although our room was small, it was clean and it had all we required. The bar downstairs was good and we enjoyed the company of the barman who took pleasure in telling us about Canada and Toronto in particular. He was a gem and as we were ready for any information, we really enjoyed out glass. Dinner was wonderful! Thankyou for a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in experience was a disapointement”
Reviews.Author: renrenren
Reviews.Content: Attempted to check in to the Royal York on Aug 15th so that I may attend a large conference in Toronto. I arrived at 8:15 PM hoping to get access to my room and relax before the next day's activities. Upon arrival, I was informed that my room was not ready (King-nonsmoking). I was offered a sofa-bed room (are you kidding??) or a smoking room with two double beds (allergies). I was offered a gold room for an extra 100$ a night which I found unacceptable. They took my cell hone number and offered to call me when my room was ready. I was offered a credit for the restaurant in order to chill out and wait for room to be ready. Room was finally ready at 11pm (along with another 50$ restaurant credit for my troubles). I was not impressed with this level of customer service and have come to expect more from Fairmont in previous stays. Beyond the check in experience, the staff was quite cordial.. bar and restaurant staff were pleasant. Room is on the small side but clean and comfortable. Paid internet unless you are in the President's club. With so many options in town, the check in fiasco kind of tainted my stay as I was expecting more. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It, Then I Didn't”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromDaBronx
Reviews.Content: Was there from 8/4/11 until 8/9/11, to attend the annual meeting of a professional organization to which I belong. Originally I booked at the Residence Inn for $250 per night but canceled when the rates for the meeting were only $175 per night at the Royal York. My wife had stayed there with her parents 50 years ago, when she was a young child, and had fond memories of the hotel. So at a savings of $75 a night for 5 nights, saving $375 was a good deal. For the first 3 nights, everything was great, and the hotel was on its way to a 5 star rating. The only negative was that the carpeting in the room was compressed down, although it was not worn. Sunday evening we came back from the Hockey Hall of Fame, and the air conditioning was not working. Called the front desk, and they sent a mechanic to the room. He determined that the blower blew out, and could not be repaired till Monday morning. I was given two choices, stay in that room or change rooms. I opted to change rooms. Big mistake. I had to repack and then lug all my luggage myself. The new room was at the far reaches of the building and smaller. It had a queen sized bed. The original room had a king sized bed. It did not have a safe in the room, although the original room did. I had to place everything in the safe deposit boxes at the reception desk. Bottom line was that for our inconvenience the hotel did not offer anything at all, and instead downgraded the accommodations we had. This knocked the overall rating down to 3 stars. On the positive side, the hotel is gorgeous and well maintained. It is part of an underground walkway system called the PATH. One can walk from the hotel to the subway and the commuter trains, to the Hockey Hall of Fame, to various commercial buildings in the Financial District (each with restaurants and shops), to the Hudson Bay Company department store, and to the Eaton Center shopping mall, all underground and without concern for the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: The fairmont is one of my favorite north American hotels. It's in a grand building and the entire atmosphere is one of grand reception areas in classic style. Â It definitely is not the most modern of hotels but has individuality and character. Â Rooms are of varying sizes. Mine was perfectly adequate and tastefully furnished. Â The bed was comfortable, there was wired and wireless internet in the room and public areas (top tip: join the fairmont loyalty program online for free before you visit. Â Members receive free net access) and I had a quiet undisturbed night of sleep. Â Breakfast was absolutely fantastic in the restaurant. All staff I came into contact with were great. Â Extremely friendly and helpful. Â Unfortunately I lost my cellphone during my stay in Toronto and was blown away when the receptionist offered to wipe the cost of the calls from my room to my cell phone company in the uk.Â  All in all I would highly recommend the fairmont for those visiting Toronto and it will certainly be my first choice when I visit Toronto next.Â

Reviews.Title: “Character hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: SusanPerth
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Royal York. The hotel has the character and style one would expect from the Fairmont chain. The room was spacious and comfortable. Lake views would be better described as glimpses as new buildings have been located between the hotel and shore line. The hotel is opposite Union Station where you can catch a train, subway or street car. There are two conference centres an easy walk from the hotel, well at least in the summer months. There are plenty of excellent restaurants in the area. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive but a much cheaper option is the cafe on the lower floor. A passageway on the lower ground floor also leads to the maze of underground shopping. Housekeeping could have been better. The floor wasn't vacummed during our visit, soap wasn't replaced, we started with 5 towels and 2 bathmats but by the third day we were down to 3 towels and 1 bathmats. I'm not sure how you access this hotel if you have a mobility problem. We were confronted with steps whichever entrance we took. On our departure we were informed there is a conveyor belt for luggage. We had carried it up the steps on our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Happy birthday to me”
Reviews.Author: Sunshintuna
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with some friends for a girls sleep over for my birthday. The parking was a little dicey to get to, but that was because of major construction to Front St. which is not the fault of the hotel. We got a gold room, and I must admit, that I quite enjoyed the ability to check in in a less crowded, quiter environment. The view was not great, but who cares, I live in Toronto, so the view didn't mean anything. The service was impeccable. We did not want for anything nor was there anything they weren't willing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the Memories”
Reviews.Author: BarrieJoey
Reviews.Content: Our family planned this months in advance, for a 16th bday party for our daughter. We took the valet parking, I think they told us that we could park our own car in the back, but we had way too much luggage for that. It cost 42.$ for valet.There was 6 of us in 2 rooms. The rooms were very comfortable and clean, the beds were sooo comfortable we could of stayed on them all day. When we arrived they brought a huge piece of cheesecake with happy birthday on it with fresh fruit around it for our daughter. Absolutly fabulous cheesecake. We were on the 16 floor and with that we got orderves at 5 that night and breakfast in the morning. The meals for us were on the 12th floor. We had the pkg room so we recieved 4 free tickets to the CN tower as well, we paid extra to go to the skypod, the girls loved it. We took everyone to the Benihana restaurant. It is considered pricey appox. $35 a plate and up depending on what you order. What a great experience this was, you have to ask for a table that the chef cooks at, make sure you ask for Toto he was fabulous. We notice the other chefs were not as interactive, he gave our daughter a chefs hat for being 16, she loved it. The food was great, if you order the ice tea...its real tea not the stuff you buy. With our meal we got soup, the onion soup is homemade with chunks of mushrooms, there is also misu soup (tou Foo), salad with home dressing and white rice, more food than you could probably eat, then the actual meal, so much food They brought my daughter another cheesecake for dessert and sang to her. We love cheesecake. An over all excellent experience for us. Would we go again, you bet and we would go to the restaurant as well. It is casual dress. The highlight of my husbands visit was that he and the girls saw Stevie Wonder stepping out of his Limo so close he could of touched him. Unfortunately the girls with phones in hand wouldn't take a picture so he went without. You never know who is wondering the halls of the Royal York. I realize the hotel is older but they have such a casual elegance about them. We felt comfortable and at home from start to finish. Thanks for the memories

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Serge P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a few times in the last four or five years on business because the events or meetings were held at the Royal York. Every time when I was assigned a room it was a much older and very used one. Renovations had not been done for many decades. Unless you agreed to pay a hefty premium, even though you would complain about the state of the room, that is what you had to contend with. My suggestion: come in for a look at the lobby and enjoy the stately look but do yourself a favour and sleep somewhere else, it's just not worth the price and disappointment. Also the price of the food in the main restaurant is grossly exagerated.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: TucHippo
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to the Royal York, a beautiful property, as is the case with most Fairmont hotels. I enjoy the older style hotels so this one suits that preference quite well. At check-in our suite was not yet available. We were told that it would take about an hour for it to be readied, but I was handed $75 in food/beverage credits - very nice and above and beyond for just one hour. Almost an hour to the minute I was called on my cell phone and the room was ready as promised. Nice food choices on site, and a short walk to lots more in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Xecutiv
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Older property, not so modern, but elegant. Small bathrooms in the rooms. No complimentary wifi in the lobby which needs to be a hotel standard. Close to Union Station and many places to eat. Has a Benihana restaurant attached (must have reservations)

Reviews.Title: “Old school hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: sir_snorksalot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend for a friend's wedding. It was about a $55 (canada) taxi ride from the airport. The hotel has a historic feel, and while some might think it a bit stuffy and worn down, I enjoyed it. The bed was very comfortable, and our room/bathroom clean. The staff were helpful. For some reason, the lobby is always really crowded with people checking in or out. I think the hotel's biggest benefit plus is its location in a touristy part of Toronto with a short walk to the lake and other attractions. I'd recommend the Brewery district and the market area, as well as a trip to the islands (I think the ferry is cheaper than the boat tours, which don't really teach you that much).

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SuzWilkinson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 4 nights in July as we were attending a tournament there. It is a grand building but our room was pokey and felt a bit run down. I certainly didnâ€™t want to spend any extra time there. It was incredibly busy when we arrived â€“ we had to wait for 25 mins to check in - I felt that the reception area should have been more austere to fit with the surroundings, but I suppose that can be difficult to achieve when hundreds of people descend on the place. The pool and fitness room was great, up to date and airy, although itâ€™s a bit disconcerting as the internal rooms overlook the pool â€“ you can see straight down at everything. The location is good â€“ directly across the road from Union station but there are many other downtown hotels. We got to see both the Sheraton and Intercontinental hotels and they were more to our taste. For the price (which was already slightly discounted) I felt disappointed with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elwin133
Reviews.Content: Sat night stay. Room 10-287 turned out to be next to the elevator. King bed. I was very pleased that the room was very quiet. No noise of flushing toilets, no elevator noise, no slamming doors in the morning, or voices in the hall. The lobby and elevator are very ornate, but the room was quite modern looking. Nothing looked brand new except the LCD TV, but nothing was worn out or old looking. The bathroom was very good. The bed was excellent. Soft and comfortable. One of the best hotel beds I have used. Very good value for money using Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYHan170
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night because of the hotel's convenient Porter Airline shuttle available outside the hotel's door. Staff was attentive and helpful, however the lines for the Concierge were long. Lovely restaurants in the hotel and there is an underground mall under the hotel. The hotel is a little expensive and parking is very expensive but the location is terrific. Rooms are small but comfortable. Hotel is large and hallways are very long. Only complaint, typical of expensive hotels, you must pay $16 for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh. Do not walk barefoot on the carpet.”
Reviews.Author: Sealfat
Reviews.Content: I don't like socks and shoes. I am the type of person who will remove these in my home and will do likewise in a hotel room. Bad move. The carpet wasn't sticky, but it had this texture of permanent dampness. I wore my sandals the whole time. The bathtub drain was plugged too. Postitive: the bed and pillows were great.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: constant-traveller28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in early july & just wanted to say that this is a lovely HUGE hotel in a great location. The lobby is very grand & has a lovely old-fashion feel to it,its like a savoy hotel. There are lovely restuarants in the hotel,shops,shoe shine,beauty salon etc. Apparently this is where the Queen stays when shes in town too! Its a 5 minute walk to the CN tower, 10 mins away from the beautiful harbour (tho you do have to walk under a couple of flyovers!) The hop on-off bus stops right across the road too,whch i would highly recommend,we walked everywhere & didnt use it until the end of our stay! its good value for money & goes eveywhere! I would recommend getting it one evening to the distillery distict & going to Pure Spirirts for lobster! A local recommended this & it was delicious! Also they were using the lobby one day to film a soap opera! hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated room, not great value.”
Reviews.Author: snarfley
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the location is very convenient for getting to the airport, other cities or the suburbs via Go/Via train due to its proximity to the subway, the Airport Express and the train station. The lobby is beautiful, and if it's raining you have underground access to plenty of shops including an LCBO for alcohol and a Shoppers for cosmetics. However, the room itself (fine, we were in the lowest category room, but it's still a five-start hotel) was pretty old and tired. The bathroom plumbing wasn't working very well, the bathtub needed replacing, the room was tiny with no floor space for a suitcase, the wallpaper was horrible... I could go on. Also, having to pay $25 a day for internet for it to only include wireless or wired, not both, is adding insult to injury. At least you can print tickets for free in the business centre. I guess I would consider staying here again if I were travelling again with lots of heavy bags and needed to be in this location, but I would certainly look around for anything else in the area first.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Royal York remains a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: crvcrv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal York in 1998, and did not truly remember very much about my stay there. On this occasion, I stayed one week at the Fairmont Gold, the concierge floor, and it made significant and memorable difference. While the rooms are not very spacious, and some walls are thin, the comfort is all there. The bathroom fixtures are fairly recent, the beds and pillows are very comfortable, and all regular amenites are there. The concierge lounge, though, is superlative. There are one or two concierges on duty from 6 a.m. until 10 or 11 p.m., all of whom are uniformly helpful. Breakfast is served at the lounge until 10 a.m., and it is excellent. The coffee, or tea, is very good, and there are usually options such as eggs Benedict and Belgian waffles, or scrambled eggs with sausages or bacon, or eggs Norwegian and pancakes, all of which were very good. In addition, they offer a wide variety of fresh fruit, cereals, breads, and assorted fruit juices. At other times of the day, tea and coffee are available with pastries and cookies. The macaroons, some coated with a little chocolate, others with coconut shavings, were delicious. For cocktails, they have a top-drawer selection of hard liquor, mixers, and some wines and champagnes. There is an additional charge for these. The lounge itself is very comfortable, so if you are travelling with colleagues who are staying at the hotel, it is a good place to spend some time to hang out together. The meeting rooms are a little dated, but are also very spacious. We had no complaints about the conference rooms, although they could be better air conditioned in the summer. Overall, the Royal York afforded a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: Cmark75
Reviews.Content: For years I wanted to stay at one of Toronto's oldest and prominent hotels and at the chance it was below my level of expectation. Overall nothing wrong with the place, just missing that grandeur I thought it might have had being a Fairmont downtown Toronto. Lobby: beautiful, open with great atmosphere, and great lobby bar. Location: excellent right across from Union Station & Subway and short walk to many other downtown attractions including bike rentals at Union Station. Rooms: dated. Needing an up date throughout floors and rooms. Pool area: small, same with the exercise facility. Wouldn't be bad for a business traveller but we were looking for some relax time and due to the size it was busy. Overall: Not bad but nothing spectacular. For the "summer sale" price we got the single king room for it was not a bad value, but not at full price. Not that I wouldn't stay here again but with all the selection downtown of other hotels I would likely give another place a try before coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory - very, very faded.”
Reviews.Author: termascda
Reviews.Content: This hotel regales you with its opulent and royal history, in books, plaques, on menus, etc -- but it has not been renovated for a long time. Nothing worked well in my room even though they had apparently given me a complimentary upgrade. The lamps, the clock, the taps --all in worse shape than I had in my student days. The shower and sink gave low pressure, scalding-hot-then-freezing-cold water. Still, the bed was comfortable with good quality bedding, and the hotel has a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LeeD4
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Gold floor was amazing, we were looked after made to feel at home and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. As a big cooperate hotel you might think that everyone is in there room, here you don't have that feeling at all. And with great concierge and a really nice lounge area warm and have found some great new wines to taste. Also high tea was great.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spice67
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Royal York in Toronto in a deluxe room. The room was quite spacious and comfortable. The bathroom, although rather small, was clean and satisfactory. We enjoyed the complimentary robes in the room and the two closets, The lobby is elegant, and the hotel is located in a convenient area for sightseeing. We walked to all our restaurants. One concern was all the construction on Front Street immediately in front of the hotel. It was difficult to turn into the entrance. We chose to self-park at a garage behind the hotel, not affiliated with the hotel. Since we arrived on a Sunday and Monday was the Civic holiday, two days of our parking at that garage was half-price. As a result our parking only cost us $86 for the three days, as opposed to the $42 per day for valet parking at the hotel. Overall we had a great experience at the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny0386
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to Union Station which was fabulous. Most of my trip was spent outdoors using a lot of public transportation, so proximity to the station was wonderful. The hotel is also relatively near the CN Tower, where I spent the latter half of my last day of vacation. Even though I did not venture back to the hotel very much during the day, it would have been pretty easy too. The room was comfortable and clean, it was really everything I needed for a sight-seeing vacation. The staff at the hotel was also very friendly and amenable.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property - a classic”
Reviews.Author: CherHaines
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights last month and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Besides being a classy and historic property, the Fairmont Royal York is comfortable, well-located, and provides excellent service. The best part of this visit by far was the feeling of history one gets when staying at this classic hotel. The ballrooms are magnificent throwbacks to a more elegant time. The shops and lobby area also are standout. Bellman, conceirge, front desk all provided worthy of the 5 star service rating this hotel deserves. Here are a couple of tips to help you enjoy yourself: join the President's Club and you get free Internet and local phone calls. This will save you $15/day. Also there are mini-bars in the rooms that you can remove contents from in order to have frig. We had yogurt and fruit for breakfast in lieu of $20/pp buffet. The in-room coffee was decent and they even provided real creamer! We did encounter a problem during our stay - the A/C unit was leaking (condensation, they said) and 3 visits from maintenance later there was still a very wet area of the carpet near the unit. I give the property high marks for effort and service in the way they handled, but they said "it happens all the time". Shouldn't they find a permanent fix? Other not-so-great stuff: room was pretty small and bathroom had hardly any sink space. Walls were very thin - could hear the people in the room next door. Summary: Best features: location, service, room amenities, character of the building, architecture Negatives: thin walls (could hear people in next room and hallway), air conditioning leak that no one could seem to figure out how to fix, fairly small room

Reviews.Title: “The Grande Dame of the British Empire”
Reviews.Author: asdfghjzxcv
Reviews.Content: Fairmont offers unparalleled service and atmosphere. There is a wide variety of rooms, some tiny, some spectacular. Elevators could be more reliable and the Front Street construction was a distraction. But all in all it was a wonderful and memorable experience. We have been coming here for 40 years and will continue.

Reviews.Title: “A Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: FF13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a downtown gem in Toronto. It is a very old structure (opened in 1929) but it has been modernized and expanded over the years. Our room was very good and the service provided by all staff members was excellent. It is directly across the street from the main railroad station. It is convenient to many city sites and tours.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: ficchivl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It is conveniently located in central Toronto. It is a luxury hotel but absolutely needs renovating the furniture and style of its rooms (including suites). It is rather old fashioned.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: armeegurl
Reviews.Content: We rented a room to attend a local show and I have always wanted to stay here. The rate was great and it was close in proximity to everything we needed. The parking is $42 per day, so we opted for underground parking one block away for $10 a day and had no issues. Front desk staff were courteous and quick. The lobby is bustling with activity and there are so many things to observe and take in. The lobby was pretty and airy and there were shops within the hotel but we didn't go in to any of them. Our room was on the 3rd floor and when we got out of the elevator, we were hit with quite a smell of old, stale cigarettes or mold. Our room was a king suite in the corner. We had a huge size king bed with wonderful sheets/duvet and a good size bathroom. I loved the smell of the soap and hair products! The bathroom was quit outdated but I knew prior to booking that we weren't booking a fresh, new hotel. I was taking this in for the history and experience. We had a hard time trying to regulate the air conditioner as it was 15 degrees when we came in and the carpets were stained and felt damp. At 440am I was woken up by the rattling of the blowing air conditioner and tried turning it off, but the stagnet air was too much to handle, so I cranked it on again. By 5am I went to find some juice or any kind of beverage in the hotel. After walking all the way to the vending machine, hidden in a closet, there was an out of service sign on it. So I went down to front desk. They advised that nothing was open, I could go to Tim Hortons in the area or call in-room dinning ($4 automatically added to your order). I turned to go back to my room and then went back to ask for change to possibly find another vending machine, the staff member told me to wait there and he'd see what he'd do. He came back with juice and sent me on my way - I was SO appreciative, it's staff like these who think outside the box to keep a customer. BIG thanks to you! I used the gym which I really enjoyed, the pool and hot tub looked nice, but I found it too busy to jump in. The attendant at the front desk was VERY friendly and kind. ANOTHER great staff member. We had also realized on our way back to the hotel after our night out that we forgot toothpaste, we hit the front desk and within 10 minutes we had a tube in our room! I was really disappointed and frustrated that I didn't get a good nights sleep from the rattling air conditioner and what we think was rattling pipes in the washroom. The staff that we came across were great and I recommend the Fairmont Poutine, which I did order and truly enjoyed. As I have never stayed there before, I don't know if there are better types of rooms than what we had (3-102). I wish my experience with our room could have been as great as the staff that we had dealt with. I thought about complaining about the noisy AC, but it was 5am, my husband was sleeping and all I needed was a repairman coming in!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bucsuz
Reviews.Content: Recent stay at the Royal York was greatly enjoyed. Gold room worth the extra. Parking pricey but not much more than a self service parking a few blocks away. Location good for shopping and restaurants and any downtown business. Fairmont knows how to do it right.

Reviews.Title: “Classic piece of history”
Reviews.Author: Kas864
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Excellent location and within walking distance of the main downtown sights. Lots of good eating places close by. Hotel very clean and very well run. Only negative being it's slight lack of personality. However, it is an extremely large 4star chain and has many hundreds of people in and out daily. Could not fault the room. Good size, clean, comfortable and plenty of amenities in the bathroom. Ideal for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: shazzie_canuck
Reviews.Content: This is a very overdue review. We stayed at the Royal York for two nights in October 2010 & I thought I'd done a review then. I'm using the notes from my travel journal to write my review. I'm from Toronto and always wanted to stay at the Royal York, but could never really justifiy it, but now that I live in the UK, I just had to stay there. We arrived on a Via Rail train from Ottawa, so getting to the hotel was very easy - right across the street. The airport express coach service from Pearson also stops at the Royal York, and of course it's not far from Toronto island airport. All of the hotel staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and professional. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was on the 4th floor. it was nicely decorated and although somewhat small, it was perfectly comfortable. We did have a slight issue with housekeeping where on both mornings we had not been left with a coffee pot or cups, but that was quickly rectified with a phone call. Tip1: make sure you join the fairmont presidents club before you stay- it doesn't cost anything and with it the in room internet access is complimentary, otherwise it is about $15 per 24 hours. We joined after we made our reservation and on check in gave the lady our number and it was all sorted. Tip2: Even if you decide not to stay at the hotel, you must have a look around. The lobby is lovely and there are plenty of seats so you can relax & look around. Up on the mezzanine level there are many photos, prints etc displayed and it's well worth a look. We also managed to have a quick peak in the ballroom and a few other rooms; they weren't set up for any functions, but still nice to look at. There are also shops, restaurants in the lower ground floor which are worth a look, and of course from there you can access the PATH which is a great way to get around the downtown during poor weather or do a bit of underground shopping. We didn't use any of the facilities, so I can't comment on that, other to say that they looked lovely! On the morning we checked out, we had several hours before we needed to be at the airport and were able to leave our bags in a secure room, so that was really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Queen stays here!”
Reviews.Author: KnowAboutTravel
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to the Royal York, it's worth a visit. It's grandeur is reminiscent of days gone by. From the chandelier to the brass plated elevators one can imagine the years of dignitaries that have walked the halls. Despite its leanings towards posh, it's fairly affordable... just don't eat in the restaurants or drink in the bars!! Lots of excellent eateries within a short walk in any direction. It's most handy for those traveling by train, with Union Station right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Walking back in time: elegance, beauty and practical”
Reviews.Author: VanessaPi3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls week-end and we did not regret it at all. The location is so convenient, the staff dedicated and calming and the rooms comfortable and practical. The hall of the hotel is worth a visit as it is magnificient and so impressive. Our bathroom wasn't super clean when we arrived but we told them and they made sure to fix it the next morning. We also used the laundry/ dry cleaning service and although we had problems with one of the dresses sent (came back with a sticky thing on it). They fixed it and made sure it was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: clf51
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Royal York many times during my husband's business trips. The rooms are expensive since you are staying at a hotel with a lot of history. It's been around since the mid 1800's. It has an impressive lobby and the staff are wonderful. It is situated in downtown Toronto, close to Union Station and a lot of shopping. The Eaton's Centre is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel-A treat to stay in”
Reviews.Author: rileyboy10
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for one night. Previously here 15 years ago and was pleased to see that the Royal York has maintained its standards. Rooms are on the smaller side but still comfortable. Very clean, and nicely appointed. Hotel lobby is large yet cozy with many sitting areas. Walk down the main lobby stairs and the underground is right there with many shops to browse through. Fast efficient service checking in and out. Great hotel no complaints! However, Toronto appears to have lost its old world charm. Construction is everywhere with no regards to preservation. Not the Toronto remembered, rather a brave new modern world (city).

Reviews.Title: “Good Old Fashioned Charm & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JQ_1a
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location opposite Union Station in the heart of the financial district. The lake, CN tower and lots of bars and restaurants are within easy walking distance. It's an old fashioned hotel with a beautiful lobby (which is usually buzzing with acitivity) and excellent customer service. Beds are comfortable and the rooms contain bathrobes and Miller Harris toiletries. Free Wifi and gym gear for Presidents Club members.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: newportmom
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It's expensive, but the area is expensive and this is the best hotel around (tons of history). We used AAA discounts and got an extra large room, which made a huge difference - tons of space and just a good experience overall. Parking costs are totally outrageous though and there are few alternatives nearby that are cheaper, especially with all the downtown construction going on. It's easy to get around without a car, so I would recommend ditching the car and taking public transit. BTW - when you go to the CN tower DO NOT get the extra package with the movie and motion simulator - total waste of money and has no relevance to the CN tower at all!

Reviews.Title: “Large well placed hotel but expensive and impersonal”
Reviews.Author: ailourophile
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Trailfinders as we overheard some other guests saying they did too. Interestingly they thought the same as us - they wouldn't necessarily have picked it if left to their own devices but it was being pushed because of a 3 nights for 2 deal. That made it better value than it would otherwise have been, but do you notice how the dearer the hotel the more they want to charge you for as extras? In our other two stops on this trip we had complimentary breakfast and access to a computer for guests free - not here! If you have breakfast actually in the hotel it will set you back $29 each + tax + tip. If this is the sort of luxury you crave then you won't mind, otherwise go to the deli in the shopping avenue in the basement. My husband craved eating breakfast off actual china so we had the hotel breakfast once. We arrived at 3pm and to begin with no room was declared to be ready for us. This I do find unacceptable. I had to press for a room there and then and took one with a Queen bed near the lift and it was fine - but smaller than in the other two hotels we were in in North America during this trip and with bottles of water sitting with labels round their neck telling you how much they would cost - I find that very offputting. Where they did score was in recovering my mobile phone from the room for me after we had checked out and keeping our luggage secure until our flight later int he day. The big convenience of this hotel is that the Express Airport bus stops and picks up at the hotel and it is in an excellent position for sight-seeing and the railway station if you needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby - great. Rooms - not so much.”
Reviews.Author: cathy818
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at a Fairmont and the second time I've thought to myself "why is this place supposed to be so great?". Sure, the staff is pleasant and the lobby is beautiful, but the room looked like a outdated Holiday Inn. I understand the historic value and all that blah blah blah, but when you're lying in bed watching TV looking at peeling wallpaper and old carpet you feel kind of ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not .. standard rooms no biggie,”
Reviews.Author: kgreen12
Reviews.Content: im a travel agent and i stayed here in my passing thru to somewhere else , the check in was good and fast the main areas the check in and stores and pool and everything is amazingly pretty it is all clean and shiny and marble , once you get off the elevator the wall paper and old paper will flowers and not impressive , i was in a standard room and it was the size of my bathroom at home, nothing is impressive for the rates that some of my clients have paid for this , if you pay the extra money for the gold floor or higher it may be nice but i wouldnt pay over 200 bucks for a room that has no frills, a stay at the delta or sheraton or a marriott property would of been a better and cheaper bargain....

Reviews.Title: “My favourite, I've stayed twice”
Reviews.Author: ElleJayCardiff
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel in a central location. I definately recommend joining the Fairmont presidents club for extra benefits and fantastic service if you eat in the hotel. The shops in the lobby and basement are something extra to browse and perfect for an emergency snack. I have stayed here twice and would stay again if I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded on our honeymoon, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: theramsdens
Reviews.Content: We had booked our stay at the Fairmont through a travel agent and it was only by chance that the receptionist found out it was our honeymoon. We were upgraded from our view room to a large suite! The hotel is a beautiful building which is felt mostly in the large entrance/reception area. The room we were given, was beautifully clean and well presented though the bathroom was slightly dated. There was also nice complementary cafetiere coffee each day. All of the staff that we encountered were very efficient and friendly and the hotel seems to be a really well run establishment. The only negative was that some of the corridors were a little run down and could do with refurbishment. However this would not put us off a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Toronto hotel for everything”
Reviews.Author: lindylu56
Reviews.Content: Look no further than any Fairmont hotel but don't ever miss a chance to stay here.The history is amazing and you could spend a day alone in the hotel just exploring and still won't see everything. Guaranteed you will love it..It's clean and no bed bugs!!! You feel like royalty, and yes they have stayed there with pics to prove it, no matter where your accommodations are within the hotel. I have stayed above the 12th floor on separate stays and other times through out the hotel. Since I was in Toronto for a U2 concert and that was something else :) , plus my daughter lives there, this was the perfect place for me to stay as far as access. I decided to stay a week and had opted for a package and the room was big , 500 sq ft. I HAVE STAYED THERE MANY TIMES BUT NEVER WROTE A REVIEW DUH on my part. Loved the 500 sq ft room and it was huge. From the moment you step onto the property they treat you well. No luggage worries. They took my car, had my luggage in my room before I even got there..The room service was excellent. The windows opened and the beds were comfy with the finest of linens. I will always stay at the Royal York when in Toronto. No other hotel can offer the ambiance.The Royal York is Toronto;s best.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and elegance!”
Reviews.Author: HappyWebbie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel and other Fairmont hotels and they never fail to impress. The York is old-world elegance and a very romantic get away. We stayed for 3 days in a suite which was impeccably clean. I am normally one of those nuts who wipe down hotel rooms with disinfecting wipes on check in, but I skipped it this time as the rooms was clearly polished and spotless. This room had two bathrooms, which was very convenient. Also the bathrooms are a bit small so this helped a lot with toiletry space. House keeping was prompt and showed a lot of care. For example, I had a water glass beside the bed. After cleaning, a sparkling clean glass was left in exactly the same place. The location is perfect for walking to dining spots, hockey hall of fame, Kensington market etc. We ate in the breakfast buffet which was very expensive but good. One strange thing .. In the lobby there is a dining spot and we arrived at noon for lunch. However, they said they were closed for half an hour as they switched from breakfast to lunch. I guess not many business lunches take place there if this is the usual case! We had drinks in the Library bar which was very nice with very attentive waiters. You could tell they had pride in the place that they worked by their service and perfection in drink preparation. Drinks were quite expensive, but worth the experience. There is a lot of construction in front of the building which is a little inconvenient, but in retrospect this did not detract from the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Does it right”
Reviews.Author: StoneWiegman
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to The Royal York since 1979. The only thing that has changed is the addition of "The Fairmont" to The Royal York's name and that is a good thing. It is hard to improve on perfection and the Royal York is perfect. Close to the train station, the CN Tower, the Jays stadium, the Metro and anything else you would want to see or do in Toronto. All the rooms we have stayed in over the years have been simply grand. Views are great no matter what room or floor one stays on. Our last trip was the celebration of one of our friend's 60th birthday. When the clerk asked them if they were visitng for business or pleasure our friends informed them the milemarker birthday plan. Without hesitation the clerk upgraded their room to a wee bit higher floor with outstanding views of the harbour. The Royal York is clean, comfy, and one should not go to Toronto without staying at the York to experience what most hotels can only aspire to.

Reviews.Title: “Splendidly different from bland "chain hotels" - worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Davejag60
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights recently - on arrival receptionist happy to advise on various room options even though we had pre booked standard room through Trailfinders. Given a pleasant corner room although limited views of local attractions. Quality of room good and hotel overall was impressive though a bit of an air of faded grandeur. Location excellent being near to CN Tower and waterfront. Some good restaraunts nearby and I recommend avoiding the hotel breakfast unless you want to pay 5 times the cost compared to the deli next to the hotel !! All hotelstaff we encountered were very helpful and informative which made the visit even better.

Reviews.Title: “I have had better stay and hotels that cost half the money”
Reviews.Author: Sherry6411
Reviews.Content: I was not very happy with our stay at that Royal Fairmont York. We took our trip at the begining of July 2011. First problem was that check in is at 3pm, I called the hotel at 4 saying we were running late but on our way. We arrived at the hotel at 5:45pm and our room was not ready, we asked how long due to the fact we had dinner reservation at 7:30pm. They could tell us. It was 6:45pm we still didn't have our room, we had to leave without being able to get freshen up. We arrived back at the hotel at around 10:30pm , was informed that I couldn't use my Fairmont Resort gift card that I was told I could use when I made the reservation. Asked for our luggage to be brought up to our room, it took them over an hour to get us our luggage. Room was extremely dusty and me have allgeries was not a comfortable stay. Our last night their they in form me that I have outstanding bill on our room... we had to pay $84.00 to park our truck in their parking lot. The only thing that was good about our stay was the location of the hotel for the thing we wanted to see. Unhappy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth being in the President's Club”
Reviews.Author: JiddaWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed only for one night, as I was visiting relations in Toronto. Wish I could have stayed longer. Staff are great, always pleasant and helpful. I joined the President's club on line and it was well worth it, as you go to anotherr reception desk with no queuing. Also I was upgraded and had a huge room with a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom had a marble basin but the plastic bath was a bit of a come down. When you stand for a shower, the base seems to sink down and I am a small person. The whole hotel is very luxurious yet relaxed. Breakfast had a varied choice of food. This is my second trip to a Fairmont Hotel and I will certainly visit other Fairmont Hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh... Shabby throwback to the turn of the Century.”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Traveler777_eb
Reviews.Content: Fine if you want to save a few bucks and it's extremely close to the Porter Air terminal (they offer free shuttle service) but that's all its got. I was sent here on business, NEVER again. It's a tacky attempt at an antiques showcase. Creaky sputtering plumbing in my OLD bathroom, stained carpet, 1950's thermostat, smelly, beat up furniture... And I was on the "GOLD" level! And check out the TV on the SIDE of the bed??? Oh - the gym is the WORST! 5 treadmills, a few bikes, and some multi-use cable-pull setup from the 80s!! It's VERY small. (On a side note, if you want a GREAT, gym, stay at the Sheraton on Queen. it's huge.) Extremely kind and thoughtful staff, but I'll stay at the Soho Met or Hazleton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: GWSD
Reviews.Content: I have to admit a bias - I love the Fairmont chain in Canada. I've had great experiences at a number of them over the years. So I'll try to be objective about this hotel, and just give a couple of hints to keep in mind. First, if you are doing anything in the Rogers Center or Air Canada Center areas, it's hard to beat the Royal York for its location and comfort. We were at both the ACC and Rogers on the weekend we stayed, and the ACC is less than a five minute walk from the hotel. The Rogers Center is only a little further. The hotel has a decent little pool and a nice fitness center. The staff are professional and friendly and very helpful. Our room was well-maintained and great for an older hotel. The hotel has BeniHana (Japanese Steakhouse) in the basement and of course hundreds of good restaurants nearby. If you are going to stay at any Fairmont hotel, take five minutes to register for the Fairmont President's Club. It's free and gets you very worthwhile perks, including free wireless in your room, which in business hotels saves you $10 - $15/day. At the Royal York and some other Fairmonts you can also get free use of mountain bikes.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great for the most part, service in Epic restaurant not so good”
Reviews.Author: VacationFunintheSun
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Royal York and had an enjoyable stay. We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Union Station and convenient location in downtown Toronto. Many attractions were a quick walk from our hotel including the Harbourfront, theatres, Rogers Centre and Eaton Centre. This was a definite plus! The hotel lobby is very opulent and creates a great first impression. Bellboys and check in staff were friendly and efficient. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was clean and comfortable. The room is on the small side but cozy and had everything we needed - king bed, flat screen tv, mini bar, coffee maker, free wi-fi (if you are Presidents club member - which is free). The only issue with the room was there was a wet spot on the rug. We noticed it as soon as we arrived but assumed that housekeeping had cleaned a recent spill and didn't concern ourselves with it. The spot dried, but reappeared with a vengence on our last night. We also heard dripping water through the walls throughout our stay. We now think that the air conditioning was leaking under the carpet. We went for breakfast at Epic on our last day with mixed results. We arrived at the restaurant right around 10 a.m., and waiting for about 5 minutes for the hostess to acknowledge us. When she did she informed us the restaurant closed at 10 for breakfast, and only the lounge was available for breakfast with limited menu.
