She indicated the lounge was full and said our best bet was to go to the Library Bar where they also served breakfast. 10 seems early to end breakfast and that caught us off guard, however off the the Library Bar we went. When we got to the Library bar we were told it was closed and did not open until 10:30. Back to Epic and were greeted by a different hostess. We then noticed there were many empty tables in the lounge - they just needed to be cleared. The hostess agreed to clear a table for us and we were seated. Not sure why the first hostess did not offer to do the same. Our waitress seemed harried. As soon as she arrived at our table she was turning around to leave. There seemed to be more hostesses than waitresses. We felt that our presence was an inconvenience to the staff. The breakfast itself was tasty although a little pricey - standard for hotel restaurants. We wouldn't mind the price if the service was better. I would stay again at the Royal York when visitiingToronto if the price was right, but not sure I would return to Epic.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but with plenty of charm”
Reviews.Author: Irishstandards
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for years and live this hotel, it is a destination in itself! As someone said in a review you almost expect to see a kid in a bigwheel shouting "redrum redrum" as you step out if the old elevators into the creepy corridors! The lobby is breathtaking and the old world charm is evident everywhere! However that is also it's greatest flaw! The rooms are in dire need of modernisation! The wall paper is faded and peeling, the White paint us now cream and stained, the furniture is not really appropriate to the room and the bathrooms are just awful....however it is all clean! The rooms need serious brightening up also especially the rooms that don't receive any natural light from the tall buildings around it. However new flat screen Tvs and the recent introduction of wifi are welcome and the A/C is effective. Little thing are a pain though, my current room has no practical electrical sockets for convenient use... I couldn't even find anywhere to use the iron without having to push furniture and bed out of the way for the board and I had to plug out badly needed lights to charge my laptop! Overall however a great hotel with wonderful staff and bursting with a creepy yet lovely charm!

Reviews.Title: “Only flaw is the noise issue”
Reviews.Author: crazy_cat_sab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in July for a concert and was pretty pleased with our stay. We were lucky to have been able to check in early so we didn't have to lug our stuff with us through Toronto. Check-in staff was very pleasant and kept apologizing for the tardiness of the computer systems; one of the best check-ins we've encountered in a long time. The room was sufficient for our stay; 2 double beds, a comfy chair, a desk and chair, bathroom with shower and tub combo, tv, mini-bar and a HUGE walk-in closet on the 6th floor overlooking Front st. The beds and linens were very comfortable and we made use of the black out curtains. The only flaw of this hotel is the noise issue. As people walked by our room, we can hear them; as well as from adjoining rooms. It took us a while to fall asleep and we were woken up pretty early from the noise as well. Even though there was construction on the hotel exterior, we did not hear any noise from that. The concierge was fantastic as well as the luggage storage attendants. Checking out was a breeze; many options to choose from. There are some great little shops within the hotel that should be checked out. The Royal York is a beautiful hotel conveniently located within downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “We were disspointed”
Reviews.Author: caissy28
Reviews.Content: My husbant and I stayed there for 3 nights with my 3 years old daughter. We were at the 11th flool, and the room was very small for 3 people. On top of that, I've locked my self and my daughter in the bathroom for a few minutes, until my husband came back, because de door knob was not working... So we were unable to close the door completely. We found the room old, and not very clean. It was also noisy. Service was ok though. Construction was awful also. Parking is so expensive! And not including gratuities on top of that. We had to take the car 2 times, so it costs a lot...

Reviews.Title: “good, but not great, hotel experience in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: the_sulution
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this place given its history, opulent feel, and fabulous location in its proximity to everywhere we wanted to go in our weekend stay in Toronto. Instead I felt a great deal of frustration in our brief stay. We were reliant on using the elevator to street level from the lobby; it worked only for 1 day of our stay. This elevator was quite necessary for us as I was traveling with my spouse and 2 toddlers in a large double stroller. We were left having to carry this stroller up and down the stairs at every entrance to the hotel. Fortunately, other hotel guests were nearby to volunteer their assistance on many occasions. The elevators in the east side of the hotel were also frequently nonfunctional and eventually we ignored them completely. Every time we stepped into an elevator we were constantly feeling uneasy as to whether we would get stuck in between floors! (This was exacerbated by the fact that we encountered several other elevators/escalators were nonfunctional throughout the city.) I felt a bit claustrophobic in our room as it seemed like the furniture (2 double beds, lounge chair, et al) was oversized for the size of the room we were in. However, the beds themselves were fabulous as they were extremely comfortable and we all had restful nights of sleep. I was also disappointed that wireless internet was available only for an extra fee. I am used to staying at "lesser" hotels where this service is complimentary. Oh well. In the pool area, my toddlers enjoyed the wading pool and its fountains. The attendant on duty even brought out plastic water toys for them to play with. The heated pool was nice, but a tad over-chlorinated as my eyes started to burn after swimming laps for about 10 minutes. Also, don't look for a drinking fountain in any of the public areas; there aren't any. Overall, my experience at this hotel can be summed up by the title of my review.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy121
Reviews.Content: The location and convenience of the Royal York was perfect for an overnight stay in Toronto. The library bar was fun and relaxing and the perfect spot to unwind after a night out. The room was nice and comfortable. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and easy stay to see Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MikeAussie83
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights with wife and 6mth old daughter. Upgraded to suite which was great. Nice location in the middle of everything so a shortish walk to various sights (CN tower, hockey hall of fame). Service was great, except parking was difficult even with valet due to construction. Would stay again for a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: violet_femme
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled to Toronto last fall for his surprise birthday present: a ticket to the Chicago Bears game and a night at the Royal York. We were both amazed by the facilities; the hotel is has gorgeous decor, and incredibly comfortable beds and pillows. We felt like we were royalty in the huge bed we had, and the hallways and foyer were completely opulent. The drinks in the bar downstairs were a tad overpriced -- $35 plus tip for two mojitos -- but it was worth it for the experience, and an overzealous Bears fan send my boyfriend a drink on him for flagging down the server. It is a great hotel for a splurge, and I would recommend it to anyone based on its facilities and the proximity to nearly everything worth seeing in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DinkyandBoy
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a pleasant stay in the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto. We weren't sure what to expect as some of the reviews indicated that the hotel was outdated and tired. While this may be partly true and some updating could be done to the hotel - overall it is well maintained and excellently located. The lobby / bar area is very grand and beautiful. The only complaint or issue we encoutered is that having ordered room service, we called to inform them we were finished and left the tray outside. Our tray sat outside in the hallway for nearly 24 hours. There was other trays left in the hallways also which just doesn't give a very nice impression. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay and if we were to return Toronto would certainly consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful & elegant”
Reviews.Author: TripperAz
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a top notch in all ways. also located in the best area to get everywhere--even in winter & walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel in the heart of the financial district”
Reviews.Author: gambit76
Reviews.Content: Rooms need some updating but you can't beat the location for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Devlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 sons (ages 4 and 19 months) for one night on 13th June 2011, and we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. It has a perfect location directly opposite Union Station, and it is linked to the station and the underground PATH system. The hotel itself has several shops and a selection of restaurants. We stayed in room 17-141. There were 2 comfortable double beds, large flat screen TV, mini bar, safe, storage, and full bathroom. The room was not huge but was big enough. The service in the hotel is great. Check in is from 3pm but we arrived before 12 noon and our room was all ready for us. We didn't use any of the leisure facilities, but we would the next time. We travel to Canada quite often because we have family in the Toronto area, and we will definately stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central location”
Reviews.Author: Kiko15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very big, very nice lobby, full of Royal history, and it is very close to the CN Tower ( 10 min walking ). They have a very helpful online check in desk where you can print your boarding pass before leaving. The Concierge is very helpfull as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Neats1269
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a very nice hotel, rooms have 2 very comfortable double beds, bathroom is a little small (but how long do you really need to spend in there). I wouldn't recommend breakfast at 'Yorks', its very expensive for what you get, plus its chaos in there. The hotel is perfectly situated for the Station (directly opposite), CN tower, Rogers centre, plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. The only downfall that we noticed was the queues for the reception desk, they didn't appear to have enough staff on at the right times.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: rmh512
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to book a large group or you are part of a large group, beware! The Fairmont could not find rooms this week for guests with reservations (me and others) who were staying at the hotel in connection with a large conference at the nearby convention center. As late as 5pm, several people were still being told "come back by 9pm and we'll see if we have a room." The excuse - "a lot of people have delayed checking out." I leave it for you to be the judge on that one. I did get a room, by the way, at 9pm, and it wasn't worth the wait nor was the "parlor with a Pullman bed" they offered me at 5pm as an alternative. Add to that desk personnel who really could have cared less becaue it wasn't their fault - it's made for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms desperately need renovating”
Reviews.Author: rejoyceWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal York hotel in downtown Toronto. I was aware of its history as a grand old railroad hotel like the Greenbrier and that its now a Fairmont property, so I had high expectations. I was gretaly disappointed. The guest rooms are very dated and tiny. They desperately need renovating. To top it off, the hotel hoisted some kind of conference and allowed dozens of the conference attendees to stand at the entrances to the hotel and smoke. You had to walk through billowing clouds of smoke to get in and out of the building. Being asthmatic, this was a big problem for me. I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in an amazing hotel with rich history”
Reviews.Author: malkie76
Reviews.Content: First stop on my honeymoon was this fantastic hotel in Toronto, located in the centre of downtown. First impressions are a warm and welcoming lobby which is stunning and grand to view and a highlight of the hotel. We had a room with a view at the front of the hotel, although the view is now somewhat spoiled by the high-rises blocking out the bay! Room was exceptionally clean and easily large enough to accomodate the king-size bed, desk, chairs and all of our cases. Large bathroom with very nice amenities. The hotel is located immediately next to the Union Station providing transports links to all parts of Toronto. It's actually connected via underground walkways with much of the downtown area meaning you never have to head outside if the weather is unpleasant. Also connected via skywalk to the CN Tower and the Air Canada centre. There are a choice of places to eat and drink within the hotel, from a relaxed Irish style pub, to the more upmarket library bar and EPIC dining. Swimming pool, whirlpool and gym are also extremely clean and were not busy - plenty of robes and towels etc provided. Worth a visit is the mezanine level which has photos on the wall detailing the history of the hotel and famous people who have stayed over the years (including HRH on occasion!) Only slight issue is that the lobby isn't actually at ground level, and you need to climb up or down a few stairs (~10) to approach from any direction (I couldn't find a ramp anywhere). There were staff on every door willing to help if you need assistance with luggage. Final point (as others have mentioned too) - join their membership programme for free prior to arriving. This will entitle you to free internet access, and free gym wear (shoes, shorts etc) while you are there. Overall a fantastic experience

Reviews.Title: “Plan your visit”
Reviews.Author: ciscokid23
Reviews.Content: Went back to the Royal York this year after a less than spectacular visit last year. Why the return? Coming in to Toronto by train from Montreal on VIA Rail, there is nothing more convenient than this old Canadian Pacific Hotel now operated by Fairmont Hotels. It is located right across the street from Union Station and you can roll your luggage right across the street to the hotel using the connecting tunnel underground. Like all older hotels, the rooms vary enormously - from last year's tiny room and bathroom to this year's ample mini-suite with adjoining living room and large bathroom. Is it worth the gamble? I think so if you plan ahead and don't book the rock-bottom accomodations. In return, apart from a great room, you'll get a lobby that seems out of the old movie "Grand Hotel", a mezzanine with comfortable easy chairs and interesting historical photographs, a lobby bar full of character if slightly noisy with American tourists, and the Epic restaurant and bar which you will certainly prefer to the Benihana's in the lower floor. The hotel is centrally located with the Distillery District, the St. Lawrence Market, the CN Tower, the Eaton Center, the Four Seasons Opera Hall, and the West End theater district with the Second City Comedy Club all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Old and broken”
Reviews.Author: Emily080
Reviews.Content: We stayed here years ago and enjoyed it. So I was shocked to find how run down the Fairmont RY has become. Within minutes of arriving, I called the Front Desk and asked if we could be moved into another room. Unfortunately, I was told that all Deluxe rooms with 2 dble beds were fully booked. Our room was spacious, with two separate baths, two closets, sitting area with pull-out couch, and two tall windows. However, the carpet was dirty, the granite counter in one of the bathroom was chipped, there was a dead moth at the corner of the window, lamp on the desk did not work, noisy a/c , sound of water behind the wall, couch was stained and worn out, broken radio alarm clock (has sound but couldn't move up the hours to set time), faucet splashed water all over my clothes, hairs on the tub, and the room was very dusty, with the radio alarm clock especially nasty. Manager of guest services reacted quickly. Our room was dusted when we came back from dinner, and an Air Ionizer/Purifier was put in our room (I have asthma). We truly appreciated the effort Management made to make our stay more comfortable. To be fair to the Housekeeping team, we were there on a particularly busy weekend (June 10 -12). However, the dirt on the Radio Alarm Clock seems to have been there for a long long time. The lobby was constantly filled with people but check-in was fast and staff friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the breakfast and dinners we had inside the hotel - Epic and Benihanna. It's unlikely that we would return in the future due to the following reasons: paper-thin door that makes it impossible for us not to hear noises from the hallway; beds that are too soft; the numerous stairs that I have to climb or go down to reach street level no matter what entrance we used; and the analogue TV signal in full screen format displayed in a widescreen flat panel TV (all faces are stretched and screen mode cannot be adjusted). We did not enjoy the bed, the shower, and the TV. What else would one do inside a hotel room? Room amenities were average and nothing to be excited about. This Fairmont Royal York is a hotel with 4 stars pricing but 2 stars furnishing and amenities in our room, which is classified as Deluxe. I feel sorry for the Manaagement. It must have been a constant struggle for them. BTW, while my daughter and I struggled with our luggages and shopping bags, none of the bell boy and doorman standing around offered to help us. A sign on the door even told us to use the revolving door instead. How does people with wheel chair gets around Fairmont Royal York?

Reviews.Title: “Right where I wanted to be!”
Reviews.Author: Klumbus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont on somebody else's dime, but that does not affect my opinion: I loved it. For me, the opportunity to stay in such a historic building was an unexpected bonus of my trip to Toronto. And the location is great. I had a suite, so I certainly can't complain about not having enough room. Plus I was on a corner of the building, so I had two different views. The room was clean, the furniture and bed were comfortable, and the appliances worked the way they were supposed to. The staff was very helpful and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “To sleep - go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Marlynou
Reviews.Content: When I entered the room, I wanted to go back to the front desk and asked to be changed since it smelled cigarette smoke, the carpet was stained and around the bathtub it was Yerk.......But I was very busy during that business trip and I decide to let go. The first night I was able to sleep but the second night after a very long day, I went to bed at 10:15 pm. to be awakened at 10:30 p.m. with very strange noise coming from the room next door. After 15 minutes I got up and went to inquire what was going on. It was the maid that was cleaning the room. I asked if she could be a little quiet. She continued to make noise and start yelling accross the hall to another maid. I went again to ask for a little quietness. 15 minutes later I called royal service that was supposed to send the supervisor. It didn't help and I don't know if somebody came but the noise continued and stopped only around 12h15. So much for a good night sleep in a "Fairmont Hotel'. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “dated but still grand”
Reviews.Author: mandie1277
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before business meeting.Check in was fast and efficient.Room was small but comfortable.Was a little noisy, the walls are thin. Parking was expensive. Did not have breakfast. Ate at Epic restaurant at the hotel was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Best service”
Reviews.Author: Bhardas
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming Bell staff was eager and efficient The hotel is amazing over all

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls...”
Reviews.Author: d3e
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month for one night as we went to a concert across the street at the ACC. Lucked out by booked the FRY on Expedia.ca for $118..figured we might as well stay there. Arrived at 6pm to be told that our room wasn't ready. Yup...6pm on a Sat, concert starts at 7pm. Was given keys to the spa locker room to get ready for the concert & told that someone would call us when in fact our room would be ready. When we got up to the spa...there was about 6 other girls stating the same thing. Luckily after about 20 mins our room was ready. The room itself was nice. A little outdated but thats part of the charm.. Beds were comfy & the washroom was decent. My only complaint was how thin the walls were. That, and we had the trashiest people staying in the next room. Who screams profanities at 3am ? Losers. Called front desk & got them kicked out after security being sent up twice. Then woke up at 7am to blaring music from a marathon being held outside. Now I know why we paid so little... Overall..ok stay for the location. But I wont be returning.

Reviews.Title: “parking scam”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Gl0be_Tr0tter
Reviews.Content: I checked the hotel website before booking and it stated "Self-parking: free of charge Valet parking (summer only): $15/night, with in-and-out privileges". It did sound a little too good to be true for downtown Toronto, but I thought if thats what the website said, then the matter didn't require any further investigation. When we checked in, the unfriendly/unhelpful front desk clerk told us there was no self-parking and valet was CAD$42 per night. Considering we were paying CAD$110 per night for the actual room, CAD$42 per night for parking seemed a bit steep. When I asked her about the website, she said that the website was referring to a different Fairmont, the the Toronto property. Apparently there is a hidden link on the website that users are supposed to click to see the actual parking rates. She half-heartedly suggested that we could park the car somewhere else for cheaper, but she was not suggest any specific garages or locations. The hotel itself was in an okay location. There was construction outside (May 2011) so we had to drive around the block (in Toronto traffic) to get to the hotel. The room was a little outdated and cramped but clean. Our wardrobe door was broken and the ironing board needed replacing. The curtains wouldn't close completely and we were looking directly into an office building, so the workers next door would have gotten an eye full.

Reviews.Title: “The old lady is in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal York for business and was very excited to stay in one of the old luxury hotels in Canada. Unfortunately, old needs to be a big part of their name. the good: The outside, the lobby, the hallways and elevators still speak of grandeur, the ballrooms and the library bar, you feel transported back to the old glory days. The staff is simply fantastic, quick and good housecleaning, reception, concierge, belldesk every body is very nice and professional. The bad:The rooms are obviously the same size as 100 years ago, which means small. The wallpaper is old and dirty, so is the carpet and the bathrom. The beds are not to be slept in, maybe time to change them, and the airconditioning has the noiselevel of a Porsche reving its engine. I could not sleep for two nights and I am a very sound sleeper. So take the tour, look at it but until they renovate it and bring it a bit into 2000, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JoF-W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights as part of a Thomas Cook Tour, myself and my partner had a double room and my mother in law was next door on her own. It was a real slice of old school - if you like modern hotels then this is not for you. BUT if you like to touch the past then you'll love this place. The rooms were great, the service was superb - yes some of the corridors felt they were out of the shining but I'd go back in a heartbeat. Make sure you join the Presidents Club before you go so you can access the wifi for free. Also take a visit to the library bar as it is something special and their caesar is stunning. We also had the breakfast buffet one morning in the York Deli - it was fabulous and they were excellent at providing gluten free options. It was a really special start to our trip to Canada.

Reviews.Title: “An Oldie but a Goodie”
Reviews.Author: researchnerd
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying 2 nights at the Fairmont Royal York in May 2011. The location of the hotel is great, directly across from Union Station in the heart of Toronto, close to the stadiums, restaurants and bars. We took advantage of their valet parking, came out to $42 I believe, very typical for hotels in Toronto. I do have to say that the lobby is very grand and oozes history, the marble staircases and ornate wood ceiling add to the charm of the Royal York. After checking in we headed up to our room on the 12th Gold Floor, I would highly recommend upgrading to this floor. You have access to the Gold Floor Lounge where we had some great breakfasts in the morning and cocktails and hors dâ€™oeurves in the evening. A concierge was also available in the lounge and they were very helpful in booking some last-minute dinner reservations. I was a bit disappointed in the room, nothing too special about it. Our view was very lackluster; we looked out to a different wing of the hotel. The room was quite small and seemed very cramped, there was just enough room to navigate around all the furniture, wish it could have been a bit larger. But the beds were very comfortable so thatâ€™s what really matters. We did not eat at any of the restaurants, but stopped in for a few drinks at the Library Bar in the lobby. Our waiter and the bartender were very knowledgeable when it comes to drinks and were a pleasure to talk to. I would recommend staying at the Royal York if you are a traveler that enjoys the finer things and great service, my only gripe with the hotel was the size of the rooms, so if space is what you need I would either upgrade to a larger room or perhaps find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: SLG1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, and the location was perfect. Had tickets to baseball game, and only a few blocks away was great. Hotel staff was very helpful in all aspects of stay. Concierge was particularly great, and arranged great seats for theatre. City was very easy to get around from hotel location. Room was very nice, small, but very comfortable. Really enjoyed out stay at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Jay Ballgame Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SueBee62
Reviews.Content: The stay at the Royal York was wonderful. It was so conveniently close to the ball park and to loads of good restaurants. A great place to stay if you are visiting Toronto downtown. Parking is right at the Hotel so you can park and do all your sightseeing by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cbrunet_11
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations before visiting the Royal York hotel and when I entered the lobby to check-in, I was very impressed with the "grand" feeling of the place. Check-in staff were extremely friendly and helpful and I felt like I was about to have a very luxurious experience, which I definitely am not accustomed to. After staying for two night at the hotel however, I can definitely say that the hotel did not live up to expectations and I have actually stayed in 3-star hotels that were much nicer. The hotel room was very small, the wallpaper was peeling and stained, a towel rack had been removed from the bathroom wall and the holes left behind were not covered up, the shower had no water pressure, and one of the cleaning staff broke a glass in our room and left the shards on the counter. Definitely not what I expected of a hotel with Fairmont's reputation. When you see the room rates at the Royal York, know that you are paying for the hotel's outer appearance, the grandeur of the lobby, and the name, "Fairmont".

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, great location, costly parking !!”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 3 days in early May. Having stayed here before, I had a pretty good idea what to expect. The parking is of course outrageous being in downtown Toronto, with my Sunday through Wednesday parking costing more then $140.00. (for underground self serve parking connected to hotel). The hotel is clean, luxiourious and well located for downtown Toronto events. The subway is right next door, while the CN tower, Rogers Centre, Yonge Street and other attractions are all within walking distance. Eating or drinking here is unfortunately very expensive, although a pub down below the hotel does offer a casual, comfortable experience with reasonably priced beverages. The hotel is also connected to a number of food courts, which allows you to venture nearby for a bite to eat, without having to go outside. We also had a banquet at the Royal York and the ballroom was simply stunning, the food delicious and the staff friendly and attentive. I enjoyed my room, finding it ample, clean and comfortable. Overall a good experience, particularly if you're looking to impress the little lady and seek a hotel with history, class and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Motel Quality Hotel Price$$$”
Reviews.Author: Chantal0515
Reviews.Content: We Live in Ottawa and chose the Fairmont because in Ottawa they have a very good reputation (expensive, good quality, luxury...) so we were very very excited to go to the Fairmont in Toronto. At first glance the Lobby is sooo beautiful very luxurious. We couldn't wait to see the hotel room but were very very disappointed when we opened the door. We ended up on the 2nd floor me and my boyfriend I got a king-size bed or maybe it was a queen because it looked very small. The room was tiny, the decor soo ugly it look like a cheap motel, and I understand it suppose to be the classic luxury look but this was soo ugly nothing luxurious about it. The washroom is where we got very turned off , the bath tub was rusty it was just gross! So then we thought maybe it was just our luck we got an ugly small room near the elevators but we had travelled with my sis and cousin so we checked out t heir room which was a 2 bed room. They were on the same floor. They had the same situation tiny tiny ugly room and gross bathtub! On the plus side : unlike other reviews our room did not stink like smoke. Location is great if you are attending an air canada event , no need to go outside , there are tunnels that lead to the air canada center from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Royal York worked great for us!”
Reviews.Author: erielassie
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, I decided to take a chance because we like old historic hotels. Wow, am I glad I took a chance. We arrived very early in the AM by Megabus and made our way to the Hotel. We checked our bag until check-in, and went on about our day. When we returned to check in, we got to realize the beauty and grandeur of this classic hotel. The only thing better than the ambiance was the staff. Everyone we encountered was professional and very helpful and courteous. We were in the East wing on the 8th floor and our room was very nicely decorated, very clean (non- smoking), and allowing for the age of the hotel, quite comfortable in size (one queen bed). The bed was sooooooo comfortable! I used the whirlpool and pool and that area was very nice and clean. The convenience of being on the PATH and so close to the TTC made our travels about the city even easier. We will definitely stay at the Royal York again. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable And Great Location”
Reviews.Author: John5259
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent in Brisbane and have stayed in 236 Hotels in 101 Cities in 38 Countries. So I feel I am in the position to know the difference between an average, good, or excellent hotel. In one statement, I would rate this a very good hotel, but not achieving excellence. For us, the only excellent thing is its location. The Toronto Airport Express Bus service drops you right off at the front door, and as we had a train to catch a few days later to Ottawa, being right accross the road from the main railway station. Excellent! Upon check-in, even though we had their written confirmation for a Deluxe Smoking King Bedded Room, they did not have one available. They only had Twin Bedded Deluxe Smoking rooms available, which we accepted. The two beds in the room were Double Beds, so that wasn't so bad. When we arrived into the room, no ashtrays! We phoned the Front desk requesting an ash tray, which turned up about two hours later. The room was huge. Reading previous reviews, it sounds like the "Fairmont Rooms" are quite small, so opt for a "Deluxe. Apparently they are twice the size. The Flat screen TV needed to be bigger, bacause the room was so big! So, despite the Twin Beds, a very comfortable room, with very comfortable bed. The bathroom was quite small, but well appointed, and in a good state of repair. Also very clean. Housekeeping staff were friendly, and did a very good job. The room was always kept spotless. The only meal we ate in the hotel was Room Service on our first night, having just completed an eighteen hour flight from Australia. The service was quick, about 20 minutes, the food was hot, of good quality, and with ample servings. So top marks for Room Service delivery. So all in all we had an enjoyable and comfortable stay. By today's standards I don't think it quite measures up to Five Star, I would describe it as a very good Four Star property.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: granttheron
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, we arrived late. The flights got in at about midnight, which meant we arrived at the front desk at about 1AM. Lucky us, there was someone there. Unlucky us that they had "no more non-smoking rooms"! Considering we had a late check in confirmed, this was a bit of a shock. After 10 minutes of checking if there were other rooms, I finally got a non-smoking room - right next to the elevator that literally would have made it impossible to sleep. So I bit the bullet expecting a decent smoking room. Alas, I was disappointed. I have pics attached, blurry as I am tired, but you judge for yourself: 1. It REALLY smells of smoke - expected I guess, but I wanted a non-smoking room to begin with 2. I felt like I had checked into a hotel in the Eastern block 10 years ago. Drab, outdated decor with the quality past it's prime. Sagging bed skirts, cigarette burns on the floor, strands of cleaning cloth on the door handle, stains on the chairs. I would be ashamed to call this my hotel 3. Considering the smell, I tried to open the window. Window breaks. So I call downstairs (it's now 2AM). Guy comes to fix it, mumbles that it is not broken, fixes it and then starts giving me uphill about the fact that there is nothing wrong with the window like I am some kind of moron. That was pretty much my limit. This guy should be fixing things when the guests are not in the room. And I expect that had I wrangled with it more, it probably would have worked, but I kind of expect the window to work first time. Again, pics attached, so you judge The front desk were apologetic and offered food vouchers, but I can pretty much be sure that besides a coffee in the AM, I will not be eating here. If the rooms cannot be kept in shape, I shudder to think what the kitchen looks like. All things said and done, unless you EA books this because of company policy, do NOT stay here. Sorry Fairmont Royal York - this was a really poor show.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for a Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SiddG
Reviews.Content: As a surprise weekend I booked the Fairmont Maharaja Package. At first the package felt expensive for 1 night but our experience was one to remember. FYI - we live in Toronto and growing up here we always wanted to try out Fairmont!! This hotel was so perfect we did not even leave the hotel!! Must do at the hotel; - Have dinner at Benihana's (lower level of the hotel) - After dinner have a few drinks at the Library bar (at reception level) - Have breakfast at EPIC (at reception level) - Use the gym (great equipment) Best things about the hotel; - Location location location - Service at the reception, gym and restaurants (our favorite was the library bar) - Library bar - Gym - The view Rooms are a little dated but have character!! Parking is very expensive. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms stink, literally”
Reviews.Author: longjohnsilver19
Reviews.Content: Rooms have strong odor of cigarette smoke (at least the 5th floor does), several of my co workers in different areas said the same thing, prices are outrageous for food and drink, $6 for a bottle of water is insanity, you will pay big bucks for internet unless you are a Presidents club member, building is beautiful and shopping underground is nice. The location is great for being downtown and you can walk anywhere, just up the street from the Hockey hall of fame. Ive had much better rooms at Best Western. Ramada etc, sorry Royal York, but you could have done better, the smoke smell bothered me alot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reliable Old Warhorse”
Reviews.Author: spicycaesar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Royal York whenever in Toronto for over 15 years. Its location can't be beat for meetings downtown, sporting events at the AC Centre, etc. It is a large hotel but soemhow manages to still deliver a high degree of personal service. Some smaller rooms are a bit loud (poor sound insulation especially with interconnecting doors) but the food and atmosphere are great. It also has a decent gym and pool. Toronto has many wanyabe new downtown hotels (like the new Ritz Carlton) which are souless and have a funny pretentiousness which pervades Toronto. The Royal York has none of the above. It is simply a very comfortable, familier place which rewards travellers with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Royal York Never Fails”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were both in Toronto on business recently and stayed at this grand hotel once again. As always the staff were excellent. The management looked after us exceptionally well (with a complimentary upgrade to a suite). The Fairmont Fit programme proivided us with work out gear so we didn't have to pack our own. This hotel is simply exceptional and should be far more highly rated than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Overall still a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: ottawatraveler_11
Reviews.Content: I have seen reviews here remarking about the need for refurbishment. While I do agree that the rooms are in need of updating, the hotel still has excellent staff, above average cuisine, and high quality rooms, even if a bit more shabby than chic these days. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Royal York but don't stay on a Sunday”
Reviews.Author: argyll66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Royal York many times and brought friends with me for a night in the city and a chance to watch an afternoon Blue Jays game followed by drinks in my favorite Library Bar. In fact we had planned to have a starter drink in the quaint Station Bar, then move to the Library Bar, go out for dinner and finish off the night in the pub downstairs. Great plan except that all 3 bars were closed as it was Sunday, leaving us with the Epic Lounge as the only option which was not the style of bar we were looking for. Very disappointed and completely unacceptable to have a major hotel in a major city close 75% of its facilities just because it is a Sunday. At the very least these closures should be advised at time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Outdated”
Reviews.Author: nbwaterfront
Reviews.Content: Some people are calling this hotel "elegant", but in the end its just another word for old and outdated. For the price, you can get by with something much nicer, as rooms are outdated, small and musty. Lobby and restaurants are clean, but again for the price, this place is simply getting by on its repuation from 50 years ago. The rooms need a major revamp to compete with anything built in the last 25 years. However, if you like paying $200 for a small room with outdatd wallpaper, a musty smell, dirty carpets and banged up furniture,fill your boots. I think my room had a 27 inch TV that I used to own in 1995!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bestmom15
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Royal York was a huge let-down. First let me say that the staff are very friendly and helpful. However, my room was shabby. The sofa seemed to be from 1940. The bathroom was old. Apparently, there were attempts to modernize the bathroom by placing a new 'skin' over an old tub. Unfortunately, the skin was cracked all the way around the back of the tub, creating perfect breeding grounds for bacteria. On the second night of my stay, my key wouldn't work. The front desk told me someone was on the way to help. After half an hour, I went to the desk myself. Also, the hallway smelled moldy and I had to take allergy pills for the duration of my stay. The final insult is that a $100 a night deposit was placed on my credit card. I was not informed that there would be a deposit required if paying with a credit card. Two days after checking out, my deposit has not been returned. There are many, many nicer, cleaner and more affordable rooms available in the same vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby, tatty rooms and NO WIFI.”
Reviews.Author: TootingMike
Reviews.Content: Despite their claims the wifi does not work. I have stayed in 4 different rooms in my last 2 visits and only one of them had any reception. They don't show any desire to sort this out. Stay at the Intercontinental on Front Street instead. A much nice hotel which has rooms that have at least been redecorated in the last 50 years. Poor.

Reviews.Title: “Neglected, Out of Date Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveler8601
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel. As for the room, it was disgusting! It was in serious need of an update, the wallpaper was falling off the walls, the chair provided was dirty and very uncomfortable, and only had a small tube television. The wardrobe was so old, took up half the room and was unusable, the drawers were full of splinters and I couldnâ€™t unpack any of my clothing in there. The bathroom was falling apart, parts of the ceiling were crumbling off, the bathtub drain didnâ€™t work, and there was no fan. Service was hit or miss, the bellboy was very rude and wouldnâ€™t leave our room, and we were in a hurry and had to get to the convention. We were told the hotel was at capacity all week so we couldnâ€™t change rooms. The common areas (lobby, fitness center ect.) were very nice and well kept. Iâ€™ve been to much nicer hotels in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Awesoome Location”
Reviews.Author: Sungirlxxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Location great if going to ACC. Booked King, Harbourview. Decor very traditional , but lovely. Lobby fantastic. Bathroom small but well appointed. No complaints will stay here again. Check-in efficient

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Rossco10
Reviews.Content: we were excited about staying at this hotel. Obviously the more you pay the better the accomodation. Room was small, batroom was tiny and infact youhad to leave the bathroom to dry yourself. No safe which was important to us. Room was not clean and dust build up behind the furniture. Could not use wardrobe as doors would not slide due to rusting in the tracks. Conceirge was always very busy and took anywhere between 20 minutes to seek service. In the lift foyers there were always used glasses on the tables and food trays remained in the corridors for long periods. As isaid you get what you pay for but this hotel is in serious need of renovation. It is very much overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, great location, big, almost too big.”
Reviews.Author: onobed
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is an elegant hotel. It has all of the grandeur one would expect from a Fairmont. It as centrally located and the service was good with one exception which is why I rated it three stars (I had a tight time frame in which to recieve a package. The staff said it was on its way, but it took over 30 minutes when it should have taken 5. For my taste the hotel was too big: there are at least 50 rooms on a floor. If you have a room nowhere near the elevator you need to add extra time to accomodate. In the end, you can't beat the location. It is right in the heart of Toronto. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: YVR2011
Reviews.Content: Great service but rooms are becoming a bit tired, I had a suite at 269.00 per night and was disappointed with tattered furniture and the dead pigeon that I noticed on the gravel roof that my room looked onto. I always stay at the York when it is available and will continue to support it. But renovations would be nice!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Toronto frimount royal york limo car service”
Reviews.Author: TonyK93
Reviews.Content: we are looking for a Town car limo there is Black town car waiting door man saying no no you can get that car that not our car this kind of last minute deal then call limo Town car same driver from airport limo Canada pick us up nice car same time staff front deck not help full same thing happen at four season york ville keep it up guys Tony from Oakville

Reviews.Title: “I will never recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blondiegreen7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the FRY for three nights while we filmed our episode of Dragons' Den. When I booked, I originally did two nights, and then had to book another night when our flight left a day later. First of all, we were booked into a handicapped room, which is fine, but it was so tiny, we could barely squeeze around the furniture. Then, I wanted to soak in the tub, but the water was ice cold and there was no water pressure. After calling the plumber, they just decided to give us a different room. This room was ok, though a little worn, like other people have mentioned. They did send up a complimentary bottle of champagne, which was nice, but not appropriate, since I was 6mos pregnant. We wanted to use the internet to watch movies and send emails, but they were going to charge us $20 or something. Seriously? Every other hotel has free WiFi. Uurgh. The next morning, they did not even clean our room. Nothing was touched. Definitely not what was expected when it's an expensive hotel. That evening, we were locked out of our room, and they said it was b/c of booking the last night separate from the others. My husband phoned the front desk, but they told him to come down to fix his key, so he did. Then they said that I had to fix the key b/c I was the one who had booked the rooms. Meanwhile, I was so exhausted from the day, and I could hardly move my 6mos pregnant butt. I think I was crying by the time I got there. My husband and I were NOT impressed with the hotel. We thought they might've given us a free night b/c of all the hassles, but nope. Won't stay there again, and won't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Aged”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the Fairmont Hotel chains, but this one needs to be renovated. It's really showing its age. I booked a regular room with a king sized bed and the space felt a little cramped. The toilet looked old and the wallpaper was starting to peel off a bit. Besides the fact that this hotel is very old, the service is still attentive and strong as always. This is a great location and was right in the Financial district of Toronto which was convenient for my Toronto visit for work. Fairmont Royal York has a business center which costs $5.50 for internet usage. I kind of hoped it was free, so I didn't get a chance to use it. There's also a Shoppers Drug Mart connected downstairs in the underground if you need to buy any toiletries and etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: drummerhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Royal York on business. It was my first time at this hotel. Great customer service throughout the stay. It is the classic hotel that was built in the late 1920's and is a Canadian landmark. A true 4 star hotel! Only complaint is that the walls are a tad thin - heard every cough from the guy in the next room. Would, however, stay there again. Just be sure you get a good rate!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: spitfire28
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the FRY quite awhile ago, it is an older hotel but that is part of the charm. I didnt particularly enjoy the view it was looking out over the break inbetween one side to the other and actually had a beer bottle on the ground also construction onlooking. While the room was small that was not the problem i found some of the small touches could have been better it was cocked properly around the sink etc. My manin problem was that it was dirty, while lying in the tube i could see the floors needed a good washing, the coffee pot was broken and i actually burned myself. As for the staff the check in gentleman was nice enough and polite but the rest of the staff not so much when we asked for a map at the consierge we were given one but that was it, no can we help you find something, this is where we are on the map or any nicieties at all. When i asked our housekeeper for something on our last day they asked when we were checking out ( I had asked for a later check out). I did however love the old feel for the hotel and we went on the second floor and looked at the pictures I had so many questions and did finally ask someone which was an effort as no one seemed interested in conversation with guest. I mentioned it would be a wonderful addition to the hotel if they had someone do tours of the hotel with history of it, former performers, show rooms and even the scary stuff that all hotels have, a missed opportunity for the hotel. IN any case I might stay again but we were on a prepaid price and I wasnt given my points for the hotel , I hadnt realized this until just before i left for our trip so I might not come back there. Another good thing is that it is close to everythign and you can walk everywhere which is a plus. OH and one last thing it was noisy, we heard people coming and going at every time of day including 3 in the morning and I even heard some one cough in the next room and the staff was loud when conversing in the hall. The doors are heavy so we always heard them shut.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Old world luxury!”
Reviews.Author: w0rshipthesun
Reviews.Content: Service was Amazing! From the front desk staff to the door man who assisted us with our luggage. We upgraded our room to the "signature suite" as we knew that the regular rooms were a little small. Wow! It was well worth it! The suite had 2 bathrooms and 2 Rooms one with a sitting area and dinning room table. Location was awesome right across from union with underground connection so you don't have to go outside in the cold winter. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: reemaz
Reviews.Content: Went with family and were upgraded because of fairmont loyalty membership and availability-very pleasant surprise. Closeby to downtown attractions and very centrally located in heart of city. Historical significance and charm of hotel was not lost on us and though it shows this is not a brand new hotel, we appreciated the antiquities and history described in hotel pictures. Well-trained staff, clean hotel. Amazing beds and tvs and phenominal selection of Fairmont teas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Luxury”
Reviews.Author: merlin888
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is old world luxury. Grand lobby, impeccable service and fantastic lounges. It is a great base to do all sorts of sight-seeing in downtown Toronto you can walk to or take public transportation. Great care is taken to make sure your stay is comfortable from valet parking, reception and room service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation in Canada”
Reviews.Author: RAJIV_NAHAR
Reviews.Content: We were on family vacation to Canada and stayed at Fairmont Hotel during our stop over in Toronto. It's and excellent property right in the heart of Toronto business district next Main Central Train station overlooking CN Tower. Lot of good places to visit just walking distance i.e. Beach & Promenade, Rogers Stadium, Shopping Centres etc. Though guestrooms must around 30years old but holds its value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies, don't bring too many shoes”
Reviews.Author: Bully_Wench
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost one week during a conference. The hotel is beautiful, especially the lobby with it's detailed ceiling and old style charm. Check-in and check-out were a breeze and the staff were both very helpful and friendly. Although we were too busy to enjoy the plethora of amenities, we did enjoy the restaurant (breakfast and dinner) and the food was delicious and the service excellent! We also had a drink at a beautiful bar that was reminiscent of a classy library. We loved getting a quick latte at the Starbuck's counter in the lobby before heading out bright and early. The room was very comfortable: I was sharing with a colleague so we had a standard room with 2 beds. I agree with previous reviews stating that the bathroom is on the small side, especially if you're sharing a room. We were surprised at the size of the closet! It was almost non-existent and did not have enough room for our shoes. I would definitely recommend this hotel: service was excellent, location was ideal, rooms were comfortable and the food was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “The Royals would not be amused”
Reviews.Author: JVC-YYC
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Fairmont Hotels I expected the same quality and service that made this company grand. What you can expect is decor of old grace and elegance or outdated, musty screaming for an extreme makeover. Please do not rate your Fairmont experience by this unRoyal experience. I recently spent 4 nights at the York, selected for it's location and proximity to our offices and the Air Canada Centre. My commute was plesantly connected via the underground network which did not expose me to the winter elements. It was the internal elements of my room that shocked me. I paid extra to have a view and was upgraded to a king bed room. I could not change my mind in this room and the view consisted of the train tracks/barns with an inch of lake view between the highrises. The bathroom was extremely small which given the age of the hotel I was willing to overlook. However when I looked for an electrical outlet to charge my electronics, was shocked to see a sea of wires to an outlet with the cover plate laying on the floor.....not in one location but two. You've all seen the "fire waiting to happen" photos of overloaded circuits. I also could not help but notice the very dated electronics in the room.....circa 1980. I know that because I had the same alarm clock in my first apartment. I can accept planned obsolence, not what I expected for the reputation of the Fairmont brand. I contacted the front desk for the first time to question the increased fee for the view and report the concern for the missing face plates and fire hazard. I sensed I was not the first to complain as the upgraded fee was promptly removed from my bill. A short time later I discoverd the television did not work, and selecting the TV channels was an onerous task to navigate, in light of the remote that had to be pressed repeatedly to make one selection (imagine pressing the same button 5 - 8 times before working). I was surprised to learn the WIFI was not completmentary; surprised I could not plug in my laptop and use it on bed because the one spare outlet would not reach; surprised I could not get my air card to work in the room. This prompted a second call to the front desk requested tech assistance and an extension chord. The tech arrived and was unable to resovle the problem and ultimately I was provided free WIFI for my stay. The extension cord received was exactly that...the old school (in keeping with the 80's theme) brown cord vs a power bar. Again, you've all seen those photos of overloaded circuits. I was also advised the TV cable provider was down in the downtown core.....and later learned colleagues in neighboring hotels all had access thorugh the same cable provider. I also reported a chair in the room that had a dangerous gap in the wood joint connecting the seat to the arm....another accident waiting to happen. I was not amused that none of the reported issues were resolved in my 4 day stay. I was also not amused in hearing my neighbours in the next room, flushings left, right up and down from me. I was provided a cheese tray and a complimentary one night stay at the York. I challenged this as I had no plans to return to Toronto and the York would definitely not be my home away from home. Perhaps this explains why William and Kate will not be visiting TO on their Canadian visit.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, comfortable, and classy”
Reviews.Author: lost_and_happy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for our belated Valentine's Day weekend getaway. The location of the hotel offered front door drop-off & pick-up for Toronto's Airport Express bus and drop-off only for Greyhound bus. Our room offered a queen-sized bed in a clean, quiet, comfortable setting. The view on the 11th floor of the CN Tower is spectacular, especially at sunset :). If you can, ask for Room 103, 11th floor. The hotel staff were friendly and knowlegeable. Kudos to cleaning staff for their attention to detail. We will always remember our times at the Fairmont Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: stephietoronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business in January. Tip: Join the fairmont's president club to get free internet access. Great location - it's part of the underground PATH network which means you can walk around without being outside - it connects you to Union Station, AirCanada Centre, and all the way up to Eatons Centre (shopping mall). Rooms - small but you have to keep in mind this is an older hotel. Walls are on the thin side, again, because it's an older hotel it's somewhat expected. I had no problems with our room. It was kept clean. It's a huge complex, the first few times going back to my room I had to check the signs, and the corridors are long. Food - we had catered food and I was overall pleased with the quality, although everyone had differing opinions. Health facilities - used the swimming pool, decent enough for a few laps. Water temp on the colder side. I would recommend for its location perhaps but thinking you would get better value for your money elsewhere that's also downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but elegant feel”
Reviews.Author: lulu1046
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night of our wedding before leaving for our honeymoon the next day. This was our hotel of choice for our guests - we got a great discount rate for them & everyone said how much they enjoyed it (we had a lot of family/friends from out of province). We had never stayed at this hotel prior to our wedding but were impressed. The rooms are really small but the hotel has a unique, romantic and old charm to it. The service was great, too. We stayed in a suite which was nice & more spacious than the regular rooms from what I saw of guest's pictures. I would recommend this hotel if it were cheaper or comparable to other Toronto hotels - I do not know the normal going rate but we stayed for about $130 and I was very happy with it at that price!

Reviews.Title: “Too Old....”
Reviews.Author: 007_Wannabe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a few Fairmont locations (San Jose, Seattle, etc.). I expected the same service level, exquisite rooms, etc. This place (Toronto - Royal York) is useless. I usually stay at the Sheraton a few blocks away but decided to try the Fairmont. I guess my expectations were just too high. The rooms are small, old, un-kept, and sadly, the customer service is horrendous. I will stay at the Fairmont again, just not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business travel”
Reviews.Author: SleeplessinToron2
Reviews.Content: I have had to stay here twice for business and each time have been put in an outdated room, that's noisy overlooking the air intake fans. I phoned three times in advance of this trip to ask for an updated room in a quiet location, and was assured it was noted. I even called en route from the airport to say I would be checking in later and to confirm my request for an updated room in a quiet location, to which I was assured would not be a problem. But sure enough, I checked in and was told there were no other rooms available in a rather rude manner. I'm not expecting perfection, but I'm on business and would like a decent night's sleep and some caring customer service. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is - a good business location.”
Reviews.Author: Chapul
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a Toronto monument (literally and figuratively). Its strongest asset is its location: it interconnects underground to the subway system, to suburban trains, and through a labyrinth of poorly marked tunnels to major office buildings and shops in the financial district. In the middle of winter this is a distinct advantage. By night, the location loses some of the appeal. Independent restaurants are further away, and the streets are emptied and, although safe they are lifeless. I wouldn't opt to stay here as a tourist to the city. The good business location doesn't translate easily to a good destination for tourists. The hotel is vast, and although the public rooms are grand, in an Edwardian sense, the room I stayed in during my 6-day stay was an illustration in some of the hotel's weaknesses. It is true that not all rooms have been recently redecorated. Other reviewers have pointed out that the furniture sometimes is chipped - but the beds are very comfortable and on a business visit some things matter less and the rooms are more than adequate - if a bit small on closet space. Nevertheless - in January - my corner room was surprisingly draughty, and there is no bathroom ventilation and mirrors are fogged easily. Otherwise, why are we still paying for wi-fi hook-up in 2011? At nearly $20 including tax, this is excessive and unnecessary. The gym is small, slightly awkward, but decent. Massages are just short of $100/60 minutes. The business centre was cheerful and helpful with getting a package to DHL just before closing. I can't say that I felt welcome at the concierge's desk. Continental breakfast (in room) is $22. Go downstairs to one of the many coffee shops in the commercial walkways beneath the hotel and save $18.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever....”
Reviews.Author: CURB4U
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days, It was the best stay ever... The 12th floor Gold is the only way to go.... The staff was wonderful, especially Andrew, Paul and Cam...The food was terrific and the rooms were just as nice!! There really wasn't anything that went wrong, and believe me I'm SUPER PICKY !! We're so glad that we meet some new friends along the way. We're planning on coming back in the Spring...So get ready for us..Eh!! Thanks again for a wonderful time... The Eh Team!! Jennifer & Wayne Marsh Bill Ricigliano Stephanie & Jon Kruse A special message for my Bellman "If only I wasn't Married" lol

Reviews.Title: “royal yuk”
Reviews.Author: kenty22
Reviews.Content: hotel staff conspicuosly awol, sad historic hotel could use a major facelift, room service lousey, rooms crummy, security lacks, dosent deserve good rating

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: REH81
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in this Hotel . It's very original as all the furniture makes you feel like you were living in the 1940s . It's different from all those modern Hotels it has it's own ( cachet ) as they say in french . The best thing and advantage this Hotels has is that's it's just in front of the Union Train Station ....just facing it , that is great if you arrive by Train as i did.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, tepid and stone cold”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: En route to the Caribbean we brought a daughter and her two boys in from London for a brief weekend get-together at the Royal York. We took two rooms. It was a mixed experience. The location and the service was hot. Being linked to both the subway and Union Station is a big plus. And you are dead centre of all the attractions. We got wonderful service from the concierge desk with both tickets and restaurant recommendations. The bell desk was great with luggage storage and transport organisation. From hot we went to tepid with both the rooms and weekend services. The hotel was clearly on half speed and half staff for the weekend. Facilities had either weekend hours or were closed. The main restaurant was closed for breakfast with the option being the mall level Royal Kitchen. If you are looking for a light breakgfast, say a piece of toast and a poached egg, you are out of luck. But you do have a choice, you can have the buffet or you can have the buffet. The hot buffet was warm at best. 'We don't get the turnover on a weekend' said the helpful waiter 'So the food has been there for a while.' The hotel is a classic with typically smaller rooms. Ours had clearly seen a lot of traffic and was a bit on the tired side. The bathroom was very small. Despite being small people, the toilet, wedged between counter and bath tub was a bit of a challenge. Two aspects of the visit were stone cold. They didn't mention it on the website, didn't tell us when we booked in and didn't tell us at reception. Instead they pushed over the counter an oh-and-by-the-way piece of paper. The pool is closed for renovations. Who, one wonders, is going to wobble off to another hotel in a Toronto winter for a swim? The boys were very disappointed. And then there was no hot water in my daughter's room, a fact only discovered after the younger boy was put to bed and fast asleep. A handyman came and gave them the oh-and-by-the-way it's the weekend and we can't do anything until Monday routine. The following morning they moved my daughter to another room. Wouldn't you think, no pool, no hot water, they might just have thought to give them a better room, maybe a bit of an upgrade on a quiet weekend for all the inconvenience? In truth we would have settled for any expression of genuine concern or a sense of regret from the staff. I hardly dare add that my wife who was with us, booked the rooms and paid the bill, is a member of the Fairmont President's Club. Some service, eh?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.......”
Reviews.Author: Mcsqueen
Reviews.Content: I half to say this Hotle was a pretty,. I can't wait to go back someday and do it all over again. it is in the perfect location. We were very lucky to have such a grea time. We did not need to worry about anything. The staff was amazing, so kind, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Always feels like home when at the Fairmont Royal York”
Reviews.Author: Parisien
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Fairmont Royal York for a weekend away and truly enjoyed every moment. Why we loved this hotel: 1. The Library Bar - best martinis ever! 2. EPIC Restaurant - truly one of the city's best hidden gems. Food is amazing and service is impeccable. Loved the complimentary amuse bouche at dinner. 3. Fairmont View Room - great views of the city that are especially gorgeous at sunrise. the room was not that large as it is a really historic building, but the bed was out of this world. Have to try to see if I can buy the linens. The mattress was like a cloud. 4. Hotel Lobby - truly a grand feeling that is historic and so special 5. Access - we could get to Union Station, Starbucks, the TTC (subway) and shopping without going outside!!! A big bonus when slushy and cold outside. There are a lot of hotels that I could have chosen for this trip, but I chose the Royal York because of its comfort, high level of service, and location that seem to be consistent with all Fairmont Hotels. When I stay at other downtown Toronto hotels, it seems to be hit or miss. TIP - when you have a Fairmont President's Club membership (which is free) you get free local calls and free internet, which equals at least $15 value daily. Wireless was easy to access and good service BTW. As well, if you like to work out - they offer Adidas workout gear and sneakers that are sent to your room so you don't have to pack it - for free! Truly an amazing bonus. I hope that you will enjoy your stay at the Fairmont Royal York as much as my husband and I did.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose well”
Reviews.Author: XHamON
Reviews.Content: Will stay their again for business definitely and will consider for leisure is location is suitable.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed - expectations just not met.”
Reviews.Author: sunshower82
Reviews.Content: I planned a stay at the Royal York as a special weekend away with my husband and was so excited to stay in such a beautiful hotel. We got a room that was so far back from the main lobby, we had to take 2 separate elevators and found our room was so small that you could barely walk around the perimeter of the bed. There was a small window with no view - just a wall outside - and to top it off, had no hot water in the morning for our showers! It was shocking, for a Fairmont property and at such an expensive rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience at a special hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASASG_7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Fairmont hotels and I agree with the person who said they are very different one from another. Some are quite grand (the Montreaux Palace in Switzerland) some are sleek and urbane (Pacific Rim in Vancouver) some are fantastical (Banff Springs) and some are historic -- like the Royal York or the Empress. Folks, if you want everything brand new and shiny -- go stay in a brand new hotel. The Royal York is a stately, lovely hotel full of old charm everywhere you look: hand carved wooden grates in the elevators, marble patterned floors, grand chandeliers, and painted ceilings. I was there for three nights Dec 2010 and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel was decked out for Christmas which made it especially charming. The staff was warm, helpful, and genuinely went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. We got a suite overlooking the lake, with furnishings in keeping with the style of the hotel. And the location could not be better (near the water, a short walk to the theaters or the CN Tower, and at the southern tip of the underground mall which was great for blistery evenings -- and the subway is right there as well to run up to the Royal Ontario Museum!). I wish I could post pix, but my camera was stolen at the airport! Is it worth it? If you know your style is towards sleek and new -- then this probably isn't the place for you -- but if you want a taste of a grand old hotel, this is it! TIP: Join the Fairmont loyalty program to get free Wi-Fi -- not all reooms are wireless (some still tethered) so if that matters tell them!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no surprises”
Reviews.Author: StudlyOttawa
Reviews.Content: Trouble-free stay, across the street from the Via train station. Arrived Sunday to find only one restaurant open in the complex, but oddly it wasn't full. The only oddity was an undated note in the room stating that the window should remain closed because the warm weather out on the lake was driving gnats inland. In December, I don't think the middle of Lake Ontario is heating up. Apart from that, all was as expected. I didn't explore much as I was just staying the night. I did note that with numerous entrances to the street and subway, the hotel wasn't exactly isolated and secure from intrusion, but along with that goes the accessibility to surrounding attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: AlanandTracey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Royal York for 4 nights with my daughter and sister-in-law. We had a great time. The hotel is in a perfect location with PATH access to all major parts of Toronto. All staff were extremely friendly, polite and helpful at all times. The hotel was very clean in all areas. We were given a nice room with partial view of the lake as I am a member of the President's Club which is worth doing as it's free. The room was a little small for 3 adults but the beds were extremely comfortable. Our only complaint would be that you have to walk through the gym to get to the swimming pool and the pool was rather chillier than it should have been on one occasion. The pool. jacuzzi, sauna and steam room were very nice. We ate breakfast in York's restaurant downstairs and this was very good value for money. We also ate at the Elephant and Castle pub, a few blocks north of the hotel, on a few occasions and had some good food. It is also worth visiting the St Lawrence Market area as it has some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay gave us lasting memories, just not good ones”
Reviews.Author: broomrdr
Reviews.Content: we checked in with high expectations, and had great let downs. We checked in and my husband showered so we could go to dinner. He got out of the shower and told me the water was above his ankles. We called to have it fixed so I could shower and it took over an hour. Needless to say I was unable to shower and had to go to dinner without one, because it took them over an hour to show up at which point my husband told them to come back when we went out. The following morning we assumed the tub was fixed but of course it wasn't. I ended up showering in ankle high water which I'm sure was full of other peoples sludge. I pulled the sludge out of the tub myself and called the front desk again. It took over an hour again and only after a second call. One again we are waiting and our little getaway is wasting away while we wait. The manager of housekeepiing and a room attendant came to the room and the room attendant was arguing that the hairy sludge wasn't there the day before. She agreed to clean it and athe front desk manager brought another key so we could get ready in another room. She then showed me another room that wasn't acceptable. I told her that we wanted to get going and that we would pickup keys to our new room when we returned. The next room that we got was so small, I was so disappointed. I called the front desk again and they had no other room for us, so we where left to stay in this room. They offered us dinner or champaigne which we declined. They offered us a free night stay on our next visit, which I declined. I just wanted a nice room to finish our already ruined getaway. I will admit I did accept a comp night for the night before cause our evening was ruined.But I really just wanted a nice stay. They offered for me to speak to the rooms manager which I also declined because they had no other room to put us in so I had nothing to say to him. About 45 minutes later we heard a knock on the door and the rooms manager(Scott) was there. He said he understood I was very upset at the whole situation and offered for us to see another room. I was very doubtful but we went anyways. The room he showed us was spectacular. It must have been a suite. Living area and 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms...lots of views from every window. Finally someone understood it was about making it right. Although it was the last of our 2 night stay, it did brighten up the evening. While we where at the theatre they had strawberries sent to the room and it was a nice surprise when we got back. Scott was the only one who got it right. I still have more sad memories instead of happy memories for my 25th wedding anniversay getaway. It is unfortunate because that isn't how I like to travel...usually I let things go, but this was a bit too much....don't know what else they can do to fix a once in a life time celebration.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a Royal disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Burydrive
Reviews.Content: Overall Impression: My wife and I would not recommend staying at the Fairmont Royal York hotel and we most likely would not stay there on future trips to Toronto. The Royal York is by no means a bad hotel, but it just did not meet our expectations â€“ expectations set by our previous stays at other Fairmont properties (the Royal York was the fifth Fairmont property that we have stayed in over the past year). As expected, the hotel is traditionally decorated and well located within Toronto but it is unexpectedly tired looking and in desperate need of renovation/update (which was shocking given the room rate charged for our stay!). We learned two very valuable lessons during our stay at the Royal York; always check TripAdvisor reviews prior to booking a hotel (we made our Royal York booking on the road at the last minute so we didnâ€™t perform our typical research) and Fairmont properties do not seem to possess the consistency that we have come to expect. To be honest, our stay at the Royal York has caused us to question our loyalty to the entire Fairmont brand. The Hotel: When choosing a hotel on vacation travel, we tend to select 4 & 5 star luxury hotels that are historic, posses traditionally decorated common areas (late 19th or early 20th century), and are located within the center of the city and/or center of the city's historic district. The Royal York fell into this category quite well. In addition to being located within the heart of Toronto, the hotel was close to shopping, restaurants, Torontoâ€™s Union Station, Air Canada Center, the CN Tower, and more. The hotel appeared to be equipped with typical 5 star amenities (valet, restaurants, lounges, pool, fitness center, business center, etc) but we did not use any of these services/facilities other than the valet during our stay. Overall, though, we feel that the hotel needs a good renovation/update to be considered a luxury hotel. The Room: This part of the review is bit long so we put the important information first! For our stay, we reserved a Fairmont King Non-Smoking room directly through Fairmontâ€™s website (we are Presidentâ€™s Club members and the Fairmont website has our number on file - plus the room rate listed on the Fairmont website was the same as both Expedia.com & Hotels.com). The room and bathroom were traditionally decorated and there was crown molding throughout the room.
