The size of the room met our expectations plus the room had a comfortable bed (appeared to be king size), desk, LCD TV, mini-bar, safe, and iron/ironing board. The room was carpeted and the windows in the room were a nice size (we had a corner room with two windows â€“ one window on each of two walls). The bathroom had a tile floor (marble as far as we can recall), granite counter tops, and included complementary Miller Harris products (shampoo, conditioner, cream, shower cap, etc). Normally this would be a perfect room for us but in this case the rooms (like the common areas of the hotel) are fairly well worn and not really that clean. For example, the dirt build up on the overhead furnace air intake vent was nasty and both the toilet and the tub in our room looked like they were in serious need of replacement (there was even a slight hole in our bath tub!). Obtaining this room, however, was a bit frustrating! Upon arrival we were assigned a room on the third floor but we eventually ended up staying in the room described above on the sixth floor (we had to change rooms several times). Our initial room assignment (3-103) was in really rough shape. The room desperately needed renovation plus it smelled like smoke. Upon informing the front desk that we would prefer a different room they assigned us a room on the fifth floor (room 5-133). This room was in much better shape than the previous room but the television didnâ€™t work (we had sound but no picture) and we could clearly hear the couple in the room next to ours (they either had very loud voices or they were in a really good argument). Upon informing the front desk of the situation, we were then assigned a room on the sixth floor (room 6-174). The heating system in this room was very loud (started up with a loud squeaking noise that eventually dissipated) and the television remote didnâ€™t seem to work all the time (either bad batteries or broken keys â€“ not sure which), but after more than an hour running around changing rooms we just decided to keep this room and get on with our one night stay in Toronto! The Staff: Due to our short stay, we really didnâ€™t interact with the staff other than during the check-in/check-out/room re-assignment processes. The valet and the front desk staff seemed friendly and helpful. The concierge seemed less than excited to interact with us (we asked her where we might find a coffee shop and her response was general disinterest). The room attendants (house-keepers) that we passed in the hallway were very pleasant and always said hello/good-bye. Some Insights: The front desk staff didnâ€™t seem a bit surprised that we had issues with any of our rooms. Each time we had an issue with a room we were handed a key to a different room (as if it is a very common practice to have issues with the rooms in this hotel). Instead of resolving issues, the hotel staff appears to just provide guests with keys to alternative rooms - so you may want to check in as early as possible to allow yourself time to work your way through as many rooms as possible before other guests snap up the acceptable ones! The hotel itself sits on top of underground shops so supplies are fairly easy to find. The hotel is directly across the street from the train station so arriving by rail appeared to be very easy. If you are looking for some casual and fun places to go for dinner and/or a drink you can try the Distillery District on Mill Street (http://www.thedistillerydistrict.com/). Itâ€™s about a 20 minute walk from the hotel but you get to see a part of the city that you might not otherwise see. Another casual restaurant/bar that looked interesting (and close to the hotel) was the Irish Embassy Pub & Grill (http://www.pjobrien.com/). Arriving: We drove to Toronto from Niagara Falls (the trip is about 90 miles and took us about 2 hours). Even though we arrived during weekday rush hour, finding the hotel was straightforward (we travelled on the Gardiner Expressway and the hotel is two blocks North of the expressway). For ease, we parked our car with the hotel valet (cheaper options are available close to the hotel but we didnâ€™t want to mess around finding alternative parking). The cost for the hotel valet was slightly more than $40.00 CAN per night (which included taxes). Departing: When we left Toronto we were heading to Ottawa (a 280 mile, 5 hour drive). The valet made sure that our car was outside the hotel on time (we called 20 minutes before we actually needed the car to ensure that we didnâ€™t have to wait in the lobby). Leaving the city (via the Gardiner Expressway) is very straightforward.

Reviews.Title: “Dated in some ways, but a real classic”
Reviews.Author: Blurgeshmurg
Reviews.Content: Great service, and a perfect location - Toronto was basically built around this hotel! Some rooms are small by today's standards, and some parts could use a fresh coat of paint, but the flawless service and old-fashioned glamour of a landmark hotel make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Swings and Roundabouts”
Reviews.Author: MissPf
Reviews.Content: I can see from the reviews on here that some people feel badly let down by this hotel and I can understand why. The rooms are grubby and the staff a little abrasive. But there is something about this hotel that just makes you feel like a part of history. I did enjoy room service, in fact it was some of the best I have had. So, I think that it's a lucky dip with this one. But a brand like Fairmount can't continue to let this piece of History turn in to a has been. I do hope the management read these comments.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok.”
Reviews.Author: Vay_KayK8e
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a work conference taking place in the hotel. Iâ€™m not sure that I would consider this hotel to be a luxury hotel. The room was small and somewhat outdated, particularly the bathroom. The view wasnâ€™t great and the room was a little dark â€“ I mostly had a view of the building next store and a little of Front Street/Union Station. The TV definitely needed to be replaced. Free wi-fi would have been nice too. This location would be great if you need to be close to Union Station, which is directly across the street, or are taking a flight with Porter â€“ the shuttle to Toronto Island airport leaves from the side of the Royal York. Approximately a 10 minute walk to the Eaton Centre/City Hall area. It is also connected to the PATH.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good for the location”
Reviews.Author: shynk
Reviews.Content: I was a little scared after reading some of the reviews on here but the experience at the Royal York was wonderful. I have been to several downtown Toronto hotels and this one is at the top of my list. The lobby is very elegant and the location is wonderful. Yes, this hotel is old so the room sizes (small) are to be expected. We got a free upgrade to a room with a sitting area so we had lots of room. The bed was fabulous. The TV was tiny but I wasn't going there to watch TV all night! The room was clean. Yes, it needs some updating but it looks like they have started renos. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for character and wanting the nightlife. Had a great time on my date with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shafet
Reviews.Content: This property is great. The common areas are really fantastic. Location is great too. My only complaint is that my room was somewhat dated with the furnishings and cramped. It is an older (but mostly up to date) hotel with charm. The bed was really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms aren't worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Mappie
Reviews.Content: Great location. Public areas are still very impressive. Hotel rooms are small, dated in appearance & not overly clean. Closets are tiny & there is little drawer space. Hotel rates & food/beverage prices are excessive for what you get. Our rate was $169/night. We could have stayed in a bigger, cleaner room in the same area for less. I would recommend the Royal York but only for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: GPS2010
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't ready at check in time, when we arrived. And it wasn't ready tow hours later. We asked for the room we had reserved four months ago at 15:05 and they answered they didn't have it jet. They just sent us for a walk and at 17:00, when we were back, they had done anything at all but leaving our luggage in the middle of the hall. We had to argue to finally get a different (worse) room to the one we had paid for months ago.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: scissorchik
Reviews.Content: After driving 4 hours from North Bay, I was very excited to arrive at the Fairmont Royal York. The lobby was divine-very old-world glamour, and i could hardly wait to see the room. But that ws my first mistake-not everything is as it seems. At this hotel, check in starts at 3 and the cut off is 6pm. We arrived at 5:20, thinking we had plenty of time to unwind and get ready to take in a show at the Princess of Wales Theatre at 8:00. Upon arriving we went to check in and were told our room was not yet cleaned. They offered us a $95 voucher to use in the hotel restaurants, and that it would be another hour to an hour and a half before the room would be ready. I was shocked-this 5 star hotel can't even get the rooms cleaned on time? We took a quick walk to the theatre to familiarize ourselves with the route, and then returned to wait in the lobby. As we sat there, we saw at least a dozen people check in and head off to their rooms. After an hour we inquired about our room but were told it was still unavailable. We asked them to take the voucher back and use it towards the cost of the room. They weren't very happy with that, and began to show some attitude in their demeanor. We sat for another 30 minutes, and by this time it was 7pm. When we inquired again we were told that no, our room was still not ready. At this point we asked to speak to a manager to clear this matter up. The employee went into a room for about a minute, then returned and handed us the key card to our room. Just like that. No questions asked, no apology, no explanation. I should have known that this experience was going downhill from that point. We got to our room, and I was disappointed to see it was slightly outdated, had a postage size bathroom (with somebody's hair all over the floor) and rushed to get ready. I guess I had expected something oppulent and decadent from the style of the lobby, and the name Fairmont. The room was okay-nothing to write home about. I've stayed at Comfort Inns with better service and cleaner rooms. I filled out the 'survey' that was in the room, and attached a note describing the issues we had with the hotel. And when i got home, I took the time to email the hotel and tell them how disappointed I was witht the room and the very poor service. I got a one-line reply saying they had 'fallen short' of their reputation and the information had been passed on. At first i thought-hey-this is an industry that thrives on reviews and referrals. They make making their guests happy the number one priority. As a business owner myself, I know when to issue an apology and make up for any shortcomings. The Fairmont Royal York obviously has different values, and basically brushed me off. I will be sure to tell my clients, friends and family about my experience at this hotel, and make sure to tell them not to waste their money. There are plenty of other hotels to stay at, with better service and more affordable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Save Yourself the Money and the Grief”
Reviews.Author: bellesque
Reviews.Content: Dirty carpet & scratched furniture; sour creamers--1 hr. and 3 calls later they came but at the desk they said, "Well, you got them eventually, right?"; ridiculously expensive breakfast restaurant with lousy food--$30 for truly ordinary buffet; mistakes galore including 'accidently' putting a $900 (instead of the $300) incidents at checkin on my credit card. VERY disappointing. If this were a 2* instead of a 5* hotel, sure, Screw ups R US! But it's not. And then I get home to a call from VISA about charges that the 2 visits to hotel restaurants put for 'incidentals'. I called the hotel's accounting. "What incidentals?" I said. I'm at your restaurant, I ate, I'm paying for the meal with a credit card, there are NO incidentals." He said, "That's just the system."

Reviews.Title: “Grand old hotel, rooms disappoint.”
Reviews.Author: svbreila
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay at the Royal York for our 4-day trip to Toronto. The building, lobby and public areas are lovely (pool is great). And the location is prime. However, we were really disappointed in our room which was small with a depressing view of a wall. The closet was minuscule and the drawer space nearly non-existant. Service was bland and uncaring and we felt like second- class citizens the whole time. Not up to the Fairmont reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel but under renvovation”
Reviews.Author: Travel2971
Reviews.Content: The Royal York may not be one of the nicest Fairmontâ€™s in Canada but it still has the Fairmont style. The rooms are clean but a little on the small side. The staff could be friendlier and the outside was under renovation while I was staying at this hotel. Overall itâ€™s a great place to stay for a night or two but for the price I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a week stay. The Royal York is great for corporate or business travelers. The location is central and everything is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Royally disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lissandtrav
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying in the Royal York after having stayed in other Fairmont hotels in Canada prior to it, but have to say it was not all its cracked up to be. We paid for a Deluxe non smoking room but it was a bit small and located on a floor with other rooms that did allow smoking so on the first night we were able to smell the smoke in our room. But the most disappointing part of our stay was the dinner we were served on our first night there. We were tired, it was late and we thought we would order a pizza from the in house dining service and two soft drinks. The menu made it sound quite tasty and that it was made in house. So you can imagine how mortified we were when it was delivered by a member of staff in a Pizza Hut box with one bottle of Sprite. Do you know how much that cost us, with the expected tips? $75! For one pizza and a 1 litre bottle of soft drink that they obviously had delivered by Pizza Hut. We could have done that ourselves for a fraction of the cost but that's not what we thought we would be getting. It was lukewarm and they could at least have taken it out of the box and pretend they made it. We'd rather be deceived than blatantly mocked. Lesson learnt for us: not to eat in house there again. A huge let down from what is supposed to be a respectable, high class hotel. All of the food was expensive though. We were on a bed and breakfast package that limited us (after asking whether there was any limit on what we could select) to a total of $70 from the breakfast menu. This may seem a lot but the costs of the breakfasts quickly surpassed that amount. One other thing we noticed was that there wasn't a mini bar. There was a place for it, so we assumed that it was out for repair. We wanted a place to store water for the few days we were there so we called and asked if we could have a refrigerator. They obliged saying they could bring one up immediately. We later found out that this is considered to be an optional extra and so were charged $25 for its use without being told there was any charge at all. The other let down was not just limited to the Royal York but to all Fairmont hotels: wi fi internet access. It should be available and it should be free to all guests in this day and age. Not available to you in the hotel lobby only and for something like $15 for every 24 hours. That is daylight robbery. This is 2010. If the little motel down the road can offer it, so can you. Guests pay a premium but free internet is considered one of the 'perks' of being a President Club member only. Newsflash members: you are paying through the nose for it. The only good things about this hotel were the location in downtown Toronto and the indoor pool and gym which was run professionally and offered excellent services.

Reviews.Title: “Royal York - It's First Class”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed the Royal York in the past but reading the most recent reviews has prompted me to write once again to describe the experience that I had staying there just last night. Quite unlike those reviewers who have recently posted, I can tell you that my experiences staying at the Royal York have been exceptional. I have probably stayed here a dozen times in the last 10 months. The staff are unfailingly helpful. The rooms have been top notch. Although the gym could be better, it is adequate. The Library Bar is an excellent spot for a pre-meal cocktail or a nightcap at the end of a long day. The Fairmont Fit programme allows you the use of work out gear without having to pack it. I have stayed in Fairmont Hotels in Chicago, Ottawa, Banff and Boston and the Copley Plaza is the only city destination that comes close to the Royal York (and these hotels are all exceptional). I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “SO disappointing....fell well short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: Alice46
Reviews.Content: Have been to Toronto many times and have always wanted to stay in the Fairmont so despite reading bad reviews on this site before going - we splashed out and booked it for our 6 night stay. The hotel is in a wonderful location and while we expected the rooms would not be modern (in fact we liked the decor...very old world French style) we did NOT expect to have to clean the room ourselves! Indications of service were poor from the start. We pulled up at valet parking on arrival and were asked if we wanted help with our bags....now at a 5* of this repute you don't expect to be asked. We had 3 cases and a couple of other bags and had no problem pulling them behind us - and that's exactly what we did as we got the impression the guy wasn't too bothered in taking them. Check in was efficient but not almost rude. The girl at the desk asked for the name of the 2nd person staying in the room....I hesitated a moment as it was a strange ask given I had already handed over the paperwork relating to the reservation. Before I had chance to recover she indicated to my husband standing behind me and asked "is HE staying in the room also"? We got to our room (3rd Floor, Deluxe Double) and was immediately met with a very strange odour coming from the bathroom. We thought it might be some unpleasant disinfectant but on investigation discovered the toilet had been used and not flushed! I can only assume the rest of the room wasn't properly cleaned. After hours of travelling and it being late I did not call the front desk so got out my antibacterial wipes and cleaned the bathroom myself. I then discovered a 'Welcome card' in an envelope in the living area. Nice I thought.....until I realised it wasn't for us! I thought there might be a mix up in names but on further looking found documentation items/check out details belonging to the previous occupant as well as a used water bottle top. There were 2 bathrobes hanging on back of bathroom door - but it was obvious one had been worn by the previous occupant and just re-hung. Next morning I presented these and my complaint regarding the bathroom and bathrobe to the front desk. I might as well have been giving them a weather forecast for the amount of interest they showed! The guy asked if we wanted to move rooms....but then quickly added that as we were already in a deluxe room he would have to check for availability. I said I would move to a higher floor (more light as the lower floor rooms are quite dark) if there was one available but would be happy if the room was just cleaned properly and the other items put right. There was NO apology forthcoming! As the week went on there were other things that bothered me. (If I was in a 2* motel they may not have bothered me so much but this is an expensive 5* so I expect 5* service). Used coffee cups not taken or washed (although replacement cups were left). Ice bucket left with water for 2 days....I eventually emptied it myself. Coffee maker not cleaned. Ran out of the little cream/milk sachets on Tuesday - still hadn't been replaced by Friday when we were leaving. On a positive note the bed and feather duvet/pillows were extremely comfortable and provided for a great night's sleep. I also indulged in a massage which was great. We DID enjoy our stay in downtown Toronto very much but never felt we had lived through an exclusive 5* experience and this hotel is definitely not worth the rate paid. We've stayed in other Fairmonts which were just excellent - the most recent being in Monte Carlo - from which you just walk away saying WOW! Unfortunately this Fairmont had no such effect on us....it is trading on its name.... but for how long we wonder? We will be staying in one of the many other great hotels in Toronto next time and sadly won't be recommending the Fairmont. SO disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect Fairmont quality.”
Reviews.Author: brettbell
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Fairmonts -- DC and Chicago -- and the Royal York is nowhere near that quality. Yes, the lobby is lovely, but I'd rather have a lovely room than a lovely lobby. I paid extra for a "deluxe" room -- big mistake. The deluxe rooms are on a low floor, and the one I was given was in a section being renovated outside so the windows were completely covered. It was like a big room in a cave. My claustrophobia immediately kicked in. Because the hotel was fully booked they couldn't move me the first night. The next night they downgraded me (albeit without a refund) to a standard room on a higher floor so I could at least see out a window and check the weather. On the plus side, the location can't be beat, especially if you're traveling by train. It's right across from Union Station. Also, every staff member I met was gracious (like most Canadians) so I do recommend the hotel, as long as you don't expect Fairmont luxury. P.S. Toronto is a GREAT city!

Reviews.Title: “Good loaction with some rooms that are not so nice”
Reviews.Author: Adjmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September We arrived from a short flight from New York and was told we had been downgraded and was given a $60 refund. We was given a very bad room with no view from the window (or much light) no hot water, the shower head was hanging off the wall and the lift was so close that my fiancee could not sleep for the first night. That morning I spoke to someone about this and they gave us a much better room with a view of the lake. This was what I was expecting, King size bed, flat screen TV, just everything was of a much better standard. The location is very good to get around and see Toronto. the subway is right under the hotel and the Eaton center is a short walk as is the CN Tower and Skydome. We made use of the swimming pool and steam rooms and these were all of a high standard. The entrance hall and lobby are amazing. We never ordered room service as we was always heading out early. As long as you get a nice room you wont be disappointed at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: Virtio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid-October just before the Toronto Marathon. We were in town to visit the ROM and booked the ROM package. When the clerk told us we were upgraded to a suite he gave us a smile like something was up. When we walked down the hall to our room we were surprised to find double doors leading to our room and a plaque over the door with the name "Van Horne". When we opened the doors we couldn't believe our eyes. This was no ordinary suite! There was a large sitting area to the left followed by a living room with a large flat screen TV and a full bathroom. To the right was a formal dining room with chandelier. Down the hall was a kitchen and then the bedroom and another full bathroom. The bed was the best bed that we've ever slept on at a hotel. The room was on the first floor and had a view directly across from Union Station. We were quite happy with the other aspects of the hotel as well. We always felt like we were getting the royal treatment. The valet was quick and polite. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough. The rest of the hotel was beautiful and historic. The location could not be beat, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: dawnlpm
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the reviews on here we either got lucky or people are way more picky than we are. We stayed here for a few nights and loved it. The lobby is beautiful and very picture worthy. The underground shopping is awesome and we made friends with the guy at the pipe store. My dad smokes so we went in there to get him a pipe and the owner was great and we talked to him for at least 30 minutes. The location of this hotel is one of the greatest things about it. We arrived by train and walked to the hotel....we went to a Blue Jays baseball game and walked there....went to the CN tower and walked there....went shopping and walked there....went to eat & drink and walked there. :)

Reviews.Title: “I live in Toronto have a beautiful home...”
Reviews.Author: Truefitt
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto have a beautiful home and I love going here to stay I take my two kids we go swimming Big lobby to run and hide from dad GOLD LEVEL is the best wow Five Stars ..... Then I head to Truefitt&Hill for a 9 steam towel hot shave Wow

Reviews.Title: “Good...”
Reviews.Author: cricketmad52
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, whilst attending a wedding in the city. We were on a very good rate as the groom's mother had block booked some rooms; we were also upgraded to a deluxe room suitable for wheelchairs as I have an injury at the moment. The staff couldn't have been more helpful with every request we had. Bed was very comfortable and everything worked well. Food wasn't great in the restaurant but it's not far to some pretty good other places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Under renovation”
Reviews.Author: AlandDiane
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of Fairmont properties in the US and Canada and this was probably the least desirable. It was just another old, big hotel in the downtown area. The room was clean, the beds ok, the staff we encountered were friendly, but the surrounding area is not as attractive or dynamic as the Fairmont on Georgia Street in Vancouver or the Fairmont on Nob Hill in San Francisco - two other properties that are of similar age. And, the exterior was under renovation which made it a bit difficult to enter or leave. This might have been different if there was a regular season hockey game the night we were there. This was our first stop in a coach trip from Toronto to Quebec.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, thats it”
Reviews.Author: crnmd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel when you walk in,would be great if you slept in the lobby. This property is very old which I knew, but the rooms leave much to be desired to carry the fairmont name. Bathroom is tiny with cheap shower curtain,small bath tub and peeling toilet seat. The bathroom counter space is so small everything falls into the toilet. My fitted sheet was torn on the corners and looked like a holdover from the depression. Room never really cleaned, just rearranged during my stay. Wi fi only free in lobby. Great location near union station,convention center etc. I believe this property needs some serious updating to carry the fairmont name. Other hotels close by are more modern and more reasonably priced. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the 60's - not a good thing”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: After checking in in the beautiful lobby, we were transported back to the 60's. The room was small, the bathroom was definitely from the era of peace and love. When we tried to move to the 21st century, we were stymied. The Internet wired connection did not work and three calls to maintenance resulted in a dude appearing in our room saying "those Internet help line guys are useless, your computer won't work and the IT guys are on holiday for 3 days. Then we tried the tv, a 12 inch model that evoked the 60's. Most channels did not work and after 3 calls to maintenance they Politely suggested asking for a room change. It was like I was a kid back in the 60s with 6 channels. After all this, I complained on checkout and essentially was told that if I did not like the Internet service, I should try working at the hotel! What a disgrace for a 4 star hotel! Six calls for assistance and all I get is a Fawlty Towersesque checkout. Avoid this hotel unless you want friendly poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, worn, rude”
Reviews.Author: nonbusinesstraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this September. This hotel is possibly the dirtiest hotel I have ever stayed in. We had to move rooms twice, due to not only dust and dead bugs, but half eaten food left by previous guests. The drapes were torn and the furnature worn. Our first room had sour milk and a half eaten kinder egg in the fridge, and a spider web with three dead flies in it. The front desk manager refused to move us until the housekeeping manger called her, and told her that yes the room was very dirty and she would stay in it either. So they down graded us to a double room (front desk manager told us it was the only room avaliable) from the king we paid for, we were tired and were going to stay in that room anyway, when we again found food from previous gusets in the closet. This time we called the house keeping manager directly, she came to inspect this room and told us she would move us to another room ( we were move to a king room that was clean and much nicer? front desk told us no rooms available?????). Unfortunately we only took photos of the second room, but will nominate this hotel for worlds dirtiest hotels. Oh yes and we have had no response from management to the letter of complaint we sent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: amhOttawa
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my spouse who was attending a conference nearby. Our teenage daughters joined us for a long weekend. The Royal York is a lovely old hotel. Our room (we needed 2 doubles as the girls were with us for half the time) was clean, classy and small. Internet was free with the (free)loyalty membership. Location was great - close to island airport, trains, subway and the PATH (inside shopping pathway). We enjoyed our inhouse dining. We ate at the Epic Lounge with the girls, Epic for lunch without. Not cheap, but nice food and atmosphere. Nice drinks one night at Library. Really chintzy drinks a second night. Gym was clean. Equipment worked. Bring earphones.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a celebration”
Reviews.Author: PrincessSam85
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited the Fairmont Royal York for our anniversary and to see the Leafs skills competition. The location was perfect and the atmosphere is stunning. We were in awe of the lobby as it was set up for Christmas it was that much more special. The in hotel spa was fantastic and the massage was just what I needed after a long car ride. A little expensive but treat yourself you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adambird
Reviews.Content: Spent part of honeymoon here, loved the hotel the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is good, only 5minutes walk into the centre of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible rooms! Bugs EVERYWHERE.”
Reviews.Author: JM51
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for my boyfriend's birthday for October 2nd, 2010. There is some type of construction on the outside of the hotel, which greatly diminishes the initial appeal. Checking in was fine and the concierge was pleasant. The lobby itself is quite nice However, when I entered the room I was very disappointed. At the rate of 279 + tax a night you'd expect a nice room, but it was very small and dated. That I could have lived with, but there was BUGS everywhere in the room! I called down to the front desk to inform them of the insects in my room and the lady said the only thing they could do is send someone to spray the room. I could not believe that. They didn't even offer to get us another room. I have stayed in many hotels and I have NEVER stayed anywhere with bugs all over the place! After filling the ice bucket we left to return to find 20 or so small bugs floating in the melted ice. Totally unacceptable. When I informed the front desk upon checking out, the lady said she'd "make a note". This hotel is a terrible place t stay. I've had better experiences in lower-priced chains. Beyond the bugs the room itself was not clean. There was a hole in the curtains and the view was terrible - all we could see was the ugly roof. I would never stay in this hotel. I can not believe the state of the room we stayed in and the fact that the hotel did not have the decency to do anything to compensate for the infestation in the room. I will definitely advise friends and family NOT to stay here. I stayed in Cuba recently and the rooms didn't have one insect in them - and that's a tropical location.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs many improvements”
Reviews.Author: porscheturbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late September. I was not impressed with the check in personnel who keeps sneezing and wiping his nose. He was somewhat sincere when he told me that there is no room with a king size bed because "the hotel is full". Walked into the room and the decor is ok but the room was not clean at all, especially the toilet.....very gross indeed. When I used the shower I noticed the lower portion of the bathtub is all soft underneath and there seems to be a cut in the tub....I hope they fix that before the floor caves in. Went in the elevator to go back to the lobby to grab a bite and the personnel in the EPIC (the hotel restaurant) is both rude and incompetent. The elevators are also very slow and gets overloaded easily. All in all, I am sure this hotel had its glory back in the olden days but my view is you can get better accomodation in Toronto...the rooms are simply too old and too tired..as is the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this older hotel”
Reviews.Author: MimiDot
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Royal York for my first visit to Toronto. This hotel is perfectly located downtown close to the Air Canada Centre, Union Train Station, Eaton Centre, CN Tower, etc. The lobby is beautiful. There is an historic feel to the building, but with all the modern day commodities. The room was very comfortable and clean. Enjoyed the pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “THE FAIRMONT NEEDS TO TREAT PEOPLE FAIRLY”
Reviews.Author: Thehaslams1
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fairmont Royal York a good month before we travelled and paid in full for 3 nights stay. we arrived at the hotel at approx 7pm after an 8 hour flight from Manchester naturally expecting our room to be ready,as I queued to check in another man said he`d been trying to check in since 4pm, and sure enough when i got to the desk I was told there was no room ready, worse still they couldn`t give me a time when one would be! The first excuse given was because it was the "Toronto film festival" then it was because they had a contract with aircrew and they hadn`t checked out on time, we were eventually given a50$ voucher to use in the bar/eatery while we waited for our room

Reviews.Title: “worth a visit even if your not booked in”
Reviews.Author: debbie2373
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with excellent customer service,The hotel is well worth a visit the lobby and ballrooms are unbelievable like going back to the 40's in a good way ,as it very classy.Rooms ok although too many patterns but that may just be my taste.The rooms are very clean.We left two jackets in the wardrobe and when we phoned from our next location(Conneticuit) they happly said they had them and would send them on,which to me was wonderful service up until i had $80 taken off my credit card for postage.After weeks of phoning the manager and waiting for her to get back to me we finally had the money refunded.We had checked with the parcel force who delivered it and they said for weight and distance it should of cost $10.LET THIS BE A WARNING CHECK YOU'VE NOT FORGOTTEN ANYTHING.This was there only let down.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Hotel just right in the City Center”
Reviews.Author: Afribee
Reviews.Content: There is nothing objectionable at the Fairmont Royal York - its location is just perfect, you can reach it right from the subway station or rather from Toronto's underground walkway. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious - people who like a Colonial style will love the interior decoration. The Hotel lobby is very impressive - take a picture of the beautiful watch! The service is friendly and prompt. The fitness center is very good. You can reach most of Toronto's downtown attractions by foot easily. All in all, we can fully recommend the Fairmont Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it was a great experience but it was one of the worst in years”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: How many times have you stayed at a five star hotel and were told by the Fairmont Gold woman "obviously this hotel is not for you. Nothing makes you happy.". Wow! Did she really say that to a customer? It was like "please don't ever come back here because you are an annoying guest.". Ever since I had issues here, it just kept getting worse and worse. I am actually very shocked after staying here for 3 weeks and having to change 3 rooms. Obviously, they never wanted me to come back and I won't. And yesterday was Sept 11th and I had friends I had lost on my mind. I didn't need more stress from a "service" I was paying for. I had this fantasy that since I was staying on the executive floor, I would get a decent room and be in one place for the full 3 weeks. I over packed since my assumption was that I would unpack once and pack once. I usually go to 3-4 countries in 3 weeks. I needed a home base as I was starting a new job and needed to focus on work. I had just been a caregiver for the last few weeks before this trip so I was at capacity. And on my first day in Toronto, I had to go to a funereal. This hotel is old.. It is not built with easy access. There is a flight of stairs at the entrance where the limo driver dropped me off. I waited for someone to help me with my bags, which I usually easily wheel all the way to my room. I went to the special lounge where someone very cheerful greeted me and informed me that I was booked for two nights. I had to let him know that it was actually 3 weeks and that I want to be in one place for the whole stay. I should have known then. I won''t bother you with all the details - here are some highlights: I had to move 3 times because of them telling me yes, we have wireless. No, we don't have wireless. And after telling them how important it was for me to have wireless (I am recovering from an injury) they put me in a room with no wireless access. I told them I was allergic to feathers. I woke up at 3 am with an allergy attack from feathers. On an executive floor, there was screaming and yelling from 2-6 am one night. No sleep for me. The next day I was told that they had to ask the guests across the hall from me to leave the hotel. And it doesn't matter because it is an old hotel and you can hear EVERYTHING through the walls. One of the guys who worked there decided to share with me some stories about this. I hate drama and this was just drama all the time. I felt uncomfortable going to the lounge for breakfast and drinks because the people who worked there made me feel uncomfortable as I was the problem guest. I chose not to go to the lounge as a result. The scariest part was when I woke up on a Monday morning and found a hand written note from another guest under my door claiming they saw someone steal something from my room and could I knock on their door before noon. What??? I felt so awful that another guest was contacting me directly. It wasn;t about stealing anything but the fact that another guest was trying to contact me directly was so creepy. I have been travelling all over the world and this was the creepiest thing that has ever happened. They ended up calling security and I had to waste my time giving a report. Later, I was told it was a prank. At a 5 star hotel? What kind of security is there for a single woman? They did upgrade me to a suite. They did provide me with fruit and sparkling water. But they did not provide a good experience. A home away from home. They did not offer to comp me for the night where the guest they kicked out kept me up all night. Their staff went on strike and it probably explains why they did not put the roll of toilet paper on and just left it on the floor for me to change, even when they were not on strike. And how, I was gone from my room for 7 hours and no one came to clean it, when there was no strike. I guess my expectations are way too high and I am just a difficult guest, as I was told? I know, I should have switched hotels. But I was tired and stressed. It is my fault for wanting to give them another chance. But after checking out and being told I was the difficult guest, I am done. I am sad. I am in shock at how bad the experience was and how no one really cared. The irony is that those who know me know that I am low maintenance. I just wanted a good experience. Is that too much to ask when you pay for a 3-week hotel stay at a Fairmont hotel?

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Fairmont was at the end of an extended 3 week holiday in Canada. The Fairmont was by far the worst. of our trip. We have been lucky to stay in a lot of nice hotels but the Fairmont is selling itself on its past reputation now. Our room was very dingy and shabby with stained carpets, tired furniture and a bathroom that clearly needed work on it. The hotel had been booked for over 6 months but despite that we were put in a twin bedded room and my husband and I shared a double bed. Our sons were on a totally separate floor! Our bed was awful. Clearly it was very old as it dipped severely in the middle which meant very little sleep for the 3 nights of our stay. The service in the hotel was appalling. The only saving grace to the stay was the afternoon tea we had in the Library Bar. What a sad end to our visit to Canada where we found the people generally to be both very friendly and polite and everywhere very clean. The Fairmont proved the only exception to that.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe the Fairmont name is attached to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: valentino88
Reviews.Content: When I book a upper class hotel with the name Fairmont, there is a certain level of service expectation. Otherwise, one might as well go to a Holiday Inn which is basically what this hotel boils down to. I stayed for 5 nights. In all that time, not one single time did the door man ever open the door for me. Granted that is not a big deal but again I have stayed at 4 Seasons where I had never even touched the door once. When I checked into my room, nobody ever offered to take my bags up. While the room was not horribly dirty, it is by no means when I expect in a Fairmont. The vents were dusty and rusted, there are obvious signs of mold, peeling wallpaper. I paid extra for an ocean view room. Have a look at my photo. I think I paid extra for the view of the telus building instead of the ocean. I can see ocean in between the buildings though. Thank goodness the pool is very beautiful and the restaurant still retains that Fairmont service. But everything else is pretty bad. The door to my bathroom wouldn't stay open so the maid just propped it open with a trash bin. While I expected the building to be old, I have seen old hotels that look and feel classic and classy. This place just feels like a dump, dirty carpets etc. Shocked that Fairmont would allow a property to become so run down. The major plus, location. Now I know why the rates were below $200/night. Sticking to real 5 star hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent train/hotel combination”
Reviews.Author: tom_weihmayr
Reviews.Content: We went to a convention held right at the hotel and chose to travel by train. An excellent choice as all we had to do when we arrived was walk directly across the street to the hotel. I have stayed here many times before and (as always) the staff are first class. This time I used an upgrade coupon (although I was quite prepared for there to be no availability due to the large number of guests). I was pleasantly surprised in that not only was there a Suite available, but it was roomy - some rooms at this hotel can me small due to the nature of the construction and age of the building - clean, and comfortably air conditioned. My favourite place to relax is the Library Bar. Aside from the sheer history of the room, its dark wood paneling and comfortable chairs are an excellent setting for a nice drink and a small bite to eat. For an excellent dinner experience, the Beni Hana Restaurant offers a filing meal and entertaining culinary experience. Check-in, check-out and luggage storage were all fast, courteous and hasstle-free. Parking is expensive but it's still better to have a valet park you versus hunting for a spot in the expansive, cavernous parking complex under the hotel, as it is also adjoined to 3 large bank towers. That is why I chose to take the train. If your business or leasure trip keeps you largely downtown or even on the subway line, you don't need a car. Finally, I made the short (3-4 block) walk to the Eaton Centre for a little shopping. You are in the middle of the whole city here, so shopping is not hard to come by. Highly recommend this hotel for its historical value and all-around comfort.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sillyjilly6104
Reviews.Content: My parents came to visit me from BC this weekend, they booked a suite and were SO disappointed with what they got! The room was filthy (stains on the wallpaper), the sheets had holes in them, it was dingy and dark, and to top it all off there were BED BUGS!!!! My Dad is covered in bites and we actually saw the bugs in the sheets. Absolutely horrifying.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with my stay”
Reviews.Author: NormD
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the entire experience from reservations to check out.

Reviews.Title: “A magestic hotel in a really central location”
Reviews.Author: The_Lamberts
Reviews.Content: We tstayed at the Royal York for four nights, on a good deal arranged through Trailfinders. By registering with the Fairmont President's Club (free) we were able to use the dedicated check-in. The hotel has a magnificent lobby and a real sense of history. It's ideally located next to the railway station which can be accessed by a series of underground corridors, Our room was bright and spotless. Service was excellent throughout our stay. We enjoyed a great breakfast in York's Kitchen - unfortunately this only opens at weekends. Toronto's great subway and streetcar services are easily accessible. The hotel proved a great base for exploring this vibrant city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very grand inside, room...”
Reviews.Author: Cruzmurray
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, very grand inside, room was a good size.. From the hotel we were able to go downstairs to the shopping mall and subway.. Staff were polite especially in the library bar

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: kathleenmarie
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We were here for 4 days. We booked a larger more expensive room, which I did not like, it seemed crowded and no view. We asked for another room. It happened to be less expensive and had a nice view. It was very comfortable. The location of the hotel was great, we did not have a car but the train station was across the street. The service at the hotel was very good. Would stay there again if we returned to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful old hotel with phenomenal service”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamilyRichmond
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The historical aspect really captured our kids' imaginations. It was spotless. The beds are incredibly comfortable. Although it is across from Union Station you could barely hear the trains. The lobby is beautiful. The staff could not have been more helpful. The bathrooms are small but perfectly functional with good showers. The pool is a good size but does get a little crowded at peak times. The afternoon tea is wonderful and well worth it. When booking this hotel remember it was built in 1929. If you are not a fan of older hotels don't stay here. Some other reviewers have mentioned the smell of smoke - even though we had a non smoking room, we could smell smoke. I think that 70+ years of having smoking in hotel rooms has left its mark. That said, we loved our 6 night stay here. We would stay here on our next Toronto trip!

Reviews.Title: “A CHARACTER FILLED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Northamptonians
Reviews.Content: Having spent 3 nights with family, close to Toronto, we stayed here with our 15 year old daughter the night before catching the Amtrak train to NYC as it was directly opposite the Union rail station. We were very pleasantly surprised at the character of this hotel. It has a colonial style/feel to it. The foyer is large and very beautiful. We also liked the feel of the traditional hotel services here, with the bell boys and doormen in their traditional dress. The staff were extremely helpful. We arrived 2 hours early and so we were told we could leave our luggage whilst we went off to Toronto Island. However, I had a bag with passports, travels documents and money in that I didn't want to leave or take with me. This wasn't a problem. They let us store it in a safety deposit box at no charge. The rooms were very pleasant and comfortable, though maybe a starting to look a little tired, but not to the extent that it was tatty and it did not spoil our stay in the least. We had a lovely view of the CN Tower. We did not eat at the hotel so cannot comment on this, but overall we enjoyed our stay at the Royal York and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rangeley
Reviews.Content: Nice, charming hotel in a great location. Service was good. Food outlets were good. Sleeping rooms were decent size for city, very clean and nicely appointed. I would return again if traveling toToronto.

Reviews.Title: “A fine old hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: SEAchange
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is a marvellous example of the old CP Hotels and, like any of them, if you book a standard room, it will be clean, very comfortable and small. This is an old but elegant hotel. The common areas are quite wonderful and the staff is excellent. Particular kudos to Terry the Doorman for superb service. The location couldn't be better with terrific access to public transportation and taxis and within easy walking distance of most of Toronto's downtown attractions. It connects to lots of shopping and is an easy walk to much more. In-house amenities are plentiful but expensive. There are many other restaurant and bar choices nearby, however. It is also the second last stop for the airport shuttle so the trip to Pearson is quite quick. It's a very good choice when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try”
Reviews.Author: rockyviewmd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on Jul 13,2010. The location is nice, very close to union station. The room is small. The bathroom is tiny as well, like the bathroom in Qubec's fairmont. One night is fine if you want to try a hotel with much history and story. Free internet access if you are Fairmont member.

Reviews.Title: “the price is not right”
Reviews.Author: Mike_J1963
Reviews.Content: this place does not meet the expectations of the Fairmont standard. While it is a 'nice' place, it is not really a cut above the rest. Rooms are comparably small, features are getting old, and investment in upgrading would be well spent

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Trelice
Reviews.Content: I must admit to being a little aprehensive on arrival at the Fairmont Royal York. Reviewers seem to be have extreemly differing views and experiences so I was not sure what to expect. I have to say we were lucky to have a very postitve experience. The hotel is beautiful, a real old fashioned Grande Dame of a hotel. Our rooms were newly referbished and comfortable. Everything worked and the beds ensured a good night's sleep. There inevitable some downsides. The service was a little impersonal fro both the desk when we checked in and teh concierge. We arrived on a very early flight and left our bags at 8:30 in the morning but they culdn't het us a room until 4pm. The bars were a little disappointing. Not quite the sophisticated experience I had hoped for. The Library bar was noisy and full of kids at 11;30 pm and the larger Epic bar was full of convention types. A real highlight though was the tiny York Station bar on the Mezzanine Floor at the top of the escalators run by Aliana (I think her nake was) who has been mixing cocktails there ofr over 30 years. A wonderful warm welcome with complimentary hot snacks and the best Martini I have ever had - go for the Iceberg Vodka from Newfoundland. The pool was a good size with a whirlpool and steam room as well as a well equiped gym. All in all a great home from home - highly recommended. All in all a great hoe

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: yda51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights. The location is great - easy for Union Station, the lake and downtown. However the room was pretty small for two double beds and there was limited natural light. Also the sink in the bathroom was cracked and the room just looked tired and in need of some tlc. The public rooms are splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: JazboOttawa
Reviews.Content: Recently took the train to Toronto and booked in at the Royal York, as it is across the street from Union Station. Wonderful old hotel, the charm hits you as you enter the lobby. Check in was quick and friendly. Great, but small room, with a view of the lake. Very clean, nice furnishings. The real advantage of this hotel is the location. You can walk to St Lawrence Market, Convention Centre, Rogers Centre, Air Canada Centre. All public transit access is across the road.

Reviews.Title: “The Fairmont Royal York is more common than royal”
Reviews.Author: KC_travels08
Reviews.Content: This is your typical historic hotel built in the 1920's. Expect small rooms with small bathrooms and small closets. Beds were comfortable and there was a nice flat sceen LCD TV, but no room to put more than one suitcase on the floor. Great location -- across the street from Union Station and close to CN Tower & Rogers Centre. I prefer more modern hotels, but this one is OK IF you get an inexpensive rate and are thrilled by history. However, I'd also rate this hotel lower than others in the Fairmont chain because of service. Besides the small room, it was little things that bothered me: (a) being ignored by the concierge for a full 5 minutes while she was on the phone -- we finally just walked away (she wasn't speaking to anyone so it appeared she was on hold; she could have waved to us or whispered I'll be with you in a minute) (b) while waiting outside the main entrance I witnessed the hotel doorman and a tour driver get into a verbal altercation about where the van driver should park his van (it was raining and he was picking up passengers--the doorman wanted the area under the overhead roof kept clear; I found that interesting since the driver was picking up hotel guests) (c) a fire alarm went off in the middle of the night for several minutes waking up everybody -- no explanation or apology at check-out (d) our room was never cleaned until 4-5 pm every day, despite the fact we were out of the room by 9 am daily -- not a big deal except we came back to the room every day about 3:30 pm to find it the way we left it (e) one day the minibar attendant entered our room without knocking first -- at least I never heard him (e) one morning I asked another doorman where the closest McDonalds was besides Union Station. He told me that was the closest one and walked away. Gee, didn't I ask for one BESIDES that? You see, the Union Station McDonalds's doesn't have ANY SEATING!! To be fair, there were some service highlights. The front desk person was very professional at check-in (though she wrote the wrong room number on my portfolio envelope!) And once in the elevator, I witnessed a hotel employee ask a gentlemen who was leaving if she could take his suitcases to his car for him. When he said "no thank you," she replied "it would sincerely be more pleasure to help you, sir." Wow, what a great thing to say! Nevertheless, Toronto is a great city and you are in the heart of everything here at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilTinyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is located right in the heart of downtown Toronto. It is straight across from the Union Station and is only a short walk to the Cn tower. The suite i stayed in was very big and i felt right at home. My room had a bedroom + a pull out couch. A dining room table, fireplace, bar, lots of closet space, nice tv and one washroom. In the lobby they have a coffee shop that sells starbucks coffee or the actual starbucks is only a 3 minute walk. Parking was pretty good only cost us 15 dollars for the night. Only problem i had was getting a new room key when i lost mine because the room was not under my name and it was impossible to go back into my room to get my stuff. The detail of the decor was amazing and there are big comfy chairs on the second floor if you need a quiet place to read or work. Apparently there was a complementary breakfast but we didnt have time to check it out. Not really sure what else to add but if you have any questions feel free to message me ! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: ryhy
Reviews.Content: Great Experience I went to downtown Toronto for a special treat in a hotel and I was thoroughly impressed with my stay at the Fairmont Royal York. I stayed on the gold floor, the food service and convenience was incredible. The hotel is close to the Rogers Center Air Canada center and the hockey hall of fame for the sports lovers and is very close the business district. The hotel is a short distance away from the waterfront as well as the ferry dock that will take you to Center Island. The service is fabulous and the hotel it self is beautiful. They have a restaurant in the basement called Benihauna (call hotel to talk to the restaurant) where the food is made in front of you at almost every table. The restaurant is quite amazing and a must see. If you are going to go I recommend you stay on the gold floor which is very convenient. It has two free computers you can use as well as breakfast drinks as well as dinner time snacks in their lounge. It is not one of Torontoâ€™s newest hotels but it is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage”
Reviews.Author: LeoDravas
Reviews.Content: Pretentious. What else can I say.... superficial, inefficient, musty, poor ventilation, haughty. Anyone that rates this as good service needs to travel more...much much more. I would say pathetic but the beds are comfy. Other than that, thin walls, expensive for basic services, awful parking (no parking really). Unless you have no choice...skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilverStar092
Reviews.Content: This was our fith stay at the Royal York over a 10 year period and it was as good as ever. The outside of this hotel looks like a castle and its location in the heart of downtown, right opposite Union Station, is a major plus. This was our first time driving in as we usually arrive by train. The valet parking was simple and the bellman had our luggage in our room within 20 minutes. The hotel lobby is THE best I've ever seen...very ornate and it was especially festive as this was Canada Day (July 1). We had a one bedroom suite which gave us plenty of room, a sofa bed, comfy chairs, and 2 marble floored bathrooms. The a/c worked great and our suite was very quiet. Dinner choices were limited since this was a holiday but we greatly enjoyed dinner at Piper's, on the lower level of the hotel. Do yourself a favor: stay at the Royal York whenever you are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: jaxma98
Reviews.Content: I was shocked by the poor quality of this historic hotel. I stayed for three nights recently with my husband and my 12 yr old son. We were in a deluxe suite that was deluxe only in its price. The bathroom was bad. The light fixture was broken and rusted. The attached hairdryer was rusted and broken as well. They used a flat sheet for the bottom sheet rather than a fitted sheet. I had to call twice to receive bedding for the pull out for my son. The furnishings and condition of the room were worn and tired. They charged for WiFi!!! My son could not use the pool after 8 pm because of his age. The concierge was AWFUL. They were little to no help whenever we called upon them for direction or reservations (when they answered the phone...it mostly went to voicemail). In person at the desk was not any better. It was a real shame. We had great expectations for this hotel. Very disappointing. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you stand your ground”
Reviews.Author: USTraveler3146
Reviews.Content: I read many negative reviews after I made a non-refundable reservation for two nights. SO...I took all the negative comments to heart and when I checked in, I specifically asked for a refurbished, quiet room. Supposedly there are some rooms with antiquated furniture and lots of noise, I waited a few hours to check in, but the room was very nice, small, but nice flat screen tv, modern furniture, comfortable king-size bed and no noise even though we were near the elevator. I also got a coupon for free appetizer and $50 food and beverage credit. Everything in the hotel is expensive and Canada has a ton of tax on everything but the food was good and the place is gorgeous but be aware, parking was $42 a night. Absurd.

Reviews.Title: “A stay you'll never forget”
Reviews.Author: Skip-the-Dog
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Fairmont Royal York was a very enjoyable experience: the staff was extremely friendly, very polite and always taking care of you, the rooms were well-priced and clean, and the security and comfort was no doubt very amazing. You do not need to go very far to eat or shop, for it has many restaurants and boutiques underground (PATH system). It is connected to the PATH system so you do not need to go outside to visit other attractions such as the Eaton Centre which wasn't very far away. The location of this hotel was excellent: in the middle of downtown and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “A grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: charlie2t
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had occasion to stay at the Royal York for 4 days.Check in was a bit hectic due to the hotel being the headquarters for the Shriners International convention and the large number of Shriners checking in on Sunday, but the front desk staff were very friendly and handled the task of getting the rooms assigned very well.A very special thank you to Adam, who made the experience very pleasant. The Royal York is an old hotel and has many of the elegant features found in the grand hotels of the early 20th century, but also the modern amenities of an up to date modern establishment.The rooms are equipped with coffee and tea service and the beds are modern and comfortable.The bathrooms are small, but are well furnished and adequate. The food in the restaurant was excellent and the service superb.There are many other good places to eat within easy walking distance from the hotel and the spiral staircase in the lobby will take you down to the concourse, a huge underground shopping mall with just about anything that you could want. Expect to pay higher prices for everything in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Most disappointing Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: mo4ever18
Reviews.Content: I decide to give the hotel a chance to clarify themselves before I make a bad review on them. I have waited a month for them to respond to my concern, but yet, no one has got back to me. i stayed at the Royal York for a business trip during June 10 the 13th. Overall, I can give Royal the credit of elegance and presistant with the traditional hotels of Fairmont Hotels. However, I am VERY DISAPPOINTED of how they handle problems. During my stay at the hotel (in room 8-190), I experienced some itches. The itchy areas turn into red dots. I didnt put too many thoughts into it, as I was thinking it may be due to bug bites outside of the hotel. As I went home on June 13th, I experience more red marks on my body. This is very unusual. I went to my doctor immediately and she informed to me that they were some kind of bug bite. After I returned home, I called Royal York to complain to the Management. The next day, the Assistant Manager of House Keeping - Stephan left me a voice mail msg saying that they will have a company come to the hotel to examine the room, and he will inform me of the results. I gave Stephan 1 week before my attempt to call him. I left him voice mail msgs and he would not return my calls. Then I spoke to the hotel manager on duty and she transferred me to Stephan. Stephan told me he will call me back and provide me with the results. It's been 2 wks and I have not heard anything from the Royal York. The hotel assured me that they will take care of the problem and will inform me of the situation. I am very disappointed with the incompetence of the staff. I have stayed at Fairmont hotels many times, and have never encounter such experience.

Reviews.Title: “For $129/night it was very nice”
Reviews.Author: lindz3
Reviews.Content: We got a special promotional deal through the President's Club and paid $129.00 plus tax (which is hefty) plus valet ($42). The valet discouraged us from self parking around the corner saying that it was $35.00 We believed him, but when we walked to King's Street we saw self parking lots for $20. The valet absolutely misled us! Our room was on the third floor and as soon as the elevator doors opened we were hit with the stench of old smoke. YUCK! Our room was way down a long hallway, directly across from the exposed, uber tacky ice machine. The ice machine didn't even have a door covering it and the concrete floor all around it was so tacky! Our room was fine. It was fine for $129.00 per night. If I paid anything more than $200.00 a night for that room I would have said it was awful. The room was worth $129.00 no more. It was small with two double beds. Our view was very nice because it included the CN tower. I loved that our window opened and we slept with it open and had a great breeze all night. The bathroom was tiny, but fine. The carpet was older, the furniture was older...the beds were comfy. All in all...it was just fine. Personally, I expect a lot more from the Fairmont product, although we did stay at the Plaza and were not too thrilled by that property either. Would I tell a friend to stay here? The location is really great...but again...I 'd have to say to watch that you don't pay too much. As an aside, there is a President's Level. I talked with a man who was staying on it and he said it was "awesome". Also, I do want to say that I did request an updated room and was told that I was given one...I don't think so. This property should really work fast to improve itself because it is travelling down a slippery slope.

Reviews.Title: “The Royal York is a wonderful hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: schnoodleontheroad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Royal York many times and have never had a bad room or a bad experience. I have had larger rooms and smaller rooms, but all have been very nicely decorated, and the beds are very comfortable. The location is excellent, just across the street from the train station, an easy 5 minute shuttle to the Island airport, and on the shuttle bus route to Pearson Airport. The hotel is connected underground to the subway system and Toronto's PATH system. There are many restaurant choices both in and all around the hotel. It is within walking distance to major venues such as the CN Tower, Theatre District etc. The fitness centre is very well equipped as well. I would highly recommend the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “The Executive Floor was really good.”
Reviews.Author: TBone_CA
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying there for two nights on the Exec. fFoor and then came back into town for one night and stayed in a "normal" room. If you are travelling on business you will enjoy the Exec floor. Room was spacious, clean and quiet. The bed was fantastic...firm but wow you really woke up feeling rested. There is a special breakfast room / bar / cafe on the floor where you can drop in until 11pm for a snack or drink. The breakfast buffet there was excellent and they have very good coffee. The service in the Exec lounge was outstanding. I found the staff there to be efficient and friendly ( and very attractive ). Gym and pool are ( apparently ) excellent. They will also give you a complimentary shoeshine - if you want to leave your shoes with them overnight you will find them ready in the morning. Laundry service, WiFi etc. exist. Of course you are also conveniently located in the middle of the business disrict. They have done a lot of research into what business travellers value most in a hotel. On the second stay a few days later in the normal room it was a pretty "average" experience. The room was vintage styled but not really an interesting vintage in my opinion...just old really. Left to your own devices down in the lobby there are a few restaurants on the main and lower floors that we went to for lunch and breakfast. They were functional but clearly uninspired. Front desk staff were friendly. I felt that the exec floor experience was truly special and had good value while on business - whereas the regular room experience was quite average.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable place but improvements are necessary”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Two families traveling for a graduation who booked the triple AAA rate of 150 us dollars for a standard room with two double beds. Our timing was not the best since this was the week before the G20 convention which involved a security lockdown with steel fences and barricades on all major streets and I think this was the crux of problem. Pros: Location is perfect and central to areas of attraction of Toronto The Path is the underground pedestrain walkway lined with many shops and located one floor below the lobby.(starbucks is a definite plus for coffee lovers) Beautiful lobby and rooms have an old world charm. Epic is a nice place for lunch with wonderful food but a bit pricey Rooms are small and cozy. Beds are comfortable. Pool (indoor) is nice and fairly clean. Cons:Service needs improvement. Parking is atrocious and some valet attendants need to review the rules of customer service. Reception or the check in desk could have been friendlier and more helpful. At times I felt I was imposing on them if I asked questions but 2 of the 6 people were very pleasant and helpful. TV in one of our rooms was fuzzy and didn't work very well. Entrance to our hotel was barred for security reasons and this was frustrating. NO HOT WATER available the morning we departed. This was totally unacceptable especially when we heard Pres Obama would be residing here in few days. Parking overnight 42 dollars Business office and internet minimum charge 5.50 for 30 minutes Wifi free in rooms with your own computer and presidential club membership I say this with regret-the Royal York is not of the same caliber of its sister hotels in Chicago, Maui, Los Angeles and Vancouver. Management should make significant improvements. Don't rest on your laurels...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Bhajanawali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed in this hotel on numerous occasions while attending the conventions in downtown Toronto. This hotel has most elegant looking foyer and decors. It is close to almost all entertainment centers of Toronto and ofcourse to the Toronto convention center, wher G 20 leaders will meet this week. The rooms are spacious but the rates are pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorKing
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York is a first class hotel in the classic style of grand hotels. I stayed there for two nights on business. The rooms are fine and typical of business hotels. The hotel had full amenities, although the only thing I used was the business centre, which provided free access to the internet and a printer. I got an excellent rate of $145 ($164, including a variety of taxes). They provided free internet access. At least I think it was free. The card on the hotel room desk indicated it was $13 per day, but nothing showed up on my bill when I checked out. The location is fine. It is relatively close to most downtown points of interest, although depending on where you want to be, there may be closer properties that are sufficiently comparable. Check-in was very quick. I had no wait and the desk clerk was very friendly. She offered me a choice between two rooms, explaining the pros and cons of each. I chose the room on the higher floor, which she warned me was right next to the elevator. However, I never heard any elevator noise during my stay. I appreciate this comment is in direct contrast to one of the recent postings for this property. In addition, after checking in, I went out to grab a quick bite to eat. On my return, I found a chilled bottle of white wine waiting for me. I called down because I hadn't ordered it and was worried about getting charged for it. However, they told me not to worry about it and it did not appear on my bill. My only complaint was about the temperature control in the room. When I arrived, (at about 6:00 pm) the room was a chilly 17 or 18 degrees Celsius (63-65 Fahrenheit). I set the thermostat to 75F and went out for about two hours. When I returned, it wasnâ€™t much warmer than 65 or 66F. I then set the thermostat to full blast. By 11:00 it was still under 70F. It pretty much took until the middle of the night, as far as I could tell, to warm the room up to regular room temperature. I suppose I could also complain that my upper floor view consisted almost solely of nearby office towers, but that really isn't the hotel's fault. Overall, it was a positve stay. I would definitely consider staying here again the next time I'm in Toronto for work, or for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Where You Feel Like a Princess”
Reviews.Author: mtl-wasa
Reviews.Content: You walk into the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto and you think "wow, I feel like a princess"... the lobby has a special vibe and the staff is extremely efficient and charming. Some rooms might be a bit small but the beds are comfortable and everything is well arranged. It's too bad all those skyscrapers now block the view of the lake but it's still a nice view of the city. It is also very pleasant at the Epic restaurant in the lobby level: great food, great ambiance and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: daithelife
Reviews.Content: Chosen for the last two nights of our visit to Canada to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary this hotel managed to show all the problems to which a great hotel can be prone. Paying a premium price to stay here because of the reputation of the hotel we were soon rudely disillusioned. Despite being presidents club members at Fairmont we had to queue to check in as the reserved check in wasn't manned. As at the Sheraton earlier in the week our travel agent had noted our reason for travel and the reception clerk said a drink (bottle of Champagne) would be sent up to our room -It wasn't. When I asked why not when we went out two hours later I was told it would be there on our return. When it wasn't I was told it was on the way and it arrived 6 hours later! There was no provision to check personal email although the TV in the room allegedly had that facility and we were charged $5.50 for 3 minutes use of the business facility. Although willing the concierge was not very helpful, and charged us $125 each for $70 dollar tickets to the Blue Jays game. Despite assurances she also failed to secure boarding cards from Air Canada, leaving us to get seats apart for our return journey. Finally, and perhaps the final straw, we had booked for afternoon tea in the Library Bar before leaving for the airport. Offered a list of teas we chose Darjeeling - but were served a standard breakfast tea. When we pointed out the error the tea was replaced, but when we asked for the pot to be refreshed it was filled with an inferior tea once again. After some altercation the senior server explained they had no knowledge of specialist teas and bought the leaves in the pot marked Darjeeling to show me. It was quite obvious that there were two teas mixed together. A little Darjeeling with a far larger amount of what looked like a poor broken Assam leaf. To give her her due she did delete the cost of the tea from the bill, but what was meant as a final luxury was of course totally ruined. In general the hotel, despite its air of opulence failed in the small but important matter of staff training and guest relationships. Maybe we just weren't solvent enough for them to bother - but if so why did the Sharaton treat us like Royalty or Pop-Stars?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel...not so beautiful old rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sheikyerbooty
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night (Saturday). Nice old hotel with beautiful common area's. I've seen some reviews mention tiny rooms. That was not my experience, I joined the Fairmont President's Club (it's their Rewards Program) when making my reservation and upon check in received a free room upgrade and free wired internet in the room. The room itself was spacious, but due to a full hotel we were given a room on a smoking floor, so the decor was somewhat dated. The deluxe room had two doubles, and two bathrooms...a sitting room, along with 2 flatscreen tv's and a mini bar. As mentioned the room was dated but exceptionally clean. We were located close to an elevator, but did not have a problem with noise. Check in and out was a breeze, and everyone was very friendly. The location of this hotel is also a plus, as it is a 5-10 minute walk to just about any attraction or location in the downtown area. Check the hotels website for specials, as they run many different ones. I paid $129.00 a night off the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Canuck72
