Reviews.Content: I am staying at the Royal York Hotel right now. Am here with work, and was allocated a specific room for work purposes...I think they gave me the worst room in the place. Forget the outdated interior, broken lampshade, closet door that doesn't open properly, and to top it off, I had to move on my first day here because the room I am in now was being serviced. ?? The worst part about the place is the constant noise of the elevator. I am not talking about a ding or something...I am two rooms away from the elevator, and my colleague who is one further away also hears this constant noise, like moving machinery. It is really incredible that it is this loud...I have only been able to fall asleep because I have had such long days...not sure I will survive this, and I really need my sleep. In terms of service, I admit the front desk staff was extremely friendly. I would have marked excellent except for two things...one, why didn't they tell me I was going to have to move rooms? I wouldn't have bothered unpacking. The second point is there is a constant slamming of doors....last night I heard the door across the hall slam and looked out my peephole to see the person who had just went in to that room exit and again let the door slam. It was a hotel employee and it was after 11pm. I hope my stay gets better...don't think it is possible to get any worse. On the positive side, if you do stay here sign up for their rewards program. They will give you free internet access...otherwise it costs about $15 a day with tax. Also, I haven't used the pool yet, but have seen it and it's gorgeous, as are the lobby and other public areas of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoy the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: Aparticulartguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal York for 3 nights for a family fun trip to Toronto. Myself, hubby and 10 year old. Over the years, I have stayed at the Royal York about 5 or 6 times. I really like this place, the location is the best- close to Convention centre, Blue Jays, Air canada centre, union station, restaurants, CN tower, Eaton Centre, shops. I have stayed for business and leisure, by myself , with my husband, and with husband and child. Here's the good and the bad Good Location (see above) Transportation- is a stop on airport express bus..about $20 per person from Pearson, some discount for a roundtrip.I take this when alone, as a cab is abour $45 one way, a town car $55. With 2 or more people, I take the comfort of a town car limo from airport. Pool-it has one, a pretyy good one in my opinion. Adult swim only afrom 9 to 10 pm, pool has good locker room with attendent to give locker, towels etc. Health club not real big, but OK. Service- some of the best in a non 4 Seasons Hotel. I phoned for xtra pillows for sofa bed, and was asked would you like a duvet, too? They made up the sofa bed with duvet and triple sheets.Bell man always available to help, concierge helpful Linens and bed- very high quality, very comfy. Nice robes. Coffee - in room coffee maker made decent coffee, real creamers in mini bar (10% and 2%) not just coffee mate powder like in most places. Real china cups and silver spoon for the coffee service. Toiletries- good quality. Bath gel as well as the usuals. Bath tub is old, hotel was bilt in 1929, so is deep enough for a real bath. Not so good There most certainly is variation in the rooms. My first time here, (over 10 yrs ago) I had a room the size of a closet, next to house keepings room. Small, noisy, closet was itsy bitsy. (this was in the days before Hotel websites, when you phoned, asked for a room and got what you got because you didn't know any better). One time, I had a nice large king room, once a way too small king room while travelling with my husband-- I expressed my displeasure and was upgraded to a huge suite with 2 baths. Once we stayed on gold floor,in a king room, a tad small but good view and top notch service, loved the lounge- excellent, highly recommed. This time, room was perfect. I had booked a deluxe, wanting the extra room to fit a cot for my 10 yr old. I had the room pictured, which had a king bed, sofa bed, dining table for 4, and a closet big enough to live in. This appeared to be more than was offerred in the deluxe room, I guess I got a really nice deluxe room! Prices- are not low. Breakfast is very pricy Epic Buffet $28 but really good omelettes, pastry left lot to be desired. You can walk around corner to Tim Hortons, theres a second cup right there, too. Room service very $$$ too. Epic sfternoon tea is $29 per person but a lovely experience. So, you can splurge on the pricey food, or leave the hotel and get something much cheaper close by. Conv. store, Tims, etc out of main entrance, go right then right onto the next street. Hot dogs from wagons across street good, too. Air con- is pretty good. We had it cranked and kept the room cool enough, the bed area on other side of divider was that cool, but we asked for a fan, and all was good. We like it really cool at night, and found the temp good. It was just June, not a heatwave so maybe the a/c doesn't work as well in dead of summer. Bathrooms- are indeed small. Hotel is old, not much you can do. Not much counter space, but tub is nice and deep, If you want a nice soaking tub and separate shower, stay at the SOHo Met. No fan in bathroom. Noise- there was some party one night around corner from my room. I don't know what was going on in there, I saw about 20 young people all dressed up leaving....loud music. I called desk around 10, was told they enfore quiet after 11. I didn't hear a peep after 10:45. Maybe the people were having a party before going out. Business centre- opens late (9 or 10) on weekends I think thats all I can offer. Its a different experience each time, but I still love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel with lots of history”
Reviews.Author: Sue91
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a 4 night stay at the Fairmont. We arrived very jetlagged and tired so was very appreciative of the speedy check in and professional staff at the front desk. Room was in a nice quite corner of the hotel on the 5th floor so there was no street noise when we opened the window. Pefect location as has been mentioned here before . We had breakfast the first morning at the hotel and although pricey was very good. Order the Buffet breakfast as opposed to seperate items as its much better value. It has been mentioned before that his hotel is in need of a facelift and perhaps in some areas I agree but its steeped in history and has an old world charm to it that is hard to get anymore with all the modern contemporary hotels everywhere. We got a great rate with hotels.com so would definitely stay here again when I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “way overrated and you can make it a hit if you are careful during check-in”
Reviews.Author: toronto_visitor_55
Reviews.Content: There are two sets of rooms in this hotel for the same price. One set is pretty horrible with small room size and with bathrooms really pathetic almost like 30 yrs old maybe and old picture tube TV and beaten up couches and table, the other set of rooms are really amazing with flat panels, amazing room space and nice layouts. I was really shocked to see how come the hotel is cheating customers like this. Being a four star hotel you would expect a better quality, Its almost like winning a lottery if you end up in good room or the crappy one during check-in. during check-in make sure you ask for a better room, otherwise its not worth the price even a chain hotel's rooms are better.

Reviews.Title: “A Toronto Icon”
Reviews.Author: LeeJoMaldives
Reviews.Content: So I decided to stay at the Fairmont as it appeared to be an iconic hotel and when you are sitting in the lobby you will see why. You could be in any one of London's prestigious hotels as the architecture and the decor are extremely English. I would advise anyone visiting Toronto to stop by and see the lobby and maybe have afternoon tea, but if you are paying full whack I would imagine you may well be disappointed. The hotel rooms are very worn and could do with some refurbishing. Everything is priced additionally including WiFi $14, bottled water $6, breakfast $25 etc. The gym and pool are small but well equipped, although it was quiet when I went and I can imagine if you are a hardcore gym goer you would be shocked by the size of the gym for such a large hotel. If you are on a budget I would advise you not to drink in the Lounge Bar, a G&T and some bread with hummous cost $30, although it is beautiful and they have musicians on Saturday evenings. If you want a bit of regal elegance and have some cash to spend I am sure you will enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hit or miss service, just don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: stamfordtraveler72
Reviews.Content: Just spent the Memorial Day weekend in Toronto. I usually don't stay at higher-end hotels like the Fairmont, but it was offering a good deal of around USD200 per night for Friday-Monday. Pros: Airport Shuttle, Location to sights and mass transit, Health Club staff, PATH access Cons: No flat screen TV in rooms, small bathrooms, unstocked mini-bar, room service menu is kind of limited

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: violettesnanny
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel as a special treat. While the location is convenient for the train, there is very little else in walking distance. The foyer and mezannine levels are magnificient but the rooms are very ordinary. We had real problems fitting our suitcases into the room and were advised by the porter to put our bags between the beds!!. Hardly a solution. When leaving the room while it was being serviced we heard multiple sighs and groans about our luggage being everywhere. Although the beds are comfortable they are not made properly, pulling down the top sheet resulted in the bottom sheet coming adrift. We would have liked to have enjoyed a meal here but the prices were totally over the top and some of the restaurants/coffee shops were not even open. We had to resort to walking over to the railway station for breakfast. All in all, a big big disappointment and not a hotel I would recommend to anyone or revisit in the future. I am sure there are better hotels in more convenient locations at more reasonable prices in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: mk43
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Toronto from Ireland for a 4 night stay with my daughter, had stayed in the Fairmont in Boston before and really liked it , so decided to choose it again. The fact that the Hotel has not been modernised is part of its charm. Room was clean tho had not been vacumed but beds were extremely comfortable and clean. However our stay clashed with a wedding there and also the Victoria celebrations so sleep was a problem for us as there was quite a disturbance in the corridor on one of the nights - we have not complained - YET !!.Found the location great and Airport Express Bus stops outside , so we found this very handy. Would reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated a birthday at the Royal York in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TOchild
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Super classy. Was only here for one night, so didn't deal with hotel staff much other than check in and out. Very easy and efficient. Amazing rooms, high end. Clean. Nice TV. Comfortable Beds. Nice bathrooms. I didn't pay for the hotel...and I know it is very pricey...but if I were to splurge and spend a night in downtown Toronto for whatever reason, I would try to make this the spot I stay at! Obviously amazing location as it is directly across from Union Station and the Air Canada Centre. A couple minutes walk to the lake and the SkyDome (The Rogers Centre). So much to do in this general area!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but somewhat old and tired”
Reviews.Author: BobMQC
Reviews.Content: Well, my title says it all. Had overall a good stay, but the room, decor, fixtures, even the number of toiletries in the bathroom were below my expectations for a hotel of this stature (and price).

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience I've Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: DenMark3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of a kind. It's worth every penny and more. If you like comfort, service, and quality, then this is the hotel for you. Our room was spacious, clean, and quiet, with a wonderful view. There is so much to look at and so many places to explore around the hotel that you barely have to leave! We felt wrapped in luxury for the entire weekend at a very affordable price, even lower than some surrounding hotels. If the Queen herself can frequent such a hotel, I suppose we can too!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dr8461
Reviews.Content: If the only thing you care about is location and money is not an issue, then this hotel is for you. Walking distance from the Union train station, convention center and CN tower. However, the rooms (regular) are just ordinary and not worth the fortune they cost. Even toothpaste/brush is not complimentary, if forgotten. Parking is another issue..unless you find a city parking lot (there is one close by), you will have to dish out a fortune for that. Rooms are old fashioned with not much of a view. Refrigerators and microwaves are not available..cannot store anything in the mini-bar fridge. They will charge you even for the business center use! A big disappointment for its name and fame.

Reviews.Title: “Old, very old. A huge machine. Chain hotel service: efficient”
Reviews.Author: BluMartini
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. That is if you have no other options, it's your best option. The rooms & public areas are old & need a major refurbishment. The service is efficient - but for the price of a 4 stars, I expect more of a hotel today.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with old-world charm, great service, and good location”
Reviews.Author: peregrinatious
Reviews.Content: I agree with another's recent review: great staff and location, decent rooms. From check-in to check-out, every encounter with the hotel staff was great. They were friendly, but more importantly they were helpful and resolved all issues to my satisfaction. Location is good for the downtown area. Toronto is easy to move around by foot or on the subway, and this hotel is connected to Union station and (like much of downtown is) to the underground pathways. Plenty of food choices from fast and cheap to world-class and expensive nearby. The lobby and elevators are well maintained. Fitness center and pool were clean. Actually, all public spaces were kept very clean and well maintained. Decor throughout is not modern, but that's part of the old-world charm. My room was not ultra-plush, but it was solid/decent with some nice touches (very comfortable bed, coffee maker, blackout curtains, marble bathroom). On balance, I was willing to overlook a few negatives (e.g., a worn nightstand and armoire, and having to pay for Internet) because of the great service and the comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Phiby
Reviews.Content: We loved the Royal York. It is a truly beautiful hotel, a historical landmark with every comfort. The location is perfect, especially if you are arriving at Union Train Station, which is just across the street. It is a short walk to the lake front with lots of good dining options in the immediate vicinity. The pool and wellness center are great. The breakfast buffet is generous and varied. We weren't hungry until dinner. The only bad thing was that we were there during a huge young engineers conference for one out of the three nights, and they were making a lot of noise in the rooms around us all night. We didn't call the front desk to complain because we were only half-conscious and couldn't wake up enough to reach for the phone, but the receptionist was very appologetic and said that if we had called a security guard would have put an immediate stop to their rowdiness. After the young engineers shipped out, everything was perfectly quiet. The beds were only doubles, so a bit narrow. You're probably better off getting a room with a king. The toiletries provided are very fine.

Reviews.Title: “Never again, if I can help it”
Reviews.Author: psmith45
Reviews.Content: I grew up loving to visit the Royal York as I lived an hour outside of Toronto and would come with my family during the Christmas holidays or other occasions for dinner. Never stayed here, but it always seemed like a fancy place. Then, last year I had the misfortune of staying overnight during a conference in the dead of winter, and it was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Really. I ordered a non-smoking room, but they bumped me to a smoking room that was DIRTY WITH THE CIGARETTE ASH FROM THE PREVIOUS GUESTS STILL ON THE TABLES. Barf. On top of that, the room heater was completely BROKEN. When I called down to tell them the problem, it took them OVER AN HOUR to get someone up there and relocate me. Yes, no exaggeration. I was sitting in my winter coat the whole time. When they finally put me in a different room, it was right over the bar where I could hear a very loud band playing. Sigh... The rooms are expensive, and I found the decor pretty lacklustre (peeling paint, old fixtures, scuffed up beat up furniture) for such an expensive hotel. I know hotels can have bad days and problems at times. I did mention this to the staff after I left and they were somewhat sympathetic. I write this in hopes that the management will find the wherewithal to fix their service problems and restore what is now a "faded" glory to what I hear was once a luxurious destination hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Great location! Okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: jlmOntario
Reviews.Content: We spend the night at The Fairmont Royal York in Toronto as we had bought tickets for a basketball and baseball game. We normally stay elsewhere as the regular rates for rooms here start approx. at $250/night. We received a family and friends rate, so we decided to try it out! For those who don't mind a 2min walk, try parking in the lot underneath the Strathcona hotel (across the street from the York St. entrance of the Fairmont). It is quite a bit cheaper than the valet parking offered at the hotel! We received quick and friendly service while checking in/out and with our room issue. The issue we had was that the room we were first given had no working tap water, was missing the knob to turn the shower on/off, and the shower was also leaking water. Other than that the room was beautifully upgraded! We were quite disappointed when we were switched to another room that was a down-grade in comparison. We did receive money off of our room for this (as there were no other rooms available), which did make up for it, but once you see the up-graded room it just puts you off! (There is also a pool and a few restaurants that are said to be good but more on the expensive side, we did not use either) However our second room was still nice and very clean, and the service we received while fixing the room change was excellent. The location of the hotel is great! Within walking distance to the ACC, Rogers centre, Eaton Centre, etc. I would go back to the Fairmont if I did have another Friends and Family type rate, but would not pay the regular price for the room we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel with Rich History, Too Pricey For Us”
Reviews.Author: SurlySalm0n
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. If you take the time you can imagine what this hotel was like in it's prime. It must have been THE place to stay. Royalty and Other V.I.P.'s have stayed here. You can look out the window of your room to a partially obscured harbourfront view and see it would have been amazing before the area really got built up. Accordingly, you pay for all of it. This is a top of the line hotel. If you admire the furniture, architecture, history of the times this hotel has seen and want valet, luxury, stay here. If you want modern, look elsewhere. The rooms are a little small by today's standards. As are the T.V.'s. The hotel has a great Tepanyaki restaurant. My wife and i stayed and dined here on a belated Valentine's Day trip. Benihana's is Japanese show cooking. Look to spend $75.00 a person and leave full from an excellent meal of shrimp, vegetables and Steak or Chicken prepared on the flat top right before you. We had drinks at EPIC, a lounge style bar just off the lobby. Again expect double the price of normal cocktails. In the morning we had the "complimentary" full buffet at York's kitchen. This is easily a buffet with no equal. You name it, its there, enjoy it. Stay here at least once for the experience and make a night/weekend of it with your significant other.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: zarebscytravel
Reviews.Content: absolutely great, we was satisfied, but not for kids hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_petunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights in December for business. Centrally located downtown. Beautiful lobby! Room was a bit tired. Certainly the decor is traditional and I have no complaint with that, but it could use a bit of a facelift. The bathroom is tiny and I didn't like the floor in the bathtub. I don't know how to describe it, but it felt like they had placed a rubber lining over the original tub or something. Floor of the tub was squishy and uneven. Very strange. I ordered room service one night, which was good. I wanted to grab a quick a la carte breakfast one morning, but discovered a coffee and a muffin would have cost about the same as their breakfast buffet ($30) which I didn't have time for, so found a Starbucks instead. Expensive parking (but probably the norm for the area). I did have some problems with reservations and check-in. I had booked online at fairmont.com using a Friends & Family rate. In checking my booking after the fact, I had ended up with a conference room of some sort with no bed or washroom. The reservation agent supposedly fixed this for me, but upon checking in, it turned out I had no booking at all. They had records showing the original booking and its cancellation, but not a new booking. They were able to accommodate me, but I did not end up in the type of room I had originally booked (I believe I had asked for a king bed and ended up with a queen). It took a while to sort out, but in the end it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Its a great place to stay in toronto”
Reviews.Author: merc123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night,on the 12th floor.The staff were fantastic,starting with the booking agent when i made the reservations,to reception,room service,everyone was great.We did order room service,the meal arrived within 25 minutes as promised,the food was fantastic,if a little pricey,but who's counting.The hotel may be old,but to us that's a good thing,it is a beautyful place to even just hang out in the lobby.And of course the location can't be beat.The room was spotless clean,the bed super comfy,and noise was not an issue at all.Only minor complaint would be,The bathroom was kinda small,but thats it.It was clean and functional.We will definately stay at the royal york again when in toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: traveltravelOntario
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in toronto So much to do and see we stayed at the royal york what a nice place all in all the stay was good but I had a room on the inside. there was something banging around all night with the wind so I did not sleep well but when I checked out they discounted my room I would stay there again if I am ever going to toronto again

Reviews.Title: “100% up to snuff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have no idea what all the bad press is about. I stayed at the Fairmont Royal York on the night of March 29, 2010 and came away 100% satisfied - as I always have with Fairmont hotels. The service was outstanding, starting with the booking agent who took my reservation over the phone. It continued when I arrived with efficient and professional service at the check-in counter. It continued again when, after discovering that I had initially been booked into a room that was literally right next to the elevators, I was quickly switched to another room on a higher floor that was satisfactorily far from the elevators with just one call to "Royal Service". (When I explained over the phone that a colleague was already waiting for me in the lobby to head out for dinner, the hotel agreed to switch my bags to my new room for me while I was out, with me stopping by the front desk once back from dinner to pick up my new key.) It included the cheery clerk at the lobby coffee shop who helpfully suggested that I might be interested in joining the Nike Lounge womens-only running group that evening, upon noticing that I was clearly returning to the hotel after an early morning run along the waterfront. And it even extended to the friendly and polite concierge who stored my luggage in the morning and gave me directions to my meeting. The Fairmont's decor can only be described as traditional, in the grand railway hotel style at its origin. Perhaps that's the issue? Maybe people were expecting sleek, modern, minimalist design? That's not what you come to the Fairmont for - rather, watch for the exquisite mural of the Canadian Rockies over the main entrance, the incredible vaulted decorative ceiling in the lobby, the carved brass doors and dark wood in the elevator and the expansive colourful carpets and crystal chandeliers in public spaces. It's old-style luxury all the way - that's what Fairmont does and they do it very, very well. Add to this convenience - the Porter Airlines shuttle dropped me right at the hotel's York Street entrance and there was easy access to the city's Path and subway systems - and all for $145 / night! Truly, every part of this experience lived up to my expectations. I would definitely stay here again, given the opportunity and would recommend it without reservation to friends and family visiting Toronto. People - the old girl's just as fine as she ever way!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, old charm”
Reviews.Author: bZita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Valentinesweekend and booked gold floor. Beautiful hotel - old charm - entrance and reception area is magnificent and location is right in the center near CN Tower and underground pathway. The room was fine although rather small, bathroom is a bit dated. It was fine but nothing special and defnitely not worth paying extra for it. The breakfast for the gold floor is served seperately and was very nice. The only downside was that it was extremely busy because of Valentines weekend and it was clear that they could not handle this. A lot of dishes were empty, there was a long wait for tables and a lot of people were sent downstairs for the regular breakfast. The seperate check in and out on the gold floor was excellent and saved us a lot of time because the regular reception area had long lines. Overall a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel - if you like that sort of place”
Reviews.Author: JamesFann
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Toronto, but had never had the chance to stay at the RYC, until many years later as I moved away and then travelled there on business. Overall the room was clean and in perfect location for all my meetings. As it is connected to the PATH system, it does make life alot easier on a rainy day. If you like old classic hotels, this hotel is perfect to show that style off. The overpriced menu is a bit hard to deal with but if you wander around - lots of better and cheaper eats are around. The bed I had was comfortable and everything in the room worked as it should have. The fitness centre is one of the better ones available for a hotel, however still does lack a ton of room, but does have around 6 treadmills and a few elliptical machines. If there are more than 3 people playing with weights then you're out of luck. For the price paid, there is alot better I'm sure, but it's a beautiful hotel and the staff that I dealt with was courteous and helpful. *Free high-speed if you are a fairmont member - free signup - so worthwhile for sure. It was a bit choppy at times, but it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice When In Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: I recently overnighted in Toronto the night before a business meeting. I completely enjoyed my stay. The staff were very helpful, the business facilities are very good, the hotel is quite elegant and the rooms are well appointed. For breakfast the best bet is to go down to an a al carte restaurant on the basement floor (other spots are too expensive). The Royal York is a landmark hotel and is handy to the Go Train, VIA Rail, subway and the Pathway (an underground walkway that runs from Union Station to north of City Hall). There is a little coffee spot in the lobby that is well worth a visit. Also, don't mss the Library Bar (a great spot for a night cap). The exercise facility is well equipped for aerobics, not so good if you want to do weights.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: BWOverseas
Reviews.Content: Maybe its the 8th floor but from everything I saw it was so tired and dated. I have stayed before and cant remember it being this weak. Noise also an issue as their convention business is strong and the attendees often late to bed and noisy/loud. Bathrooms and room fittings very old. Watch out for a) the daily $5 per day 'marketing fee' b) even a few seconds long distance is charged for minimum 1 minute - $8.95! Not going back, there must be better options in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: WorldExec
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is not the fanciest of hotels in Toronto however it is probably one of the most well-known. There are many things which make this place unique. I recommend joining the Fairmont President's Club if you are going to stay as members get benefits like free high-speed internet access, as well as nicer rooms. Some of the smaller rooms are very old and tired, but the beds in all rooms are incredibly comfortable. I am guaranteed a great night's sleep every time I stay. The location is amazing as it is connected to Union Station and is in the Entertainment District. Make sure you stop in Piper's for a beer and some great food in the lowest level.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel old world charm”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveDisneyAlways
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful but expensive. We like to stay here because it is located by union station just a few steps across the street. We'll take the train to toronto for a quick trip. Close by is Air Canada Centre, CN Tower, Casa Loma, R.O.M, Shopping. We always eat at Union Station there is an underground tunnel from Royal York to Union station grab Mcdonalds, subs and many other choices. The rooms are elegant but nothing special, the bathrooms have marble etc but are still very dated. The swimming pool small but nice, and there is a hot tub very nice. Over all if you can afford it I love this hotel but your not getting much more then a clean bargain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AnonymusLondon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times now. Admittedly some of the rooms are a bit tired and might need a light make over. However, what makes this hotel great is the service (and the great location). I had a small issue with house keeping and once reported, the house keeping manager called me in the room, apologised and immediately fixed the issue. After a little while, one of the senior managers called me to make sure I was happy with everything. And this for a small issue.. I was very impressed. Despite being a very busy and large hotel, the reception team is great and always smiling, the guest service team is incredibly helpful and everyone works very hard at making you feel welcome. Maybe some of the rooms are not perfect, but the service definitely makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “superb location, superb service”
Reviews.Author: Ottawaguy-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the royal York three times recently on business trips, and chose it initially because of location - across from the VIA station, and walking distance to my meetings. What a truly enjoyable experience - although room size varies considerably, overall high level of amenities, and excellent customer service. And the Gold floor lounge is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to relax, stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: cuestick99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Toronto Royal York several times a year for 10 years....obviously I prefer it...have stayed at other places too..the Rogers Renaissance, Intercontinental, among others. This hotel is a walk -into- yesteryear class. If you want trendy and modern, don't stay here. This is a very regal old dame and she has been around for a long time, and the hotel itself is impeccable in cleanliness, amenities and atmosphere. It's SO quiet in the hotel and if you want to-die-for food, just try their bakery products. So many choices for food, activities, and its the best place to just hang out and take it easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Peri34
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best customer service I have ever seen in a Hotel. Everything is looked after. The hotel is clean and has character.

Reviews.Title: “Red carpet treatment for President's club members?”
Reviews.Author: Mapamaclmach
Reviews.Content: We booked via British Airways in Newcastle and only afterwards read some of the reviews. Luckily we read one that advised us to join the President's club because we assume that that was what gave us an upgrade to a fantastic suite with a lounge with an en suite toilet and a bedroom with an en suite bathroom. The staff at reception were great and the hotel itself couldn't be in a better position with direct buses to the airport from outside the door and only a few minutes walk from the CN tower. We also booked a tour to Niagara Falls through B.A. and that too picked us up at the hotel. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Basic suites are great, luxury needs work”
Reviews.Author: hilamonster
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Royal York a handful of times and have always had excellent service. The location is fantastic and the lobby is beautiful. I had a great stay in the basic suites - it is a good size to have a couple friends over. In the luxury suites however you realize just how old this hotel is. The decor is very outdated and there is a big old tube television in the middle of the suite. There is too much empty space, chips on the wall, old cheap picture frames falling off the walls, a pathetic looking kitchen and sad green plants. It is definitely due for a makeover but the service makes up for the holes in appearance. Great for a pre-party with friends but not a loud and crazy hotel in general. Food downstairs is also quite good, albeit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, great location...”
Reviews.Author: trave1s22
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Toronto in the winter be prepared for the cold. There is one imporant thing to know, though - there is a PATH network of underground tunnels that allow you to walk around the city and stay out of the cold. The PATH system runs beneath the Fairmont Royal York and really made this a great place to say. It was a 15 minute walk to Eaton Center and 5 minute walk to the Air Canada Centre. The hotel itself features a grand lobby, several restaurants and a health club but the basic rooms look a bit old and in need of updating. The furniture in our room was definately showing signs of wear and there was no flat screen television. The hotel was a bit noisy in the morning as we could hear housekeeping walk the halls and knocking on doors at 8:30 a.m. on a Sunday morning. Overall, this was an affordable stay in the heart of the city and even in the frigid grips of winter we were able to walk around the city without risking frostbite. The concierge was extremely helpful in planning our meals and providing directions. Our trip to the hockey game was very easy given the PATH walkways and proximity to the Air Canada Centre. I would definitely come back in warmer weather and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel but could use some work”
Reviews.Author: BruceCalgary
Reviews.Content: I saw the New Year in with friends in Toronto and decided to check out this landmark or Toronto hospitality. Overall, the hotel was in better shape than what I was led to believe by some of the reviews on this site, but it could definitely use a facelift. New carpeting and more vibrant colours throughout would help energize things My room was comfortable, reasonably well appointed and functional, though a tad small, especially the bathroom. The pool and workout facilties were pretty decent, although the fitness centre was completely out of towels New Year's Day-if you didn't bring a towel with you, you had to run back to your room to get one. Another big annoyance was the Internet access---I couldn't even bring up the basic function menu on my t.v. for the first day of my stay and it took FIVE calls to the front desk before corrective action was taken and then another half day to get things working right. Even when I was able to access the Internet, I couldn't do any pre-flight check-in for the next leg of my journey because the Browser was not powerful enough to navigate the WestJet site. Trying to book a rental vehicle on Expedia was also a no-go. At the end of my stay, the front desk would only comp the value of my internet access, nothing more for the inconvenience involved. I had a deep discount Friends and Family rate and the value was about right for what I experienced, though, but I would have felt a little let-down by the whole experience if I had paid full fare.

Reviews.Title: “Always expect and receive very high standards”
Reviews.Author: djlottoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been patrons of the Royal York Toronto and in other cities over the years and have never been disappointed. It's nice to know in advance that you are not going to be upset with any services received at an establishment and we never have been.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Lady - slightly senile in places”
Reviews.Author: spold905
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a company "did not quite make it in time for Christmas" party also hosted at the hotel. Deliberated a bit about whether to stay here or trek out late at night to one of my more frequent boutique hotel haunts. I'm not a stranger to other Fairmonts on business travel but figured if I booked a Signature suite we would be in one of the nicely rennovated rooms rather than old "historical" ones. So being a "Presidents Club" member when we checked we were upgraded to a "Mid Parlour Suite". In reflection this is rather a mixed bag. Essentially this is two older rooms with a connecting door, partially rennovated (bathrooms and some fittings) but still tired in places, one room has a sofa-bed so I guess they are ideally allocated to families - each room has a standard bathroom. Aged carpets and chunky furniture (bedside table also turned sideways since it would not fit correctly oriented), new flat panel TVs, heating system noisy and blows dry air directly into your head at just above bed level - bad for sleeping. Free internet if your are a Presidents Club member. Lots of space though with two rooms. So it kind of worked - but left feeling we did not quite get the thing we booked - suspect a Signature suite while smaller would have been better appointed. BTW parked at the Green P on York St 50m from the hotel and paid $16 for parking as opposed to the $40 hotel fee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: JosephCrelli
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there for 3 days while our youngest was at Sick Kids Childrens Hospital. We had great service, but one person stands out and that was our Room Attendant Erin. She was so great that she came on her day off and watched our two little ones so my wife and I could have a few hours to de-stress. Erin also sent us a beautiful card and gift certificates to the food outlets in the hospital. The staff at the Royal York were all great, and we will be advising everyone we know to go there. Well done Royal York for hiring such caring people, especially Erin ( Room Attendant ).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but rooms in need of updating”
Reviews.Author: ZigZag5
Reviews.Content: Overall the Royal York is a great hotel. It has good amenities, in a centralized location and still carries a lot of the grandeur of a historic hotel. However I was a little disapointed in the room. It seemed very old and tired looking and was in desperate need of a makeover. Not what I was expecting for such a famous hotel and especially for a Fairmont. Hopefully hotel modernization is within their furture plans. Overall it was a good stay and would recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “They've lost the plot”
Reviews.Author: geedee7
Reviews.Content: I got a "prepaid special" rate of $175 (plus plus) for a night. It's a Fairmont, it has to be good! I tried to check in at 1450.... room not ready, check in time is 1500. Tried to check in at 1505... still not ready! Unlike a previous reviewer, I was offered nothing. I eventually got checked in at 1600..... The coffee maker didn't work, the internet cable was mashed up in a bunch of tangled wires behind the "desk" and I noted a bottle of water cost $6.50!! The internet was an extra $13.95 per day and parking was $40! I was scared to breathe as I knew it would cost me! The rooms were standard size, and poorly decorated. For an "upmarket" hotel, it's pretty dismal. In a nutshell, if there'd been a Holiday Inn next door for half the price, I would have taken it. The rooms are the same, the internet is included, as is parking. For twice the money, the FRY offered nothing like twice the experience. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel, but needs renos.”
Reviews.Author: luvjasperdog
Reviews.Content: Our party stayed at the Royal York on the night of December 26. We had two Deluxe rooms and a regular Fairmont Room. The Deluxe rooms were very spacious with a separate sleeping area, large sitting area, TV's in both rooms, 2 bathrooms, and work desk. The furniture was good quality but some of it was showing its age. The wallpaper looked as though it was very old and needed replacing. The bathtubs in each bathroom looked like the originals... could stand to be replaced. Having said all of that, although everything looked a bit dated in the Deluxe rooms, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Check-in was fast and friendly. We had asked that two of the rooms be close together as one of the rooms was for my elderly parents. We wanted one of the other parties in an adjoining room or across the hall in case my parents needed assistance. When we checked in we were advised that they had indeed looked after the request, two of the rooms had consecutive room numbers Front desk staff said the rooms were across the hall from each other. However, when we went to the floor, the rooms were actually down the hall around 2 corners apart, even though they were one number apart!!! Staff thought they had fulfilled our request, but obviously got it wrong. The Fairmont room was the most up to date room as far as decor, everything in it looked as though it was not too old. The room was very nice. We got real bargains on these rooms - $180 for the Deluxe Rooms on a high floor with views, and $127 for the Fairmont room. If I had paid regular price in high season for the Deluxe Rooms, I would have felt a little cheated. However, I thought we did very well for the price. When we went to have breakfast or brunch on Sunday morning around 10:00 a.m., we were told that the restaurant was closed. There was nowhere in the hotel to have a meal. All that was open was the Epic lounge, where the prices are just silly. So we ended up having to take a taxi elsewhere for brunch. Two of us went to the Epic lounge for coffee at about 4:00 p.m. After waiting about 10 minutes for service, we ordered one latte (that came in a small coffee cup/saucer) and one regular coffee. After about another 10 minutes, someone else came by and asked if we'd ordered, and we said we'd ordered 2 coffees some time ago, and hadn't seen the server since. The coffees arrived shortly thereafter. We then got a bill for $12.00 for our two coffees, with no refills! The afternoon before my parents went to the Epic Lounge and ordered one small plate with sliced meats and cheeses and 2 coffees and were billed over $40.00. This was all that was open for eating while we were there. We did enjoy our stay at the Royal York. The lobby is fabulous, the location is excellent for transportation, walking and seeing sights, hockey, basketball and baseball venues. Views from upper flooors are great. The hotel is really beautiful. It's worth staying there if you get a good price - but beware if you go in high season, you'll probably feel like you paid too much.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: My_lover_boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the RYH due to location (we had a business commitment 5 minutes away). The Corporate Rate we paid was $129.00 which was too much for our room and service. There was rust on the bathroom ceiling, paint was peeling, tiles and grout in the bathroom were coming away from the walls, furniture was very tired, not sufficient towels for 2 guests and when I asked house keeping for another towel they were not pleased. We had stayed there years ago and the room was tired then, but not this bad so we thought it had just deteriorated even more so we did not call to be moved. At breakfast the next morning I ordered french toast which took 20 minutes to arrive and when it did it tasted like onions and was cold, no apology from the waiter nor did the manager come to our table which is customary in other 4/5 star hotels we had stayed in to ensure we were happy customers. 20 minutes later when my second plate arrived the waiter said "I hope you like the taste of these ones." And, yes, we were charged for the order....and still no apology. It took us 31 minutes to check out because they were understaffed. When we were asked how our stay was, and we explained our room and how disappointed we were, the woman behind the counter said and I quote "well, you got an excellent corporate rate, so you get what you pay for. Had you called to complain, we would have moved you to a renovated room." This hotel is well past it's prime.

Reviews.Title: “Inexcusably poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: EscapesfromTexas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a business stay. When I arrived at this hotel, my room was unavailable at 3PM and I was asked to return at 5PM. The room was still not ready for assignment. Ultimately, the room was unavailable until after 10PM. I was neither compensated for the delayed access to the booked room, nor for the inconvenience of having to change into my conference attire in the steamy fitness center. I was promised an upgrade, but this also did not materialize, as I was finally booked into a standard room. I travel on business about twice a month and to Toronto about 3-4 times per year. I will not stay here again, nor will I book a Fairmont in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt as grand as anticipated....”
Reviews.Author: emdavis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fairmont for 5 nights in December in Toronto. Very grand, majestic foyer etc. However, the rooms are tiny (double double rooms) and tv needs a serious update. There were trays of room service food left out in the hallway for days at a time - granted it is a massive hotel but it was still a little off putting. Good location, especially as you dont need to go outside to reach the train or the underground path. Some renovations and improvements needed for an otherwise beautiful hotel in a great spot in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in TO”
Reviews.Author: Travel_lovin
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is a gorgeous, stately hotel, and all service received was beyond compare. All-around a fantastic time was had. I don't know about the 'shoddy' rooms a couple of people have mentioned, as all of my stays have been in top-notch renovated rooms, and very tastefully decorated. Epic Lounge for breakfast is a must, the food is spectacular! The shops in the 'shoppers alley' are really great, nice products, great staffers. Easily one of the best hotels I've ever been to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night on a stop over to drive up to Blue Mountain 2 Â½ hours away December 11. The room that I booked was a king harbor view room. Tip: donâ€™t book one of these rooms if you want a harbor view. As I had never been to Toronto before, I wasnâ€™t aware of the layout. I even questioned the front desk to see if they gave us the wrong room, but noâ€¦a harbor view room is a distant view of the harbor, only seen in the day between the gaps in buildings. The Harbor is about one kilometer from the hotel. If I had known that, I would never have paid extra for that room. The hotel is ok, and the staff are pleasant. The general room is small, but ok for a small visit. Iâ€™m sure there are better hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good on the outside.....”
Reviews.Author: lapis986
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times. Huge hotel that is a landmark in Toronto. Rooms BADLY need renovating. Considering that all the big banks headquarters are next door, you'd think some enterprising banker would just lend them a few hundred million for a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: rossmorey
Reviews.Content: beautiful hotel,had reservations for almost 2 months,check in time was 3oclock ,tried to check in at 3:15,told room was not ready was asked to have a drink or somthing for 20 dollars on the hotel,checked on room after 1 hour still not ready,checked on room after 2 hours still not ready ,was givin 60 dollars to have supper in the lougne, checked.on room still not ready so we checked our bags and walked to play we had tickets for,at 10 min to 7oclock the hotel called and said our room was ready . next day we stood in line again for 25 min to check out when we finnaly got to the counter was asked to wait so she could take someones lost cell phone to somewhere. like I said the hotel is beautiful but I dont think we will revist it again

Reviews.Title: “its was excellent”
Reviews.Author: TaraJordan
Reviews.Content: right down town from everything, walkin distance to everything & anything. muchmusic is a lil walk, but the mall, and hockey hall of fame, and the sky dome, n CN tower are less then 5 minute walks away, get places to eat right near by.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: priteshUk
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i have stayed at Located within 5 minute walk to CN Tower, and just opposite train station. Downtown hotel so has numerous places to wander at day and night. Eaton Centre and bus station are close so another advantage Room service is excellent, but the biggest assets are its staff. From the doorman to the concierage this hotel is fit for royalty (as proved by the Queen of England's visit here) Definately stay here again in fact i would not consider other hotels nearby

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AboulFawares
Reviews.Content: I always maintained that there are five star hotels, and then there is a Fairmont. Fairmonts always remain to be one notch above in terms of service. I have always felt that they go the extra mile to make your stay special. The location was good and the union subway station is just steps away (through a tunnel). The hotel is very luxurious although the electronics in the rooms are dated. Expensive parking ($40 /day). Left very happy! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Still grand, great service”
Reviews.Author: LScott52
Reviews.Content: The grande dame of Toronto hotels is still grand. The lobby is unsurpassed for elegance and atmosphere, and is especially lovely during the Christmas season. Rooms tend to the small side unless you book a suite. As a Fairmont member, I was able to upgrade to a parlour suite and it was fabulous - very spacious and comfortable. The view was nothing special - roof tops and office towers. Service is impeccable from check in to check out - staff in the Library Bar, valet parking, housekeeping, etc. are all friendly and helpful. Epic is a truly excellent restaurant with a diverse selection of entrÃ©es. Our dinners were delicious and the service fabulous. York's Kitchen is where breakfast is served and it, too, is very good. We've been staying at the Royal York for many years and have noted the lack of turnover in the dining room and restaurant staff - this speaks well of the hotel and how it's employees are treated. The hotel's location across from Union Station is a bonus, but be aware that the tunnel between the hotel and the station is currently closed for renovations. One small quibble - why have the televisions in the rooms not been upgraded to large LCD flat screens? Very small, cathode ray TVs are still in the rooms. On this stay, I thought the mattress was beginning to show its age - a bit saggy. Overall though, the Royal York is still a wonderful hotel and one that we will stay at again when we visit friends in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous during Christmas Season”
Reviews.Author: travel81king
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness: The Lobby was absolutely gorgeous. Decorated for Christmas with a lot of energy from all the hotel patrons enjoying the scenery. Rooms were spotless (except for a few dead flys in the bathroom light fixture, but not disgusting). Location: Steps to everything. Connected to Union Station (Via "the Path" underground retail area connecting the financial District with UNion). The Air Canada Centre (ACC) is then connected to Union. Rooms: I had the smallest of the rooms, buit plenty large enough for my Girlfriend and I to enjoy some take out sushi on the coffee table and in room love couch (Also turns into a pull out bed if required). beds were fantastically comfortable and linens were crisp and clean. Service: Had to get directions to the nearest take out Sushi (Beinehanas is in the lower level, but was not looking to spend that much) so the Conceirge made a few calls for us and referred us to a nearby sushi place that was unbelieveably good! Check in and out was easy and the staff were very helpful. Value: I thought it was great value for the location. All the other comparable hotels in the area were as much or more expensive. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking to spend a romantic night in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Tired lady”
Reviews.Author: RobertNewYork72
Reviews.Content: Impressive lobby. Excellent location accessible to subway & train station underground which would be valuable once the snow falls. The rooms are dated: high ceilings, heavy furniture, small windows. Be sure to request a non-smoking room as the smoking rooms stink of years of smoke. Overall an adequate business hotel but I wouldn't stay here with my wife for a 'romantic' vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Remember this hotel is ancient - and it shows!”
Reviews.Author: Coal_Harbour
Reviews.Content: Great location but a run down and outdated hotel. My room had torn carpet, peeling paint and wall paper, hot and cold water surges in the shower. In other words a one star room in a three star hotel. Some of the rooms have been remodeled so if you have to stay there make sure you request one. I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Generally Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Grundlegibson
Reviews.Content: Service is great, hotel lobby and exterior is beautiful and classic. Hotel is well located. Unfortunately, one generally spends most hotel time in a room (as opposed to the lobby) and the rooms are terrible. Although clean, they are tired, dated and lacking amenities. My opinion is that Fairmont is not keeping pace with similar class hotels with respect to the actual accomodation portion and I will be staying in other newer hotels as a result. I would suggest this hotel is more appealing to seniors or those who value antique style historical buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, needs a star removed from rating.”
Reviews.Author: Nilhas
Reviews.Content: I booked months in advance for a business trip. Even so when I arrived they had given away my room and said "all we have left is a disgusting, old run down room that reeks of smoke and is worse than many many 1 star flop houses." It was quite late and after a long flight we took it but we may as well have slept on the street for all the comfort. Next I called room service and was told "the lady is gone for now but she will call you back" CLICK. Hmm, so I tried to sleep but the smoke permeating everything in the room made that impossible. The next day we were able to transfer to a newer none smoking room but no apology was offered and no discount was given. I will never stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone. Ruined my Toronto time.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Salafen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a large suite, huge space for 3 nights. Charming and traditional. Centrally appointed in CBD, bars, sports attractions, restaurants, shopping and transport nearby. Traditional victorian hotel befitting of any major city. Inventive window displays gives this hotel great kerb appeal with charming hatted doormen directing you up carpetted steps to an impressive bustling lobby, with courteous staff and informative concierge service. Small shopping area below lobby with Benihana restaurant, coffee shops and one off boutiques. Reliable and efficient business centre. This hotel is one of the larger hotels I would stay in however it had lots of charm and made a refreshing change to the quieter, and smaller more intimate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it is everything a Fairmont Can Be = Great.”
Reviews.Author: TroyandSuzuette
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. I recomend this hotel for sure. The hotel had very friendly, intellegent, happy helpful staff. The hotel has a lot of history. The hotel was clean. I found it to be a good deal for what we got, in downtown location, directly across from Union Station. There is also a very nice ladies Spa in the lowest level that is way cheaper then spa's in Halifax. My wife loved it and went there each day, for waxing, nails, a and a facial I think. There is a unique cigar/pipe shop also thatsells lead figures. A a wicket toy shop. Upstairs is an adequate spa, w/ pool. V clean. I got a massage but the massage girls talked too much. A deceint massage however, not hte best. Our room overlooked uniion station. No noise at all. The view was great. The roof of union staion is a dirty old mess of rusty sheet metal. Why that isn't used as a park or green space is beyond me. Would improve the view. The hotel room was not as clean as a Fairmount ussually should be. I stayed at the Fairmount in Calgary, Whistler, Banff and Lake Louise. They were all much cleaner rooms then the Royal York. In BC at Banff the room cleaner left his card under the bed that said " My name is Georgio and yes I cleaned here too" I loved it. It made me laugh and really put the icing on that stay for me. However the service for everthing else is just as good. The hotel is very close to everything downtown and on the PATH for shopping. The hotel has one resturant and it is good for breakfast. I had a personal Japanese man as my waiter and he was incredible as a waiter. Really professional. The chef is like super smart with the food, and any special orders, and I like d the chef a lot. Oh one more thing the hotel offerred and arranged for usa a free tour of the roof top gradens which was special of them, and they remembered it was our honeymoon. The hotel needed to offer a palce for formal dancing with some type of music, even recorded. I hope the hotel reads this and responds to me. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great traditional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gronzy
Reviews.Content: Keeping up it's great heritage, the Royal York is well located directly across from Union Station and close to many amenities in Toronto - Walking distance from the Hockey Hall of Fame, many restaurants and minutes from CN Tower. The room was both quiet and clean, though could still be a bit more updated. The Concierge desk very busy but good at assisting with bookings, and the gym/workout accommodation was better than other business hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pantha11
Reviews.Content: Great Location Fantastic Foyer Great restaurants Fantastic staff very small rooms very poor rooms As soon as you go to the rooms youn realise they are dated and in need of refurbishment. It is such a shame, the staff are amazinng, the most helpfull and professional that I have encountered. Sadly the rooms just need sorting out.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Downtown Hotel, good location, but don't expect luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jhenstock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a business trip to Kitchener. My company was kind enough to move me to a Toronto hotel for the weekend, but I did not get a choice of hotel. The Fairmont is an old, impressive looking building, the lobby area is large with lots of marble and chandeliers. The bedroom wasn't huge, and the bathroom was on the small side, but it had a King bed, desk, table & chairs, and was clean and comfortable. If you're expecting luxury though, you won't find it in the standard rooms.The room wasn't any better than the Radisson I stayed in the previous week, and the bathroom was smaller in the Royal York. You would not get 2 people in it at once, unless one was in the shower. That said, it's in an excellent location to see Toronto - I walked nearly everywhere. The meal I had in their gastropub 'Pipers' was very nice, and the staff were very accomodating, finding me a seat at the bar as the restuarant was full. Lovely chicken macaroni cheese, just what was needed after being caught out in a storm! Overall, a pleasant stay in a good location, but the bathroom is too small for a couple for any longer than 2 nights, and there are probably cheaper hotels with similar amenities in good locations.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto's Grand Railway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RailwayHobo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Royal York at least three times now... always when arriving or departing Toronto by train. As a former CP property, it is (not surprisingly) located directly across from Toronto's main rail station. While most guests at the hotel no longer arrive by train, it remains a very attractive and comfortable place to stay when visiting Toronto. The rooms are comfortable and quiet and the Internet is free (assuming you apply for a free Fairmont Presidents Club membership before you arrive). I prefer well maintained older (pre WWII) hotels to the more modern variety. I also have generally had good experiences with the various CP/Fairmont properties I have visited over the years. The Royal York is no exception. There are several restaurants in the hotel; all that I have tried were good or better than good. The lobby area is active and vibrant: the hotel is a welcoming and lively place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Not So Royal”
Reviews.Author: ChequeMark
Reviews.Content: Unlike others I was not expecting a Four Seasons experience while at the Royal York. I was hoping for a clean room and good service in a location that was close to the activities that we planned on taking in while in town. What we got was somewhat different. The room was small and out of date. Cleaning was OK but not what one might expect for the price. Food was good but overpriced for what you got. The service was so far below even the most basic of expectations. We asked the concierge for walking directions to one of the attractions we were looking to visit. the response can only be described as rude. We were spoken to as if we had just been violently ill on her desk. The look on her face was as if speaking to us was beneath her stature in life. On top of that the directions she provided were incorrect and left us two blocks North of our destination. I was so put off by the experience that upon my return to the hotel, I requested to speak with the manager. The Duty Manager presented himself and listened to my concerns and responded not with an apology but with â€œI donâ€™t understand why she was like that she is a very good employeeâ€�. The net effect was the equivalent if saying that I must have been wrong in my view of this experience. I do not live in the illusion that the â€œcustomer is always rightâ€�, in fact the reality is that there are times when the customer may well be wrong. That said a little empathy and a simple apology would have gone a long way. It is safe to assume that I will not return to the Royal York anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overrated”
Reviews.Author: nicogi
Reviews.Content: When you go to a Fairmont hotel, you have expectations. The Royal York is in serious need of updating. Pretty much everything from the lobby to the rooms is faded and looks old. Rust stains on bathroom walls and floor, which make you wonder about the general cleanliness. Let's not forget the smelly and dirty corridors leading to the parking garage. We got heavily discounted rates for this trip and, given this hotel's perfect location, it was okay. But please do not, under any circumstances, pay the full fare. There are much better hotels in Toronto, for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable, central - perfect city break hotel”
Reviews.Author: ortonioni
Reviews.Content: This hotel really exceeded our expectations. It's big, it's classy, it's central. The staff are just so helpful and pleasant. We got a really good deal here and couldn't believe our luck. The room was always spotless, and though it's a large hotel, it was quiet and well soundproofed. Good sized rooms and comfy beds and room facilities. Just opposite the main train station/metro and a stone's throw from the CN Tower and the ferry out to Toronto Island - not tomention some good restaurants and bars. Made our stay in Toronto just perfect. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jman12345
Reviews.Content: The hotel Royal York is probably the best hotel in Toronto. The hotel is located downtown and it is right across from a train station (there is no noise from the trains though) and in the basment it connects to a subway station. The hotel is old and apparently haunted on the 8th floor. We stayed on the 8th floor and we didn't notice any stange occurances excpet the TV turned on spontanously. All though the pictures show a flat screen TV there aren't any. The rooms aren't very large but they have very nice victorian style decor and have a mini bar and safe inculded too. There is a large pool and fitness center located on its own floor. The thing about the pool is its more of a lap pool then a lesuire pool and there are certain times were lap swimming is only permitted. The restuarants are exspensive and thats why we only eat there once. There is a cafe in the basment that is great for a cheap and delicous breakfast with bagels ands sandwichs. The one downside is that if you come here for business the internet is quite expensive if you are not part of the presidents club. Also, the maid service at the hotel is slow at times. Overall the experince was great and I enjoyed my stay at the Fairmount Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location with the best breakfast in town!”
Reviews.Author: Carolsailor
Reviews.Content: Only problem we had: The bell- hop took our bags on the curb & assured us they would be to our room quickly as we wanted to go out directly after checking in. Well, after 30 minutes we called & asked & it still took another 10 minutes. Way too slow for me! The breakfast in the am was suburb, nice sellection, good service & tasty. The room was nicely decorated & bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine!”
Reviews.Author: yukisweetea
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Fairmonts around the country and this hotel is definitely the one that needs room renovations however I got a great price and other than the rooms being a little older and small, everything was great. It was comfortable, quiet, and everything was in good condition. There is a whole underground area with stores and fast food which was a nice surprise, especially if you're on a budget and not interested in anything too fancy. The hotel was the perfect refuge from a long day of being a tourist. Just keep your expectations reasonable and snag a great price and everything will be just fine!

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Royal York, the gem of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ahuspen
Reviews.Content: Not only was the staff incredibly friendly, helpful and nice as could be, the location was wonderful for our occasion of visiting Toronto: The Toronto Film Festival. There were daily media junkets held in the Fairmont Royal York, so the lobby made for a perfect view of people watching and star gawking! Also wth connections directly to the Metro, Union station and the underground PATH walk way, convenience was the name of the game. We will likely stay in this gorgeous hotel next year and for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was elegant and historic located in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jleong16
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Fairmont Royal York. Checking in was easy and did not have to wait long. The staff was attentive and very helpful with directions. The hotel is located within walking distance of much of Toronto's landmarks including the CN Tower, Rogers Center, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc. The room was small, but clean. Had a view of Union Station. Hotel was accomodating with easy reservations for transportation to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ColinTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Royal York for four nights in Oct 09. It is a top class hotel and amazing value if you search for deals on the internet. As our guidebook pointed out, The Queen chooses to stay there when visiting Toronto ... what better endorsement can you ask for?! Toronto Tip: Kensington Market is a must to experience the rich blend of cultures Toronto has to offer in a buzzing, friendly environment

Reviews.Title: “Cash to burn? Here's your place”
Reviews.Author: Han_of_Dan
Reviews.Content: I lucked out I guess and got a room here as part of a conference I was attending. So reduced rate and easy booking plus I'm not really paying in the end. The Royal York really is very grand although I have no idea how it compares with other luxury hotels being more of a b&b or hostel person. What I liked was friendly quick service, a really comfortable room and a superb location. I didn't really have a view as such but was so busy I didn't care and got a good sleep each night. Location is good in relation to the airport buses, VIA, GO and subway stations. The lobby is pretty nice to sit around in as well. I didn't like not having breakfast included in the price when most places manage this, the buffet and room service options essentially prices themselves out of the equation although the bagel/muffin place was alright I got food out a few times as well. A last thing which struck me as odd, given the staff swarming the place, was that used room service plates etc got left lying around in the corridors for ages. Also, getting the room spread up sometimes was quite late in the day, 4pm one time, which again is odd when there were staff all over the place. Didn't really bother me though. For a bit of luxury and if you have the cash to splash I guess it's as good a place as any.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with a central location”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofnextholiday
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel by train from Montreal and stayed for 4 nights. The location was excellent as Union Station is just accross from the Hotel. The lobby is lovely with beautiful arangements of fresh flowers and elegant furniture. Had to wait a while to check in as it seems a very busy hotel, but did not mind as I was admiring the lobby, but this may be frustrating if you are travelling on business and need to be somewhere urgently. They could definitely do with a few more staff on reception! The concierge desk was extreamely helpful and had a good selection of maps and leaflets and the staff were very knowledgable. The room was not the largest hotel room I have ever stayed in, but it was beautifully appointed and very elegant. The bed was extreamely comfortable and the room was quiet. There was a safe in the room, which was very useful. Had breakfast one day in the hotel which was very good, although fairly pricey. There are good places to eat evening meals along harbour front and also to the right of the hotel. The pool was very nice and not busy when we used it. Did not like having to walk through the gym to enter the pool, but the overall pool area made up for this minor inconveinience. The hotel is connected to the underground shopping malls, so this is very useful. Overall, a really lovely hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again if we ever had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Preserving the splendour”
Reviews.Author: UK_Basball_Fans
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is enough to convert any discerning traveller. Having joined the Fairmont Presidents Club at a hotel earlier in our trip, check-in was very prompt at the dedicated desk. (FP club essential if you want free internet access). Excellent location just across from the main rail station and close to main shopping areas. Also close to the CN tower and Rogers Centre for baseball (main reason for our visit to Toronto). Lovely toiletries, restocked daily. Would recommend "Over Easy" for breakfast at 56 Yonge Street (6 min walk) or that you consult the concierge for other options. We received excellent service and the concierge kept our bags on our last day until we were ready to leave. Recommend bus service from hotel to airport as it stops outside and this hotel is the penultimate stop on their route, so travel time is circa 45 mins subject to traffic and cost is very reasonable compared to taxi. We would like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gem2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royl York for 4 nights, excellent hotel and glad we chose this hotel. The hotel reception is lovely, concierge were more than helpful and all staff very friendly. The room was great, view of the CN Tower which was nice, 2 double beds, TV (although not much on!), en suite bathroom which was always very clean. Only critism was the bed which was too hard for me.The hotel has a spa whith jacuzzi, steam, saun and fitness room which is comlimentary. Location was excellent, the PATH system is connected underneath the hotel and leads out to Union Station. CN Tower is across the road and there are plenty of bars nearby. Yonge Street, main street... is 5 minutes walk from th ehotel... all round excellent trip. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A Staff to Guest Ratio that only a Bean Counter could love”
Reviews.Author: PhileasFoggontour
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at Fairmont Hotels, but the Royal York falls short of what you would expect. The public areas are nice, if crowded and the rooms (I stayed on the Club Floor) small. At some point the hotel is clearly going to need some investment to bring it's standards up, but the present problem is the standard of service. The service in the hotel is poor, and if any problems are encountered the staff have a habit of pushing you from one desk to another. To get even simple problems fixed there seems a need to escalate the problem to a manager. Requests get forgotten (can you make up the room early?) and apologies aren't forthcoming. Even on the Club floor the service was less than impressive. It seemed that if you were a regular guest (and perhaps a captain of industry) there was significant grovelling and gesticualtion. For the unwashed others any requests were met with sparing response. The valet parking, given the $40 a day, was poor. The constant reminder of needing at least 30 minutes to have a car ready, and the waiting on the street until a valet was available really didn't suggest value or service. At times the valet area is a complete mess with lines of waiting cars. My guess on this hotel is given the huge number of rooms to fill each evening (this is a big and sprawling hotel) they are let at low rates to tourist parties. As a result the hotel has a large number of guests, but the resulting lower revenues only pay for a less than necessary number of staff. Staff always seemed harried, and wanting to move onto the next guest, rather than deal with the current issue. Service then suffers, badly. When I was there a large part of the lobby was let out to a film shoot, which the hotel seemed quite proud of ('please ignore the sniper on the roof'). It might have been revenue for the hotel but it did close off some of the entrances to the hotel and (more meaningfully for me) meant that the nicest bar (the Library) was unvavailable for one day and one night). Overall the feeling is that the hotrel is watching the bottom line more than the service and needs of the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to major attractions, felt like a Royal with fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: Jenn1334
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a musical show, and found a fantastic "Bed, Breakfast, and Parking" package through Royal York. We spent $120, and got valet parking, fantastic buffet breakfast, and a gorgeous room within walking distance to our venue. Highly recommend to anyone. This was my second time visiting the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: chickflix
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending the Fan Expo. I checked in around 1:30pm even though check-in is supposed to be around 3pm. There was a long line up of other Expo people checking in but the line went quickly. The location of this hotel is unbeatable. I walked everywhere I went throughout the weekend. The room was average size; I was impressed with the cleaners work as after they cleaned the room they rearranged my belongings so they were exactly as I left them. If you book ahead of time you can get a rate that's half the price of nearby hotels. I will use this hotel every time I go to Toronto from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Classy if a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: CanariesPA
Reviews.Content: As noted, the Royal York is a wonderful old railroad hotel, with fine lobby space and ambience. As with older hotels generally, the rooms are a bit smaller than in newer buildings, and a few of the fixtures, etc., are worn. I had none of the service or cleanliness issues that others report. Service in fact was quick and courteous, and billing was accurate (important since I split my room bill with a colleague). The location is excellent for downtown business & culture, near the convention center, CN Tower, ballpark, symphony hall, etc. The university is not far to the north and the cathedral district to the east.
