My only real complaints were, again, room size; shower water pressure, too, was a bit weaker than I would have preferred; and to charge for internet access these days is just gouging in the hope that it can be put on the guest's expense account (I wish). The place isn't cheap, even with a convention discount, so while rooms are what they are, the latter at least could be dealt with. Still, everything worked, and I enjoyed the ambiance of the public spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: DebCOntario
Reviews.Content: I found the Fairmont Royal York very impressive and grand. I enjoy old buildings that have style and grandeur. I had a room with a harbour view. It was very comfortable and I slept very soundly. Having shoulder problems, comfortable beds are very important for me, and I am never disappointed at Fairmonts.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel don't go there”
Reviews.Author: GGGSarnia
Reviews.Content: i was in toronto on business and the conference was at the Fairmont Royal York. My interior designer recommended staying there ( he originates from Canada). What a mistake to make!! I arrived at the hotel impressed by the imposing facade outside and the enormous reception area. Check in was easy, efficient and friendly. No offer of help with my bags I got in the lift - it didnt go to my floor. I had to get our and move across to another bank of lifts. Arrived at my room and there were dirty dishes and glasses outside the door. Stepped over those into the smallest hotel room in the world. It had a dirty shag pile carpet that was very worn, a view of a wall, the TV did not work ( they didnt fix it despite numerous reminders over 4 days ) There were holes in the sheets, no room service menu,. the bathroom was minute. One of my colleagues, a larger framed man, could only back into his bathroom in order to sit on the toilet!!! The worst thing about the room however was the wardrobe ( closet in Canadian ). This was built into the wall and the depth was less than a foot.. In order to hang clothes you had to open the wardrobe doors ( making the room even smaller ) and hang the clothes with half of every shirt and suit sticking out into the room. Who on earth designed such a useless wardrobe???????? I decided to see how long it would take the hotel to move the dirty plates and glasses from just outside my room. I stayed for four nights and they were still there in exctly the same place when i left> for all i know they are still there now. Gym and swimming pool were excellent and open 24/7 which is a first for me. I didnt use my bathroom preferring to shower at the gym. Highlight was going to see the Blue jays against NY Yankees. Restaurants in the hotel are OK, bit dirty, but good service. I discovered on my last day a lovely bar at one end of the hotel that was great with excellent food. Underneath the hotel is a small shoppping mall with an excellent barbers. My hair was cut really well and the shave / head massage a real treat that I wish I could have regularly. This hotel is tired and needs some work especially to the bedrooms. When i return to Toronto I will be looking for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but too big?”
Reviews.Author: dshep
Reviews.Content: An impressive entrance and location. Rooms fine. We just a problem with the bathroom in that the bath had a crack in the base that looked as if there had been an attempt to mend it (which had failed). I do not think they should have allocated the room in that condition. When I mentioned it at reception, there were promises of an immediate check and reallocation of room if necessary - for when we returned after a day out. When we did return, we then (while facing a deadline for a meal out) had to wait a couple of hours for a different room and then to be moved to it. Perhaps too big (and not enough staff) to manage?

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: Deepa8
Reviews.Content: Booked my room through hotels.com (saved $200 in comparison to price quote by their reservation desk). Royal York is known for it's history, the rooms have a bit to desire for someone of my generation. Great location. Staff was amazing, upgraded to a suite for my wedding night.

Reviews.Title: “As Royal as it Gets!”
Reviews.Author: EdmAng
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience and highly recommend this place to stay in downtown Toronto. I was there for business and came down a few days earlier to explore around. This hotel was right central and convenient for EVERYTHING! When I arrived in the lobby I was taken back by how authentic and rich it looked, my jaw dropped. I arrived before check in and they had a room ready for me right away. The room was newly renovated and very nice and clean, only downside is the rooms are quite small. I took advantage of the health club for swims, hot tubs, workouts and steams and it was great... they even had nice refreshing grapefruit water in the pool area to drink. I especially enjoyed having a robe in my room to go to and from the health club, just a nice added touch that made it more comfortable. I never ate at any of the restaurants as it was quite expensive if all you are looking for is a quick bite. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel, the value is definately there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cmstudebaker
Reviews.Content: We got a room at this hotel using lastminutetravel.com, and was not aware of the name of the hotel until after we made the reservation and pre-paid for it. We paid $140 for a 4-5 star hotel and ended up with the Fairmont Royal York. After reading the reviews on here, I was disappointed and lowered my expectations, but figured it wasn't a bad price and all you really do is sleep and shower in the room anyway. And since it was prepaid, we had no choice. I also signed up for the President's club online, which was free, although they required a credit card to put on file which they said was for future reservations. I'm sure they can't charge me anything without my authorization. Upon arrival, I went to the President's club check-in desk, where there was no line, and was promptly assisted. I was told that I had reserved a smoking room, to which I replied that I had reserved non-smoking, but she then informed me that we had gotten a complimentary upgrade from the regular hotel room we booked to a 1 bedroom suite. So I decided to accept this and determine if I felt that the room smelled of smoke once I got there. They told us that the room had two separate entrances in which either key would work. We found the room and I noticed that the hallway smelled heavily of smoke and was very concerned that the room was going to be the same. Upon entering, we were absolutely awe struck with the beauty and size of the room! The decor was victorian style, with two separate living room areas, a dining room table, kitchenette (no appliances, except a fridge), two full bathrooms, two coat closets, king size bed and a walk-in closet! There was a door between the one living room area/bedroom area and the second living room area, that could be shut if you wished. There were bath robes in both bathrooms, so a total of 4 bath robes! The toiletries were wonderful. The bed was soooo comfortable and had a wonderful down comforter. We slept GREAT! A few minutes after we got into our room, the front desk called to see how we liked our room and, of course, we told them it was absolutely incredible! Then about 5 minutes later, housekeeping came to the door with bottles of water, when just a minute before, I had said how I could use some water! I'm not sure why some of the reviews on here were bad, but if these people stayed at the same hotel that we did, apparently not all rooms are created equally! Typically, during my travels, I figure a room is just a room and we don't usually spend much time in it, but we made a special point to spend more time in this room because it was so beautiful! I would not hesitate to go back to this hotel anytime I am in Toronto! Great location, great city, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Without its location, there's not much here”
Reviews.Author: Tallguy2
Reviews.Content: If you like "charm" in the massive, Stalinist Gothic style for $380 a night single, then this is for you. But if you're looking for comfort and value, run away. To be fair, this is the period property that Fairmont seems to specialize in, albeit without the care & attention devoted to SOME of their other locations. Note to Fairmont: simply attaching your name to a marginally improved hotel doesn't bring it into Four Seasons competition. The chain is capable of doing a good job, as my stay at the Fairmont Monte Carlo evidenced last year. But caveat emptor at the York. Rooms are tiny, bathrooms even moreso. You need to close the door before standing at the sink?? The "View Room" upgrade provided a second window looking at other hotel rooms to compliment the scenic vista of the train station roof across the street. This from the 10th floor. Maintenance is sketchy, as the abrupt failure of a drapery track in the middle of the night proved. So did the multiple holes in the ceiling evidence the slapdash approach to repair. Heavy drapes and short plastic screw anchors don't mix all that well, but Fairmont keeps trying. On the positive side, the air/heat worked well, the elevators were reasonably prompt for a 1,000 plus room hotel, and there are reports that the food is adequate, if severely overpriced. And it's linked, not only with Toronto's union station, but with the vast underground network of shops and interconnected office towers. Assuming that's what you're after. For the large hotel experience along the waterfront, try the Intercontinental or Harbour Castle. Look elsewhere, too, if you like the theory of staying in a glamerous old hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: gravey2000
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Toronto for a conferene and booked a room with a king bed. On arrival I was told all they had was a room with a queen bed. I reluctantly took it. It turns out that it was more of a updated closet which was located right next to a bank of ancient elevators that made a tremendous racket all night long. Finally called down to the front desk at midnight asking for a different room and was told that nothing was available and there was nothing they could do to help me. I spent the next two hours calling other hotels to book a different room for the remainder of my stay and finally got a very nice room at a Ramada for much less money. This is what really bothers me. Those elevators have been there for decades as has that room and there is no way that any hotel should consider that acceptable. The fact that they knowingly rent that room out boggles me. For some reason I am drawn to older well known hotels but in my experience they frequently disappoint but none as much as the Fairmont Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Too many cut corners for a "luxury" hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lil-Lea
Reviews.Content: The Royal York was quite the disappointment for us. After hearing so much about it and its glorious history, we thought we would be in for a special treat. We were sadly mistaken. The wallpaper in the room was peeling and literally stapled back to the wall with big ugly staples, very small bathroom which looked as though it hadnt been redone in well over 30 years with a gaping big crack in the sink and mysterious soft squishy spots on the shower/tub floor. Filthy tile and grouting. This luxury hotel is also the first I have stayed in over 5 years now that still sports a tiny 28 inch (at most) tube television.... even the cheap hotels I have stayed in have updated in that regard. Wires sticking out all over like a rats nest under the desk (no wireless internet) Our neighbors smoked and loudly partied until 3:30am when I could no longer bare it and called service, no apologies made whatsoever, though someone did come and tell them to quiet down.... they continued smoking and hence made our room smell like an ashtray. Its hard to rationalize spending hundreds of dollarsper night in a hotel you can't even get to sleep in. The flagship restaurant Epic was closed while we were there, huge disappointment as we were planning on having dinner and tea there. No alternatives were given. We were told the Library Bar had an extended menu with items similar to Epic.... the waitress had no idea what we were talking about and the menu was full of sandwiches save a steak. We ended up eating dinner in their restaurant Pipers and all of us getting ill. By the way do not order the duck confit poutine... the "duck" is actually chicken. Valet was ridiculous... for $40 a night for parking you shouldn't be expected to wait 10 minutes and end up hunting down your own valet and bellhop. Thankfully it wasn't cold... I would have been very angry to stand in the cold waiting for someone to take our car and luggage.... unless you want to lug your stuff up stairs to get to check in... you have no option but to use the bellhop service... trust me.. I thought about it after waiting for so long. I don't really have much good to say about the Royal York.... the view was nice.... the beds were comfortable. Nice water pressure in the shower and hot water. Linens were all clean and fresh. The staff courteous... a fantastic concierge, I don't remember his name, but he was an Englishman and very knowledgeable and helpful. If nothing else now I can say I've stayed there... but most likely wont again.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder”
Reviews.Author: briggott
Reviews.Content: Depending on your love for historic hotels, you will either love the Royal York for its architecture or hate it because it's old. The room was quite spacious as far as older hotels go and the bathroom was expectedly small with no counter space. The closet was VERY small with only room for about 10 hangers and no extra space. Seriously the smallest closet I've ever seen. Location was good and right across from Union Station which made our rental car pick up very convenient when we left town. We could easily walk to Eaton Centre for shopping, St. Lawrence Market, Historic Distillery District, and Convention Centre from this hotel. Internet was $13.99/day with no free internet anywhere in the hotel...of anywhere else for that matter. We did find we could purchase internet for $9.99/day through a community-wide internet provider but we had to find that out on our own because the concierge at the hotel did not provide that information as an option.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Lady of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jkarennj
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of staying on the "Fairmont Gold" 12th floor for 5 nights recently while in town for a conference. The staff was always fantastic and anxious to make sure my stay was a good one. The room, while small, was perfectly comfortable. I was a bit disappointed with the quality of food at The Epic downstairs. The breakfast buffet was very average. Still, I would come back and stay at the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location, watch out for parking”
Reviews.Author: mjbbowls
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference. The hotel room was lovely and clean, but a little smaller than most. Staff was helpful. Amenities good. Location was great...in downtown, a few blocks from the lake, 1 block from subway, 4 blocks from CN Tower. Lots nearby. Parking was a surprise. When I finally found the garage for the hotel and parked, I asked at checkin to verify the rate and was told the garage is not connected to the hotel. The rates on garage were deceptive and it turns out they were $36/night. That surprised me. I would definitely stay here again, but find another place for my car.

Reviews.Title: “Good Toronto choice, expecially for the history”
Reviews.Author: Lovesanicehotel
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Royal York, particularly the opportunity to get a little historical magic and opulence without breaking the bank. Rooms were very reasonable here, especially compared with European hotels, and we felt that we got good value for money. The hotel is enormous, with many rooms so as we expected the room itself was a little dated. However it was very clean, relatively roomy and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. I really wanted to take it home with me! As it is a big chain and a big hotel there is not much in the way of personal service or little extras but staff were friendly and helpful. Films, internet etc all had to be paid on top as you would expect with a chain. I tend to prefer more boutique hotels for this reason but the location right near the station and many interesting sights made up for that. We found that we could walk everywhere that we wanted to go (apart from the Islands!). There is a little something special about the place given its history and size. A film was being shot in the lobby whilst we were there, and many others have used it as it has a great faded grandeur that I personally love. I appreciate it wouldn't be everyone's cup of tea though!

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: Peetabeera
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after a day at Ontario Place. We live just outside Toronto but stayed downtown for convenience. The positive: the hotel is really quite beautiful inside - even our little girls thought it was pretty majestic. All staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly. Location is in the heart of downtown. Our room (7-299) was very spacious. The bathroom was outdated with peeling wallpaper and thick caulking applied everywhere, but it and the room were reasonably clean, the room had a separate living area, and there was a walk-in closet which was a nice feature. The negative: Parking is a bit of a nightmare - for valet you enter one place and pick-up your car at another - but they don't tell you this and nothing is marked - so we ended up dragging our luggage around and feeling the $40 we paid created more of a headache than a convenience. The valet exit is always jammed as people have no idea it's not the entrance and drive in - only to be told to back right out again (onto Front St. no less!). Trying to find a quick bite to eat in the hotel Saturday evening posed a challenge - went to the Gastropub (as we were just looking for a casual atmosphere and some appies) and were told the kitchen was closed - at 8:30 p.m. on a Saturday night!!! Even the concierge was shocked when we told him. He suggested the Library - but it was a very dark place with "fancy" appetizers, not the nachos etc. we were looking for. Avoid the York's kitchen and deli - went there for a quick breakfast the next morning - place was a mess. Poor ladies behind the cash (only 2 of them) were taking care of cooking all the food, manning the cash, getting the coffee, and keeping supplies (utensils etc.) replenished. No one was cleaning at all and there were filthy tables everywhere. Have eaten at Epic before and it's excellent. The Japanese restaurant looked great as well - but if you have kids or are looking for a casual place to eat - you'll have to venture outside the hotel. We ended up at Lone Star a couple of blocks away - exactly what we were looking for in terms of food and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmichels
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews, I feel like I didn't stay in the same hotel as some of the other reviewers. Our room was beautifully decorated, was more than spacious and had no real cleanliness issues. I have stayed in many hotels and experienced some pretty bad places. This is not one of them. The Fairmont Royal York is conveniently located, has a very helpful staff and is beautifully appointed. We would definitely stay there again. An overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: yadin
Reviews.Content: this hotel has potential to be fabulous. Unfortunately, the rooms and other areas need to be renovated so badly. we were upgaded to a one bedroom suite which was okay- the room was very large with a couch, fireplace, dining area, etc. But, the furnishings and especially the TV in the living area were so old. The bedroom had a flat screeen tv though. The bathrooms were small and old as well, although they had the miller harris toiletries which were nice. service at this hotel was pretty good, even though it was very full. We had a $25 food credit which we wanted to use for ice cream bars, but the waitress didn't know how to use the food credit so she gave them to us for free- that was great. pool was nice. Overall, okay hotel but certaintly not up to fairmont standards.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: tonbean82
Reviews.Content: This hotel, from the time I arrived to currently as I'm laying in a COT, has made me furious. I arrived at 8am from the US and had set up an early check in. Long story short, after checking back hourly to see if the room was ready, eventually at 10pm, I was told that my room was given away and the only thing available was a room without a bed that had a twin pull out sofa, which I am currently laying on wide awake. There were no other hotels in town that had rooms available, otherwise, I would have been out in an instant. The manager who I spoke with said he "MAY" be able to reimburse the $300 I paid for this cot which I"ll be sleeping on for 5 hours and then checking out. He did not offer any apologies and was completely unaccommodating. I will never stay in a Fairmont again..I am furious as this has been the pits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice building, lousy room”
Reviews.Author: Ashl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old building, great location - too bad the rooms are such a let down. Dirty, lamps don't work, coffee pot uncleaned since the last guest, etc, etc. Very mediocre, unlike the price.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless, Posh and Elegant -- Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Empress_Natalie
Reviews.Content: I had been wanting to stay here forever, but couldn't afford it until this summer. I was not disappointed! We were both impressed by its beauty, though it does need some little fix-ups here and there to restore it to its former grandeur. I think perhaps we had one of the updated rooms; from reading other reviews here, we didn't have any of the problems others seemed to have. Plush, clean carpeting, spacious bathroom, lovely furniture, the comfiest bed I've ever slept in. We chose to eat at an outside restaurant, so I don't know what the food was like. The staff were amazing, and quite frankly, they were all a delight. They even held our luggage for us after checkout so we could go shopping and not have to lug it around. All in all, we both loved it here, and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LaughingLlama
Reviews.Content: This large art-deco hotel is conveniently located just across the street from Union Station and on the airport express bus route from Pearson International. I recommend registering (free of charge) on the 'Fairmont President's Club' scheme prior to arrival. This gives benefits such as free in-room high-speed internet access and a special check-in desk. However, judging by previous postings, I also think it may result in an upgraded room - mine was very well appointed and appeared to be recently refurbished, with a large flat screen TV. I took advantage of a special holiday-time offer which also included 3 nights for the price of 1! This was excellent value for money - but, admittedly, the standard rates do look somewhat expensive. The hotel has the charming atmosphere of a by-gone age.

Reviews.Title: “it's time for an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: adaytripper2
Reviews.Content: I had heard a lot about the Fairmont Royal York prior to traveling there for a meeting in July. I heard what a classic hotel it was. The staff was very nice, however, the entire place needs an overhaul. The lobby is very beautiful, but the rooms are old, musty and antiquated. I hope that this timeless classic invests money in renovations, because if I were to return to Toronto, I would not stay here. I was overall......disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from a Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: scleffi
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for one night at the Fairmont Royal York after attending a Blue Jays game. We parked in the attached garage, which was under construction and fraught with a million confusing signs. We self parked but somehow the parking was still $40! Check in was smooth and the woman at the front desk was very professional and informative. The lobby was very grand but everything looked a little old. We stayed in a standard king room and I was anything but impressed. The carpet was thin, the bathroom was tiny, the heating/cooling system was out of the 70s, the furniture was old and scratched, there was a 19 inch old tv, and the upholstery on the chairs was stained. Having stayed at other Fairmont properties in the US and Canada (in standard rooms) I expected much more. If we were staying in Toronto longer than one night I would have tried to switch to the Westin. However, the staff was very friendly, helpful, and professional and the price was right. We received a discounted rate online because we pre-paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Poor.... downgraded”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: Booked in Friday night for one night. I hadn't been to Toronto before and so wanted to stay somewhere v nice. I must stay in 5 4-5* hotels a year and this one comes nowhere near. We had booked a harbour view which is described as being on a high floor ...with bathrobes. Ended up on the 6th floor (v low floor) and no bathrobes, no inroom safe, old small TV, no extractor fan in the bathroon which was barely big enough to swing a cat, chair in the room was taken from the conference room, King bed was in fact a Queen, stains on the curtains, viedw of a roof. We paid extra for the upgrade to the view on a high floor, King. And got downgraded but of course no refund. It was a 3 star at a push, maybe 3 star by European standards. I am heading back to T at Xmas and this time will make sure I stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Grand”
Reviews.Author: msec
Reviews.Content: Very large, central to everything. Room clean, large, very comfortable. We only had breakfast here but food was very good. Our main complaint was that we had to pay $14 a day for internet access in our room and as we wanted to stay in touch with family this was very expensive. The pool and fitness centre were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: penster1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Royal York and had a great time. The staff were amazing, very helpful and accomodating with the kids. Our initial room with two double beds, I think it was the standard room was too small for kids. We inquired at the front desk and were moved to a room double the size for a slightly higher rate. It was worth it. Also kids under 5 eat for free in the restaurant. My only complaint was that they stopped serving breakfast by 10:00 which is very early when you are coming from the west coast. Not even the casual cafe had breakfast items so we were forced to find a McDonalds. Other guests were asking us where we found the food as they too were in search of a hot meal. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a marvelous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: boedaccia
Reviews.Content: arrived in Toronto around 5pm on the Friday after a long drive from Ohio. Met by the porter who helped us with parking and arranged for our hire car to be valet parked. We had the express check in option through the Presidents club as we had read about the long queues - no queues although very busy and less than 5 mins are we were checked in to room 145 floor 11... First impressions of lobby - very BIG AND GRAND our room; facing Union station, with the CNN tower to the right. Beautiful, clean, tidy, comfy beds, small but comfy bathroom with a rather nice shower...i.e it worked! Right by the lifts but no noise at night. The hotel; we went and explored...basically got the lift to all the floors, inc floor 19 which is sometimes out of bounds and also went in to the ballrooms etc...the floor above the lobby has photo's and history of the hotel...for example it had a hospital wing and the biggest kitchen in a hotel ever! also lift 9 is the the lift that is used when the Queen is in residence... Facilities; the gym is nice, the pool is great after walking in the heat. The Epic Bar and The Library were very nice (avoid the gren things in the bar snacks - vile lol)...service always good. Breakfast - very good and filling - at weekends it is downstairs in the PATH York Diner but moves to Epic during the week We did have a minor issue with our bill which was sorted promptly and effectively with no fuss or bother. For 3 nights b&b with valet parking and breakfast was $700 - we booked directly with the hotel and got this rate which was worth every penny! I loved this hotel and would like to know more about it! Good location, great people, great place! You can see it from the CNN tower! by the way the business centre internet is cheap and fast!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: 76Traveller
Reviews.Content: I spent six nights at this hotel recently and enjoyed all aspects of the experience. The room was clean and of a good size. The central lobby is grand and lovely to sit in and watch the world go by for a little while. The location was central enough to make it easy to get around Toronto. Ordered room service a couple of times and found the food to be nice and reasonably priced. All the staff we came into contact with were helpful and polite. If given the chance I would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected but a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: AprilB
Reviews.Content: Having previously spent a couple of nights at the Chateau Frontenac in Quebec City I had to wonder if all Fairmont Hotels have front steps and no staff available (or willing) to help you at the door. Such was the case with our late arrival at the Royal York in May. My husband and I arrived via train before midnight for a one night stay. A covered walkway connects the train station to the hotel but stairs are involved. It was easier for us (as my husband is not allowed to lift for health reasons) to go outside instead and cross several lanes of traffic to reach the hotel. Once there though, we met with stairs. There was no doorman and we didn't see a sign indicating an elevator or another entrance for handicapped people. Luckily, a friendly passerby helped us with our luggage. Once in the lobby we found no one at the check-in counter. A man at another counter rousted out someone from a back room. Pros: The room was a pleasant surprise. It was roomy, comfortable, nicely decorated and it had two windows. Everything was in working order. Most importantly (to us), it was very clean and quiet. Cons: The negatives were minor. The desk clerk, when we enquired, should have known there were other bottles of water available for less than the $8 ones on the desk in our room. And if complimentary bottled water should have come with the turn-down service, why were we not given the option of that service since they knew we were arriving late? After returning home I was annoyed to find a charge of $10.60 applied to our credit card. It is ridiculous that an outfit as large as Fairmont does not have a toll free number to question bills. After I sent two emails I was told that the extra charge was for a bottled of water and a can of Pringles. We never touched any Pringles! Happily, they said they will refund the $10.60. All in all, I thought $160 was a fair price for this hotel. Be sure to sign up for the Fairmont Presidentâ€™s Club if you want free access to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for 1st Visit to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Westshore
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights late June, early July in a gold club room with a king bed. The rooms are small for club level, but overall very nice. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see, although it was a long walk to Royal Ontario Museum, Yorkville, etc. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Plenty of nice restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk. Dhaba on King St has the best Indian food I have ever eaten. I hope to get back to Toronto but next time will probably stay in a hotel 6-8 blocks north as our interests revolve more around museums, etc than CN Tower, entertainment district, etc. Great city and very easy to navigate (and I get lost EVERYWHERE).

Reviews.Title: “Dear old money hotel”
Reviews.Author: wordwench
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to downtown Toronto from NYC since I was 14 (and that was a verry long time ago!) I've stayed in many places from a summer dorm room rental on a local college campus to a few 4-star hotels I'd always felt the Royal York was out of reach for me, price-wise (I look at it as the Waldorf-Astoria of Toronto- very lush, plush, very "Old Money"). But for this weekend getaway, they actually had the best hotel rates (if paid in advance via their website: $86.00 pp+tax, USD). Surprisingly, for this rate I had a rather large, comfortable room overlooking the front of the hotel, with all the fancy hotel amenities. It is a very grand hotel, lots of brocade upholstery, marble in the lobby, and wood paneling. The staff couldn't have been nicer. Very convenient location too- close to the harbor, railway station (across the street). The health club/pool also nice . The downside: Though the bathrooms were renovated, much of the furniture (in my room, as well as the lobby bar) was thread-bare and worn down. The king size bed was also old and a little too hard for my back. Hotel food is usually overly expensive and this was no exception, even with the USD/CAD exchange rate. Bottom line: would I stay there again? Not my #1 favorite Toronto Hotel, but yes, with the low rate, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaClare
Reviews.Content: Flying into Toronto, very easy using public transportation to the hotel. Shuttle by bus, to the subway, The Fairmont is right across the street from Union Station. The Fairmon is very historic, pleasant, has everything you need for your stay. The city is walkable, used the train to go to Niagara Falls for a day trip. Location, location, comfort, I would come back for a stay. You can get a deal on the room rates, just hunt.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in historic landmark!”
Reviews.Author: nickeldale
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RY on June 5th & 6th to see a Blue Jays game and enjoy an extra night in the big city. Base rate was extremely surprising...<$100/night but prepaid over the net!! A lot of searching to find this rate! We knew that there would be additional charges for parking($20/day) and any other items. Join their President's Club to receive free local calls & a paper. The staff were excellent overall. This is a very large and very old hotel so expect smallish rooms and slower-than-average elevators. A great time with good friends makes any stay pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eeparadise
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York is truly a beautiful old hotel. The lobby and public areas are worth a look even if you don't stay there. The location is in the financial district, directly across the street from the train station. Close to many attractions, though not much going on in the evening. Lots of restaurants as well as the underground shopping are within walking distance. As the hotel is old, the rooms are small - especially the bathroom (compared to other Fairmont hotels I've visited). A very small, old TV was the only bad part of the stay. I especially liked the seperate trash cans for recycling. The "super saver" rate was reasonable and we were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Feel cheated...”
Reviews.Author: Eagle70VirginiaBeach
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 days at the Royal York for a conference. The first day I was charmed by the old architecture and history...after that, it's just another big hotel. First disappointment was finding out I paid $229 per night and a colleague there for the same conference paid $159. Other hotels in the city were offering conference-goers 50% off food vouchers and free breakfasts, but the Fairmont offered nothing. Guess they figure they are so old, they don't need to. I had a plain room with no view at the back of the hotel overlooking an alley and office building next door. Room was small, but adequate for one person. Bed was comfortable, but the thin walls made sleeping a challenge with noisy neighbors. Bathroom was tiny and the addition of a granite countertop made sitting on the toilet a real challenge. I am a large man and was literally wedged in and couldn't move. Some hand grips in the shower would have been nice. Toiletries were nice, as others have commented, but be prepared to make the sliver of soap last 7 days as it was never replaced. The snack basket was overpriced...$4 for a small bag of M&M's! Surcharges for EVERY phone call $1.61 per local call and $23 for a 7 minute call back to the States. Free in-room coffee, but I had to request creamer from the housekeeper and she had the kitchen send some up. The free newspaper was absent one day. My perception was they were short-staffed as my room didn't get refreshed until after 6 pm one day. The hotel is convenient to downtown and connected by the underground PATH to Union Station and the subway. All in all, a nice, old property, but be prepared to pay top dollar for everything and shop around for the best rates, as they apparently vary widely.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Great Big-City Historic Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: We (a small group attending an event in town) booked four rooms for one night: one king and three doubles. Fairmont was offering a tremendous rate for the night as part of its "Be an Original" campaign ($109 Canadian), which made the Royal York less expensive than many inferior properties in the vicinity. Since we were arriving by train, we loved the idea of the hotel's attachment to Union Station via an underground walkway- what a great way to arrive! I love the big-city vibe this hotel gives off: lots of people milling about, ballrooms hosting elegant functions, lounges filled with business people enjoying an after-work cocktail, lots of little shops to browse among down below in the concourse. The staff is well trained, very professional and pleasant. I enjoyed cocktails in the library lounge listening to an excellent guitarist play a variety of tunes. We were assigned rooms on the 6th floor. The three doubles were in the West Wing of the building, and my king was in the East Wing. My king room had obviously been more recently redecorated than the doubles-- more modern furnishings, more neutral decor, flat screen television. The three doubles still have decor from the late '80's (rose carpet, lots of chintz fabric and floral wallpaper) but all of the elements were well-maintained. The rooms are not large but offered more than enough space for a night. The bathrooms are especially compact but nicely outfitted in marble with good quality toiletries and bathrobes. All of us commented on having had one of the quietest, most comfortable night's sleeps ever. The beds are plush, the pillows are voluminous, and the rooms are well sound-proofed. I especially liked that the windows open-- something not often found in a high rise hotel. The next morning I used the well-outfitted gym and had a look at the lovely, modern pool area (it's not an historic pool like at the Fairmont Chateau Laurier in Ottawa). The pool area offers lemon-infused water and a variety of newspapers for guests to take- a nice touch. The only element lacking in the hotel is the restaurant in which breakfast is served on the weekends: the York Kitchen. The buffet offered is just not up to the standards of the buffets I have enjoyed at other Fairmont properties-- not as much selection, messy presentation, hurried/harried staff, and a very noisy "Golden Griddle" atmosphere. It's too bad that Epic is open for breakfast only on weekdays, as I imagine it would offer more of the dining experience we were looking for. I'm looking forward to returning here again-- especially if the promotional rates are still in effect. Next time, however, I would splurge on an upgrade to a "Signature" room or the "Gold Floor" in hopes of getting a larger room on a higher floor with a better view.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Classy, perfectly located city hotel with 1920's charm thrown in.”
Reviews.Author: TravelsALot
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Royal York hotel during Victoria Day long weekend. We got a great deal via expedia.ca ($109 CAD/room per night). We travel often and have stayed in many top hotels, and we found the hotel to be exactly as we had hoped. The room was great (not massive but absolutely fine for two adults). We were a little apprehensive before we opened the door to the room because some of the other reviews we had read on this site made it sound like we would be sleeping in a room the size of a shoe box! This was not at all the case, and the decor and furniture was classy and in keeping with the style of the rest of the hotel. It was a non-smoking room and was clean and fresh. The bathroom was on the small side, but had a full bath with a great showerhead and was well stocked with everything we needed. We were also impressed that the room had a good view of the CN Tower and Lake Ontario - this was not something we had expected considering the fantantasic rate we were paying. The hotel itself with it's beautiful entrance hall, lovely shops, great bars and very nice restaurant, all made our stay special. We were also able to walk to great bars and restaurants easily from the door of the hotel. Go ahead and book! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: BethanyinDallas
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay in one of the Fairmont historic railroad hotels, so I jumped at the chance to stay at the Royal York during a recent trip to Toronto. It was lovely and conveniently located. It was nice to be so close to Union Station and the skyway to the CN Tower, especially because it rained quite a bit while we were there. There were some nice little shops on the basement level of the hotel. It's obvious that the hotel is older, and certain things are to be expected (we had toilet flushing problems). However, the historic nature of the place makes it worthwhile, in my opinion. Really enjoyed our stay and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful reception areas, tired rooms in this very Grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: heb999
Reviews.Content: The reception areas in this hotel are breathtaking. The location is very good, right opposite Toronto's main railway station. The staff is excellent. The rooms, however are tired and mine had such a poor outlook over a roof to another wing of the hotel that I had to keep my curtains closed the whole time to prevent being looked in on. As often, in old historic buildings, it is a huge challenge to adapt the building into a modern hotel. The rooms are often all different and so you can be lucky and find yourself in a huge light room or unlucky and end up in a small dingy room with no outlook. There was nothing wrong or broken with the bathroom or general furnishings, just the size of the room and overall feel of the room which is no fault of the hotel owners but the building itself. As long as you stay out of your room the rest of the hotel is magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac_Don2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Fairmont Royal york for only one night while my way to Windsor from Ottawa and it took my heart in very first view. The Hotel is great and is just opposite to Toronto main railway Station. My Travel organizer booked royal york due to its proximity of railway station and I must say that unknowingly she booked me at the best hotel I lived so far. The Fairmont royal york is a grand hotel with 1000s of room and some of the great restaurant of toronto. The room is well designed but wash rooms are a bit compact and lag some space however the view of CN towers from room took away all my problem of room. The hotel is on a bit costly side and even during lean period they charged me CAD 179 for a night stay. Even all restaurants are priced on a higher side but match the quality of food. Please beware of charges on your card while leaving the hotel or afterwards as they charged me on account of use of mini bar however I never used that. I know that in most of the big hotel some time they charge you wrongly on account of mini bar but I never expected this from royal york

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: OntarioWelltravelled
Reviews.Content: This is the Royal York, a Toronto landmark right in the heart of the business district and overlooked by another Toronto landmark, the CN tower. The hotel retains all the trimmings of a place that has seen whole eras go by. The entrance lobby is grand by any standard and direct access to Union station and the Toronto PATH (underground shopping lanes) means this is a wonderful central location whether you are staying for business or pleasure. On the practical side the rooms are small, somewhat tired and furnished in turn of the last century style; internet access is expensive ($14 charge including for wifi access in the Business Centre) and the restaurant prices are steep. I found the organised chaos that was breakfast at $25 for a full cooked buffet meal did not provide a good start to the day. Problem here seems to be groups of local business people using the meal as a meeting venue and therefore taking up tables for extended periods of time. When the hotel is busy that results in queues. Staff were exceptionally helpful including those in the Business Centre who are employed by Xerox rather than the hotel. For the very best in efficient service and access to guest services I suggest you join the Fairmont President's Club. Joining is free but is only applicable from your next following visit. It will give you express check in, access to executive facilities and free internet in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, central hotel!”
Reviews.Author: utah33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of downtown Toronto. It is beautiful inside and out, and has great service. You feel like a king/queen with the beautiful decorations and attentive service. The hotel is steps from everything downtown you could want: subway, CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Skydome, Opera house, eaton centre, union station, st. lawrence market and more! The hotel is expensive, but not that much more than other, less nice, hotels in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel, requires a little money spent.”
Reviews.Author: Quality-men
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights & very much enjoyed our suite on the 14th floor, this hotel was built by Canadian Pacific Railway in 1929 for passengers for the Union Station,. The hotel is located above PATH, a vast underground shopping and transportation complex with access to Union Station and the CN Tower is three blocks away, so the location is great in every way. The Hotel was built in huge blocks, it has 1300 rooms, oftern these blocks look into the back of buildings or into each other, so beware! We found the Hotel Lobby to be glorious & the Conference & Banqueting rooms to be as sumptious as the Palace of Versailles, absolutely wonderful! However the Hotel is, in some areas, in need of a refurb, especially the older rooms on the middle floors. Breakfast is a good Buffet with efficient staff, but again you could be one of the 3000 guests. Also there is a huge conference business, due to the sheer size & number of the conference rooms there. The leisure centre is small but good. We would recommend, go enjoy the history and look at the pics on the Balcony- fascinating!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaYoung
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is an elegant 4 star hotel. If you are looking to have a classy and memorable holiday or business trip look no further. In the heart of downtown Toronto the Royal York is walking distance to major attractions such as the Eaton Centre, CN Tower, and Younge street. The hotel is perfect if you are looking for a night out at the theatre. The rooms are luxurious, spacious and clean equipped with a bar, hairdryer, fridge, ironing facilities, and dry cleaning. The staff are delightful and the hotel offers an excellent restaurant, bar and pool. The top suites offer an excellent view of Lake Ontario. One of the most classiest and chic hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Romantic Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now. The first time in Gold preffered the second time that was closed for refurbishing so we took a suite below which was much bigger but didnt have all the extras the Gold preffered give you, such as the excellent and always helpful private concierge and separate little lobby. All the same its luxury surroundings are as expected from Fairmont. Its a busy place, not ideal for a tranquil relax in the bar areas, drinks are expensive, wait staff are ignorant and dont expect any food after 10pm unless you go to your room and order room service (I recommend the butter chicken!) which is a pain if you come out of the theatre starving! The spa is nice, not always someone on the desk so I found it hard to book a treatment when I wanted it.

Reviews.Title: “Awfully Old and Tried”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter2012
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks grand on the outside, the rooms inside are awful, they look extremley old with paint chipping and cracks in the wall dirty faded carpets. I was very surprised this was the case for a Fairmont. I know the hotels are usually old but I expected it to be maintained well. There was always dirty towels and sheets piled up in the hallways as well as empty food trays indicating a lack of cleaning staff. The first room I was given stank of smoke even though I requested a non-smoking room, the next room smelt ok, but the bathroom was tiny, and the actuall bathtub was made of some sort of plastic covering that was coming undone and would squelch and move as you stepped on it. This hotel reminded me of something from the movie 'the shining' as it was extremley large and you could be walking down long hallways without a person in sight, and the oldness didn't help. When leaving the hotel, I went to get my suitcase from storage as I had left it there in the morning, this was a friday and I was trying to beat the traffic rush to the airport, the bellman simply ignored a whole bunch of us saying there was no one around to actually go pick the luggage up from the storage room, it took at least 25 mins to get the suitcase and then dash for a taxi, and these people want a tip!! Also note in the morning when I dropped the luggage off, the bellman said that I had better remember his name or else I won't get the luggage I thought this was a joke then I realized it was a ploy that I must come back and ask for him so that he could put me in an overpriced limo and get a tip! Note contrary to what the bellman says taxi to the airport is cheaper than the limo and you can get a flat rate for the taxi as well during rush hour!! Worst hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Caribana”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel313
Reviews.Content: Perfect but too small for 4 women. Had fun very neat and right next to subway

Reviews.Title: “Falls short of expectations. Poor value.”
Reviews.Author: CDNeh
Reviews.Content: My impression is that this hotel must make its profit on the convention crowd - people staying on someone else's dime.We had asked when booking about parking and were assured it was available. On arrival the doorman told us that no parking was available and seemed indifferent at first to our situation. Despite having made direct telephone reservations our room was unavailable for five hours past the stated check in time we had been given. The lady serving us at the front desk was apologetic and provided vouchers for use in their restaurant and lounge. Our luggage was handed over to the concierge and we went off to kill time when we would rather have been relaxing in our room having had an international flight that morning. Public areas were full of "jolly" public service convention types, some of whom were probably dragging their heels at vacating our room. When we finally received our key cards mid evening and went up to the room, a large pile of dirty towels graced the hallway beside our door - an hour later they were still there. Had to ask staff at the desk to see they were removed before we went up again to retire. The room was "OK" but a bit worn looking, scuffed furniture and stained carpet. Had a late dinner using the vouchers which was very good but served by an expressionless waiter. Bed was comfortable enough. Breakfast buffet was ho hum - overpriced, but as I say most of the patrons we saw probably cared less about value. We were given a reduction on the price of our room but overall I wouldn't bother to stay here again. Other downtown Toronto hotels deliver more for the money in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything except dated rooms was great”
Reviews.Author: MyattMD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Business in Feb 2009. Everything is fantastic except the dated rooms. For the money (I payed $195 for Signature King) this is for sure one of the best bangs for your buck in this city. Location, cleanliness, service and value were exceptional I found. The old wallpaper and decor in the room on the 14th floor needs serious updating. I used the business office which was great except the $45/hr for the meeting room which I elected not to use for that outrageous price. I think they should have let me use for free, since no one was using it at all. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service and Welcoming!!!”
Reviews.Author: EastmeetsWestAB
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really convenient for you to travel around, particularly in snowy conditions. Underground station is nearby and there are plenty of restaurants around the hotel for food. It is also close by shopping areas. If you have a "Path" map, you can easily walk to Eaton centre without going outside. This is a plus particularly when face with heavy snow storm. Being a Fairmont Presidential Club member is definitely worth it. Check in is extremely quick, free shoe shine, internet usage and free local phone call. When we check in, the lady was very welcoming. Even after 1.5 years of not visting the hotel, she seems to still remember me and welcome you back again. The room and amenities that we have been allocated is OK. Nothing to wow about. The bed is comfortable. The room is of reasonable size. The reception area is beautiful and it is big enough for you to meet up with friends and have a quick chat. There is one shop inside Fairmont that is really great. I do not remember the name but is very close to the Spa shop managed by a Japanese lady. Her goods are really value for money. If you go to Toronto towards the end of January, make sure you check out Winter delicious deals. C$15 for a 3 course Lunch in CN Tower is just amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Royal about it!!!”
Reviews.Author: winnie74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on Valentines day. The lobby was nice and check in went well.....and then we saw our room. The room was very dirty and gross. There were notes on the notepad that they supplied from previous guests. The remote for the TV was disgusting and gross. The coffee maker was dirty. The phone was dirty and gross. The bathroom was very dirty as well. There were hairs all over the bathrobe that was supplied. There was so much dust on the headboard, you could write in the dust! We were very dissapointed and should have left and went to another hotel. I wish I had of looked up the reviews on TripAdvisor before staying at this hotel. Definately not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip to Toronto in May 2008. It's the closest hotel to the office so that's why I stayed there (and my company has corporate rates!). It's an OK hotel, not bad but not fantastic either. The rooms were clean, they had nice toilettries. Check-in was quite slow as there were a lot of people but not enough people at the check-in counters. Check-out was equally slow. This is supposed to be one of the nicest hotels in Toronto - if so, I'd hate to see what the other hotels look like... It is OK but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Fairmont Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: furrykarma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when my husband had a business trip. I am originally from Toronto so I visited friends and family. I always wanted to stay there so we did. We checked late at night and were given a "handicap room" based on the facilities of the bathroom. To give the front desk credit, I think he tried discourage my husband from the room saying he only had one king bed room (I guess my husband did not pick up on the hint). This was the worst room I have ever had (next to a motel 8 once). One of the pictures on the wall had the glass broken from it. The furniture was old and ratty. It stunk like smoke. The bathroom had not been renovated in a while. And the worst--the air conditioning did not work and the air in their was completely stagnant. I had the worst sleep of my life. I feel bad for any disabled patrons who are forced to sleep in that room--shame on you Fairmont. I normally take photos of all rooms I stay in but was so tired that I skipped it. The next day we changed rooms to two double (or queen beds--not sure). The room was spacious and clean. Thankfully air conditioner worked. The lobby is nice in that old fashioned way. My daughter loved the pool and the gym looked good too. We were disappointed with the parking--the only option was extremely expensive parking that was hard to find. The staff was pleasant and helpful although from these other reviews perhaps the cleaning should be stepped up. Finally, my husband left $200 in cash in our room--they found it and sent it back--but charged a fee ;) All in all, our stay was good except for the first night. This is the second Fairmont I have stayed in (last one was Newfoundland) and I have to say--not really impressed. I thought Fairmont was 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel9999
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the years and usually been quite happy with the hotel. We booked a signature room which was large and had a separate living room and two full bathrooms. It was perfect for entertaining our friends before we left for a show. We has some food catered up to the room and it was excellent. Room service was also very good. I had a massage at the fitness centre (not the spa which is not associated with the hotel) and it was also very good. The hotel has a gym and pool. The gym has the basic equipment but if you are looking for a larger gym there is a GoodLife Fitness right across the street attached to Union Station (you do not have to leave the heated walkways or tunnels to reach it). All in all it is a good choice and is always consistent in terms of service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful base if you are exploring by subway because it is on the transit line. The hotel is huge and comfortable. The rooms were a little small but very nicely furnished. The pool was sensational. We liked the special bathign suit dryers we have not seen anywhere else in the world. Toronto is a fun city to visit and this is the place to base yourself

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby”
Reviews.Author: ne_quine
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay over the New Year period. Thankfully check in was speedy as I am a member of their Presidents club and so it has a dedicated check-in desk and we weren't forced to join the rather big queue! Room was decent enough for our needs - we were only staying there 5 nights not 5 weeks! Room was clean, beds were comfy, nice big flat screen TV and comfortable chairs to sit in. Our room also faced onto York Street so we had a lovely view of the CN Tower. The bathroom was a bit on the small side but again you aren't spending all day in there so was fine enough for your actual needs. My only grumble about the rooms was the lack of insulation! We seemed to have the "neighbours from hell" either side of us. One side came home from the New Year's Eve celebrations and kept us awake by their noise until easy 3am then just as we though we'd finally get some sleep, the room on the other side came back and woke us up at 4.30am! Not impressed as you can gather and hotel security did eventually pay them a visit to keep the noise down. Concierge were extremely helpful with the requests they made for restaurants - finding us a great Chinese restaurant for New Years Day and then an Italian one before we saw Dirty Dancing. They also sorted us out with a sightseeing tour of Toronto that fitted our needs too. The Lobby is fantastic and so beautiful - remember your camera to take photo's! And as a plus too, the hotel is connected into the PATH system so even though the weather was very cold outside you could still get around Toronto without having to go out into the cold. Thankfully breakfast was included in our package otherwise it would have been rather expensive eating in each day - almost $70 for 2 continental breakfasts by the time they added on a 15% service charge and the taxes... and they've got the cheek to ask if you wish to add a gratuity too!!! The only negative things I'd say about the hotel was that most of the hotel bars/restaurants were closed while we were there and the ones that were open (EPIC and the Japanese one) did seem to be rather expensive. The library bar made a rare opening on New Years Eve but the service was horrendous - 40 mins to receive a drinks orders then a further wait of 30 mins for the food to arrive and when it did the food was cold! As you can imagine the tip that day was $0!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but room nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ABtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this historic Fairmont. Lobby is beautiful. Staff here, like at other Fairmonts, are well-trained. Check-in was okay. Elevators fairly prompt. Hallways are drab and really long. Pop cans are $2 in the vending machine next to the icemachine. However, $4 in the minibar. Voices certainly carry in the hallways, whether party-going guests at night or cleaning staff in the morning. My room had a flat panel tv, but the bathroom - no fan - was small and only adequate. Not somewhere you want to linger. Blowdryer is in a bag hanging with the one bathrobe. The closet was also small, but they've managed to fit in an iron and board. Comfortable queen bed. Safe in the bedside table. Stately decor. Local photo and art on the wall. Free coffeemaker, but that bottled water sure isn't. Fitness room is great and open 24hours. Bring a headset for the TVs in the cardio machines. Steamroom and sauna are in the change rooms. Lap pool with whirlpool have specific hours. The pool is typical size for a hotel. Access to all that is with room card, and there are lots of towels available. I've stayed at modern hotels downtown Toronto, and prefer them e.g. Sheraton, Hilton, and even Renaissance in Roger Ctr.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DasEFX
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Hotel is a wonderful older hotel. It is very close to the nightlife scene (a few blocks away) plus it is really close to the CN tower. The hotel is on the older side. Some of the rooms need renovation as do the hallways, but the service is good. The lobby is beautiful. Great place to take pictures. And if you forget something, there is a gift shop which is on the expensive side, but has everything. As for the rooms, they can fit three-four people comfortably. The beds are comfortable, but it isn't like the pillowtop beds that you get at newer hotels. The rooms are cleaned well. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: renbabe
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Fairmont hotel for business. The reception staff were excellent, attentive, courteous and friendly. Rooms were spotless and room service excellent. The whole experience was excellent from the service delivery aspect. I would recommend the Fairmont to anyone passing through Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worthy of the Fairmont name.......”
Reviews.Author: topher26
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on a couple other occasions and can say that the rooms are definitely in need of a renovation. My last room had crown molding hanging off the wall, and the ceiling in the bathroom was chipped, and different colors. The bathrooms also do not have an exhaust fan, and the mirrors steam up really fast. Also bathrobes are not provided in the rooms, so bring your own. Most of the rooms have been updated with a plasma TV, but some still have a 24â€� tube TV. The rooms are very small for the rate that you are paying. You are paying more for the beauty of the lobby, and the friendly Fairmont service staff. This is my least favorite Fairmont property

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, just don't drive there”
Reviews.Author: fanofearl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal York for the first time while on business in Toronto. Our overall stay was pleasant, and the hotel itself has a great location right on Front Street, and connected to the PATH system. Our room was compact, yet pleasant, and comfortable for 2 adults. The halls did get a bit noisy during the night as others made their way back to their rooms. The hotel didn't have parking available when we arrived, and we ended up parking down the street at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre. This wasn't really convenient, but I imagine that the $22 a day that we paid for parking was pretty reasonable for downtown. One recommendation that i would make is to consider joining the Fairmont President's Club. There is a dedicated front desk for members, where there was absolutely no wait to check in or out, while there were significant lines at the regular front desk. One handy benefit of membership is complimentary in-room Internet access, otherwise it costs $14 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: dangerboy00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal York for one night. The room was very small, wallpaper so old, bathroom equiped with a shopping mall toilet, carpet old. But what really made it a joke was the minibar ... cost of 1liter of water 8.50$...Having stayed in other hotels in Toronto, I know there is a lot of hotel with nicer room for cheaper and bottled water is complimentary. Fairmount should do something about this location because it will ruined its reputation ... it did for me... never again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired room decor”
Reviews.Author: MoreStars
Reviews.Content: The lobby promised old-world elegance and comfort but the room was very disappointing - Small with very tired decor including dirty carpet and rather beat-up furniture. The tiny bathroom featured mismatched tiles, ancient and dirty wallpaper that clashed horribly with the tiles, and a black mildew stain around the tub drain that made us shudder. On the plus side, the king size bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: aroundtheworld21
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, very clean, nice decor, and very close to all the major attractions! Overall great stay in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional elegance, noisy all night long”
Reviews.Author: Palette1
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont Royal York Hotel is a well-tended landmark, one of Canada's most distinguished and historic hotels. The public areas are gracious and reassuring, with lots of brocade and gilt, plenty of comfortable seating and luxurious expanses. The shops in the hotel are fascinating (visit Julius Vesz, an incredible shop that sells pipes and military miniatures--it is just amazing). The location is excellent--very convenient to many sights and to transit. The room we stayed in was smallish, but that was OK--it was clean, pretty and comfortable. Every person on the staff was pleasant and tried to be helpful. But, wow, in the night, was this place noisy! 2 AM, 3 AM, 4 AM, the halls were full of roaming bunches of class-trip teenagers (and prenuptial parties of bridesmaids) chattering, arguing, singing... The staff seemed somehow unable to do anything about all of this. I've stayed in Big Ten college dorms that were quieter. It was very puzzling to us, because the rest of the time the hotel seemed so sedate, but every night, after midnight, without fail the hallways got noisy. I am ranking this hotel okay, rather than terrible, because the surroundings were so pleasant and the staff seemed so nice, and probably bunches of off-the-leash teenagers are not there every single night; and I recommend this hotel for those who sleep soundly, those who take sleeping pills, and the deaf.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Live Up to It's potential”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerLAX
Reviews.Content: I am a Fairmont Presidents Club Member, so I booked on the hotel website in order to use my account #. Some Fairmont Hotels are 5 star, others are 4 star.. This hotel has the potential of being a 5 Star hotel, it's a gorgeous property, good location, Spa ammenities. however the staff fall a bit short of the usual service that I'm used to. On websites, the parking rate is advertised as follows: Valet parking: C$32 per 24-hour period in secure garage with in/out privileges. Self parking: C$17 weekdays, C$27 weekends per 24-hour period in secure garage with no in/out privileges. However, once I parked my car, and checked out, I found out the rates were actually now $40 valet or $34 self park, weekday (with no in/out) $17-$34.. That's a big difference from what's advertised! When I asked the front desk girl about it, she said the hotel doesn't have a contract with the parking garage and they cannot control their rates... She said "oops, they were unaware it was posted on their website for less". Also advertised: robes in the room.. I found no robes in the room. If you book a lower rate room, you get the view of a rooftop with debris, facing the Union Train Station, next to a noisy elevator which sounds like planes taking off. The swimming pool was nice. The beds were comfortable. But they're barely teetering on a 4 star rating. With better management, this hotel could be on the same level as any top 5 star out there but for now, I will choose to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady”
Reviews.Author: moodywatcher
Reviews.Content: We had stayed for 4 days at this hotel and had a great stay.We where booked a king room and was not disappointed. Our room was ready when we arrived and was veryquiet our entire stay We found the staff always helpful and always friendly during our stay. We have never found the old CP chain never to please and this is furthur indication of the prefessional attitutude at this hotel. We wouldlook forward to returning to the grand old lady.

Reviews.Title: “Art deco grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Peewak
Reviews.Content: Worst part of the Fairmont experience was the wait to check in but,on reaching the counter,staff very helpful although the gentleman did welcome us to New York! Room well appointed,very clean,decent facilities,nice bedding. After long train journey from Montreal,particularly appreciated swanning around in the fluffy bathrobe! Room was big enough for our final 2 nights but,I think,would become a bit stifling if staying longer. The hotel rejoices in its glittering past and I think the slightly fading grandeur lends itself to the more mature guest - we certainly emjoyed the excellent pool,spa,gym -a touch of class,and a good way to start the day. An excellent way to end the day is to take a night cap in the fabulous library bar - apparantly,a bit of an institution for the Toronto glitterati - rumour has it that messrs. Pitt and Clooney were propping up the bar during the film festival,the week previously.I emulated them by,at least,propping up the bar as well and that's where the similarities end! Enjoyed the Fairmont experience immensely

Reviews.Title: “Not Sound Proof AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: Codester
Reviews.Content: Upon entrance of this hotel there is a very nice large lobby. Its old decor is very luxurious looking and takes you into a time warp from when they built the building. Its neat, but I am more of a modern person myself. We got valet, its almost $40 a day, but much easier to deal with and when you get here you dont really need a car as you can walk to attractions and restaurants. The man at the valet I didnt find overly polite. He was trying to rush us and our things out of the car and seemed that since we werent driving a Bentley, we didnt get treated how I felt we should. The funny thing is that the car wasnt even ours, and we do drive a much nicer one than the one we had. Check-in was easy and went smoothly. Not superior treatment, but not bad either. We did however NOT get the king bed room that we booked online. We have a standard room on the 5th floor with a queen sized bed. I wasnt too happy about that. When I book a specific room online, I do expect to get it. But its not worth it for me to drag my things into a different room. The room is of average size or a smidgen smaller with a very nice 32'' (?) or bigger, flat screen TV and looking out over the train station and the Air Canada Centre. The bed is a little hard for my liking although it does have a pillow top mattress. The toiletries are minimal, you get your shampoo/conditioner, lotion, shoe shine and shower cap, but not all of the things you would get if you stayed at the Hilton. We stayed at one that had all of those, plus specialty items, and a grooming kit which was a nice treat. The hotel is VERY LOUD! I can hear everything going on in each room, up to 2 rooms away and everything in the hallway very clearly and the hallways echo which makes it louder. The hotel isnt bad, but I woudnt have any desire to come here again, although, I would probably return because of the location. Its very middle ground....mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: ali_gale
Reviews.Content: WOW... we had an amazing honeymoon stay at the Fairmont September 15-19, 2008. What started as a stressful day (our airline did not have us booked in seats together...) we arrived at the Fairmont (we sprung the extra money to stay on the "gold" floors - very worth it) to a wonderful welcome, and a surprise upgrade... The staff both in the Gold Lounge and throughout the hotel were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, and beautiful with amazing 16th floor corner views. We LOVED the old charm of the place, with new amenities like a pillow-top bed and LCD TV's. So very comfortable. The fitness centre was very up to date with treadmills, ellipticals, etc with TV's in them. Also the pool and hot tub were fun and relaxing. The conceirge desk was great...very helpful in helping us make our way around Toronto and giving suggestions for things to do/places to go. Breakfast and evening hor doerves were delicious and filling! And I fell in love with there "maple maple" fairmont brand tea which I was able to purchase in the gift shop. The staff became familiar with us and recognized and acknowledged us constantly, it was really nice, and superb services. We considered it a great treat and priveledge to stay at such an ornate and historic hotel. The location was great, we could hop a subway across the street, walk to Skydome, ACC, the theatres and Eaton centre. If you're looking to treat yourself, and want a great experience, I would definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Interior - Needs a Kick up the Butt!”
Reviews.Author: ArdaghMark
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last leg of our Canadian holiday. The huge reception area is stunning - nostalgic and atmospheric. It is a busy hotel - we were there during the film festival and it was rumoured Tarantino was staying here too. The major problem lies with the rooms. We had 4 rooms. In our room, we had no hairdryer or shampoo - it was all a bit inconsistent between what some had in their rooms and others didn't. The room service maid made loads of noise in the corridor whilsr cleaning rooms of departed guests in the morning - whilst we were trying to sleep. The bars and restaurants are not cheap. Staff are friendly though - as is the norm in large Canadian hotels. Just for the decor and atmosphere, the hotel deserves a 3 star rating - if only the amenities and service matched it then it would be an easy 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scotty88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a trip to Niagara Falls. You really cannot beat the location. Both nights we had a room with two beds. There were lots of towels and the room was clean. The minibar was outrageously expensive but that is to be expected. We were able to get a great meal at a reasonable price in Pipers Bar. The business center was great. We used the pool at night with the lights from the city visible through the huge windows. All in all we had a wonderful time and would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Axcl
Reviews.Content: General appointments of this Hotel are very good. Front Deck staff and Concierge staff are very efficient and helpful. Housekeeping (room servicing & cleaning) was good. Convenience to Toronto is very good - across the road from Union Station, also on the PATH Underground city. 5 minute walk from CN Tower & Rodgers Stadium & Ice Hockey Hall Of Fame. Toronto Subway system accessible from PATH. Pick-up point for day trips around Toronto (i.e. city tours, Niagara Falls tours, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Classic Charm Requires Patience”
Reviews.Author: aim1986
Reviews.Content: I'm just returning from our lovely weekend at the Royal York in Toronto. It was our 20th wedding anniversary and we and our 2 children (13 & 7) stayed at the Royal York. The hotel is classic charm, all around. Out of necessity, certain things will never be able to be fixed: namely the super-thick walls which must make remodeling a nightmare; but if you're looking for a fantastic experience of being treated with the courtesy long-lost in the 21st century, you need to stay here. The service - and services - are straight out of the 19th century; the ambiance is from a bygone era, while the entire hotel has been modernized to today's standards. I've read the reviews about "thin doors" and being able to hear room noise while walking the hallways.....it's true, but hardly an inconvenience. this hotel oozes class, and just by osmosis you pick up some class just by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Poorly Managed”
Reviews.Author: ants432000
