Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel at 0300hrs due to problems with aircraft (prewarned hotel we would be arriving late) no staff available at entrance to help with luggage (the entrance the taxi took us to is not disabled friendly many steps no lift) my partner is disabled. When we checked in we were given glowsticks as there was no power in our room due to scheduled maintainence this is unaceptable especialy when one of you is disabled! They tried to charge us for breakfast although we were on a three night bed and breakfast package There were holes in the bedlinen and it wasent changed on the 2nd night as it says on the room card There was no tariff for the mimibar in the room Our facecloths dissapeared and were not replaced by the maid in the morning. They have charged us for a bottle of water post checking out that was promised not to be charged for as we could not see any prices displayed for this in the room. Lovely Hotel really nice decor lovely room......poorly managed my advice is to keep well away and go to the Westin Harbour a few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “historically beguiling”
Reviews.Author: emmuk74
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, it's kept all it's historic charm whilst also providing modern conveniences. it's connected to all the travel within the city and has one of the best concierges I have seen. will stay there again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Very outdated”
Reviews.Author: Jewelzzz
Reviews.Content: We didn't actually stay in this hotel but had friends staying here and we ended up coming over to their hotel to check it out. DO NOT STAY HERE. It is old and very outdated. The rooms are very small and the beds aren't comfortable at all. Good location though. Very close to the CN Tower. However, if you don't mind being farther into the entertainment district in downtown Toronto, there are many hotels on Queen St. W that are in way better shape and more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: piment0
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights for a weekend getaway. Our room was late being set up, but we were immediately offered meal vouchers to compensate for our troubles. Our room was clean, with a king size bed and large pillows. Rooms are small but we assumed that being a heritage hotel. Elevators are quaint and speedy! Health club was nice. Overall, we felt that we were well taken care of, and would like to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't rush back”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a Christmas function. The Imperial Room is goregous for events!!!! and the Bennihana restaurant is really good and fun. EPIC is so-so and I wouldn't go back. It is too big, toronto's version of the Waldorf. The room was small and old. Thank goodness it was just for a weekend. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas. Bad location unless going to the ACC.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: NPotomac4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when visiting with my wife and kids (ages 8 and 4). The Hotel is in a GREAT location, but VERY old. It didn't quite live up to 4 stars. We checked in at 11 and were told our room wasn't ready yet, but they'd put a rush on it. Fair enough. We went out and toured around and returned at 5:30, only to find our room still wasn't ready. Our deluxe room had some plastic meeting chairs in it when we got in. The mini bar was not stocked. The refrigerator was warm and leaking water. There were stains on the furniture and mold on the ceiling. The washroom was TINY. The carpet was threadbare with no padding. The lobby was beautiful, and so was the health club and pool. The location could not be beat. There was also ample room for the family.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay, but not quite Fairmont quality”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is a very large hotel. Perhaps a bit too large to be much of a luxury hotel. We spent three nights here. Overall it was fine, especially considering what we paid. But we had come to expect quite a bit from Fairmonts, and sadly this experience wasn't what we're used to from the brand. Check-in was fine. The front desk person was courteous and professional. No wait at the President's Club line. We had what is called a "deluxe" room, which is basically two regular rooms combined into one. It is about 500 sq ft. And has 2 bathrooms. Very nice for our family of four. Furnishing was traditional, but fine. Electronic safe in room. TV was old fashion tube, but worked well enough. Coffeemaker in the room. But no creamers anywhere. Desk was very small, barely large enough for my laptop. Internet was slow sometimes, but generally fine. Our room was on 5th floor, but no street noise problems. So why did I give it a "3" rating and not higher? Well, first, except for front desk personnel, other staffers we encountered acted as though we didn't exist, and their reply to our "hello" was more a grudging groan than anything pleasant. The second day our room wasn't made by the time we returned at about 3 pm. We had left the room at 7:30 am. Sure, sometimes they get behind, but 3 pm seemed kind of late. One of the kids wanted a nap, so we just hung up the Do Not Disturb sign and forego the housekeeping. Turndown came the first day, and all they did was leave a couple bottles of water and turned on the radio. Didn't even remove the dirty towels or replace the glasses. Not much of a turndown, if you ask me. So we do the DND for turndown for the next two nights as well. What's the point? One evening about 9, we decided to go to one of the lounges for a quick sandwich. Went in and was told to sit anywhere. Found a table, but 15 minutes later never even got a "hello" from anyone. Waiters passed us by on many occasions, and never once did anyone stop to give us a menu or anything. We walked out, and went to the nearby Sheraton for our sandwich instead. The bill that was slipped under the door had a mistake (overcharged us by $69). Small thing, but took time to go and get it adjusted. At checkout, called to get the car out, and was on hold for almost 10 minutes. No one offered to help with luggage at check out either. Valet gave us the key, and that was it. Would I go back? If I get a low enough rate, yes. But no way at their regular rates.

Reviews.Title: “Royal York Great but Parking Expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: jlmck
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Royal York numerous times over the past ten years and have always been impressed by the level of service and professionalism of the staff, the overall ambience and cleanliness of the property and the great location. In the past there has always been a Royal York Customer rate of parking in the underground garage adjacent to the Hotel (approximately $25). When booking our hotel room we were informed that "the Royal York no longer does self parking". This was not a surprise to us as it had always been another company who had billed parking,etc. However we were not told until after we parked and booked in that there was no Royal York Customer rate for parking and were not advised at any time as to what the rate would be in the self park as compared to the Valet Parking. Needless to say when leaving and being charged $60 (!!!) for parking from 2:00 pm Wed. to 11:00 a.m. Thurs. we were very surprised! If we had been aware of this potential charge we would have taken the Royal York valet parking at $37 a night. This has to be better communicated by Royal York staff to guests to avoid such expensive parking bills.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous lobby and location, satisfactory rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingFelix
Reviews.Content: Located in heart of downtown near financial district and train station. Historic hotel with grand lobby and lots of atmosphere. Rooms small but clean and comfortable. Service good, excellent concierge. Can be pricey, try to get a deal online, worth about 150 to 250 per night depending on time of year and size of room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Solent_Oxford
Reviews.Content: There is nothing seriously wrong with this hotel, it's just really disappointing. It advertises itself as a leading luxury hotel. In reality, it is quite basic and disappointing. We had lots of disappointments from the moment we arrived. All three main entrances are through revolving doors - difficult with luggage and a stroller. We were offered no help and not even told about the disabled elevator around the back, which we discovered on our second day there. The room we had was small and a bit cramped. Our pre-ordered crib wasn't in the room when we arrived, and when I asked for one as quickly as possible (so our son could have his nap) I was told it would take 20 minutes. The handbasin plug didn't hold water and the room safe was already locked shut - these problems weren't fixed during our stay despite reporting them. The coffee machine didn't work properly and the cold water pressure was low. We had no face clothes at first, unless you counted the soggy one at the bottom of the bath. We would really have appreciated a refrigerator and microwave for our young son's food, but these were optional extras charged at a quite ridiculous rate - these are often free (even standard in every room) in much cheaper hotels. Many of these problems were relatively minor - but remember, this is an expensive, luxury hotel. Add to all these niggles the fact that all the time it feels as if staff are hovering for tips, and the whole experience is far from relaxing and pleasant. The location is fabulous - right in the heart of downtown Toronto - and the lobby is gorgeous. The healthclub and pool are also good. But the rooms: nothing to write home about. Top tip: save your money, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and food but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: Very good service and good food. Rooms were good too except the bathroom was really tired with old fittings and tiles. One major problem was the noise from the corridor which carried on late into the night. I noticed that my room was opposite a service area where staff were coming in and out and talking loudly until after 1am. Beds very comfortable and room was very clean. Really good room service with excellent waiter who delivered food promptly and with great style.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBD
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights at the Royal York. Loved the location which meant I could walk everywhere with the access to underground walkways. Beds were comfortable, room was quiet, and I could even open a window for a blast of fresh air if I wanted. We ate our breakfasts in the coffee shop downstairs, always good, and evening meals out. Bathroom was small but adequate, shower worked well. The downstairs lobby is gorgeous and spacious, staff were friendly and helpful. Toronto is hard to beat as a city, and staying here was great. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MacsView
Reviews.Content: My Father and I just returned from an overnight stay at this magnificant hotel. We opted for the Bed and Breakfast Package which included the Fairmount Room with 2 Double beds, breakfast, and valet parking . The hotel's computers were down when we arrived, but the staff were very efficient and pleasant. Our Room was located on the 5th floor facing the back of the hotel. The view from our window wasn't bad, some office buildings and two" little park areas", one with statues of cattle lying on the grass. Below was the hotel's indoor swimming pool. We were able to open our window and let the breeze in instead of having the AC on. The room was spotless and very cozy. I loved its decor. I expected the room to be on the small side, after all the hotel was built in the 1920's. (check out the black and white photographs of the hotel's history located on the mezzanine level, located above the lobby). In the morning, we chose to eat in the York's Kitchen for the breakfast buffet. It was lovely...you can choose from a variety of foods. Overall, I was very pleased and will definitely come back !!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and pleasant stay - as always...”
Reviews.Author: diva_enroute
Reviews.Content: The Royal York in Toronto was a very nice hotel. The hotel had a very nice atmosphere about it typical of a Fairmont hotel. The staff at the check-in were very friendly and accomodating. I always need a quiet room and they managed to get a corner room for me, a bit of a walk but well worth the quiet. The room itself didn't disappoint, traditional old style but very luxurious - it was a bit smaller though than I am used to for the Fairmont but it was still a decent size. The bed was very nice, firm but with a comfortable pillow top. I found the desk a little small, after putting up my laptop I barely had any working room. The location was convenient and being connected to the underground was definitely great considering I was travelling when TO got a huge dump of snow. I ordered room service one evening and found the food decent but nothing to write home about and the fact that I had to wait 45 minutes seem a bit unreasonable. Nonetheless, I would return to the hotel as my stay was very enjoyable and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Public Places; Rooms Just OK”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Visitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week for business purposes. Public areas are nice. The hotel is popular and has a lot of people traffic. Service is very good throughout the hotel. The room was tired and disappointing especially given the good condition of the public spaces and high quality of service. Room was clean, but well worn. One of the room telephones had its cord pulled out of the wall. Called hotel and someone responded fairly quickly. More work space and electrical outlets would be much appreciated. To reach electrical outlets, I had to crawl on my hands and knees to reach them and then unplug a light fixture to have an outlet for my laptop. Internet connection is very expensive. Overall a good experience, but hotel needs to upgrade its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: Krissy1983
Reviews.Content: Although the lobby and main areas were beautiful and very classy, the guest rooms left something to be desired. My carpet was sticky, the walls were dusty and I was given towels that could have used a run through the wash with bleach. The bathrooms are very tiny - you have to close the door to get to the sink. I'm guessing this has something to do with the age of the hotel. Bring your own hairdryer - mine shorted out everytime I tried to use it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: banker_barbie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at his hotel for 3 nights on a conference. I was put in a Jr Suite, which was nice and spacious, but the room was starting to show signs of wear. Nothing major, just rust in the bathroom, some of the electrical outlets look like they had been taken apart and not put back together, and the plasma tv was definately dated - whenever my blackberry would ring or receive a message the tv would freeze. I certainly wouldn't complain about any of these inconveniences, but when you're paying such a high price for a room I did expect the obvious flaws, i.e. an exposed electical outlet in the bathroom to be taken care of. I mentionned to the front desk on my first night and when I checked out it still hadn't been fixed; I had to bring my blow dryer and falt iron to the bedroom to plug them in. The Room Service on the other hand was GREAT! Pricey, as to be expected, but the food was wonderful, and they were very accomodating with my tight time schedules. The conference facilities were nice; also starting to show their age a bit (there's a definately musty smell throughout the hotel) but very clean and wired for any tech needs. One thing I did notice was a tiny roach in the bathroom in the conference area... it was the only one I saw in the entire hotel and the weather has been quite warm here in Toronto the last few weeks so it could have come from outside..? Overall I wouldn't avoid this hotel in the future, but I wouldn't come back on my own dollar. If you have an opportunity to experience it through a convention or one of the specials/deal packages Fairmont posts occasionally go for it, otherwise I would stay at the Westin Harbour Caste, The Grand or even one of the boutique hotels like The Drake.

Reviews.Title: “great location disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: suzeq4
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 3 night stay at the fairmont. Was disappointed with our room just seemed a little tired and run down not really what we expected but saying that we had a wonderful time and your not in room for long!! Nice bar and lovely breakfast in Yorks Kitchen and great location

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience, just okay comfort”
Reviews.Author: cornfedgirl
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont York is definitely a beautiful hotel; you walking into the lobby and it is very elegant as are all the restaurants, bars and rooms. However, the room we had - because we wanted either a king or queen bed instead of 2 doubles - was the size of a large closet. It was definitely one of the smallest hotel rooms I'd ever stayed in. The bed was not that great either; it sagged a bit in the middle. The bathroom was a decent size, however, the door was rather difficult to shut (you had to pull hard) and then getting the door open again sometimes was difficult! The knob would get stuck, so my husband had to open it for me! We were very impressed with Epic... we didn't need a reservation for a Friday night and we were able to go have a drink in the Library Bar and wander over whenever we were done. The food was very good. We really liked the Library Bar as well - It is one of those cozy, dark paneled bars that are great to hang out in. Also, the hotel somehow screwed up our reservation. We had reservations for 4 nights (and we were part of a wedding block) and they had us checking out after 2 nights. We have no idea how they messed that up, and we didn't need to change rooms or anything, we just had to go to the front desk to straighten it out. But it was weird. For our trip, we were going to Toronto for a wedding and for a couple of days of site-seeing, so we didn't care that much that the room was small. So, over-all the stay was fine... nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: meatpatty
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for a week-long convention. I'm pretty sure he got a discounted rate, which does not excuse the poor quality of the hotel rooms. Pros: Convenient location, close to the Convention Center and Union Station. Cons (during my stay): - Couldn't check in when we arrived. There was some computer problem, so they gave a drink coupon and was told to wait. - Room overall: The room was smaller than I expected and did not feel clean. We were placed on the 8th floor, next to the elevator as well as next to a service area. Everyday, we had the displeasure of walking by service carts stored in the hallway next to our room. At first we thought there were howling winds, but after the 10th time in less than an hour, we realized that the elevators were very loud, making it hard to sleep at night. Also, because the room was next to a service area, at any time, the staff were banging carts into the wall. You can easily hear anyone outside your door and down the hall. Supposedly because of our special rate and the convention, they refused to move us to another room. That's bad customer service. - Closet door wouldn't open/close properly. It was off its tracks. It already had a crack in it, and when I tried to open it, the crack grew. - One of the pictures on the wall had a chunk of its frame broken. - One of the three lamps in the room had a dead bulb. Another one was just ridiculously cheap and ugly looking. - Bathroom: The worst! The drain was slow, and when I removed the stopper to see if that would help, I found the hugest wad of hair collected beneath the stopper. Really disgusting. - Wallpaper was visibly damaged in several areas. There was some obvious water damage to this room (bubbled up wallpaper, exposed drywall). This was really unexpected and unsightly. - Internet costs $13.95/day. Apparently it's not available in all rooms, and they don't have wireless. We figured out after the first day that you can join their "President's Club" for free, and get free internet for your entire stay. I think this only applies the first time you join. - Pool: under repair. - Elevators: slow. - I also met another guest that had to go back down to the lobby because they were sent to a room that had not been cleaned. Eww, gross. In summary, whether you're spending your money or someone else's, there are many much better accommodations in Toronto. I'd call this place shabby chic, but it's really just shabby. The exterior and lobby may be cool, but I've stayed in $39 motels with better quality rooms than the Royal York. Until they do some renovations, take your business elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_TravelerUSA101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Fairmont Royal York a couple of times and we really enjoy this grand old hotel. The main lobby is huge and extremely impressive. The old fashioned dÃ©cor is magnificent and itâ€™s entertaining to sit there and watch the action. The upstairs mezzanine area encircling the main lobby contains historical photographs of the hotel and Toronto, which we found to be extremely interesting. The hotel rooms are a descent size and well-appointed with antique type furniture. If youâ€™re looking for a hotel with modern dÃ©cor and style, this is not for you. The hotel is located in the Downtown area. It is a quick walk to the business district, good shopping and Union Station. The subterranean walkway under the hotel contains some reasonably priced shops. Overall, the Fairmontâ€™s staff is professional and helpful. It is a huge hotel, but it is well run and the staff is extremely efficient. The maid service is solid and we found the rooms to be very clean. If you like spectacular old hotels and have a sense of history, you should thoroughly enjoy the Fairmont Royal York. This hotel has truly retained its timeless character. The services and the staff are solid and it has a convenient location. This is my hotel of choice for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancyclu
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the Fairmont Royal York. We had booked a deluxe king room, but upon check-in, that room was not available. Instead Nicole from the front desk put us in a deluxe double, with the hopes that we could be moved the next night. Nicole was very nice, and instructed us to contact Rachel the next morning and gave us an extension to call. Rachel was not able to put us in a deluxe king; instead we were upgraded to a suite. The deluxe double room we had the first night was very roomy and nice, but the suite was fantastic with the separate bedroom. In both rooms, the windows opened and allowed us some fresh air; always nice and very rare in hotels. Also the beds were very comfortable. Room service was excellent and very prompt. Housekeeping did a great job and stopped by each night with bottled water, which is a nice touch (don't forget to tip your housekeeper). We have stayed in older hotels on many occasions, and were pleasantly surprised that the Fairmont is able to retain its older charm without being drab or run down. We were traveling on business, and were impressed with the banquet rooms, and the buffets were the best weâ€™ve ever eaten (thatâ€™s saying a lot). The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Good convention location, good value with package deal”
Reviews.Author: pyegirl
Reviews.Content: The Fairmont is a great hotel if you are taking the train or spending a lot of time at the convention center. I got a great package deal through CANAM worldwide travel agency that included train fare from Sarnia to Toronto, three nights at the Fairmont, a very large hot, buffet breakfast at a restaurent called York's Kitchen in the basement of the Fairmont; plus, all taxes for about $560 US. A very, very good deal considering the cost of accommodations in downtown Toronto and taxes. The best part about this hotel is its location. I spent a lot of time at the convention center so this hotel is really great, only about two blocks from the convention center and just across the street from the Toronto train station. It is right on the subway line too if you want to go to other parts of the city. As for the room, it is on the small side, but normal for a hotel of this age. The room was perfectly tidy, but it looks like it is on a gradual renovation plan. The bathroom has had various parts of it replaced and is looking like it is heading in the right direction, but it has a piece-meal look to it. The granite counter is new, but the tile is on the older side (and although clean) doesn't really match. The wall paper looks like it belongs to someone's grandmother...again, doesn't quite match the granite look, but appears as if it will be the next thing to be replaced. The bed is good and firm and there were 4 fluffy feather pillows. All nice. There was a small couch and desk in the room. Internet service was $14.65 for 24 hours (including all taxes). There is wireless service in the lobby too if you don't want to sit in your room. The lobby is nice, but unlike other reviewers I don't think it is out of this world...it looks kind of sparse, piece-meal, and under-decorated to me given the grandeur of this building. The service is quite good, given the size of this place it is surprising. The buffet breakfast at York's Kitchen (included in my package) was a very nice treat... and the staff at York's Kitchen were all very friendly and helpful. Despite being a buffet breakfast, they will make custom omelets for you at an omelette station. The pool and jacuzzi are currently out of service (maintenance) so if you want to use that you have to go to the Intercontinental Hotel. The downside? It's a large hotel and it does not do somethings that other hotels do...they do not provide forgotten toiletries gratis (you are told to go downstairs to the store, where a disposable razor packet will cost you $6+). What else? Surprisingly, there is no way into this hotel that does not include stairs. So if you are carrying or rolling a lot of luggage, you MUST carry your luggage up at least 12 steps to get into the lobby. I was very surprised that there was absolutely NO WAY to roll yourself into the lobby (despite several entrances). Very surprising in this day and age. I asked them how people with wheelchairs cope and apparently there is one elevator for these clients...but to be honest you would have to ask where it is--it isn't obvious. So if you use a walker or wheelchair make sure you know which entrance has the elevator before you try to enter the building. Could be frustrating. Overall, I thought was a very good deal as I normally spend about $159-$179 at One King West without taxes at the same time of year. The train fare alone was $110 round trip, so that puts the room at about $120-125 per night before taxes and accounting for the price of an equivalent breakfast. A very good deal to me...especially since the best deal I could get through other means (including this website) for the same room was about $220-295/night.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great for a Fairmont property”
Reviews.Author: fayesuave
Reviews.Content: Becareful if you select this hotel to stay at. I stayed here for business purposes and didn't have the best experience. While the location is good (it' s right downtown and is connected to underground pedways), the hotel is located across the street from a train station. If you are a light sleeper the noise will wake you up. Additionally, while the lobby was nice, I found the room decore outdated and dark. The first room I had was on the 5th floor and was not cleaned properly. I complained and was upgraded to an "executive room" that was the quality of what I expected their basic room to be. And the upgraded room wasn't that clean either. Other than that, all amenities are nearby, but you will pay the price for them at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Rocks”
Reviews.Author: stargonewild17
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends stayed at the Fairmont Royal York for 2 nights when we travelled to Toronto to see a concert. It is in great proximity to everything and your really dont have to go outside ( because when we stayed it was in the dead of winter it was almost to cold to go outside) because ther is a path that leads from underneath the hotel to the eaton centre and pretty much all over t.o. Check in was easy and very helpful. The concerige was very helpful and drew out a complete map showing us exactly were the concert was. The rooms are nice very antique like but it really does give it a royal feel. The bathrooms were alittle iffy but still very nice ( taps in shower were a bit hard to set at the right temprature). There is a very nice arcade ( a pathway full of different stores) on the lower level along with restaurants a hair salon and other different sovenir shops. There are also stores lining the pathway that leads to the eaton centre ( ie La Senza, shoppers drug mart, danier leather ,the body shop...) The hotel is very old and has had many important guest staying there before, so of course you know u are gonna be treated like gold. Althogh i didnt like how i seen some of the guest being treated, when they asked a question about the arcade they almost seemed like they were being laughed at by the staff for thinking it was the type of arcade where you play games. This can be a commen mistake for some. Over all the royal york is diffently the best hotel choice in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the historic feel”
Reviews.Author: Spoiled22
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I stayed at the Royal York for my boyfriends birthday to watch a Raptor game at the Air Canada Centre. We only stayed for the one night, but was completely impressed with the customer service and accomodations. When you first walk in to the lobby, there is a spiral staircase with a huge old clock located right in the center of it. Painings, gorgeous dark woods and historic furniture make up the huge lobby. The cutomer service was amazing from the beginning. While checking in, the staff made my boyfriend and I feel so welcomed. Our room was great. We had a corner room (I suggest this!) with a king bed and great view of the lake. I have to admit the room was a bit small, but I have been told this is because of the age of the hotel, since large rooms were not the usual in the twenties (I am pretty sure it was built in 1926 or 27). Food was great. We had dinner at the main dining room, epic and found the atmospher was great. Except we were not thrilled with the price. While the dishes were great tasting, we didn't feel the price was really right for what was served. I don't think i would eat dinner there again, probably just go to dinner outside the hotel. We also had room service for breakfast. We had a package for bed and breakfast, but we slept in unintentionally and the restaurant was no longer serving breakfast. We were really upset, but the hotel made an exception and just sent us breakfast from in room service. I was so impressed they were willing to do this for us. Of course breakfast was amazing, and the man who brought us the breakfast was so sweet. Overall I love this hotel and the history of it.

Reviews.Title: “A fine experience”
Reviews.Author: Ingeco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights while in town for business. It was my first time in Toronto and the staff made me feel quite welcome since the very beginning. The room was more tan fine, great bed and lighting. The bathroom looked a tad old but everything worked properly. Had no problems setting up the broadband internet connection (WiFi would have been better though, to be able to navigate while lying down) and the "help desk" for setting up the wake-up call was ok too. Breakfast on the sublevel cafeteria was very good, but a bit pricey for the overall experience. I ordered room service on my third night, and even thouhg it was after midnight, there was no delay and it was served with a smile (that burger is highly recomended). Didn't go to the club/spa but heard good comments from my group mates.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: jewel_leaf
Reviews.Content: For what you pay, this hotel, while beautiful on the outside, is not all that spectacular in the end. The rooms are small and walls are paper thin. We were not happy to hear the neighbouring room's guest playing a clarinet at 8 am on a Sunday morning! The decor seems a bit dated, although some may say it is 'classic'....depends on your taste. I wouldn't stay here again, and would choose somewhere like Novotel about 5 minutes away which seems like a better deal to me.

Reviews.Title: “Failed to live up to expectations.......”
Reviews.Author: Luck-o-the-Brirish
Reviews.Content: This "Grand Old Lady" of Toronto will charm you with her impressive exterior and lavish lobby, however the rooms may leave some travelers a little miffed. Upon entering my room (an upper floor King with a lake view) I was immediately surprised by its size...or should I say "lack there of!" The room was clean and the bed comfortable, but the bathroom was absolutely tiny and the T.V. would have fit in my pocket. Overall the room just felt very tired and dated, which is somewhat surprising since all the hotel literature talks about are the millions recently spent on rennovations. I would recommend this hotel to someone on a weekend getaway who just wants to say they've stayed at the Royal York. However, business travelers should steer clear of this Fairmont property. The nickle and dime fees they charge for everything from Internet access to local and calling card phone usage left me wishing I'd followed my gut and stayed at the new Marriott Residence Inn down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Landmark Glamour”
Reviews.Author: SandSunandSea
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a two week stay at the Fairmont Royal York. The hotel is situated directly across Union Station in the heart of downtown Toronto. Upon entering the hotel, you will be amazed by the regal lobby furnishings and decor of the hotel. The woodwork, floral arrangements and gleaming floor mosaics are truly what make the hotel so glamorous. With regards to the rooms, due to the age of the building, they are on the small side compared to the newer luxury hotels available to travelers in Toronto. Many of the rooms have been refurbished giving them a more contemporary edge. The rooms boast large flat screen televisions, extremely comfortable bedding and luxury soaps in the washrooms. The marble appointed washrooms are also on the small side and consist of a bathtub- shower combination and sink. The beds are extremely comfortable but slightly smaller than the usual double bed dimensions. The hotel also offers its patrons the convenience of having several dining options within the hotel itself. On the ground floor there is EPIC Restaurant which serves both light dining options as well as four course gourmet meals. Although on the pricey side, the food is divine. There is also a Beni Hana restaurant on the floor below as well Pipers Resto-bar and two restaurants where you can get breakfast in the morning. The York CafÃ© serves breakfast for those on the go while Yorkâ€™s Grill offers hot and cold buffet breakfast options to its diners. The hotel also has great training facilities and a beautiful pool area. The extra touches such as the lemon-water and headsets for the integrated TVâ€™s in the exercise equipment provided to the clients add a special touch. There are also various underground passages below the hotel which connect directly to various other buildings. This is especially convenient to those business travellers who have clients in the surrounding financial district. Although I enjoyed my stay at the hotel, I would strongly recommend staying at this hotel if you can get a discounted room rate. Otherwise, the regular rates of $300-$400 a night may be overpriced for the room amenities and services offered at the hotel despite its well established status.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: iduj
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. My room was clean and large but not luxurious.When I got to the room I found the plastic shade that blocked out the middle of the window heaped onto the back of a chair. I was too tired to call the front desk to get this remedied so I just tacked it back up myself. This seemed pretty sloppy though. Also, the room didn't have a robe. This may seem knit-picky, but a nice robe goes a long way to making you feel a little pampered, especially after long day. The bed and linens were comfortable, and the bathroom decent sized although slightly old-looking. The staff at the hotel was very friendly upon check in and check out. I ate breakfast at the casual buffet in the basement concourse -- it was decent but nothing to write home about. Overall this seems like a once opulent hotel that now feels a bit shabby around the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: myp22202
Reviews.Content: Was booked small room because of convention in town. Room is comfortable, but hotel is old and shows the wear of age. Room service is pretty good. Club level is nicer with club lounge access, but rooms can look old. Reliable hotel with Fairmont service, but newer boutiques may be more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with grandeur and history”
Reviews.Author: ByronOz
Reviews.Content: Large downtown hotel that maintains an authentic sense of tradition and comforts of the past. Good facilitles - clean; great beds and bedding; 'smallish side' standard rooms (but OK); range of restaurants Good service - friendly; accomodating. Great location - connected to city's underground shopping mall network; located opposit main ViaRail station; easy to get to sights etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karine_ETC
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3 nights in January. Staff is extremely helpful and nice. Hotel rooms are excellent, including the beds which is not always the case. My room was located by the elevators which means it suffered a bit from the noise but isn't that the charm of staying in a older hotel. Although the hotel is old, the carpet and everything was absolutely fine. I would absolutely go again

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish_groovy_chick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the New Year. As with any hotel that has over 1,300 guest rooms it is impersonal. Good location for getting around the city. Beds are SO comfortable. We stayed in a standard room, decent size, clean, a lot of noise from the hall and surrounding rooms due to thin walls! Breakfast really good.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: thesungoddess
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto for a nice weekend with my boyfriend & found a great deal to stay at the Royal York. I thought to myself we have to jump on the chance to stay here because I have heard great things about it! I had also previous worked at a Fairmont Hotel & the quality was always excellent. I have to admit I was slightly dissapointed with the hotel. It was huge and beautiful that's for sure. We had pre-booked for a king sized-bed and ended up with 2 doubles. Who wants a romantic weekend sleeping in seperate beds?? I also found the room very small. The 2 beds took up most of the space & I was barely able to set up the ironing board in the morning. The bathroom was tiny too! Although it was very small, the room was very beautiful also. Crown molding, nice furniture, etc. The selection of tea they provide is excellent so take advantage of this. The location was also wonderful. We went shopping & to a Leafs game & didn't have to even walk outside (although we did at times) since the hotel was connected to everything downtown by the Path. Very handy. All in all it was a nice stay, with a few minor oopsies.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to our stay!”
Reviews.Author: KatyKent
Reviews.Content: We chose to end our stay in Toronto here as friends had raved about it and we wanted to visit the CN Tower which is nearby. It is huge and beautifully ornate in a victorian way but the staff were all helpful and friendly. It was not the cheapest place to stay but worth spoiling yourself a little. It was also convenient (Opp.Union Station) for theatres and the Eton Centre etc.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Warmth”
Reviews.Author: melrose13
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers old fashioned Canadian Pacific Railway hospitality brought right up to date. The rooms were large and comfortable and well supplied. The staff were friendly and helpful. The public areas were sumptious with a small selection of upmarket shops on the lower level. There were several restaurants to choose from charging variuos prices. We sampled two of them and food and service were excellent. My ony complaint was that I had too much food but I have a modest appetite. A hungry man would be satisfied. The hotel was central and surrounded by lots of interesting places to eat out. From the hotel we could join the underground walkways around the city centre. These were lined with shops which made winter shopping easy and warmer. The spa was refreshing after a busy day out. I have stayed in other Toronto hotels in the past but would not book any other hotel in Toronto now.

Reviews.Title: “Tired old hotel that needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: swervin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during Grey Cup week. This is the 4th hotel in the Canadian Fairmont group that we've stayed at and it is by far the most dissapointing. While conveniently located, it is a tired old hotel that is in desparate need of renovations. Wallpaper peeling off the walls, frayed phone outlets and finicky faucets are but a few of the problems we encountered in our 7th floor room. The carpet was old and worn, the general decor looked outdated, and our "nonsmoking" room clearly smelled of smoke. When i called to complain of the smell they offered to come and "deodorise" the room. I agreed , and after 4 hours noone had come to perform this service. Due to the Grey Cup festivities we were not in our room very much so we put up with it for the remainder of our stay. It was, however, in a great location close to many shops and restaurants and has an entrance to the PATH system of underground shops and walkways. We took full advantage of that. All things considered, it wasnt our worst hotel experience, but it was far from our best and especially dissapointing for a Fairmont property.

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur resting on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is steeped in history and grandeur and is indeed a landmark property in Toronto. I have stayed here on many occasions, and I have to admit it is always pleasant to be back, (though mainly because I am so familiar with it). However, there are some significant problems in the property which I feel have been evident for some time and which the owners seem reluctant to resolve. I suspect this is because, as is so often the case, they are more than able to fill the rooms regardless - it's always busy, and even more so when there's any kind of conference or festival going on. I can't speak about any rooms other than the basic standard, (it's all my company pays for!!) so the suites etc. may well be fantastic. Inkeeping with the history of the property, they are rather 'chintzy' - all floral fabrics etc. and dark woods. Fine, but rather tired, occasionally dirty and worn. I once found a pile of beer cans under an armchair and have found worse. I've only ever had a 'single' room, i.e. with a sole queen bed, and found it quite small but fine for the time I have spent there. The bathrooms are quite compact, too, with minimal space for all your toiletries. It's all quite pleasant and quiet but I certainly would not pay the rates they undoubtedly charge if my company was not paying. The lobby and public spaces are impressive, (aren't they always?!) and the hotel is connected to the underground tunnels so if its cold/rainy you don't need to go outside...quite handy! If you have made any special requests, I'd advise you to stand firm and get what you pay for - which is undoubtedly quite a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Seriously disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LJY76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel and were very disappointed. I agree that the hotel is in a very convenient location but not worth the price. The hotel is closer to a three star hotel than a four star hotel. Some of the main problems were that my request for a room without feathers was missed, the phone was broken in the room and not repaired or replaced within 5.5 hours. On top of that the lady I spoke to had minimal customer service skills and was sarcastic to me. Breakfast at the Royal York Cafe was terrible. Although I have low expectations for any buffet, the breads were dry, food oily, and fruit not fresh. This is a hotel that I really wanted to stay at for years. It did not live up to any of my expectations. I would rather pay an extra hundred dollars a night and stay at a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Truckerbob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Grey Cup weekend and what a wonderful old hotel. Not a place for someone who is looking for modern as the charm of the place is it's history. Being an older hotel the rooms are smaller then alot of the latest hotels. Made my reservation many months before the Grey Cup as I knew it would be booked solid. When we arrived we were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost as all the rooms were gone. All the staff are friendly at all times and very helpful. We only had breakfast there and found it a little on the expensive side. Did not try out the pool, etc. I would stary there again on a moments notice.

Reviews.Title: “So So Tired”
Reviews.Author: williamc
Reviews.Content: Well, if you wanted to visit a busy carpeted railway station that also had bedrooms, go here! It was a very tired hotel with old fashioned decorated rooms that were rather shabby albeit clean. The bathroom was old, and again although functional, tired in need of a major refurbishment. I guess the candid photgraphs really do justice to the hotel. The bars however were quite atmospheric which is I believe indicitive of the railroad feel due to loads of transient guests meeting at this hotel for an onward journey. I understand from a guide we had that indeed this hotel was a grand old railroad hotel, its just disappointing the decor has remained in the past as well. I found the food to be quite good although the staff appeared generally to be absorbed in their own conversations rather than giving customers appropriate attention. Conclusion......old tired large hotel that really misses any concept of personal service and thus not worth the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced dump”
Reviews.Author: Ellis2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most every major hotel in downtown Toronto. This is the worst value. Great location and history, so they get away with mediocre product at super premium price, gouging naive tourists. See the Pictures

Reviews.Title: “Another solid visit at the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: ChaunceyGardiner
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay here in mid-November. Iâ€™ve been here before, so know the place and happily returned. I paid for an upgrade to a superior room (twice the size of their regular rooms) and was very pleased. The first night I was in a very large, very nice room, but it was kitted out for wheelchair accessâ€¦ which meant I was on my knees to adjust the thermostat, turn on lights, etc. I asked the next morning if I could be moved, and they effortlessly accommodated me. I was put into a corner room, which was spacious and well furnished. Both rooms were sparkling clean, and bathrooms had Miller Herman toiletries! (Ms. Gardiner will be quite happy with the hand lotion!). I was a bit surprised that a hotel at this price point didnâ€™t have turndown chocolatesâ€¦ thatâ€™s quite odd. Thereâ€™s a Starbucks 50 feet out the hotelâ€™s PATH door (in the underground sidewalks that connect all of Toronto), so I was happy with my coffee each morning. Several restaurants on-site, but, at $1.10 the Loonie, a bit dear. Sandwiches in the basement were fast; drinks in the Library Lounge always fashionable, but never cheap. Venture out to Canyon Creek further down Front Street, or Adesso Italian in the PATH walkways next door (past Starbucks, bear to your left, hidden on the right). Meeting services were smart and timely at the conference I was in. Tip: Enroll in the Fairmont Presidentâ€™s Club and get free internet access. This hotel had a blistering 100mb hardwire connection, so work was easy and fast. Ten points in my book for this alone! Great location, directly across the street (by tunnel) from Union Station, and a brief walk to all of the CBDâ€¦ a longer walk, but certainly doable, to Eaton Centre. Terrific visit at a Grande Dame hotelâ€¦ Been here before, and I will most certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: PotterMoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, and, having upgraded to a Signature Room, found ourselves in room 152 on the 14th floor. The room was big, with a separate sitting area with a desk and comfy sofa, and neutral decor. The bed was huge, and extremely comfortable. There was a largish bathroom, and a separate WC off the sitting room. The breakfast buffet was included as part of our package, and was variable, despite the hotel not being that busy. We also ate in the York Station Bar - the soup and sandwiches were excellent after coming in from the cold, and the service very friendly - and in Piperâ€™s Bar, where the food was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old-Fashioned Luxury”
Reviews.Author: cancerdoc
Reviews.Content: I've been here on business before - at someone elseâ€™s expense. This time on holiday at my own expense. What a fabulous hotel, amazing public areas, friendly, helpful, courteous staff. Wonderfully comfortable "superior" room on an upper floor, the only minor quibble being the smallish "corporate" bathroom. Nice toiletries (Penhaligon) generously resupplied. We booked a B+B rate which confused the staff enormously. On the concierge floor a (limited) buffet breakfast was provided with the room cost but we were told we could eat breakfast anywhere in the hotel, which we did, eating a la cart in Epic and also being encouraged by the waiter to raid the buffet. It turned out that we should have limited ourselves to a buffet in any of the restaurants. Anyway, it was all charmingly "comped-off" when we checked out. Great old hotel, with real comfort, convenience and courtesy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Even Greater City”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Royal York in Toronto. This is a classic 1920's hotel. Our room was smallish but very nice. (the bigger rooms were sold out). The hotel is in a great location, close to the CN Tower, the Train station and close to the water front. Staff was excellent and never batted an eye for any of our requests. (bring the car up, umbrella, dining recomendations ect...) Love the hotel and love the city.

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur at the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: JoAdrian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal York for 4 days for a conference. First impressions were OK - friendly greeting from the bell boy and a lavish lobby. However, I queued for about 20 minutes to check in which, after an 8 hour flight from the UK, I could have done without; and then waited half an hour for my bag to be brought up to my room. Although my room was clean and my bed comfortable, the bathroom was tired and could have done with complete refurbishment. I struggled to have a hot shower the whole time I was there. The food I ate during the conference itself was extremely poor. I put this down to difficulties in catering for the masses, but I was equally unimpressed by the breakfast I paid for on my last morning at Epic, the hotel's main restaurant. I also had mixed experiences of the concierge - generally very helpful but less so when we came to plan a trip to Niagara Falls (we were told that it was not possible to fit in a trip in the limited time we had available one day before my colleague was flying home, but after not too much research online we discovered that this was not the case and enjoyed a fabulous day trip under our own steam). All in all, the impression I was left with was that the Royal York was like a former grande dame who has fallen on hard times. As I struggled with my own bag as I left the hotel with no offer of assistance, I vowed not to return - at least not until she has had a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Delusions of Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: I_SpyUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in September during a conference/exhibition so location was a factor for this hotel, although it wasn't first choice and others were nearer the convention centre. The Fairmont is old school through and through and looks pretty impressive as its a big hotel and is supposed to have a good reputation, however on close inspection its way passed its 'sell by date'. The reception and corridors bare a striking resemblance to the hotel in the movie - 'The Shining' The rooms are pretty small and quite frankly shabby, furniture with knocks out of the wood, paintwork faded, chipped and peeling. Bathroom had rusty fittings and the shower only got to lukewarm when turned fully to hot! Worst of all on my arrival I noticed that the previous occupants toe nail clippings were still on the floor near the bed (disgusting). Increadably it took the cleaning staff 4 days to spot this before they finally 'cleaned' the room. The hotel was supposed to have had a re-fit a few years ago but I saw no evidence of this and if it had beendone it must have been pretty bad before. All in all will not be returning here when next in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Downtown and Busy”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: This is a very large property. I found it to be clean and comfortable. It is very well located across from Union station downtown. The food in EPIC restaurant was excellent. I gave this hotel 3 stars because I didn't leave feeling that Fairmont wow. Maybe becasue I didn't take a suite and passed through very quickly. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: WellTravelledOntario
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations, wonderful bedding, loved the feather pillows and Duvet. Very Clean. Would recommend a room away from elevators, other than this it was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel in the Very Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: AB2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our wedding anniversary and was hugely impressed with the hotel. Although the Royal York is truly enormous, the service was excellent and the facilities superb (particularly the spa). Our room on the 11th floor was fantastic and was a very good size. Development on the lakefront obscures most of the harbour views but the location of the Royal York is unbeatable and it really feels like the very hub of the city. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Highly OVERRATED Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller1198
Reviews.Content: A landmark hotel which is slightly 'arrogant' in it's appracoh to customer service and standards. Particular issues -as expected from a city hotel rooms are small - very small about 12ft x 12 ft. beds very soft and springy. Double bed VERY small. Daughter had to sleep on FLOOR for two nights! - bed sheets had rips in. Bathroom tiles coming away - generally a 'tired' hotel room. Would suggest there are much better and higher quality hotels to stay in, in Toronto - would give this one a miss!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: EdRicarti
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal York for 1 night and just loved it!!! I actually live in Toronto but decided to have a night out with my partner. We arrived early and they were able to check us into our signature room right away. After leaving our bag in the room we went to have a bite at the â€œEPICâ€� lounge, I was a little disappointed with the lunch selections and the service. Went back to the room and enjoyed the amazing bed, the bathroom was also up to Fairmont standards. After spending some time in bed we went to have diner at â€œEPICâ€�, now we are talking, perfect dinner, from service to food and ambiance. The pool was unfortunately closed for maintenance (I was informed of the situation when the reservation was made), and did not have time to see the gym. The location of the hotel is very convenient. If you are a business traveler the financial district is just steps away. For the tourist many attractions are within walking distance, and there is a subway and train station just across the street from the hotel, witch is also serviced by an airport shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh! Very, very shabby.”
Reviews.Author: pompom79
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Fairmont for 4 nights by our company's travel arranger but checked into other accommodations after the first night. I had been confirmed in a non-smoking room, however upon arriving at the hotel in the early evening, I was told that no non-smoking rooms remained. I was upgraded to a larger room on one of the smoking floors instead and was told an ionizer would be sent up, but none had appeared by the time I returned from dinner much later that night. The room itself was incredibly shabby - it was one of the rooms that had yet to be renovated and was in dreadful condition. The TV was a 17" model that looked at least 15 years old, there was peeling paint, dents and scuffs everywhere, and the carpet was stained. Despite being about 600 sq ft in size, the room had as much furnishing as one would expect in a smaller room so there was a vast expanse of nothingness in the middle of the room. Very little lighting too - one had to wander around and turn on the few lamps by hand - and only one very small window facing an office building - no natural light came in through this at all. The couch cushions were askew and the pictures on the walls hung unevenly, while the armoire door wouldn't close all the way. It was the shabbiest hotel I've seen in at least a decade, and it's not worth chancing a stay here lest you should end up in one of the un-renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnph
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, excellent location, friendly attentive staff. Looking forward to going back sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough”
Reviews.Author: MaggieDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Royal York for 3 nights at the start of a 3 week trip and for 1 night at the end. When we arrived after a 7 hour flight there was nobody to help us at the door with our luggage. This is a grand hotel with a lot of history and the public areas are pretty impressive. It's a very busy spot and you feel as though you are just a number and don't really matter. Checking in the receptionist was efficient but not all all friendly. We were on the 14th floor with fantastic city views. This is a very old hotel by Canadian standards and our room felt old and was in need of a refurbishment as it was somewhat 'tired'. The big king size bed was comfortable though. On our return trip we stayed on the 6th floor - this was a much nicer room and had been recently decorated and had a flat screen TV so I guess they are working on upgrading the rooms. We used both the pool and the gym which are both very good facilities and well looked after. The hotel is in Toronto's financial district and is a good location (directly opposite Union Station). Valet parking is expensive at $35 per night. Overall a good hotel but a smile from the receptionist would go a long way to a weary traveller!

Reviews.Title: “Wow- Beautiful, Classy, Truly 5*!”
Reviews.Author: kiara_renee
Reviews.Content: I chose the Fairmont Royal York, because I have heard of the Faimonts, and was told that they were the nicest hotels throughout Canada. Their reputation does not lie. To begin with, our driver told us in the car that the Fairmont was the nicest hotel in Toronto- and when we arrived in, we were exhausted after 40hrs of travelling. It was such a relief to walk into such a gorgrous lobby, with friendly, helpful staff. When we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised. It was nicer than I expected. We were in a deluxe room, which had a nice view out over the lake. It was spacious, had 2 double beds aswell as a sofa bed- and best of all- had 2 bathrooms! The only thing I didn't like, was that the bathrooms didn't have extractor fans- but this seems to be common in North America.... The location is ideal- walking distance from everything. The Union station (subway) is directly underneath the hotel (part of the underground shopping system called PATH), the main trainstation is accross the road, lots of eating places nearby. Also walking distance from the ferry to get out to the islands. Best hotel I have ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....but...”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, relatively easy to get everywhere. Staff was incredibly friendly and helpful...but.... Can they PLEASE get tv's that are larger than 17 inches and add wireless to the guest rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...!”
Reviews.Author: savvygal
Reviews.Content: Our family spent three nights at the Royal York and we couldn't have asked for a better stay. Rooms were wonderful - we had just a double room and with two kids 11 and 13, we never felt cramped or clausterphobic. The beds themselves were heavenly, very comfortable. The pool and workout area is fantastic. You never heard another person walking the halls or in another room, it was very quiet and peaceful even though the hotel is situated in busy downtown Toronto. Staff was extremely polite, from holding the elevator to getting acurate subway directions, we had nothing but positive experiences with them. Just watch out for the bottled water and snacks in the room...if you are with kids, hide them. A bottled water will cost you $8 and a chocolate bar as much as $4. Other than that, it was very luxurious and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters07
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location - opposite the station. The room was small but lovely. Only problem was you could hear other people returning to their rooms at night. Not a lot of sound proofing around the door. If you're taking a car then use the self-park not the Valet as it is right behind the hotel and a whole lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dandrew
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel. It is absolutly stunning. The looby is out of this world. The pool is nicely touched and has a great staff. The room we stayed in was butiful, the beds were great. This is one of the best hotels in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Not so much the room.”
Reviews.Author: boy20_00
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 of my friends deceided to stay at the fairmont royal york for a weekend (i had booked from expedia), we were in town for a concert. and we loved the hotel. the door of your car was opened upon arrival with a nice greating from their doormen.. your bags were taken and you didn't see them agian till you reached your room. the hotel was beautiful and grand. check in was fast and the service was awsome. we got to our room and it wasnt so grand or beautiful, infact it was sorta sad to see, i have stayed at hiltons alot more roomy and more updated. but it had a nice european feel to it, and it didnt look much like the pictures. the shower had a little bit of rust around the shower handle, it wasnt the greatest of bathrooms i actually locked myself in the bathroom becuase the locks are so old and stiff it was hard to get open NOT FOR THE ELDERLY OR WEAK. the mini bar was EXPENSIVE. $3.75 for a can of coke... its so expensive the bell man was even telling us to go down to the shoppers drug mart down the street to pick up pop and other supplies we may need rather then getting it from the hotel mini bar or even the convience store located in the hotel. but other than that we had a beautiful view of the CN tower and our room was located on the 8th floor. the elevators were extremly fast and we loved the hotel it was conviently connected to the TTC Subway through the underground pathway. TV's were small. walls are a bit thin due to being a old hotel. this is a great hotel to stay in. you can feel the history and elegance throughout this hotel. i would recommend this hotel to anyone but i would also recommend upgrading to a deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCleveland
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, with a gorgeous lobby and a very friendly staff. It was close to the subway, so it was very easy to get around the city. The hotel is connected to both the subway and an underground mall, which was accessible for food and shopping. The hotel's concierge staff was extremely helpful with my requests for information about local theater, dining and going to the gay neighborhood. The room was small but the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: DarkJustice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Fairmont as part of a convention. The convention hotel was overbooked and we were put in this hotel. We were in a corner room with a single bed. The room was clean and well maintained. The hotel has great character. It is older but well kept. The location was convienent to Union Station for public transportation. During the stay the maid dropped my wife's curling iron. It had been broken at the airport and she profusely apologized. They offered to replace the iron but were told it was already broke. When we returned to the room they had given us a food tray and a hand-written note from the maids apologizing for breaking the iron and my wife being so nice about it. I was impressed. I would definately stay here again. We didn't have the gold or presidents club and still got a great room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lsmith06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fairmount through the package deal Toronto had on for during SARS (great deal, wish they still had it). Very nice hotel, beautiful... Since we got it through that package deal we just got one of the regular rooms. I found the rooms (my sister also got the package) to be pretty small. It was a great experience staying there and had no problems with staff or anything. I just would have been disappointed if I had of paid full price (because it is quite expensive for that size of a room. I duno maybe I was just expecting more...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristysh
Reviews.Content: I'm a travel agent and I had a free night at the Fairmont Royal York in one of their deluxe rooms. I earned the free night by booking clients into Fairmont hotels all over the world. I was travelling with my boyfriend and my mother so when we checked in I asked if we could be upgraded to a suite that has a separate bedroom area. We arrived around 12:30 in the afternoon. I dealt with Hugo at the front desk who was very helpful. He offered to upgrade me to the suite for $200. This room normally goes for $800 a night. We accepted the upgrade but our room wasn't ready yet. We were told to come back around 3:00. We did some sightseeing and came back at 3:00 but our room still wasn't ready. This was disappointing although I believe the people staying there before us requested late checkout and at the time they requested it, we were not booked in that room yet so they probably figured since no one was staying there they could stay longer and take their time cleaning it. Anyway we went over to the CN Tower (very close by, about a 5 minute walk) and we came back around 4:30 and our room was ready. It was a gorgeous room (3173-75 on the 3rd floor). It had 2 bathrooms and the decor was amazing. There was a fireplace, a china cabinet, a dining table, and a nice view. My only gripe about the room is there was no mini fridge. There was the bar fridge that was fully stocked (and VERY expensive) but I like to have a fridge to keep our own stuff as well. We only stayed for 1 night and we opted for the valet parking because when we checked in I asked what the cost of parking is. I was told it's $24 for self parking and $25 for valet. I thought that was strange so I said to the guy "Well jeez, it's worth the extra $1 to get valet isn't it? Why would anyone ever use self parking?" And he said "I know." When we checked out, we're told valet parking is $35 and I explained this isn't what we were quoted but she said there was nothing she could do about it. Basically, the hotel was gorgeous but it is definitely for business people and people that have a TON of money. I could never imagine paying full price at the hotel but it was really nice to stay there at such a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: HotelPrincess67
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel lobby is beautiful, lower level of hotel has breakfast areas (2 to choose from), on-site bars, a few stores, etc. What really "turned me off" was the concierge desk. On 2 days I went to the desk and a young lady assisted me. She was knowledgeable but not at all friendly. She performed her duty but offered nothing else. When I greeted her with a good morning, nothing - no response but she did assit me. Whilst I was being assisted, another guest came to the desk and a lady with a British accent, was on a call, when she finished her call, I watched her...she proceeded to fluff around w/some brochures but didn't acknlewlege the other guest at the desk. The guest/lady was very patient and waited for the British worker to finish her organization of brochures. I travel all over as I am a meeting planner and I frequent the concierge desks in many hotels and this one was the worst. Not at all friendly! The maid that was cleaning my rooms was not pleasant either. Bottom line....not many happy workers here....and it shows......

Reviews.Title: “Staying on the Concierge Level (12th floor) is worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: nctarheel06
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 month old, and I stayed at the Fairmont while attending the conference. It couldn't have been a more convenient location -- right across the street from Union Station, within very close proximity to the CN Tower and countless restaurants, shops, and banks. We got a deal through Expedia that gave us a cheaper rate than the conference room rate and upgraded us to the concierge Gold floor. We weren't familiar with the perks of the concierge level but since it was cheaper, we went for it and couldn't have been happier. You have express check-in/out, concierge just for the floor, turn-down service with 2 free bottles of water every night. Free hors d'oevres just for Gold floor residents every evening from 5-7pm (and they were very fancy - lemongrass shrimp skewers, asparagus wrapped with roast beef). This actually took the place of dinner twice so it saved quite a bit of money. There was a deluxe breakfast buffet as well with all kinds of fresh cut fruit (even lychee), fancy omelets that changed every day, various pastries, breads, cheeses, a few types of fish. This was the fanciest hotel inclusive buffet I had ever had. All food was served on nice china. In other words, the food is a very nice perk. The room was nicely furnished and I also liked the toiletries (imported from Slovakia). The hotel embodied class. However, the one complaint is that being a historic hotel, the walls were extremely thin and I could hear sounds very clearly on both sides of our room (even someone coughing). We felt that the pros definitely outweighed the cons at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: clements28
Reviews.Content: Having read some poor reviews about this hotel we were slightly anxious about staying there, but what are people complaining about!! Check in was a worrying few moments as we'd requested two ajoining rooms, a double & twin. The receptionist took a while to find us suitable accomodation as there was a conference on the day we arrived. However we were allocated two rooms in the recently refurbished 6th floor which were very good. Not huge in size, but more than adequate. We used the pool on two occasions & the staff there were very helpful. The location was great for the CN Tower. The carpark was $24 a day, make sure you get your voucher from reception to get the discount. We ate breakfast in the cafe in the mall under the hotel, huge selection of food buffet style. Don't have the bottled water in the room, go to the souvenir shop in the mall (open 'til late) where it's a lot cheaper! The hotel had an old style elegance about it without being stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Berkut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I treated my parents to a weekend in Toronto as a gift. We chose the Royal York as it seemed to be a elegant hotle with a convenient location. These assumptions were correct. I found the facilities to be well maintained for the age and the amenities numerous. The restaurant, Epic, located on site has a fantastic high tea service. Excellent food, and attentive service. I booked through Expedia and found that the prices were quite reasonable, 165 per night (including taxes!) I would hole heartedly recommend this hotel to others. My only caveat to travelers is that it is a very classic hotel, not a new place that is austere and modern. I prefer the muted understatement of older hotels, but if you wish to stay in a Modern, sharp edged, new style hotel, you may be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEfamilyman
Reviews.Content: An excellent old urban hotel. Some of the older urban properties are worn-down, tired. The FRY was fresh, clean, looked like it had been recently updated but had the amenities of an older property with great location, lots of open space. Very friendly staff, helfpul concierge. Rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable with nice amenities. Easy walk to many local eateries, attractions, convention center. I liked the fact that there were many different dining options within the hotel. One of my most positive urban hotel experiences. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, elegant, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a huge conference that took place across the street at the Toronto Convention Center. I have stayed at many nice resorts and will try to make comparison as I see fit. First off, I was originally going to stay at the Delta Chelsea. However, I am now glad I ended up paying more for the Fairmont. 1. Location. This was literally across the street from Union Station and the Toronto Convention Center. CN tower was a short walk as well. The hotel is also connected to PATH. This is Toronto's underground shopping system. 2. Service. Everyone was nice and friendly. Every time I called, I would get..."hello Dr.___, What can I do for you" Daily maid service was ok. Other hotels I stayed at (i.e. Ritz) would tidy up the room as well. The maid only put things to the side. Overall, this is a very classy hotel and you get the service you paid for. 3. Presidential Club. * This is the biggest tip that I could give you about this hotel. Join the club prior to your visit. It is free to join and takes about 2 min to sign up. You get so many more benefits. It includes: free local calls, free daily high-speed interent, free newspaper, and best of all Fairmont Fit. This is when Adidas lets you borrow new work-out clothes and shoes during your stay. If you sign up while you are there, the benefits don't start till your next stay. 4. Room. I stayed in a Fairmont Queen (approx 250sf) on the 3rd floor. The room was a tad small, but comfortable. It is more of an elegant style. Things are a tad old (including T.v.). The bed was comfortable (not the best that I've stayed in) and the pillows were really soft. The shower head was great. I loved the water pressure. The closet was really small and had a safe right in the middle. I was at the very end of the hall so it was extremely quiet. 5. Price. I paid about $300 (including taxes). I didn't care about the price, because my work was paying for it. However, if I had to pay for it myself, I would consider it a tad high. I have never stayed at a Fairmont, but my thoughts is that it rivals the Ritz. For that price, I would think they would upgrade the amenities in their room. Hope this review helps. Once again, if you book, make sure to join the Presidents club.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC...”
Reviews.Author: sillygirl99
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love buildings with history and character and have always admired the Royal York. That is why we booked it for my birthday weekend trip to Toronto. It's in a great location across from Union Station and close to the Hummingbird Centre where we had tickets to a concert on Saturday night. However I have to admit it was a bit of let-down when we entered our room. It was definitely in need of a makeover. This was our second stay in the hotel, and our first stay was a lot more enjoyable. We understand that a hotel of this age is not going to be "shiny and new", and the character is the appeal of the Royal York, but the wallpaper peeling off the walls in the moldy bathroom was not the character we were looking for. It's too bad that such a beautiful hotel hasn't been looked after like it should be!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, small rooms, pricey, FABULOUS troom service”
Reviews.Author: ERStexellence
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, and easy to get to from the airport. The rooms were clean, I would give it five starts, but I thouight the room rate was way too high for such a small room. Okay, I was there for a business trip so I succombed to room service. I ordered a cobb salad and it is probably the best salad I have EVER eaten! It was absolutely stupendoulsy delicioous! And priced pretty reasonably, too. The breakfast buffet on the weekend was also quite nice. Nice stay, just wish it cost less.

Reviews.Title: “Gets older every time I go”
Reviews.Author: GMROCKS
Reviews.Content: I'd like to say nice things about this stately old hotel other than the price location on front st. in downtown Toronto....but unfortunately I cannot. It does serve ok for holding large conferences in that the lobby is spacious and has several large meeting rooms. However, the rooms are absolutely cramped, with questionable HVAC and plumbing. Hallway & neighbour noise also is an issue. make sure you ask to be FAR away from elevators as these ancient beasts make quite the noise for nearby rooms! All and all, I say avoid the hotel as there are plenty of better ones in the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: yaltachick
