Reviews.Content: Great location, the ballroom is wonderful for a meeting of our size (double hollow square fitting 60 people), and the concierge staff are quite courteous. Regarding the meeting itself: had an individual who was very allergic to many foods, and the catering staff, although had the special dietary requirements request MONTHS in advance, failed to come through. The gentleman was given a voucher to go to the lobby restaurant, which meant he ate alone for most of the meals. We were there the day before Bill Clinton's birthday party and it felt like the staff were far more concerned with that event instead of ours. Furthermore, the A/V company wound up giving us a full gratis on our delegate mics as they simply did not work, creating many embarrasing moments with delegates YELLING across the tables to each other. Quite upsetting for a hotel of this caliber. I will not book a meeting here again. EVER. The room was quite old and in dire need of a pick-me-up. The bathroom wasn't in very good shape either. Understanding that the hotel is quite large and a refurbishment would take time, I let it go. However, if you are looking for a nice experience, don't come here.

Reviews.Title: “Thumb's Up to Tradition”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripFans
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto on business alone and enjoyed returning at night to such a warm and friendly property. It was as if you could feel the tradition. Check out the great pics on the mezzanene. great just sitting in lobby too. Had had horrible car and train trip from MI and arrived after 1 a.m. exhausted. Desk staff were great and gave me the best view possible for a cheap package room. Room was small but far more interesting than most hotel chain rooms. Fire alarm going off at 5 a.m. was not welcomed but found out later had also occured at hotel across street as well. Staff very friendly. Liked gift shop and staff was knowledgable and helpful. Hotel has great location esp in winter. Took advantage of underground system of tunnels which is amazing. Only caution-tunnel under street from station to hotel has alot of steps to haul luggage up. If you have heavy suitcase, walk outside. Looking forward to going back sometime to this classic old railroad hotel. It lived up to and surpassed advance billing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CLLB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the International AIDS conference in August. It is a beautiful, old hotel in a central location. It had many conveniences such as a business center, small gym/pool, restaurants, mini market, and being attached to the underground tunnel network. Being part of the conference, I also felt very much in the middle of everything going on---I think you could walk to just about any part of the city. The room itself was nice enough. I think the bathtub could have done with a little bit of any update, but other than that no complaints. I didn't have a great view, but in the middle of the city, most rooms probably looked out onto other buildings. The hotel was huge, and could feel a little impersonal, but I didn't mind that.

Reviews.Title: “Old Dame deserves respect”
Reviews.Author: wacka
Reviews.Content: This is a classic, large scale hotel built in the early 1930's with more than 1000 rooms and massive public areas. The staff are generally polite and efficient. I was there for a conference and found the amenities well layed out and thoughtful. Our room was clean, comfortable, and well appointed. The bathroom was too small (as it is in most hotels of this era), but the bed was very comfortable with luxury linen and duvet. It was very cold while we were there, yet the hotel is warm without being stuffy, dry, or hot. Not sure how they accomplish that. The cleaning staff was friendly and thoughtful. The wait for the elevators is too long and we often took the back steps down, which made our room on the 3rd floor a bonus. We did not have a view of the lake or anything special, but we did not pay for it either. The food in the restuarants is average. The drinks in the bar expensive with poor attitude to serve. I am not sure if you are supposed to tip in Canada, but I tipped generously yet it was still difficult to get the service I am used to on various nights there. The bartenders seem old and not really excited about serving anyone. The bell staff was excellent and the front desk efficient and professional. I did not use the conceirge. Note that the hotel sells cigars in the lobby shop b ut does not offer a smoking room to enjoy them. Strange considering the massive space on hand to offer this to international clients.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ascubadiva
Reviews.Content: Hi I thought this hotel was super great concierge service who booked my trip to Niagara Falls. Rooms spotless well stocked mini bar with nice snacks - although a little pricey! Good room service overall a very pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: Lady_CM
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff, great downtown location. Basic rooms a tad small but comfortable. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This is what hotels should be like”
Reviews.Author: HoHumAnotherTrip
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, from the receptionist who welcomed us (jet-lagged and grumpy) to the superbly comfortable rooms. We had a great view of the lake, which was an added bonus. I simply cannot think of anything negative about this hotel. Would go back tomorrow (if we could afford to!).

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: joode
Reviews.Content: On arrival you are just staggered by the sheer enormity and splendour of this hotel. The Royals have all stayed here as have many famous stars and you can see why. The foyer itself is just so beautiful and to wander around the galleries overlooking it, is a pleasure. The rooms are very traditionally furnished with dark, carved furniture but the facilities in the room are excellent. The location oposite the station is perfect but most impressive is the direct access to the 6miles of underground shopping malls. Breakfast can be taken in any of the bistro syle outlets but they offer good value for money and the quality and standard of the food is excellent. You cannot fully describe this hotel but just stay there and you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not as nice as other Fairmonts”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: This Fairmont is well-located, and the lobby is gorgeous - but the rooms were sadly in need of updating and the service could use a bit more fine-tuning. The non-smoking room was small to mid-sized. It had a nice view of the train station but was a mish-mash of old floral prints, and the wallpaper had clearly seen better days. The furniture was scuffed and worn, and the doors on the TV armoire (which held a 10-year old 19-incher) did not close well because the armoire was no longer exactly at right angles. The room was clean, however, the bed and linens were nice, and the bathroom was in good shape. There was no bathrobe, but they brought one when I called to request one. There were no in-room safes, which was disappointing. Downstairs staff were pleasant - however, when I called with a question about the internet service (if you first use wireless internet in the lobby and then internet in the room, you will be charged the $14 daily fee twice), I got different answers about the reasons for the extra charges, and no resolution of the issue. The fitness center was decent, although the pool was not available. Mercifully, there was no extra charge to use the fitness center (as at other Fairmont properties, e.g. the one in Southhampton, Bermuda). We went to Epic for dinner - the food and service were good and the restaurant threw in nice touches such as amuse bouche and petit fours, but the overall quality was not quite good enough to justify the prices.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: OWJK
Reviews.Content: Superb Location! Superb Atmosphere.. Staff were all very couteous and helpful with every aspect of our 3 night stay.. We came into town to see the Leafs / Raptors games. We had purchased our tickets through a hotel broker. Had them waiting for us game day! Had calls to make sure everything was to our liking! Had a beautiful view of the CN Tower.. Great Location ! Especially if you are in town for a sporting event, shopping (Underground paths to Eaton Centre), sightseeing or using public transit (it is directly across the street) Great restaurants in the area! Courteous Staff! Nice room/ Views! Helpful! Superb Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for older people...”
Reviews.Author: catfight55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Royal York a couple of weeks ago for a bachelorette party since a friend had a certificate for a free room. The first room we got was really nice and a non-smoking room. It has two double beds, two single seat chairs, a bathroom and quite a bit a space. Since we were there to party, we switched to a smoking room and it was obvious that the room just wasnt in as good shape. We were on the first floor, and the carpet and whole hall way just felt really dingy. However, we were really happy with the room because in addition to the 2 double beds, there was also a pull out couch two tvs and TWO bathrooms in the room...so the room was able to accomodate all of us comfortably. The beds are comfortable enough but not the best i've slept on in hotels. Front desk was really helpful when we requested a room change and when I needed an extra toothbrush. During our stay, we also had afternoon tea at EPIC which was good but definately not spectacular and not as good as other hotels i have been for tea. The bread on the sandwiches were a bit stale. Word of advice, if you do go, make sure you order the Royal Tea Stand ($25) and not the Tea Sommelier ($21) Selection as the Tea Sommelier one would get you a small piece of chocolate cake, one berry, and a spoonful of chopped up strawberries in a champagne sauce and the Royal Tea Stand has 3 tiers of goodies. We also ate at the York's Kitchen downstairs. The restaurant was quite noisy and has lots of kids. the food was ok...not great...and definately not a place i'd go if i didnt happen to stay there. The location of the hotel is downtown but not the best if you are looking for night life. Since there are a lot of nice hotels in the club district, i would recommend to go to those for younger people visiting toronto. It was hard for us to even find a convenient store in the area...we ended up walking into union station. There also isnt tons of great restaurants in the area. If you are visiting Toronto, stay in Yorkville or around the Club/entertainment district. I would only recommend this place for older people. This hotel is definately better than your average budget friendly hotel but by no means are the top in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lively and good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cardiff2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights in early November and really enjoyed the experience - having moved from a cheaper hotel in the city. We loved the 1929 art deco (-ish) design of the building, which is dwarfed these days by the glass megaliths of the financial district. Inside, the lobby is magnificent - oozing period charm. But it's a busy place, seemingly full of business people rushing here and there or tapping away on their laptops. Under the lobby are several shops selling all sorts of things, plus an hotel breakfast room - where we had an excellent meal at modest cost for the quality. The hotel is also linked by a subterranean link to Union Station, just across the road. Drinks are not cheap in the hotel, as you'd expect, but the food was good. and reasonably priced. The pub-style bar downstairs was good, too. It was full of chatty types - away from home and seeking some conversation. The room was well furnished, but adequate rather than large. Alas, our view was of the office block next door - but as we only inhabited it during hours of darkness that was OK. I was surprised at the lack of a mini-bar, but as I have never (not in a 1000 hotel visits) ever partaken of the grotesquely overpriced fare it was no hardship. The service was extremely efficient and friendly at check-in and concierge services. One man couldn't immediately answer my query, but looked it up and then tracked me down as I was shopping on the ground floor. I was surprised to read other reviewers say they'd had better value elsewhere. I was content with our bill - as it would have cost a lot more in New York or London. The Fairmont group run this hotel very well, so we've booked into two more. It may depend on the room you get, but we were pleased we chose the Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: DSM533
Reviews.Content: Our first night on Canadian soil was at the Fairmont Royal York, The hotel overall was spectacular, The Reception/lobby - amazing - very classy, Right by the CN Tower & Grand Union Station. The only downside was the rooms, small, out-dated,and not what I expected for a 5 Star. Some of the motel I stayed in were better than this. Staff were so friendly,and the hotel had a mini shopping mall underneath it. I paid alot to stay here for 2 nights and probably stay elsewhere If I came back to Toronto. My wife and I like a good sized modern room which the fairmont did not provide. Parking was so expensive and Valet parking even more, they must think you have money to burn !!

Reviews.Title: “Problems with breakfast and room bill”
Reviews.Author: hotel2006av
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Oct. 7. 2006 for one night. My husband and I booked the Bed & Breakfast package which was $150 + taxes and included one night's accommodations and breakfast for two the following morning. Check in went very smoothly and the staff was lovely. The hotel was great, and the pool very lovely. We really enjoyed our night there. It is a historic location, and the lobby is glorious. The rooms, and washrooms are marvelous. The problem came with breakfast. We called down to the front desk in the morning to enquire about our breakfast package and when we should head to the dinning room. We were told that it was all filled up and to wait for the brunch. When we arrived at 11 a.m. for brunch we were told we waited too long and that we were not eligible for the complimentary brunch, that we would have to pay. We complained to the front desk and were let into the dinning room and received the cold and left over breakfast- not pleased. We went home and decided it was a nice stay, expect for the cold breakfast/brunch which was suppose to be complimentary in our package. Two days later, we received an extra $60 charge on our credit card statement from The Royal York. When I called to enquire, I was told that we had plenty of alcohol and wine at breakfast and those were the extra charges. My husband and I NEVER drink, let alone $60 worth of wine with breakfast. We had to complain for over 30 minutes to have the charges removed. I won't return again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: travellerni
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in The Royal York for four nights in early October I am surprised to read the several poor reports recently posted- these most certainly did not reflect our own experience.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this very beautiful hotel. Accommodation and public spaces were superb - opulent and clean.Food was very good and staff ,in all areas , were helpful,efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very historic”
Reviews.Author: inDCfromMI
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week in August and it was a overall a good hotel. The restaurant in the lobby, Epic, was FANTASTIC. Very good food and very close. Yes, the lobby is pretty and the rooms are old, but it's in a great location, right near the subway, convention center and some shopping. It's very old and historic, which makes it a little fun to stay in, especially when you're just driving into the city. There are also restaurants in the lower floor, which is connected to the rest of the city. The only problem I had was that they charge you $2 for every call you make. If you are a Presidents Member, which I am, you are supposed to get them for free and the girl at the counter wouldn't hear it, but their accounting department was nice and refunded me my money. If you can get a deal to stay here, then it would be a fun experience. Try to get a room that faces the lake and don't stay for too long.

Reviews.Title: “Booooo Royal York!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: Reservation confirmed, but when I got there no rooms were available because a concomitant convention. I wanted to walk out but Toronto hotels were sold out. They offered a "parlour" (i.e. a sofa with a pull-out bed in a tiny room, unsuitable for a good rest after 9 hours of flight) at reduced rate + free breakfast. However, the "parlour" was not ready and I had to prepare the bed myself although I was tired & jetlagged. Lots of apologies by a very polite staff. Much faÃ§ade with little or no substance. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: slyfox
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in Sept. Everything about this hotel is overrated except for the lobby. But you can sit in the lobby for free! Paid almost $300 a night for a small room that overlooked a roof despite asking for a "view." Parking was $30 and took forever to get car. Food prices were astronomical! To top it off they have a Fairmont store where you can buy high-end gifts. I've been to the one in Quebec City and was charmed by the service. Here, the manager (I know it was the manager becuz she told me) was rude, overbearing, and followed me like I was going to steal something! I saw some china I wanted to buy but left because this woman was awful! There weren't enough towels in the room and had to call 3 times in 12 hrs. to get some! Was something wrong with their washing machine? Hope this place gets taken over by somebody who knows how to run hotels, like maybe the 4 Seasons. This was my 2nd bad exper. at a Fairmont--very overrated brand.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: VeryPickyTravl
Reviews.Content: Don't ever stay here!!! The lobby is gorgeous, but everything else sucks. The rooms are old, the bathroom was awful, bathtub wall tiles cracked and hastily patched up, no caulking on cealing, can see the mold, peeling wallpaper, ugh. No king size bed, very disappointed, for this price we got a measly queen, and it was way too soft. Banging at 2 am that woke us up. You can here everything through the doors. A neighbor's beeping alarm clock that went on at 6 am and did not stop for AN HOUR!! Stuff charged to our room that we did not buy. Would never stay here again, and would warn all other against it.

Reviews.Title: “Old, but nice”
Reviews.Author: hmcrn2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in the beginning of September. We did use the valet parking - it's $30 CAD/day. They were nice, and gave good directions when we left. The hotel has a very impressive lobby, and the staff were very helpful and nice. We stayed in a regular King room. It was pretty small, with a small bathroom, but was fairly comfortable. The restaurants downstairs in the hotel are good, but pricey (even for the breakfast buffet). The Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower, Rogers Centre, and several restaurants are very close, within walking distance. The pool and hot tub were comfortable, even though small. Would we stay here again? Probably not. Just because of the price, and the "oldness". There are newer hotels with bigger rooms that have just as good of a location. This hotel has the history, (the queen used to stay here in the penthouse suite), but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “the fairytale hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJMRC
Reviews.Content: my son,husband and i stay there for five nights the hotel was beautiful it was worth 280 per night only problem we had was the room was cold at night we asked for a person to check it out and they did,but the problem wasnt fixed i was rush to the hospital and they were beautiful would go back but would try for a room with it being nit cold.

Reviews.Title: “room not ready for 2hrs hours plus!!!!”
Reviews.Author: julieei
Reviews.Content: The Royal York................ We booked direct with the hotel, 4 weeks pre our visit. On arrival at 4.15pm (check in from 3.30pm).........to find our deluxe 2 queen bedded room was not ready. We sat in the lobby, which is very nice, but after a long flight from the UK, not where we wanted to be! After several conversations with the reception manager, we were offered 1 mornings free breakfast, BUT STILL NO ROOM!!!!! We were told that it was" a very large, busy, hotel, and the room should be available in 30mins or so" By 5.10, we were handed our keys!!!!!!!!!!! only to find that they did not work...you can imagine we were not pleased, on returning to reception the manager said " he thought there had been a problem with the computer/swipe" we will not be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: travelnplay
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Fairmont for 5 nights during the International AIDS Conference 2006. The lobby looks just gorgeous and the location is perfect. It's just a few-minute-walk away from MTCC. However, the room is very small and in-room facilities are old. However, I am amazed that the hotel appeared to lack experience in catering a large amount of guests as the case of this conference. When I checked in with my colleagues, the front desk staff made missed the reservation of my colleagues and told them that all rooms were booked out. That was 12:00 in the midnight already. Then, after lots of long distance calls to confirm information, they found the reservation and upgraded my colleagues to Fairmont Gold and gave one breakfast cupon to each of my colleagues. That made a very bad first impression on the first moment of setting foot in this hotel. What's more was that the staff forgot to handout breakfast cupons to me and a few of my other colleagues. They only handed them out on the 4th day we stayed there!! In compensation (again), the hotel provided us with complimentary internet access. One good point I observed was that the staff keeps smiling no matter what. I can only conclude that Fairmont is not worth the price it charged for the facilities and service provided!

Reviews.Title: “Never more satisfied”
Reviews.Author: PullNoPunches
Reviews.Content: As I read the various reviews, it sounds like people stayed at two different hotels. I am glad I didn't see anything before my first stay. I am staying here for the third time since April. Each time it has been an amazing experience. Not only are the rooms beautiful and comfortable, but the staff is absolutely the friendliest I have every seen. I travel often for business and I love to stay in this hotel. I have not yet stayed at on the Gold floor, but now that I have read some of these reviews, I think I will try it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Michimi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is georgous. Like any Fairmont I've been to the staff go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your stay. The location is perfect, right across from Union Station. The hotel is quite old and as such the hallways and rooms feel a tad cramped. I get a great rate here and I'm not sure if I would have stayed for over $200 but it most likely would have been worth it. The only problem was that they failed to activate the phone and in-room movies. We called once to fix it, were told it should be ready in a few minutes, but the problem was still not fixed by the time we left. We didn't bother to call back about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Old World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avalente
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for two night. Very Grnd Old World Hotel. Great Service, some area look very old but many floors are being redone. The location is ideal. Across from train station access to the the Torooto under graound PATH walkway from in the hotel. It is centrally located to the CN Tower, Rogers Stadium, LakeOntario, City Hall and many other Toronoto sites.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act”
Reviews.Author: PlanetTravelerJapan
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a package deal to see Lord of the Rings and stay at the Royal York. We stayed for 3 nights and were very pleased with the hotel, service and ammenities. Staff were knowledgeable and friendly. The buffet breakfast was excellent. If I return to Toronto, I will DEFINATELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel and lobby - shame about the small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Valdi4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days on a business trip and really got to use all the facilities - health club very good and beauty salon in basement shopping area excellent, especially as was able to book online in advance (elizabeth milan spa). Restaurants were very good in general and breakfast was fine although they did forget to bring the room service tab to the room every night after the first which was a shame as I wasn't bothered to ask for it and just got up. Lobby and builing location are fab though and the concierge staff really knew their stuff. Good value for money on the corporate rate of Â£80 though (including breakfast) so if going on business look into this! Only negative aspect was the darkness and size of the room although good quality dark furniture and bedding. In fact, bed was very comfy. Hotel is 5 min walk from most of the major attractions and about 8 min from lake marina eating area which was lovey in the evenings. And it was only 10 mins to the Eaton Shopping Centre and Yorke Street in general. All in all, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairmont Gold Experience”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: I won a free night at this hotel, and planned a special in-town getaway for my boyfriend and I. While the coupon I received was for a deluxe room, I decided to upgrade to Fairmont Gold for a mere $23.00. When I arrived to check in, I was checked in by Robin in the 12th floor Fairmont Gold lounge, who was very friendly, and gave me a tour of the lounge. Try and get room 12-130; it is a non-smoking room with a king bed, and it features a split view, as it is a corner room. There are 2 windows in this room, one faces the lake, with a minimally unobstructed view of the lake, and the other window faces Union Station. The room was VERY clean, and also had a pant press. The fan in the room was very quiet, even on high. Sure, the rooms aren't very big, but they are perfect if there are only 2 people in the room. The bed was comfortable, and we slept very well. Contrary to what someone else wrote on here, we found that only SOME of the towels were hard, there were actually a few really nice ones. We really loved the free non-alcoholic drinks in the lounge (including Nestea), and the breakfast was very good and featured lots of different things. We would definately stay here again, if I got the opportunity to stay in Fairmont Gold. Special thanks to Jennifer and Letty (housekeepers), and Robin and Johnson (Fairmont Gold Lounge) Liam W. and James B.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, but not the best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Royal York for 3 nights at start of a trans Canada tour. The lobby etc. of the hotel are very grand and imposing and well worth seeing, Our room was the smallest one of any of the hotels we stayed at during trip, although it had the normal two large beds, there was not a lot of room around them. Dark furniture and small window did not add to the rooms appearance. Having said this we enjoyed our time here but if we ever return to Toronto will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average nothing more”
Reviews.Author: AliB01
Reviews.Content: We travelled from Scotland to tour Canada to celebrate my parents golden wedding. On the way out we stopped at the Sheraton Centre Toronto and on the way back at the Royal York. There was no question about it the Sheraton took the vote from all family members. Our rooms at the Royal York were on the fifth floor which I understand has recently been renovated, the room was very nice as was the bathroom, not a large room but then it is an old building so I didn't expect a huge room. I couldn't actually find fault with this grand old lady she just appears to have lost her sparkle! Perhaps we are now more accustomed to the newer, more modern style of hotel and find it difficult going back to the smaller rooms, darker decor etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: frances68
Reviews.Content: We have lived in the Toronto area for 2 years and are returning home to the UK at the end of this month. We have often seen the Fairmont and promised ourselves a stay there before leaving. So this weekend we did just that. I booked a deluxe double room on line, only to discover on checking in - having queued for 10 minutes to do so - that I had booked a smoking room, denoted by the SK on my reservation. We are not smokers, and would not have booked a smoking room if we had realised what the SK meant. I suppose in all fairness it was our mistake. We went to the room and it was indeed very smoky! I asked to change but there were no other similar rooms available in non smoking. We were promised an ioniser, which never materialised. We had been in the room not more than 5 minutes when my 3 year old daughter found 2 candies lying on the floor, left from the previous occupants, no doubt. The room was faded, mildew on the bath faucet, large burns in the curtains. Our milk and cream for the coffee maker was not there, there was wood hanging off the TV cabinet and the tables were stained and old. The hotel was full of conference guests, I guess this is where the big money lies for the hotels these days. We booked a bed and breakfast package and on checking out, had 2 overages on our bill from breakfast, which were removed when I pointed them out. We made our general dissatisfaction known to the Front Office Manager, who was pleasant enough, but offered nothing to make us think that a) he believed us and b) that he really cared anyway. He told us that the Fairmont Royal York was the flagship hotel of the Fairmont Group. Based on that, I will NEVER stay at a Fairmont again!!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: NAB68
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for business purposes and had a very enjoyable stay. The main compliment is to the staff, from the housekeepers to front desk to doormen they were all so friendly and helpful. It is in a great location and if you dont want to walk taxis are readily available. My room was always well cleaned. The only reason why I didnt award 5* is because my room and especially bathroom were quite small. But all in all a lovely hotel and well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kc2304
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Royal York and we loved it. We stayed on the gold floor, which has the advantages of a private check in, gold floor concierge, complimentary continental breakfast, internet access in private lounge and nightly turndown service. I cannot compare it to the other rooms but I would guess it is worth paying the little bit extra for a gold floor room. The rooms themselves are not huge, but they are big enough to fit two double beds and still have plenty of space for whatever else you might need. I would say they are pretty standard in size for a city hotel. They are clean and contain all of the modern amenities you might need. We also had a lovely view of the harbour and the CN tower to the right of our room. The lobby is very impressive and is a nice place to relax after a hectic day of sightseeing. The service in this hotel is excellent. The staff could not do enough for us throughout our stay. Everyone is extremely helpful and pleasant. We found it funny that there is a man at the front door who will whistle (literally whistle!) on a taxi for you. They are parked all of 10 metres away and this is totally unnecessary, but a nice touch nonetheless! It sums up the service you receive at the royal york. The best thing about the royal york, however, is it's location. It is directly across from Union station and is very central, so is a 5 minute walk from everything: the harbourfront in one direction, the CN tower and skydome in another, and the old and new city halls, Eaton centre etc in the other.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Sheraton Instead...”
Reviews.Author: michiganonthego
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with this Hotel. It was difficult to reach the concierge or get a wake-up call, the room was extremely small, the bathroom was small, and noise from the hallway woke me up three times during the night (I am a heavy sleeper, so this surprised me!) The shower/showerhead were horrible! This was not the Fairmont reputation that I have heard about. However, the work-out facilities were nice as was our small view of the city. However, for $150 less on Hotwire.com, we booked the Sheraton Centre Hotel on Queens in downtown Toronto and absolutely loved it. The bed was better, the room was at least 50% larger, the decor was more updated, and service was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: MM2424
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto and have stayed at the Royal York several times...usually for work functions. I also eat there quite often. It certainly doesn't have all the grandeur of the resorts out West, (Banff, Jasper, Whistler, etc.) or the big rooms of the Orchid or Kea Lani...but I think that's because it is a really old "city" hotel. It's not a huge resort on a beach or in the mountains. For some reason, room service has never, EVER managed to get my breakfast order right. Seriously, I always order the same thing and considering it costs $20 (before tax, delivery and tip), you would think that they would get it right. The King Edward, Sutton Place, Windsor Arms and Four Seasons are better options for beautiful downtown hotels, but the Royal York is okay for business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: yadayaba
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 4 or 5 times since 2001, but always on the gold floor untill this feb. Was wondering what the room would be like, compared to the bigger ones upstairs. It was a little shocking at first as it seemed small and cramped. But to be fair it wasnt, the room took my case and bags and junk with ease and it still wasnt cramped. The service was just as good, (i am in there president club loyaty scheme though but i doubt that make much diffrence!) I forgot to cheeck out, it's best not to ask. but the bill to my credit card was spot on, as always. The concigre desk was very helpful and the bell boy was super. I had a lot of stuff but he handled it like a pro. If you can, splash out the extra get the gold floor rooms. They are great for special ocasions. If not dont worry about it the room you get will still be good. (There pre-pay internet rates are pretty good value.) And the best part of the hotel is the fantastic lobby, it doesnt matter what room your in there. It's just a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I stay often and LOVE IT”
Reviews.Author: eureka345
Reviews.Content: My most recent stay at this hotel was just last week, but I stay frequently (once a month, on average) on business. After my first few stays, I joined the President's Club - so I have the perspective of service both with and without this extra priviledge (which is free). I am quite young to be a business woman and find that I am sometimes not treated with as much respect as those that are a bit older... NOT here. Service is always top notch. I am always respectfully greeted with my name and a smile and all staff go out of their way to make my stay easy and enjoyable. Some examples: One evening I returned to the hotel while still eating an ice cream and the doorman on duty insisted on opening both doors for me (even though I'm not one to ask for such things and could have easily handled it myself). The conceirge desk is very knowledgeable and always has the answers to my questions (be it local attractions, driving directions, etc.) and is quick to provide maps, etc - always very accurate. I've forgotten to request parking passes (the self parking garage is a public one, but hotel guests receive a discounted rate with a parking validation slip), and even the employee working in the parking garage was understanding and friendly. I've had my luggage stored for me, and the process was quite pleasant. Right down to Hassan, the employee that always serves my breakfast in York Deli (Avenues level)... somehow I always get him... and service is always prompt and courteous and the food is always great, and it's nice to see a 'familiar face'. When walking the halls and encountering any housekeeping staff I am always greeted with a smile and a 'hello' or 'good morning'. I've called the switchboard to request information or be transferred to another room, and I am always greeted by name and dealt with in a very friendly manner. I'm not the neatest person and often throw things around while in a hurry in the morning - one evening I returned to see that the housekeeping staff had not only made my bed, they also neatly folded my PJs (I had probably left them in a ball on the bed)! I could go on! Simply said... GREAT SERVICE. Other things I love: Express checkout... especially television check out. With a few button pushes on my remote, I can review my bill (which has always been accurate) and checkout. By the time I gather my luggage and make it down to the lobby, my receipt is already waiting for me in their 'mailboxes'. SO HANDY and no waiting. The rooms themselves are great - the beds and pillows are very comfortable, the provided teas and coffees are great, and I love the bath robes. I also always make use of the irons and ironing boards, which have always been great. Yes, the rooms aren't all spacious, but the views are often spectacular and I never feel too 'tight'. My favourite room was a corner room I had on the 10th floor - amazing views - I'll attach some photos. Some of the furniture does show some wear - but it's always still functional and generally still very pleasing (a few scratches or nicks doesn't bother me!). Desks often have basic business supplies in them, which I find a nice touch (stapler, post its, etc). Now for the benefits of the Presidents Club: Firstly, it's free and easy.. I signed up online and was enrolled instantly. I haven't yet had enough stays to 'bump up' to gold or platinum level, but already the perks are great... especially the free highspeed internet access (just introduced as a perk, previously you only received a 25% discount). Also great is the dedicated check in desk, which speeds up the check in process. I hear that the rewards I'll receive once I've stayed enough times are wonderful... so I can't wait and will plan to use my rewards at another Fairmont hotel as a 'getaway'. Summarized, this is a hotel with charm - which shines through the most in its world class service. It also shows in architecture, furniture and room sizes.. so if you're looking for a generic large hotel room, this might not be for you.. but, I, for one, enjoy it a lot! Oh, and I almost forgot one of the best parts.. LOCATION. This is PRIME. *Trip Advisor keeps timing out as I try to add photos, so I give up.. but feel free to email me.*

Reviews.Title: “Gold Floor Stay”
Reviews.Author: Casserole
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times on the Gold Floor at the Royal York. There is a separate reception so you can just go straight up and receive your room keys there. We enjoy the gold lounge which has an honour bar, soft drinks, snacks, appetizers and desserts. In the morning there is a very good continental breakfast. You can also order full meals off the room service menu and they will deliver and serve them at a table in the lounge. The staff could not be more helpful with the kids or with assisting us with transportation & reservations. Rooms are on the smallish size and a bit flowery in decor but comfortable and cozy with everything you need. We had room service several times which was delivered hot &fresh. The kids love the pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “An experience!”
Reviews.Author: rro
Reviews.Content: The size and history of the hotel, and the grand lobby might give off the impression that the hotel is 5 stars, but sadly enough it isn't. My family and I stayed in a 3 bed, 2 bathroom suite overlooking the lake. I believe the name of this type of room is the Pacific Suite. The windows were very large, but slightly dirty. The room itself was dated, but not drastically. The bathrooms lack a whirlpool tub and other modern ammenities. The fact that it is an old hotel should not scare you, it should simply be an experience. Just staying in this Toronto Landmark is a treat, and the prices aren't ridiculous. The concierge was very fast. During off-season, they often upgrade your room if you just ask. Also, this hotel is simply convenient, subway, Go Train, PATH, and the highway are just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto on business and stayed at the Royal York for 3 nights just before Christmas. Our room, and the service was all to a very high level, which is sometimes sadly lacking in these larger hotels. The lobby decorated for Christmas is an absolute must to see. I would have given 5 stars but unfortunately one of the 2 breakfast restaurants was closed for refurbishment causing waiting queues for breakfast. Not handy when rushing off to a meeting, if only we had been told on the first day we could make a reservation for breakfast........ Full marks to the hotel for giving a 4.00pm check out, at no cost, as we had a night flight back to the U.K. most hotels don't due this without a cost.

Reviews.Title: “Awful place - avoid!”
Reviews.Author: xcw
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Fairmont hotels and generally found them to be good. This was the exception. I booked a non smoking room, upon arrival they said they only had smoking/non smoking rooms left - I asked what that was and they said I could smoke in the room if I wanted to!!! I asked for a room with a view, they gave me a lovely view of the air conditioning unit! I asked to change room to a non smoking room - by 8pm that evening my bags had not been moved - I spoke to the bell boy who told me they had to move a "shed load" of bags that day, hence the delay! My room was dirty, tired, the bath took 20 minutes to run and in the first room there was hot water coming out of both basin taps. It was so bad I checked out early and moved to the InterContinental down the road which was the same price and excellent. Avoid the Fairmont at all cost. I complained in writing to the manager, as expected I have heard nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Too big and too old!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid the Royal York if you can!!! I stayed here on business and couldn't wait to leave, sure the building is nice and historic, and certainly is a landmark in the city.... but that is all this place has going for it. Staff are WAY too busy to care, they show little regard for paying guests, and have a very nonchalant approach to all they do. On top of this the rooms are old, tired and worn... not to mention TINY! I called to request a larger room, and was quite pleasant only to be told by the woman who answered the phone that the hotel is a historic building, and the rooms date back to the turn of the century, so there all like that. Some excuse, too bad this wasn't put anywhere on the website or said during the phone call to make my booking. While I can appreciate the building dates back to the early 1900's, doesn't mean my room has to! Terrible room, terrible service, STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Old and showing it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While you can easily be seduced by the grandeur (FORMER) of this palatial hotel, I suggest you don't set your hopes too high! I stayed here on business because our company put us up at the Royal, and I will not return. I'll stick to my regular spot, the Hilton. My bath tub got plugged on two seperate occaisions (by no fault of my own, I am a balding man). It took the maintenance person 30 minutes to arrive on both occaisions. The staff service is okay, but I had to almost fight with the clerk to have a movie removed from my bill. I was hardly in the room if I wasn't sleeping and didn't watch any of the on-demand stuff. Housekeeping might be lacking, I found a plastic wrapper on the floor.. which makes you wonder what else is missed. The worst part of this hotel is the size of the rooms, they are SMALL! I know it's an old world hotel, but these rooms are easily 250-300 square feet. Just avoid this place, the novelty of its age doesn't offset the inconveniences that ensue.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all of my expectations”
Reviews.Author: HaveWineWilTravel
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews I went to the Royal York with below average expectations and was blown away by my stay. The staff couldn't do enough to make us comfortable. Everyone, without exception, greeted us with an enthusiastic smile. We stayed in the most basic room but were treated like VIPs the whole time. I forgot my glasses in the car that had already been parked in the garage, the valet did not hestitate to retrieve them. After a very long day we ordered a pizza in our room expecting the delivery person to bring it to us. Instead we were greeted with a polished butler delivering our pizza on a tray with china, silver, cloth napkins, a flower in vase, ice water, and a very friendly manner. Yes the hotel is aging, there were cracks in the tiles in the bathroom and the walls are a bit thin. I didn't find the room to be small at all, it was comfortable for our stay. In my opinion it only added to the charm of the classic hotel experience. I would come back again and again. Top notch service, great location, and beautiful room. I couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont for 5 nights. Perfect location, lovely room, excellent food. All in all, a very pleasant stay indeed! In addition to a restaurant, coffee place, and 2 bars, there is also the Library Bar, which has a great atmosphere and (I believe) does wonderful cocktails (I resisted myself). The service too was excellent. You are close to Union Station (and so can get the subway anywhere) and close to the waterfront (for Island tours in Spring/Summer). You are also just a short walk from a great shopping mall (the Eaton Centre). The reception area is a huge and dramatic hall with wonderful architecture and lighting. I am happy to give the Fairmont the best rating I can. Of course it's not cheap, and that may also help to explain the good time I had. But everything you would expect was there. Oh, with one minor exception - I would have liked complementary dressing gowns provided (as you get in some good hotels) :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: koppite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August. First Class hotel with plenty of facilities. Close to all attractions. All staff very accomadating. Room we had was a little on the small side. Good bars and restaurants although there were plenty of better restaurants all within a five minute walk. We were here 5 nights and ate out every night and then back to the hotel bars. The all day restaurant downstairs was good enough for breakfast. The subway system was just outside the front door and was very easy to use. I would have no problem using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachWhere?
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week on vacation in the Royal York. The hotel is within walking distance of all major attractions and connected to the underground PATH walkways and shopping malls. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful, the Library Bar was a great place for a cocktail and Pipers Sports Bar served excellent food at very reasonable prices. We plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: PEZMOM3
Reviews.Content: While the lobby is fabulous, and there is great shopping on the lower level, the rooms are small. There is NO attention to detail--TV doesn't work properly, ice machine broken, poor bellman and valet service, and barely adequate room cleaning. On the upside, the food is great, the location is wonderful and I would highly suggest signing up for their frequent user program prior to arrival. Those guests seem to have had a better experience. (it's free to sign up.)

Reviews.Title: “Five star rating, two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgreen418
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is opulent, but the service and many of the features were awful. On arrival, we were told that no one would be able to take our bags for at least 20 minutes, so we took them ourselves. Valet parking requires that you "order" your car at least a half hour in advance, and there are no in and out privileges if you self park. Once inside the tiny room, the bathroom faucet leaked. The ice machine on our floor was broken, and maid service was adequate, at best. Everywhere we turned, we were met with problems of one sort or another. There are no free hot spots in the hotel for internet, and the cost is $14.95/day, among the highest, even if you figure in the discount for Canadian dollars. (they are not the only thing that was "looney" at that hotel. All in all, i would stay at a Holiday Inn before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to groujnd transportation”
Reviews.Author: richardcrogers
Reviews.Content: The Royal York is within easy walking distance of public transporation, i.e, buses and subways. In addition - it is across the street from the VIA rail main hub - in case you are interested in doing a day journey to another part of Canada. Overall, a little pricey - but considering the central location, and the fact that we did not rent a car for the six days we were there, a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food and service”
Reviews.Author: londonvisitEngland
Reviews.Content: We had two Signature rooms for a week, twin bathrooms, large seating area plus two queen beds, lots of space. The staff were most helpfull and the food in the restaurants and room service were excellent. The location is very central both for sporting venues and the theatre, with easy access to public transport. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance at the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: family1st
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at the Fairmont Royal York the last weekend in September. The hotel is just beautiful, especially lobby and all common areas. the room was on the small side and some of the furniture looked a bit worn, but I thought it was lovely just the same...I try to focus on the positive and not search for the negative, which frankly, you can find anywhere, if you try hard enough. The staff was also very friendly, helpful and professional, and the location was great. I'd go back in a heartbeat. Oh and my husband had on his Trip Advisor t-shirt that we got when we went to Cancun to the Over 30 Club for TA night, and a woman started a conversation with us, saying this is her favorite website! guess us TA members get around...

Reviews.Title: “Royal York - almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: Brian_from_Scotland
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the splendid Royal York before, we had no hesitation in returning. The check-in staff were excellent and provided us with an excellent room overlooking Lake Ontario for a small upgrade fee upon arrival. The hotel has a luxurious feel to it with it's amazing entrance lobby. It is conveniently placed for all the attractions, which are easily accessible on foot. Alternatively, it sits on top of the underground walkway system and near the metro, Union Station and main highways. We had a slight problem when the house keeping staff "forgot" to clean our room and change the bed etc. However, we were quickly forgot about this when the hotel provided a free bottle of wine of our choice at dinner in the excellent signature restaurant called Epic. The waiting staff at breakfast and dinner were top class. We will continue to return to the Royal York provided the slight problem encountered does not become a habit.

Reviews.Title: “If you love airport hotels, you'll love the Fairmont”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Royal York for a convention. Before that, they were full and the only room we found was at the nearby Holiday Inn Express. Frankly, the consistencey of the chain motel experience (clean room with a nice view, flawless Internet) was better than the Fairmont could muster. Service at Royal York was erratic. We had to stand on the long line to the check in four times on our day of arrival. We were given the wrong room - one, not two beds - a situation that took hours and repeated visits to the reception to resolve. Although we met some genuinely friendly and helpful Fairmont employees, most of the people at the reception clearly couldn't have cared less. The first room on the 13th floor was nice, but the second on 7th floor was simply faded, with chipped furniture and peeling paint, like a cheap two-star in Paris. We visited several different rooms during our stay and all were tiny. These days when every motel has wireless Internet access, our room at the Fairmont had none. Our room keys stopped working at midnight the day before our departure - the line at the reception at 1.30 am was still long. The Fairmont was too big for its own good, with mazelike hallways and a bizarre mall underneath. Even the staff of the hotel had problems locating the conference floor. If you enjoy the faded giant hotels in Vegas, this hotel is for you. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, classic hotel with old world charm and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Cymruman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont Royal York during the last leg of our honeymoon. It was fantastic. I had stayed here on business some years before and was pleased to see that the service and accommodation were still of a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Comfort Food”
Reviews.Author: Jeffslaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fairmont for three nights having been there several years before and been quite pleased. While our assigned room was nice with a partial view of the lake the air conditioning seemed marginal for us who like to sleep in a cold room; other guests may have found the air conditioning sufficient. I advised the front desk on our way out to dinner and requested that someone be sent up to check the air conditioning, and advised that if the room was not cooler upon our return we would seek to change rooms. The clerk said she would "hold" another room so that if we sought to change later it would be available. After dinner we did change rooms to a much cooler room with a better view of the lake. The front desk clerk called up to see if everything was okay and if there was anything else she could do for us. I told her everything was now fine and could a free breakfast be thrown in for our trouble. She said fine. We like the Fairmont for its central location to many attractions and the excellent subway system. The health club is excellent and in the arcade you can get coffee or breakfast for a fraction of what you would pay in the main restaurant which is a nice option. We like the Fairmont for the full services it offers, the excellent service and clean rooms, and the concierge is always very helpful and informative. It is a classy lady indeed and worth the small premium over some other hotels. We'll be back at the Fairmont when we return.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel for a seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: aRICHone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights - but it was not worth the 'luxury' name it gives itself, or the price. When we checked in, we found a dirty bath. Had small hairs so it obviously was not cleaned after the previous client had left. On complaining, the bath was cleaned- more like somebody came and ran water to wash the hair away!!! The taps were leaky. The walls are thin- noises can be heard across neighbouring rooms. The corridors were noisy every night with doors banging. Room service trays across the hallway from us were left outside the room for 2+ days. There were insects/flies gathering and the leftover food moulding. Again, on informing the 'Royal Housekeeping' service was told they would deal with it. They didn't and the tray was languishing until the day we left. There were more such trays along the corridors!!! Overall, this is an impersonal hotel and gives a pretty basic service, with the staff who really couldn't care less. Certainly would not stay there again and would advise others to look at other options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay in the Royal York”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireMoonrakers
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned back to the UK from a wonderful three week holiday in Canada. We arrived at the hotel tired from a long flight keen to book in. I had booked 3 nights but the young lady behind the desk could only see two booked in our name - she went away to check (only missing for a few minutes at the most) and to our amazement then confirmed we had been given a complimentary upgrade to Fairmont Gold. (Possibly there wasn't a room available for the 3 nights - we will never know). We found ourselves directed to the 12th floor where we booked in. We then found out what the array of benefits were linked with the upgrade ....use of the private lounge and internet facilities, meeting room if required, complimentary breakfast, afternoon tea, pre dinner canapes etc. With the exception of alcholic drinks everything was free. We felt like and were treated like royalty. I had stayed at the Royal York a few years before and that had been a wonderful experience and we found the staff then and indeed now to be focused on providing guests with the best service. This may be a one off and it could be that be complimentary upgrades aren't given 'away' often - we may just have been the lucky ones.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Old Pile”
Reviews.Author: PRR
Reviews.Content: An old classic with some modern touches. We enjoyed our 3 night visit in Aug 2005. The room was clean albeit a bit small but fine for the two of us. The bed was good and the service top notch. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. If you are into modern glitz (flash and trash as I call it) the Royal York may not be for you. But if you like old fashioned hospitality and graciousness give it a try. Check in/out is a bit slow at times. The restaurants are excellent and the downtown location can not be beat. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto to see a concert at the ACC. Since the Royal York is close to the ACC and I am a FPC member, we decided to stay at the hotel instead of with family. Arrived early and our room was not ready so we checked our bag and went out for a few hours. Arriving back at the hotel after 3 PM we were told our room was still not ready but we could have complimentary drinks in Library Bar. Within 10 min Emily came into the bar to tell us that our room was ready and handed us the keys and information. Our room(s) was on the 17th floor, with a lake view. It was fabulous. For $209 cdn you cannot beat this price in Toronto! There was nothing to complain about. All 3 windows could open (if desired) and the AC was fine. The bedroom was large as was the living room area. It actually had 2 doors and 2 room numbers! My wife loved the suite and the view. The hallway was quiet for the entire stay and no one was bothering us. The FPC desk people remembered us the next day and the service in the Library Bar was top notch as we went there for a meal later on. I've read the reviews on this hotel. I can't believe I almost did not choose stay there. I prefer "modern" hotels however this property had class and charm, without an attitude. In September we are returning for another concert and will be bringing my mom. We are treating her to a stay on the Gold Floor. Do not pass up a chance to stay at the Royal York if you are looking for a hotel close to the ACC and Rogers Centre (Skydome.) Also the Royal York has a golf concierge if you are a golfer. Wish we had more time so we could have taken advantage of this feature. I'm sure next spring or fall we will.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the fairmont royal york!”
Reviews.Author: Kizy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal York for a mini summer break, eventhough am from Toronto. Got a great rate through the website. Stayed on the 11th floor with a harbourfront view. Had a fabulous view and bed was really comfortable. Yes, the rooms aren't that big, but very opulent decorated. They had chandeliers, gold trim and bathrobes. Had a spa treatment, was very relaxing. Had dinner at Benihana. Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WHAT YOU EXPECT A FAIRMONT TO BE.”
Reviews.Author: RPKVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on business for two nights in June. The hotel is overpriced. The beds are uncomfortable. I was woken up with echo's of rude people walking and having loud conversations in the hallways in the middle of the night. I was on the executive floor right beside a freight elevator going up and down all night. This was a beautiful hotel in its day, but I think they need to soundproof their rooms, get new beds, and get rid of the musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairmont Royal York for 3 nights last month. Check-in was fast and easy, although the person behind the desk kept saying "Welcome back". I had never stayed there before, so not sure why they thought I had. It unfortunately didn't get me an upgrade! The King room was nice - fairly small, but given the amazing price (it worked out to $40/night through an online package deal) I'm not going to complain. Bathroom was nice as well, and the room (#382 I believe) was very quiet. Even had a partial view of the lake. The housekeeping staff would turn the A/C to the coldest setting every day, so it was frigid when I would return to the room, but not a big deal. For the price and location (right by the Hockey Hall of Fame, the CN Tower and the metro), I would recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: the_gecko
Reviews.Content: Toronto isn't far from were we live, only about a 40 minute drive. We decided to go out for the weekend but anywere other than Niagara which was getting boring and a bit tacky after staying there several times in the past 5 years. Anyways the hotel of course is very elegant, very grand, pool was great, staff was okay but they weren't really up to Fairmont standards. After the maid cleaned the room on out second day, they left these little chocolates in fancy little gold bows on the pillows, which melted all over the place, since the sun was beating in through the window. The pool was nice though, but we were out an about in Toronto most of the time, doing stuff, so I guess we should have booked a cheaper hotel. The Royal York is more if your staying for a week in Toronto I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dreamcycle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many years ago. Just returned, stayed on 12th floor, the Gold Floor where you have your own concierge, lounge, private check /out, and many other amentities., including a private honor bar in the lounge and evening snacks, plus free small breakfast, free soft drinks, water etc. Expensive but worth it. We had a king bed with pillow top mattress, down pillows, mini bar, snacks, free shoe shine, suit press in room, nice shampoo's, soaps etc., very large tub, several phones, hookup for computer etc. You are right near everything in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: careyeroslib
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for two nights in a Signature Suite, and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We had intended to stay in a standard king room but, when we arrived, there were no king beds available (except in suites) so we upgraded to a Signature Suite which, although more expensive, made the experience much more home-like because of the additional space. I have to say that, this little suite, while not opulent, rivals one other hotel-room I've stayed in as my favourite hotel accommodation ever. It's unusual, I find, to sleep well in a hotel one's first night, but I slept as well (or better) than in my own bed at home. Part of this was due to the usual luxury amenities like the pillow-top mattress, the down pillows and the plush Turkish bathrobes, but part of it was the nostalgic decor: cut crystal (or glass) dooknobs and light-fixtures, antique (or reproduction) furniture and damask wallpaper. Even the novel colour choice (blue and brown) reminded me more of staying in my late grandmother's house, rather than at a standard luxury hotel. I think I slept like a baby partly because I felt I wasn't a guest in a hotel, but rather a very welcome guest in someone's home. I found the staff very accommodating, helpful and cheerful in a refreshingly low-key and respectful way. I also really enjoyed their health club. I didn't get to the pool due to lack of time, but it looked beautiful. However, I did try the fitness machines and they all seemed state-of-the-art. The hours were very good as well. The only criticism I have is that their self-parking option (both the location of the lot and exactly how to take advantage of the Royal York guest rate) is not clear. If you are planning to self-park, even if you're familiar with downtown Toronto as we are, make sure you know EXACTLY how to get to the parking garage which entitles you to the special rate (it's on the north side of Wellington but it is not at all well-signed) and make sure you don't do what we did: swipe our credit card rather than take the special ticket which entitles you to the special rate. By the time we figured out what we were doing we paid as much as if we had used the valet parking. However, that was a small thing which will not deter us from staying there again when we want a luxurious, yet comfortable, little getaway in a terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianPB
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at the Royal York over the past couple of years, and as always this hotel lives up to it's billing. Staff are excellent, friendly and always willing to help. The hotel itself has been refurbished which has brought the rooms back up to the sort of standard you would expect in a Fairmount Hotel. As for Toronto, it has to be one of the best cities in the world.. plenty of restaurants, bars etc to suit all tastes, and just as important, all pockets.. So both a hotel and city I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Dot
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay at the Royal York for a week and checked out after one night. If you are going to stay at this hotel you need to be VERY specific about where your room is. We went for the Harborview room which is a step up from a view standpoint. The room we had was right across from the service elevator and was very very noisy. We called to ask for another room and were told they were oversold. Our room was so small it was like a railroad sleeper cabin. We asked for a larger room (and were even willing to pay more money for one) and were also told they were not available. When we were ready to go to sleep we noticed there was dried blood on the toilet seat!!! We called down and they sent up a housekeeper to clean it. When the guy left he asked us if we needed to check the toilet and we told him that we were sure he got the stain as it was obvious. Well after he left it was still there (we think he just cleaned the inside of the toilet and not the seat! ) We made a reservation somewhere else and had a great week in Toronto. The manager we spoke to when we checked out was very nice and tried to find us another room but we were over the place after the bodily fluid findings! As a note many of these rooms are being remodeled now and you need to get one of those because the room we were in smelled really moldy in the bathroom. The sink faucet was so close to the granite counter that you could not put your hands under the water flow! The whole place just needs a good scrubbing. Also the doors SLAM so loudly and the hotel is old so there is no soundproofing. Very very noisy hotel. I could go on but the point is the same....stay elsewhere. (But go to their library bar for a really great martini!)

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Elegance with Modern Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Canotek
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Fairmont Royal York many times, and are always impressed by the service & friendliness for such a large hotel. Although rooms in newer hotels may be larger, those at the Royal York are very attractively decorated in a traditional style befitting its heritage. Room service for dinner and breakfast is excellent. The Library Lounge or Epic Lounge are pleasant locations for a light lunch after arriving on the train from Ottawa. (Via Rail first class is the most civilised way to travel in Canada). We have had dinner several times in Epic, and enjoyed it on each occasion. We have found what we ordered to be better than at the Beaver Club in the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth (MontrÃ©al), but not as good as at Wilfred's in the Fairmont ChÃ¢teau Laurier (Ottawa), or at Edith Cavell in the Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge. We visit Toronto frequently, and do not always stay at the Royal York, depending on the room rates at certain times. However, it is unquestionably one of the finest hotels in the city, and appeals especially to those who appreciate traditional elegance combined with modern amenities, and a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: caz1979
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mum stayed here in May 04. We transfered here for a 4 night stay after 2 nights in Niagara Falls. First impressions from the outside were 'what have we done'. The front of the hotel was almost hidden away amongst the office buildings with nothing much in sight. Once inside though it was a different story. I have never seen such grandure in my life. Check-in was very swift and the staff were extremely friendly. We asked for a smoking room so we weren't expecting the best room in the hotel. Not much of a view as we were in the west wing facing the rooms on the other side of the wing but the rooms were fantastic. The decor was very traditional but extremely cosy. Not the biggest rooms in the world but it felt like a home from home and I got just about the best nights sleep I've ever had. I didn't once hear any doors slamming and rarely encountered anyone in the corridors bar housekeeping. The hotel is situated above the Path system which was great for getting about and the CN Tower and harbour were within easy walking distance. With a picture of the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh on the wall of the lobby it made us think - if it's good enough for royalty, it's good enough for us! Do not hesitate to stay at the Royal York if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OOOooodeeeEEE
Reviews.Content: Wont bore you with all thats been said before, but just to let you know that we also think it is a grade A establishment, superb shopping area downstairs with excellent eateries etc etc. Great rooms with very comfortable beds and very quiet for such a large hotel. A very impressive building.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller0
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 nights over the holidays. It is an excellent place! If you're arriving in Toronto by train, there is no closer place you could stay, and the lobby that greets you is spectacular! The staff is beyond friendly and will go far out of their way for you. My wife forgot her jacket in the lobby when we checked out, and they knew we were taking the train, so the doorman actually ran across the road and into Union Station to find us! The rooms are a bit small, but the decor is tasteful. If you're looking for a great breakfast, try "York's" downstairs! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good night's sleep in great surroundings...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Royal York twice in the past month, and both times have enjoyed it very much. In fact, although the rooms are a bit small for a modern hotel, I would compare it favourably with some of the "fancier" hotels I've been to in Geneva, Montreal or Toronto. The architecture is grand and charming, and I've never slept better in a hotel -- the beds are ultra-comfortable! My only complaint was the shower-head, which ought to have been replaced. Otherwise, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Getting dated, in a bad way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is vrey grand and quite elegant from the outside appearance, and once stepping into the lobby, it continues to impress. The rooms however are getting dated. It looks and smells old, they are small and evidence that this place is due for a major renovation appears more and more evident whenever I visit. I have found that the Intercontinental on Front Street just down the road is much more up to date, and tucked away a little fruther, the Radisson down on the Waterfront I also recommend. The Royal York --- stay only as a novelty.

Reviews.Title: “A Legend”
Reviews.Author: Bobs-big-vacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Royal York in September 04. It really is a legend in its own lifetime. Impressive building and spectacular lobby - a truly grand hotel. Service was efficient and was not slow in coming forward. The room on the seventh floor was large and luxurious, the bed massive. A magnificent view of the harbourfront. You would want to stay in a room like this wherever you visited. Location was excellent and a major plus. We stepped off the train and effectively into the hotel lobby... our easiest transfer of the entire holiday. (a word to for Via Rail... what efficient and quality service... we would certainly travel about Canada by train again) Transfer to the airport from the York is also good with the Airport shuttle picking up outside and a 30-40 minute ride to the airport. Staying with location, we have stayed at the Toronto Colony previously and found the York to be better placed for all the main attractions. There are many good restaurants nearby and Joe Badali (Italian) was excellent. Now the balance... yes the Royal York comes at a price. Yes, we also ate out as prices were hefty by comparison elsewhere and that included coffee/breakfast. Yes, some of the finishing around electric sockets in the bathroom suggests that the legend is ageing and needs freshening up. Yes, next time in Toronto we would first look for a more competitive price elsewhere but we would stay there again and we can say that we have stayed at the grandest hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Why waste your money?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes the Royal York is very costly to stay, so I expected a good night sleep, warm room and all the goodies of a first class hotel. None of those were given. The rooms were very small for over 300.00 a night and the bedding smelled like it needed a good wash. The rooms were dated even for the old fashion look they were going for was tired. The doors are wood and at all hours of the night can hear them slam shut. The buffet breakfast is very over priced as well and is not far off from hospital food. The best part of the Royal York is to be the lobey. but you cant sleep there even thought it may be a better night stay. The help is there but they stand around and dont offer. The reception is less than friendly. Overall I would have been better off reading all the reviews and staying at hotel that is not all about the name but of service and a good night stay.

Reviews.Title: “High Price, High Quality”
Reviews.Author: Diamond_D
Reviews.Content: Yes it's pretty expensive but I know what I'm getting so I always go back. You can have a nice view of the train station and water, wonderful room with a gorgeous lobby, and great attentive staff right next door to the train station, arenas, and waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Royal York for 3 nights with my wife and 2 teenaged kids. From start to finish, the experience was wonderful. The room was superior, the staff friendly, and the location the best (located within walking distance of the lake, Skydome, CN tower, shopping etc.). Well worth the money. The only problem we had was with the concierge staff who seemed to have problems giving us suggestions but we figured it out on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather54
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Toronto, celebrating my birthday. We stayed at the Royal York as part of the Time for Toronto package. The hotel is absolutely wonderful, beginning with the staff who park your car, to the front desk staff who check you in; they were all extremely professional and friendly. Our room was lovely, decorated with class, although not overly large, you have to remember this is an older hotel, so the rooms were not extremely large, but beautiful and there is just a great feeling about this hotel. We loved our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby, shops, bars are lovely. We had a drink at the Library Bar (hi - Steve!) which was v. nice. They have a new restaurant Epic which is fabulous looking. For breakfast they have a buffet downstairs called York's which I highly recommend. The actual rooms are not absolutely fantastic, but the communal areas are so beautiful you won't mind too much. The bathroom was great however and the location (opposite Union Station) marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Was not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Royal York for 3 days for my sons birthday in Jan, What I was expecting and what we received were very different. We never had anyone offer to help us with our bags, coming in or out, the rooms were small, would look good on a photo but in real life stunk, were poorly furnished. the towels were hard small, the rooms were so cold we used our coats to keep warm, the halls were allways full of trays, the pool was so cold it was empty all the time because you could not swim, the hot tub was so hot you could only be in it for a few minutes or would pass out and end up looking like a lobster. My husband said this hotel should be a motel six. I was just glad to pay the over priced bill and carry my luggage home.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyTennessee
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Royal York on June 17-19, 2004. It is a very elegant hotel. I found the hotel to be very clean. I was told that I was in a room that had been recently renovated. It was very clean and was large enough. The bed was very comfortable. We visited Piper's Bar and Eatz. It was a lot of fun. They had someone who sang and played the piano...songs like the Hotel California. The bartender, waiter and waitress sang, too. They were very talented. It was a fun relaxed atmosphere and I was surprised there weren't more people there. I would enjoy visiting the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Smart-Alex
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel every year for over 10 years. Yes...some of the the rooms are small but it's an old hotel and it would difficult to make them bigger! ( Come on... how much room do you need to SLEEP?) I love the charm of the hotel The staff is warm and helpful for a hotel of distinction. It is in a great location. If it's good enough for royalty I guess it works for me. It simply FEELS good.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was hoping for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2001 as part of my honeymoon. Upon arrival everything seemed great, the lobby it has to be said is very impressive. Unfortunately that is as much praise I can give the Royal York. I had arranged to be in a superior room with a veiw of the CN tower. The room we were ushered to was dirty with dreadful decor, had a very uninspiring veiw of the rear of the hotel and, ok I have to admit if I put my cheek on the window and craned my neck I could see a third of the tower sticking out above the back of the hotel. I wasn't really happy. I complained at the front desk and was given a different room by a very indifferent receptionist, but found the new room not particularly nice. After 3 room changes I just accepted the best one and lived with it (I was on honeymoon after all and had other things to do!). There was apparently a large conference and a large part of the lobby was being used as a film set for some hollywood movie but I dont accept these as excuses - this must happen all of the time in my opinion. I won't be going back to the Royal York, and due to experiences like this one I've found myself booking rooms in B&B's or small hotels that give a far nicer service.
